Reviews.Title: “Not near 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Stephloveswine
Reviews.Content: The 'beach' they talk about is NOT a beach- it's a dirty sand front of a man-made bay. Do not get in the water. The house keeping never refilled our built-in shampoo dispensers until the fifth day when I jumped out of the shower & called the front desk to ask them to give shampoo. It's quite a task to refill those bottles- the maintenance guy came with tools to change the apparatus & load our bottles up, so I guess that's why house keeping never does it. The lobster bisque at Baleen made me very ill. I did report these 2 issues to the front desk upon check out & they credited us $50 for house keeping trouble, and $50 for the lobster bisque episode. The bay-side bungalow left a lot to be desired- not worth the upgrade charges. The $17/night mandatory resort fee got us nothing but holes in our wallets- we never used the fitness facility, or sports courts but you must pay for them. There is no beverage service at the 'adult' pool, so you have to go to the main pool with all the kids to get any food/beverage service. There are only 2 restaurants onsite & nothing in walking distance, so unless you cab or drive somewhere, you better like the resort food- and prices. The room service was the same menu as Barefoot bar & grill, but pricier. The staff was friendly, but overall I expected the experience to be better. The ducks were cool to watch (but we have them in TX), the prices on wine were good in Baleen & the staff was friendly. But that's it. I would not stay here again- too many other great places to stay in San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “High School Friends”
Reviews.Author: bikermarie
Reviews.Content: Two high school friends and I recently enjoyed a memorable stay at Paradise Point. The grounds were impeccable and beautifully landscaped, reminding us somewhat of Hawaii. The staff was courteous and helpful in every part of this resort, and the location could not have been better - close to major San Diego attractions and the airport. Our only regret was that we spent so much time sight seeing in and around San Diego, we missed out on enjoying the many recreational activities offered at Paradise Point itself. I will definitely recommend it to family and friends and will also return there for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: eliana23
Reviews.Content: You need to know ahead of time that there is a $32 per day fee for parking, in addition to $17 a day for a resort fee. If you are prepared you won't let this ruin your trip. With my two young sons and husband we recently stayed and had a great visit. Excellent customer service, great location. Five pools for variety and we loved the room. Walking right over to the little beach was perfect for us. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and meals”
Reviews.Author: Bill T
Reviews.Content: First day: property was clean (albeit 50 years old) and greeting was warm and professional. Meal and service at Barefoot Restaurant first night was very good. Next day: staff repeatedly ignored specific contact request(s), meal and service (Barefoot again) was poor to very poor. I sent review to hotel and received an impersonal email (autogenerated) response. Overall, value for the $$$ was not received and so I wouldn't recommend it. Moved to the harbor Sheraton for next night.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: myirish
Reviews.Content: One of the main reasons I booked at this resort was the heated swimming pool and it was great. We went over to use the pool after a day at the zoo, it was already dark outside but the whole pool sitting area was full of used towels on the chairs and empty drink containers. We found a nice spot to sit and watch our children enjoy the pool. The water was nice and warm although the air temperature was very cool. The pool was clean and well lit but we were surprised that there were no employees picking up around the pool to make it presentable. The beach area was OK the children waded in but when they came out they had dirt circles up their legs to the water mark. I was glad they didn't actually swim in the water. Our room had tiny ants that were all over the place. The room itself was OK - a little run down. The staff we encountered were friendly, the front desk was efficient. We enjoyed our stay in the area and found it easy to navigate from the resort to Sea World, the San Diego Zoo and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “what a great find!”
Reviews.Author: mlward41
Reviews.Content: What an amazing place! We experienced superior customer service from every part of this resort--from the friendly and helpful desk staff who offered us a free upgrade to the Presidential Suite (which was absolutely breath-taking!!) to the kind gentleman who escorted us there via golf cart and offered his services anytime, to the outdoor concierge staff right outside the main office who would summon the taxis hanging around onsite and recommend things in the area, to the pool attendant bringing drinks and laughing with us, to the room service staff bringing beautifully laid out food right to our table, to the restaurant staff of "Barefoot Bar & Grill" who we enjoyed so much we ate there every night! The grounds of this resort are amazing--lush greenery, beautiful views of Mission Bay, many many waterside rooms. The accommodations are all one-story "huts"--no long hallways or multiple floors of neighbors to disturb you. The sidewalks winding through the property are beautiful and relaxing to walk through. There are several pools, so surely one close to your room--even one for adults only! All this and the price was comparatively outstanding. I don't feel like i would have paid less for a more commercial "regular" hotel, but here got so much more as a total experience. My husband and I stayed with our two children, ages 9 & 7. Although luxurious, this place was very family friendly. Just perfect!! I highly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “The Best San Diego Hotel For Sun & Water Lovers”
Reviews.Author: PoopyCampo
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Paradise Point Resort (formerly Vacation Village) for over 30 years. Bring you family, bring your boat or jet-ski (ample parking for either) and use the Mission Bay launch facility across the street. It's all here and possibly the best family spot in the entire San Diego County. The pools are just fine, the grounds well manicured, a boat dock with boat rentals, and the restaurant is adequate if you don't want to jump in the car and venture to the many great places to eat in SD. This is also a great place to watch fireworks on July 4th, if you can find an available room. The best rooms in the property are in the single-story buildings that actually front onto the sand on Mission Bay. Although I have not stayed in the rooms, there are lesser expensive rooms which are set back from the bay without views of the water.

Reviews.Title: “Private, perfect location and great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: ikoiko79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paradise Point resort from April 21st to the 25th 2012. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend the resort. The location is absolutely perfect, literally in the middle of anything you would want to do in San Digeo. The lush gardens and landscaping made you feel as if you were in an island all your own. What we really enjoyed- which I laugh that some people wrote bad reviews about- was that the rooms are little 2 room buildings vs a large multi floor hotel. This plus the landscaping and patio areas give you a lot of privacy which we enjoy on our vacations. Yes, they look a little bit older or we joked how it looked like island homes on the TV show lost, but that's what we really liked about it. The inside of the rooms are nice and kept up well with anything you would expect. The front desk staff very friendly and helpful. If you want to turn your nose up because the granite isn't new enough in the bathroom, then go somewhere else and pay a lot more. if you want a private resort, friendly staff, nice sized rooms and perfect location then you have found your spot. Next time we travel to San Digeo there is no where else we would want to stay!

Reviews.Title: “High Price for Average Experience”
Reviews.Author: J B
Reviews.Content: A little disappointed with Paradise Point, the room size advertising seems misleading as either the room is much smaller than listed or poorly laid out. Good place for our young son to play on the beach and pools, and the property is well maintained and relaxing. The service was hit and miss, the food was great the first day and served cold the next day. They allow smoking near the outdoor restaurant which ruins the experience. My wife's spa experience was good. An automated response when we filled out the customer survey about our stay. Overall an okay place, but left us wanting more from a value and expectations perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Love Paradise Point!”
Reviews.Author: Mandi L
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Paradise Point Resort & Spa. The property is absolutely beautiful. I especially loved the ducks and turtles around the property. We bought a lot of bags of food and were constantly feeding them as we walked around! The torches around the property at night were also really pretty. The rooms were clean and simply styled and the beds were actually comfortable. All of the staff that we encountered were very friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this place and hope to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just fun!”
Reviews.Author: ErikaLakeForest_CA
Reviews.Content: It's a no brainer - beautiful views, right on the sand - all amenities available - perfect part of San Diego - just about everything is within 2 miles. Keep thinking back and smiling.

Reviews.Title: “little older but very nice”
Reviews.Author: lgage2010
Reviews.Content: Paradise point was a little dated in its buildings, but the atomosphere was nice, enjoyed the room and could walk right out to the beach, great views of MIssion Bay and the price was right. The staff was very helpful and professional. Would definity go back.

Reviews.Title: “It was a piece of Hawaii placed in the middle of a fun, exciting town.”
Reviews.Author: mp1966
Reviews.Content: The place was nice and clean. Pools in every part of the hotel made it easy to swim and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “A Taste of Paradise in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: MauiFanColorado
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently took our son on a trip to San Diego and we stayed at this wonderful resort on Vacation Island. From the time we arrived, an employee met us and directed us on how to get to our room and provided us with all kinds of information about the resort and about sites to see in San Diego. Our only regret was that we only stayed 3 days, instead of a week or more! The resort has so much to offer that you really could spend a week only there, without needing to go explore San Diego (but you'd miss this beautiful city!). Our suite was very nice and spacious. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom and shower room combination were a little odd, with the light switch for both in the dressing room half. This required you to have to walk through both "rooms" to turn on the light, and then return to the showering room. The shower didn't have a ledge along the floor to prevent the water from covering part of the bathroom floor, so that made showering a little messy. (This was just a minor inconvenience.) We were just a short walk from a beautiful beach that was great for running along or just for a peaceful walk. The flowers and plants reminded me of Hawaii and the sea birds were so fun to watch. We had fun playing ping pong and croquet on the grounds and had a wonderful dinner at the Barefoot Bar, seated outdoors as we watched the sunset. It was such a lovely trip! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort - looks its age when you look closely!”
Reviews.Author: Pi31415
Reviews.Content: Upsides? I had a very nice spacious room with four sachets of coffee left for my use! I liked the lack of carpets Spread out bungalows that meant I was neither above or below anyone. Very pleasant beach bar/ restaurant Free wi-fi that works! Great shower pressure Friendly staff Good jogging trails off the property (5 miles +) Downsides If you look closely, you can see that this place is probably 20+ years old Limited food options on site Good coffee shop in lobby - but only available till 11am Fridge in room that is noisy Noisy A/C unit by front door (switched off at night and fridge unplugged) Resort maps not as clear as they might be

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could be better!”
Reviews.Author: travelchat
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, the weather was not kind to us during our four days at Paradise Point. The pools were supposedly heated, but not enough to swim in during this cold spell. The beach was quite dirty with debris, so we could not allow the children to play there. Food in the casual restaurant was decent with a good Children's menu but room service breakfast was spotty with the kitchen staff not being able to get the order accurate and having to return several times to correct forgotten items. We had a two bedroom bungalow on the beach and a separate single room down the street. Both rooms were quite nice and met our needs, although in the bungalow it was necessary to go through the middle bedroom to get to the living/kitchen of the unit. With sleeping children this did present a problem. made the best of it by doing day trips to the San Diego Zoo, LaJolla for a walk on the beach and lunch, the Del Coronado for the beach and lunch, all in between raindrops while wearing our

Reviews.Title: “A resort with potential”
Reviews.Author: Debe5069
Reviews.Content: The property is located on the bay in San Diego. The views are beautiful. It was a groupon getaway. When we arrived to our room there was a bath towel hung over the shower rod and bath mat on the floor. The previous guest's key sleeve was on the desk. One can only assume the housekeeping staff thought they were returning. A call placed to the front desk brought immediate attention. The next morning we ordered room service. An opened half empty jam jar was on the delivered tray. Hair was on the back of the bathroom door. All in all a distasteful room experience. Our granddaughters enjoyed the ducks- it wasn't possible to open a window in the room but if you left the room door open the ducks would come in. We enjoyed Baleen- on site restaurant. The wait staff were wonderful and attentive. Our girls loved the pool. We did get comped for the many quality issues- so much so that I lost count. The lack of attention to quality details was so pervasive. A disappointment for a resort that has so much potential.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful room and grounds and attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: A V
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews I was a bit concerned but upon arrival all of that changed. The staff was very friendly, our room was clean, well decorated and the grounds were beautiful. It really does feel like a tropical resort.

Reviews.Title: “Bedrock hard mattress, moldy bathroom, no no carpet on any floor...”
Reviews.Author: CJ K
Reviews.Content: Any one calling this a four star resort has never stayed at a four star resort. These rooms were two star at best, no carpet on the floors so we constantly tracked in dirt, it was unavoidable. The rooms looked like they had not been remodeled since 1980, very basic furnishing that would make even the worst motel look like a resort. The tile floor in the bathroom was moldy, the sink to small to hold even a small makeup bag, when you take a shower there are no shower bar to hold towels or clothing all you had was (ick) the toilet to put your clothes on. These are not rooms but bungalows. I don't know where any one found a place to have breakfast because it was hidden, we had to travel off premises for breakfast, lunch or dinner. The price they are charging to stay there starts at $200 a night to $300 a night, Run don't walk to the nearest Hotel other than this. Grounds are indeed beautiful. I'd give this room a 2 star at best.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Resort-wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Stella183
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I are here on vacation. The weather has been terrible, cold and foggy this week. But we have completely enjoyed ourselves because of the staff at the resort. I have stayed at other 4 star resorts, which have had newer, fancier decor. However, our room is spotless, comfortable, and beautiful. Our beds are great and the showers are fabulous. Water pressure is amazing! The best part of the resort are the people who service you and this group is five star in my book (and yes, I've stayed at Westin, Ritz, Hilton, etc). Everyone is genuinely friendly and helpful. From Steve at the bell stand, to Marcy at Barefoot Grille, to Michelle in the Spa. The staff greet you with welcoming smiles and always ask how they can assist you. People make an experience great and this is a top notch group. We have not eaten at Baleen. We felt no need to eat anywhere but Barefoot, because the food and menu selection is perfect. We've eaten dinner and breakfast there each day. We've heard the chef is new here within the last year or two...great change! Food= fabulous. This is not a "polished marble" resort, which might be priority for some 4 star resort travelers. I don't recommend it for someone who would have an issue with a duck greeting them as they walk out of their room or who needs a brand new remodeled bathroom. There is definitely a mix of nature and high end here. But if service is how you define a 4 star experience, then this is a wonderful resort and you should book your vacation here. Walking distance to Sea World is an added bonus. Even with bad weather, we have had a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable, unique activities, a little dated”
Reviews.Author: BicFamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed for just a couple nights after a few days at DisneyLand. Got stiffed by cold weather, but this place is very nice. The rooms are mostly two rooms side-by-side in little 'bungalows'. You can tell these buildings are older, but the rooms are pretty modern and comfy. Service is very good, pools are nice, breakfast on the bay is very good. It is very natural...you will see spiders, mosquitoes, and there are birds everywhere. Very enjoyable, wish we could have stayed longer and enjoyed the water, pools, activities. Only complaint is they charge you stupid fees...a daily parking fee? There are reserved spots for each bungalow in a private resort, is there a lot of competition for those parking spots? ...A $17 daily fee for internet, phone and some activities...the phone is nice, why not charge people if they want to use the activities? And charging a daily fee for internet is a thing of the past. Still, loved the place!

Reviews.Title: “Dirt, Mold, Roaches and not a 4*”
Reviews.Author: Tioga7
Reviews.Content: Many reviewers here that say this is a fabulous outstanding resort; I doubt they have never stayed at a REAL 4-star hotel such as an Omni or Hilton. This place was 2 stars at best. Dirty and mold in room, including roaches in room. Grounds are beautiful but I don't live outdoors. When you rate this place 4-star quality, you expect a 4-star facility indoors and outdoors. I do NOT recommend this place unless you are accustomed to a 2-star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Awesome Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: magnuslf
Reviews.Content: I honeslty felt the tension, stress and worries in my life gone the entire time I was here. I would lay in bed at night and keep getting up just to look outside.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with my 2 night stay.”
Reviews.Author: NIchole T
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in April 2011 as part of our honeymoon. We stayed for two nights. I booked direct through the hotel from Australia. There was a slight issue with my credit card and I received a nice email asking to contact the resort. Which I did. I phone and the staff in booking were so polite, they even suggested they call me back as I was in Australia making a long distance call. The credit card issue was fixed with no drama. We drove from Anaheim and found the location easy. On arrival we noticed the grounds to the resort were beautiful. The resort was huge and all 1 level. We had a quick and pleasant check in and were provided all the details about the resort. Including a map which was great. There was suffice parking when we checked in and we had our own parking next to our room. Our room was great, it was like a little house. A lounge and table, a comfortable bed, bathroom and fridge. It was clean and a good size. Our car parked across from our room and we had a view of the beautiful bay. We had cocktails at the pool which were nice. There were a few pools were all clean and provided towels. The pool side food was yum. THE SPA WAS GREAT ! The best spa I have ever been to. My massage was great and the facilities were awesome. When we returned to our room we had a lovely surprise of wine and strawberries. We ate breakfast at the restaurant at the barefoot bar which was yum. We used some of the watersports at the marina also and had no dramas. We used the washing machines and dryers for the small fee and had no dramas. If I was returning to San Diego I would definitely stay here again. Worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “great place for holiday with kids”
Reviews.Author: MSJLondon
Reviews.Content: beautiful grounds and excellent location by seaworld as well as private beach area and great heated pools. lots to do on site too: mini golf, gym, spa, etc. very friendly staff, though not quality or amount of luxury resort. looking a bit run down at places but offers everything you need in one place in an unbeatable setting. beautiful views from the restaurants. very good reasonable food too. great place for a relaxing, fun vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting hotel”
Reviews.Author: djhidy
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed when we (husband & 2 kids) checked into our room. It was so old, dirty and outdated. It looked out over a gross man-made pond, similar to those at minigolf. There was a large spider wrapped in the bathroom towels. Mold on the shower curtain and random hairs in the shower - really awful. Scared me to think what may be lingering in the beds! Remote for TV didn't work. Save your time and money and stay somewhere else....worst hotel I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation in a really nice family resort”
Reviews.Author: LCookCincinnati
Reviews.Content: My husband, 8 year old son and I just returned from a 7 night stay at Paradise Point. This is a great family resort! We were upgraded to a one bedroom bungalow with a small kitchen and dining area. It was perfect. We were located on a pond and near a pool. There were some very cute little ducks that actually ate out of my sons hands. We didn't have a car and chose to cab to most places. Cabs were sent to our bungalow and were easy to get. We didn't have to pay for parking, which everyone complains about. Remember though, you are in a major city. Most hotels charge these fees. The nice thing is you can park right outside of your bungalow - great convenience. Elizabeth at the Market Place was wonderful and helped us arrange a car service to Lego Land. Worked out perfectly. We rented a boat one day, Sea World twice, the Midway one afternoon. This hotel is conveniently located. We ate lots of meals at Barefoot Grill and loved it. My son had a blast checking out the sharks, sting rays and fish in the pond plus also playing down by the bay. Overall, considering that we ate many meals at the resort, this was the same price as most upscale all inclusives but we found the food and drink choices better. The pools were fine; busy but it was spring break. Staff was friendly and helpful. One note: With all of the complaints I find on Trip Advisor about not only this hotel but others I have stayed at, I doubt I will be using this website in the future. I almost changed hotels based on complaints. I found most of the complaints unfounded. If you are booked to stay here and not expecting a Ritz Carlton but a nice comfortable resort, you will enjoy it. A recommendation is to ask for extra towels and maybe bring small soaps. Housekeeping is short staffed and you may not see them every day. That being said, our room was clean. Overall, it was a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: danaboo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Paradise Point in the beginning of April. It was the first time I've been to California and it turned out to be a trip to remember thanks to Paradise Point. I booked through Gilt's Jetsetter and everything worked out great. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous and I really have no complaints. We had a "lagoon room" and it was huge! It is great that each room is it's own entity, not a high rise building. We ate at Barefoot a few times and the food was excellent. We decided to eat at Baleen our first night there. They have a happy hour with 1/2 price small plates and cheap margaritas. The staff is very nice and willing to help. Sea World is right over the bridge and we saved some cab money by walking there. We even figured out the bus system using Google Maps on our phone and got everywhere we wanted to go: The Zoo, Balboa Park, Gaslamp District, La Jolla and Old Town. Taxis are very expensive in San Diego so it was great to avoid them most of the time. I highly suggest you go to Paradise Point, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “great for families with young children...but not for us”
Reviews.Author: Linda V
Reviews.Content: This place is chock full of on-site entertainment, but if you want to enjoy playing games in a nice hotel room, forget it. The hotel has some restaurants on site. We were there during spring break, when they should have known they would be busy, but they were not prepared and the restaurant we visited was understaffed, ran out of food, and didn't treat customers well. The pool was well chlorinated (good idea with all the little kids enjoying it!), the grounds were well maintained, and there were lots of options for activities for young families within the resort. Our room was not well cleaned...dirty drinking glasses not taken away and replaced, soap and lotion not restocked, areas of the floor not cleaned, shampoo dispenser in shower not filled so we had to pump and pump on it to get enough to wash hair. Our group wanted to play cards, but there was nowhere to do it...in the room or out of it, and the hotel did not have a table to bring to our room, either. For what it is, it's good. It just wasn't for us. oh, and if you order 2 oatmeals and 1 coffee for room service breakfast, expect to pay $35!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Wonderful even in Oct.”
Reviews.Author: gypsy926
Reviews.Content: 2 room bungalows by a little creek with ducks. Big screen t.v., 1 minute walk to the beach. 3 minute drive to Sea World. I won a 2 night stay and it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “FUN FUN FUN”
Reviews.Author: Larry E
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay, hopefully get to go back soon! The place is just beautiful, and the staff was so nice. The only complaint I have is that the Baleen is very overrated!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Larissa_Farias
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful place! I stayed in front of the bay. It was so good. Very cute the sunset. I enjoyed a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but many mandatory add-ons”
Reviews.Author: imhoteb
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at paradise point resort on April 2012. Overall our experience was pleasant. We made the reservation through priceline and we got a really good deal for a 2 Queen garden bedroom overlooking the main pool. The resort is more like a tropical island overlooking a private bay. We visited 5 years ago and I felt that the place is slightly running down. The staff was helpful and friendly. We asked for extra blankets and a pot of hot water and we got both promptly. The pools are nice for the kids. Other activities include tennis, basketball, ping pong and crocket. The only draw backs are: nightly parking fee $32 and a non-optional resort fee of $17 which includes wireless internet in room, unlimited domestic calls, resort activities (not including bike rentals) which adds extra $50 / night. We were ok since we got a good deal from priceline but this will be expensive for those reserving from the hotel directly.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place.”
Reviews.Author: Susan U
Reviews.Content: We did not want to leave and now we cannot wait to go back! Excellent service, check in/out, room, view, location, pool, hot tubs, gift shop, :) etc... Highly recommend. Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break 2011”
Reviews.Author: TammiRae
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the resort for Spring Break 2011. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The front lobby can be deceiving - kind of run down but the room we stayed in was nicely updated and clean. LIked having a choice on the type of pool to swim in and 2 places to eat on site. The Barefoot Grill was very nice. One thing we really liked was being able to take the public bus system to places we wanted to go. We went to Pacific Beach, Sea World, San Diego Zoo, and Old Towne for less than it would cost us to start a rental car. Also went to La Jolla one day, sat for a couple of hours and watched the sea lions - what interesting creatures.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what this hotel tries to be”
Reviews.Author: Evanston_Jeff
Reviews.Content: My perception of this hotel is biased in some ways by the fact that I was on business; had I been traveling for vacation, I may have had a differnt opinion. The resort is set up as a series of small buildings that have two units each. It appears that some of these units have full-time residents and others are used as a hotel. As such, there is an odd vibe of full-time residents and vistors in the complex; this is not a bad thing, just a bit differnt from the usual hotel. The resort tries to give an exotic feel to the location by making it a walking experience, with staff in golf carts always willing to lend someone a ride. However there is very bad signage, and it is easy to get lost; half the time I flagged down a staff member on a cart was to get directions. Geting lost due to a lack fo signage, especially at night with limited street illumination got tiresome quickly. The rooms themselves have an "island like" flavor with hardwood floor, however due to the first level location, I did have some ants in my room, which was a bit unwelcomed. There is a casual and a more formal restaurant in the complex. While I only ate at the casual restaurant, it was not very good. Overall I felt that the resort was lacking something; it seemed like it did not know what it wanted to be, and as a result, it did all things a bit badly. In the end, I would not stay here again in the future and would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “comfort zone”
Reviews.Author: m g
Reviews.Content: I would like to express in words about this resort. I've been to best resorts and hotels of the world in 2 dozens countries and around United States. And I worked in hotels so I know believe me. In fact this year I will stay in Langham in Hongkong and Manila Hotel in Philippines. But when I just want to get away from everything to feel comfortable and to be close to nature this is the place where I will go to.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Becky P
Reviews.Content: We came to Paradise Point for a family Wedding. We had never been there before and were concerned after reading a number of negative comments. The negative comments were all false. We had a wonderful time, even though the weather was terrible. Paradise Point is great, the staff, the restaurants, the rooms, the pools, everything. Special thank you to Mary at Barefoot and Valerie, Jonathan, and Chris (manager) at Baleen's. They all helped make our trip very special. We look forward to returning to San Diego and we will certainly stay at Paradise Point again. Hopefully the weather will be better next time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing from booking through check out....”
Reviews.Author: VUHLer
Reviews.Content: Fantastic customer service from the booking, to the check in, room service, golf cart service haha, and easy quick check out. BEAUTIFUL room / very minimalistic and simply classic ---right on the water, amazing view. Absolutely loved the entire stay. Coming back again soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point - Good family spot”
Reviews.Author: NancyG66
Reviews.Content: The best part of our stay was definitely the multitude of pools and gazebos to help us have a relaxing time. Best burgers and chicken sandwiches we've had in a long time at the Barefoot Grill. Wish the Passport included the putt-putt golf and fitness classes. We ended up having to pay for these, while we hardly used the things on the passport that were included for free.

Reviews.Title: “Really cool resort!”
Reviews.Author: timdrake42
Reviews.Content: We really loved our stay at Paradise Point. We ended up arriving for check in to early and they were kind enough to upgrade our room for free to help us out. Their staff was really kind and very informative. The few restaurants on the resort were really good. Great location to all of the San Diego attractions. Only a 2 minute drive to Sea World. Such a relaxing stay! Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T EVER STAY THERE”
Reviews.Author: Titus B
Reviews.Content: Disgraceful customer service, outdated and dirty rooms and an additional $17/ internet and $35/parking per day charges. Paradise Point is NOT a 4 star property! This property looks and feels like an old trailer park complex masked as a resort so if you live in a trailer, have no money, smoke like a chimney, and care not for what people think of you, you’ll be right at home in this bed bugs infested place. However, if you love you health, want a good nights sleep, and to feel safe and peaceful stay anywhere but this dump. I didn't sleep for 3 days in a row because of the very loud old broken AC in my bungalow. The entrance of the room and patio was covered with more than 50 different cigarette buds. The internet connection was non existent. There was a disgusting pubic hair in the bathroom when we first arrived. I took a bunch of photos of this ''paradise'' to send to the DHR Corporate office. I am very disappointed! What a DISGRACE!

Reviews.Title: “Expectations too high?”
Reviews.Author: sameo416
Reviews.Content: Came to San Diego for a winter get-away, and did not want to stay in a cluster of hotels in the city. Found a not bad discount price for Paradise Point, and the website pictures and description sold us. I came here with quite high expectations. We stayed for 8 days. We stayed in a “Junior Garden Suite” which is a large room with a king bed and a fold-out queen sofa bed. A small kitchenette is at the end, with a fridge and microwave only. A large bathroom with two sinks, a separate room with toilet, tub/shower, and a separate walk-in closet with a dresser and coat rack make up the balance of the room. We had a nice patio looking out over a small pond with ducks, and a view of the ocean lagoon between two adjacent buildings. The room was very clean. The beds were not that good. The king squeaked and rocked every time someone moved. The sofa bed was likewise noisy. The room climate control worked well, but was too loud to leave running over night (when the compressor kicked in it was like sitting next to a large diesel truck). The resort grounds are very nice, a small army of landscapers are working non-stop to clean up palm branches and the like. There was never plant debris on the paved paths. Lots of flowers and trees make up the very nice grounds. Likewise, there is a ton of beach space although it is not really swimming worthy. The resort is surrounded by an ocean lagoon, and the shallows are weedy and green. Lots of sand for digging, suggests this would be a great place for young families looking for quiet beach time. The rooms are average, and the place is showing its age. I spotted a number of rotted lintels or California roofs on rooms, and there was lots of wood in need of fresh paint. I know this humid climate is tough on wood. We were shocked when we finally figured out that the deep blue colour of the pond water is because it has been dyed that colour…along with the feet of many of the ducks (a real surprise for California). The staff were all wonderful and eager to help. I did get a bit tired at the excessive apologizing when I complained, but maybe that is a US thing. One apology is good, then do something to fix the problem – apologizing six times and doing nothing is just frustrating. Nevertheless, everyone I encountered was eager to help out. We ate several meals at the Barefoot bar and grill, and found the food quality quite good if a bit pricey. The service was very good. I have some criticisms, which may seem picky at first. Considering we’re paying something like US$250 per night, I didn’t think my expectations were unreasonable. I’ve stayed at much cheaper places that had much better facilities. The facility charges an added $17 per night which is intended to remove the incremental charges for recreation, well, for some recreation. One benefit is internet access. Problem 1: after 45 minutes on the phone with their tech support people, I still could not get wireless access in our room. When I complained I was told I could get wireless in the lobby, and they gave us a $30 credit. 2: after being out all day (8 am to 8 pm) we returned to find housekeeping had not been through our room. I phoned for extra towels, which were brought by in 30 min. When I asked the next day that housekeeping please stop in as they had missed us, I got multiple apologies but that was it. 3: Looking to print out boarding passes on our departure, I discovered that the only guest printer requires a credit card swipe, with $5 charge for 5 minutes internet plus $1 per page printed. That last one really got me, as I can’t recall ever being in a place that charged for internet use and printing. 4: (a small one) housekeeping made up our room and threw out the one bar of soap without replacing it. 5: I did not check to see if the power was on, but found an exposed outlet and in a different location a light fixture in the gardens with bare wires exposed just adjacent to the path. 6: one day we rented bikes for 4 hours to take a trip down the ocean-side. Cost was $12 per hour ($36 for 4 hours). I was surprised to find similar bikes for rent along the beach for $16 for 4 hours, which reflects the overall high price of everything on the resort. 7: The water taxi to Sea World is a great bonus (for a $9 round-trip ticket), but you need to have pre-purchased tickets for Sea World (we didn’t but had San Diego Go Cards which got us full admission). After being told that was fine at the store the night before, a rather patronizing ex-pat brit boat captain the next morning said we might have problems. He then apologized profusely to the Sea World person that met us while we were standing next to him, leaving us feeling rather embarrassed. They should get their story straight and remember that the customers are the ones riding on the boat, not the Sea World staffer. We made the decision to not rent a car, which was our mistake (trying to really get away from it all). You are very captive to the resort. Public transit passes by every 20 minutes or so (except on Sundays), with the alternate being a cab ride into Old Town for about $20. If we had a car we would have purchased most of our daily use supplies (drinks & snacks) at a local grocery and saved over the much higher costs at the local Island Market (like $12 for a six-pack of Bud). If we returned I would either opt for a downtown hotel, or rent a car for the whole period. A rental car would allow for accessing cheaper activities like bike rentals off-site. Public transit worked well, and we met some really neat locals while riding. Overall I would rate the place as average, but would consider staying here again (with some better preparation, like renting a car). If I did it would be with downgraded expectations, that would not set me up for such disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great family place”
Reviews.Author: 53reba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week at Paradise Point Resort. We took my 89 year-old father, four adult children, and five grandchildren. This was a great place for the group. Staying on the bay allowed for a great big sandy play area for the kids and they also enjoyed playing among the tropical grounds. The weather was cool but the pools were warm enough for swimming and the adults enjoyed the hot tubs. We were centrally located for the various side trips we wanted to take. It was hard to find a place that would accommodate our large group and provide the beach plus swimming pool...this fit our needs....just wish the rooms could have been bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Was a little dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: jzl_12
Reviews.Content: Bungalow on Water DOES NOT look like the one they have posted on their website. It wasn't very clean at all and did NOT have the views they show - For that amount of money, I was expecting A LOT more and didn't get it. The pull out couch was the most uncomfortable thing I have every slept in and the noise across the bay, terrible! I do have to say that the staff was great and they helped us out a lot with our issues. Nice place, kids loved it but I liked the connecting rooms with garden views MUCH more than the bayside bungalow. Terrible service at the restaurant and Baleen was VERY overpriced. Haven't decided if we will go back.

Reviews.Title: “We Stayed for just under a week.”
Reviews.Author: aylaab
Reviews.Content: The room that we had was very nice and updated, the bathroom was good to except that we had ants. We wiped them up the first and third day but they just wouldn't stop coming back. I cant imagine that this isn't something that the cleaning people didn't notice, but they didn't. We had a room on the bay and it was very calm and not very windy so it was nice to sit out and enjoy the sun. One afternoon we had lunch at the bare foot restaurant out side, they had heaters to keep you warm which was nice. I ordered a chicken ceasar salad ($15ish) and it was awful, tasted like instead of making a dressing they just used straight mayo. Sick! My husband ordered a burger which is hard to mess up and he said it was fine nothing special. The other two couples we were there with were also not impressed with the quality of their meals in comparison to the cost. When our bill came, we asked our waiter to split it between the three couples, and he then asked us to total up our own bills and just give him cards to charge. Sorry but isn't that HIS job? Overall for expectation of high quality, fine dining at the resort you would think that they would make sure to hire ONLY the most competent people to assist their guests. That was very clearly not the case. In the gift shop there were people all over the store and a huge line of people to pay for items and only ONE person checking them out.... Since when is standing around your most important job? You are in the service industry. The gentleman who was in charge of the bike rentals was very friendly and helpful and actually seemed to have knowledge about his job. Refreshing. One day we decided to take the water taxi over to sea world which was great, and a fun way to arrive at the park. Only downside to that is that if you want to use the shuttle to come back it only comes back at 5 &6 pm, so you have to be there all day. Which was fine, but it would have been nice to use it to come back earlier. They use Orange Cab to suggest to their customers, but it seemed that they were actually more than other local cabs? not sure, but probably not by too much. I would go back there, but next time I would eat out in town to avoid the poor service and blah food.

Reviews.Title: “Don't plan too many San Diego Activities, as you won't want to leave the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa C
Reviews.Content: Such a beautiful place to stay. We took our family in Sept and had a great trip. The grounds are unreal, and the whole hotel is over the top great! I could not drag myself away from the hotel to tour the city! You have beautiful beaches (and the water is warm as it is very sheltered and shallow) 5 or more pools and hot tubs, fire pits, and propane pits, mini golf, volleyball, basketball, surf lessons, fishing, water rentals, bikes etc all on site! I will be back annually forever. Very relaxing and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Mini-Hawaii. Fabulous cust. svc.We had a great time. Loved the views. Loved the amenities. Going back again this summer.”
Reviews.Author: Nancy B
Reviews.Content: Our family was in need of a extended weekend trip to get away from hustle and bustle of Las Vegas. We found Paradise Point on the internet and decided it looked like a nice place to go de-stress. It did not disappoint in any way. The staff was great, our room was great, and the other guests were great. We did smores at the firepit on the beach, played miniture golf and croquet. We ate on the patio at the Barefoot Grill and enjoyed the scenery as well. Their gift shop has everything, just in case you forget something. It is so close to Sea World you can walk over there. They really have something to do for everyone. We did have one afternoon of rain, but we did not let that get us down, we ordered pizza and watched the storm from our living room playing cards and dice. We decided we have found a new place to hang out this summer. We are definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Probably would never go back. Too many other great places to stay.”
Reviews.Author: roadlinergal
Reviews.Content: Secluded, not much to do at resort. Very spread out and LOTS of walking to get anywhere. If you have mobility issues, very challenging. Our maid service was very poor - had to come back 3 times in 1 day. Very few places to eat, but food was VERY good. Grounds were stunningly beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: PigletsInParadise
Reviews.Content: We were extremely impressed by the service and atmosphere at Paradise Point. We wanted a sunny getaway and this resort was perfect. They provided an excellent environment to let go and de-stress from the city. It's centrally located so it's around $20 or less cab ride to Old Town, La Jolla, and Ocean Beach. The drinks are tasty and the bar tacos (served up by Bryce the pool bartender) are actually pretty delicious! The marina creates a resourceful spot to watch pelicans dive and crew and outrigger teams cruise by, and with a little wind you can learn how to sail! The room was clean, modern & fashionable and exactly what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay on a tropical island. Close to everyting but the feel of seclusion surrounds you.”
Reviews.Author: Jkatie
Reviews.Content: When you arrive you feel far from the hussle and bussle of San Diego. You are transported to the tropics. Surounded by lush gardens and quiet. Children friendly with walking paths and pools. If you choose to stay you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Place of plently "policies" designed to rip of guests”
Reviews.Author: DMGR28970
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip for a small group in anticipation of booking a larger group of high end business travelers. As a professional I wouldn't book this place even if it were free. They have policies that are very guest unfriendly and all designed to bait and switch room rates and gouge prices. They have a 72 hour cancellation policy which is fine, but one room was booked and then less than 10 hours later cancelled and they still wanted to be paid full price for the room. All the guests were government employees except one guest forgot hise id. Even though the rest of the group had required ids, the hotel had a policy to bump the price up substantially. The front desk failed to make a change in the dinner reservation. Just forgot. Their "business center" is one computer and there is always a line to use it even to print simple tasks like boarding passses. Rooms were supposed to be king. All were 2 queens instead. The floor is some kind of cermic and freezing cold. No slippers or even a small rug to break up the cold. The heaters make more noise than a locomotive. It is liky TRYING to sleep by the railroad tracks. Lighting is poor and unsuitable if you want to read or do any work. Watch your bill. They will try and double charge you for the same room. DMGR

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for our 30th Wedding Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: Tammy F
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we have been to Paradise Point Resort & Spa. I have to admit like others after reading some of the negative comments that I was unsure about my choice BUT please remember everybody has different opinions! I have to say I was mesmerized as we drove onto the grounds and found such beauty! We were greeted by Ben who was super!! Diego at the front desk was amazing, great comps, again Thank you!!! When we arrived in our room, which were upgraded to, we opened our patio door the the view and had ducks waiting for us (ok I am a sucker for furry friends.) We also had a very nice card and a basket of fruit waiting for us. We enjoyed our first evening by the pool and hot tub, right outside our room. Again amazing! The next day we grabbed our coffee and scones at the coffee shop and again, staff superb! Headed off for a road trip to Joshua Tree..long drive but beautiful, despite the wind and extremely windy road on the way back, but what and adventure! when we got back to our room we had a plate of chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of wine waiting for us, courtesy of our daughter and son in-law! Called the front desk for a cork screw, not realizing one was laying on the table...arrived in 2 minutes! Cannot ask for better service. So if you are ever in the area I would highly recommend Paradise Point. The amenities as super and the staff are just as awesome. Yes there is a resort fee of $17 and there is a parking fee of $32 a day, but have you checked out some other places? Our original plans were to go to Vegas, hmmm, can you say resort fees...I will take these fees and get an awesome stay, great beaches, at a very classy resort!! Great job all of you, pat yourselves on the back. We will be back! Beds were great, room was clean!

Reviews.Title: “the area is beautiful,swim,bike ride,walking.it was a great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Maggie T
Reviews.Content: the turn into pardise point was a beautiful. i knew then this place was awesome. we hit all five pools, used the spa, had a great massage treatment. The coffee in the room isn't good,so bring your own. or the coffee bar coffee is very good. We used the bikes,we rode 15 miles or so. the barefoot bar was very relaxing. we ate there 2 nights,great salads&mashed potatoes. It is a very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great”
Reviews.Author: knm_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Bayside Bungalow, which was beautiful, but by far the best aspect of Paradise Point was the consistently great service! Whether it was at the cafe, the restaurant, or the guy driving the golf cart, everybody was friendly, helpful, and delivered the type of service you'd expect at top tier resort. The grounds were also amazing. We enjoyed the pools, the basketball court, and roasting marshmallows by campfire. Looking forward to going back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “A True Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Susie C
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place to get away to and relax. I couldn't have picked a better spot. The staff is warm and welcoming and the rooms are great! the Resort was more than I expected, and I was able to just sit back and relax near the lagoon while enjoying the beauty of my surroundings. The beach is also perfect for any time of the day or night, we were able to enjoy s'mores while sitting on the shore to watch the sunset. It really is paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Don't read the old reviews.... This is all you need to know”
Reviews.Author: Destinedfor2013
Reviews.Content: We recently travelled to Paradise Point, to get away from the midwest "blah" winter we've been having. Knowing that San Diego was our destination, we started looking around for properties to spend our 5 nights and 6 days. To be honest, we also were a bit apprehensive by the negative remarks made by some reviewers, so we looked for a bit at the Hilton by the Bay, and a couple of others. However, after some discussions, we decided to go with our instinct, realizing that there will ALWAYS be unhappy people out there, quick to nit-pick every last detail, and those whose standards are just ridiculously unattainable. THANK GOD we listened to our inner voice. From the moment we turned the corner on Vacation Drive, we knew we had arrived at our home for a week. Pulling up to the valet, we were greeted by the main man, Marc Garner, who quickly became our SD guru of all things. We cannot say enough amazing things about the staff at PP, from the valet, cleaning crew, grounds keepers, room service, spa staff, bar and restaurant crew, and management. The GM of the property has a kind, compassionate group of extraordinary people working for him, who go out of their way to make the guests at this resort feel as if you are the only people they are there to take care of. But we MUST give extra props to our guy Marc..... He's a gem.... We will certainly come back and he is one of the main reasons why. Our bungalow on the beach was a sweet little apartment, very clean, with a immediate beach access and a fire pit steps away. We ended up meeting some incredible people the first night we were there and met up a few more times throughout the week.... A nice community feel if you're up for that, but no pressure if you're not. The grounds themselves made you feel as though you were on an island of a combination of Tahiti, Figi, and Hawaii. Bikes to ride, mini golf to play, multiple pools to swim in, (including an adults-only pool), spa to relax in, bars on the water to let loose, a phenomenal restaurant to dine at, trails to walk, and beachfront to get lost on. And this is all just on the property. Rent a car if you'd like to get our and explore. Head to the San Diego Zoo and be sure NOT to miss Balboa Park. Go to Ocean Beach, Pacific Beach, Mission Bay, Belmont Park, head down to La Jolla and see the seals, then make a reservation at either George's and have the carrot cake for dessert or stop in at Crabcatcher. Make love and enjoy the love. It won't be hard to do at Paradise Point.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Paradise!!!”
Reviews.Author: atlantacmh
Reviews.Content: This resort is absolutely amazing.....hands down!!! I have to admit, prior to arrival I had been scrolling through some of the reviews on Trip Advisor, and a few of them left me somewhat apprehensive and nervous about what to expect. How silly of me......this place is great!!!!! The moment you arrive, you feel as if you have been "transported" to a tropical paradise, literally. The grounds are beautifully maintained, and the front desk staff were all very polite and welcoming. Our room was great, the beds super comfy, and the bathroom very nice....with a really powerful shower head, haha. Honestly, one of the greatest pleasures of this place is walking around and exploring the grounds. I have to say one last time....they are beautiful!!!! The pools are gorgeous, especially the main pool with a great pool bar and spa tub. We enjoyed chilling at the spa tub at night. There are also several bonfire pits scattered around the property which are lit at night. I'm convinced that if you do not like this property, you need to have your head examined. The place is fantastic, and I cannot wait to return sometime very soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience; there are better choices in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable with a great shower and nice king bed. The TV service was not digital and had a very muddy picture. Price was affordable using a Groupon. But the food service was subpar. It took us an hour and 45 minutes to get served breakfast -- usually one of the great pleasures for us when we stay at a nice place. The only breakfast restaurant was severely understaffed. After being seated 15 minutes, we asked a busboy to find our server and watched as he approached a server who waved him off. We were ultimately served by a bartender who was extremely pleasant. I did speak with the manager who offered us another night at the resort, which we declined. Our second morning we drove to a local breakfast spot that was great. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: comoxtravellwer
Reviews.Content: My daughter had booked us in at paradise from Mar 4 for 3 nights,supposedly a 4 Star property,we were advised that when we checked in there was a $32.00 per day parking fee,plus an additional $17.00 for use of the internet, pool and other various venues,we paid,After the first night I had to go around and ask if the housekeeper was going to come in and tidy up our rooms at 5PM,which they did.My daughter complained on checkout about the added expences but to deaf ears,my wife detected bites on her back,which turned out to bed bug bites,I will DEFINITELY not stay there or recommend that property in this life time

Reviews.Title: “we had a great family vacation, memories will last forever!! thanks so much!!!”
Reviews.Author: murrains
Reviews.Content: we had a awesome vacation the grounds are amazing, staff was so helpful even with public transportation, we will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Rachel J
Reviews.Content: The property is old - but in California - the best locations are usually the older properties. Right by the beach, Sea World, parks etc. The room was nicely updated. Some other reviews complained about mold or mildew. It is very humid so there is a bit of that. The bathroom was clean. I liked the bedding. They only have a runner over the bed that doesn't get washed - the rest of the bedding is white and very comfortable. We used the hot tub, and walked around. Lots of families. Pros: Shower head, bedding, grounds, location Cons: The parking fee is outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing weekend”
Reviews.Author: PollyMommy
Reviews.Content: We booked a King bayside suite for the weekend $308 When we got there we were upgraded to a bungalow. It was nice and large with living area, dining area, kitchenette, and double sink/closet bathroom. They even gave us a tub of choco chip cookies! Score! YES I know parking is $32 a day and resort fee is $17. But I knew all this because of you guys here! The room was clean. Service at Barefoot Bar was poor at lunch and great for dinner. The PP grounds are beautiful. Nice pools and gym. We had a fire in the beach fire pit both nights. Just really relaxing. If you look for deals online it can be well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Long Review for You...”
Reviews.Author: WhiteRock_Gal
Reviews.Content: You DEFINITELY want to rent a vehicle if you're not arriving in one!! More on that later... We were Priceline customers and they treated us well (not differently as other hotels do). Front desk was friendly- as soon as she started registering us, I asked if it was possible to get a room with a view. They were all sold out but she did give us a room VERY close to the bay! Such a lovely view! The front desk girl told us that she was going to initially put us in a room with a parking lot view- it pays to ASK for a nicer room & they do accommodate so make sure you ask! The room itself- or what it really is, a bungalow- was a decent size. One big room with 2 bed and a separate area for sink and bathroom with tub and toilet. Yes, the room was old and did look dated. No, the beds weren't as comfortable as one would hope (too soft, slightly saggy?). BUT we did only pay $80 a night so absolutely no complaining here. The room was clean and you could tell attempts were made to make it look well-kept. There was a small safe in the "closet" area and that's always appreciated. Oh, make sure you bring slippers or flip flops to wear around the place! Even though the weather was warm, the floor was COLD and hard on our feet! The "amenities"- we were charged $15 nt for resort amenities (it's since gone up to $17 I believe). We were gone for most of the 3 days were there (to the Zoo, SeaWorld, etc) so didn't get to utilize the amenities as much as we could have. We were close to the main pool and it looked nice. We did get a chance to play mini-golf and that was fun for our 7 yr old (it's just a small course spread out around the resort). I know you could rent bikes but we didn't want to fork over $25/hr. And the spa seemed to offer a lot of interesting services but, again, didn't want to be spending the big bucks on those (they weren't cheap!) Lastly, we did end up getting up room service one evening and it was VERY expensive! We ordered 2 burgers w/ fries and a small pizza for our kid. On top of the food, they charged us $5 for room service + tip (it was either !5% or 20%- can't remember) so I think we paid something ridiculous like $65 for this meal!! Bit pricey IMO. Back to the vehicle point... we didn't rent one and kicked ourselves the whole time we were there! It seemed every one else had one, though. Smart people. The resort is on it's own little "island" and there's nothing around. I mean nothing. No pharmacy or fast food joint. Which could be nice if we had a vehicle to jump in and drive to these places. We did walk to SeaWorld- took about 25-30 minutes from our room to the front gate. It's just over the small bridge but it was hot and we were a bit tired by the time we got there. On the way back, we cabbed it because we were tired from walking around all day. Now, cab prices. It cost us about $10 one way from SeaWorld to the resort. Not too bad. But the next day we went to the Zoo and I think it cost us about $25 one way. Rent a vehicle!! Yes, most likely you'd have to pay for the parking at the resort which I hear is like $30 night but the inconvenience of it all... esp if you're bringing kids- not worth it. First you have to call a cab, wait for the cab, pay the cab- on the way back, same deal. We did ask about buses but it was going to take us 3x the time to get where we wanted and it did not appear to be easy at all. With a kid, this would've been a nightmare so we abandoned that idea. If you're going to the resort simply to enjoy the lovely views and all it's amenities, and don't plan on leaving at all, then don't get a car. But if you want to be able to even leave to get a meal outside the resort, I think you'll want to ensure you have a vehicle. Last thoughts... the resort is very peaceful and laid out so nicely. Lovely views, ducks everywhere, little ponds, chairs set out to read by the views, golf cart escorts... really quite quaint and reminds one of another era. We'd never been anywhere like this (in North America) and were a little awed by the size and greenery. Nice place if you want quiet time or a romantic getaway or even to take the kids away for some fun. It seemed it would suit a whole demographic of people. I just don't think I'd pay the "regular" prices during high season. I hope this lengthy review helps! : )

Reviews.Title: “Good place for "R & R"”
Reviews.Author: TamsF98335
Reviews.Content: Property is beautiful. Staff is friendly. Be choosy about room location/condition. It's located on an island in Mission Bay so if you don't have a car, learn to use public transportation. The Old Town Trolley Tour shuttle picks up each day. Highly recommend that adventure. Public transportation is accesible if you don't have a car. If you do have a car, be prepared to pay $32/night for parking. We had great weather and friendly staff. Delicious food. Clean, not crowded pools. Felt like we had escaped to a tropical island for a week. Other than a loud heat/air unit and a mildewy window curtain, it would have been a perfect Paradise experience.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Paradise is what they say when you check in!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela L
Reviews.Content: Definitely felt like we were in Paradise all week long. Very friendly and helpful staff. Food was great and service was top notch. Wonderful time at this resort. No complaints. So quiet and peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “a great getaway from the city”
Reviews.Author: skrooz
Reviews.Content: My cousin took me here for a 2-day getaway for my birthday on March 2012. The bungalow she got was right by the beach. It was quite breathtaking. It was very quiet and relaxing. The staff was super friendly. I got a massage and body scrub at The Spa. The massage therapist was good but he was too chatty. I would have given this resort five stars except for three things. One. The telephone was dirty. Two. The remote for the TV was broken and it took them awhile to send somebody to fix it. Three. The food in the restaurant in the resort and room service needs some kind of "umpf". It's quite bland. The menu needs more of a variety.

Reviews.Title: “Will be our first choice for accommodations in the San Diego area. Best sleep I have ever had in a hotel room.”
Reviews.Author: FromSouthTexas
Reviews.Content: Will be our first choice for accommodations in the San Diego area. Best sleep I have ever had in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “OK resort but should not be rated as a 4*”
Reviews.Author: Najebo
Reviews.Content: We stayed there a couple nights beginning of March. We had a good stay but I just find that it doesn’t deserve the 4* when I compare it to some other 4* properties (I have Westins and Hiltons in mind). The staff at the reception is pleasant, the ladies from housekeeping are adorable but the valet was not so helpful. We were supposed to get a map of the resort from him but we never did, so I’m sure we missed out on a lot of areas of the resort. When you arrive at the resort, you definitely feel somewhere exotic, the landscape is really nicely done. The room. We got room 146 which was garden view… well it was more of a neighbor’s view. Our bungalow was facing another one and there is not so much space between them so if you keep your curtains open, you can see right inside your neighbor’s bungalow. In order to keep our privacy we had to keep our curtains closed at all times: quite a shame when you come all the way from Canada to see the sun! We could see that the room had been updated, but in a very superficial way: the furniture is nice, the colors are contemporary but when you look closely, the drywall was not updated as it is uneven, the windows are very old and don’t do well with condensation and the worst part was the bathroom. The sink area is ok, with its granite counter but the bathtub/WC area looks as bad as a Motel6 bathroom. The white tiling and grout looks really dated and they put a very cheap shower curtain, the same kind I had in a Motel6. If you want to be a 4*, have glass doors to the tub and nice fixtures… I did appreciate the soap/shampoo/conditioner dispenser, as it is way more environmental friendly. The towels were horrible: when I go to a 4*, I like to think I will get nice white plush bath towels in which I can just curl up after a bath, well not here. It almost feels like you’re getting a body scrub when you use them! The bed was great, we slept very well, it might be on the firm side, but we didn’t mind. There is a ton of storage if you are going to stay there several days and you have an actual walk-in closet. The mildew smell is very unpleasant at first, but if you turn on the A/C, you’ll forget about it after a while. We did start having runny noses at the end of our stay, so that would be another reason for us not to stay there again. The resort. I can’t say much about the resort itself as we didn’t really hang out there. We went once to the hot tub behind our bungalow. We first wanted to go swim in the pool, but ducks were already swimming in that pool and it kind of grossed us out. The beach seemed ok, but we went to other beaches (Coronado and La Jolla). Food I cannot comment on the resort’s restaurants, as we never had a meal there. What I REALLY DISLIKED were the fees. For 2 nights, we paid $97.78 in fees ON TOP of the room rate. That includes the parking fee of $32 and the resort fee of $17 plus the taxes. I usually never complain about the parking fee, especially in a city center; but here, you’re definitely NOT in a city center and every single room has it’s own parking space right in front of the door. So if the room is empty, that space will not be used by anybody else. I think the parking fee should just be included in the room rate. The resort fee is ridiculous and they probably know it because at check-in, they give you a whole booklet dedicated to justifying the resort fee and what it includes. It includes: internet, phone calls, fitness center, basketball, tennis, ping pong, croquet, horseshoes and bocce ball. It’s probably a great deal when you use everything but we didn’t and would have appreciated the possibility to opt out of this service. All in all I wasn’t that disappointed because I did not have high expectations AND because we only paid $70 for our room through Priceline. It’s maybe worth the $70 + $35 parking + $17 resort fee + tax but I’m not even sure. It’s definitely NOT worth the $200+ official room rate (on top of which you will add the fees). I would not recommend that place but if you really do want to go there, please find some way to get your room cheap and you’ll be less disappointed. If they had been rated as a 3* or 3.5*, my review would have been less harsh.

Reviews.Title: “Paradisiacal”
Reviews.Author: normpich
Reviews.Content: As usual, unbeatable in San Diego, if you were looking to stay enjoy outdoors life in a superb ambiance surrounded by Water, Fresh Air, Luscious Vegetation, and plenty of visiting Birds. Great place for Family gatherings, Nature lovers, Waters Sports, Joggers, and also for Group events. The weather contributed beautifully, since during our 4 night stay we enjoyed wonderful Sunshine with 78 F. temperatures.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time, you truely feel transformed when you are here!”
Reviews.Author: RoomServiceGal
Reviews.Content: Went here as part of a group for a relaxing weekend and it was the perfect spot to unwind. I understand they have made some upgrades, get a room by the bay! Baleen had an amazing menu (try the pork chop) and how fun is it when you can have smores on the beach! If you can't spend the money on Hawaii, go to Paradise Point and enjoy all their amenities. You truely feel like you are transformed when you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Massive fees”
Reviews.Author: CJ222
Reviews.Content: I was shocked when I was awarded a four star hotel on Priceline for only $67 per night. I would quickly find out why. Parking is $32 per night (up from $25 last year apparently, looking through older posts), resort fees are $17 per night, and the main pool by the spa was closed for renovations while I was there. It looked like the spa was closed too, but I can not verify that. They tried to justify the fees by saying I got the hotel for such a great rate, but if I were interested in paying $116 for a hotel I would have bid that high. I would have even considered this a steal if only the resort fee were levied. For the excessive parking fee of $32 per night (I paid $22 per night at my hotel downtown--where parking is actually at a premium) one of the resorts work trucks parked in my reserved spot during the second day I was there. Luckily I had rented a car, because if not I would have been miserable. The resort is very secluded from any other restaurants, shops, or bars other than the overpriced ones they have onsite ($30 for pasta w/no meat and happy hour priced beer), and as a solo traveler it was not ideal. The actual room was fine. I see a lot of terrible reviews on here about the rooms but I did not experience any issue with bugs or any smell, although I was not in a bay front room. It definitely wasn't luxury, but it was far from a hostel as someone suggested. (Though the towels were awful). The area and views were quite lovely as were the pool areas (an adults only pool was key). I think the resort has real potential.

Reviews.Title: “Will not come back!”
Reviews.Author: LostAngeles
Reviews.Content: We received a reservation at this property as a Christmas gift and wanted to take advantage of it before expired. Will not step foot on this property again. It is not what they advertise for. The worst part was the smell in the rooms. We tried two rooms and both had the mildew smell that was just unbearable. The second room we received was a suite and the room appeared to be upgraded, modern tile floors, marble in the bathroom, nice bedding, but the kitchen had very old cabinets and the smell just unbearable. Even the next day after got out of the room all our clothes still had the damp, mildew, mold smell! We had dinner at one of the restaurants on property and service was average, the restaurant looked so and so nothing fancy, but the prices were very high (e.g. fish and chips $18 ) We didn't have to pay for room rate but parking, resort fee, and a very low key dinner (pizza and chesadilla) added up to $150 ( !!!)

Reviews.Title: “Paradise, yes...value, so-so.”
Reviews.Author: Angela A
Reviews.Content: Overall, Paradise Point is a beautiful, breathtaking place with amazing views of Mission Bay, beaches and more. Stepping out of our room and onto the surgary sand was wonderful. The staff was courteous and friendly. The only things that were unpleasent was that there was old, moldy fruit in our fridge, our valet didn't pick us up upon checkout as requested, the market was highly overpriced and there were little ants that found their way into our room. We did not let any of that damper our relaxing vacation. We had a fabulous time and would probably stay there again despite the minor issues. The birds and wildlife are abundant...even had a group of ducks follow me around in hopes of a cracker...I gave in. ;-) They were too cute. It truly is a beautiful place and it's its own island. How cool is that?!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not be Cheated!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kathy H
Reviews.Content: We booked 4days 3 nights there. It was super dark when we drove in as they only lit up with fire in the facility (like "Survival" feeling). Never did we expect the room in there to be like "Survival" too. They given us standard room saying there is a garden view. My foot.. its was only a tree truck and a tiny patch of grass and they call it garden! We find that it was unacceptable and therefore upgrade to patio room. It was slightly better but was horrible too. The room sucks. There are cracks on the wall & on the bathtub. The paint on the door was peeling off. The carpet on the floor has a thick coating of "hair/fur" and so is the panels on the window which is extremely dusty. It was really a paradise for the insects cos we could find ants on the coffee table. We had tough time sleeping through cos was sneezing in the room, not sure if it was cause by the dust on the bed or in the room. There are additional charges for the carpark and internet. Terrible, terrible place... 4 star???? Dont be cheated. With the amount of $ paid there, we could get better & cleaner room. Don't Ever go there.. people given thumb up there.. really doubt their integrity!

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: Katlak
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property with small bugalow type rooms.Even if your room is not on the bay it is a short walk. The bayside dining is realaxing for breakfast and fun around happy hour when the weather is nice. You can dock your boat after a few hours on the bay then stop in for something to eat. Paradise Point is one of my husbands favorite resorts. Parking is pricey, I really don't understand how Hotels think it is right to charge people to park while they are staying at their hotel. CRAZY.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Tracey M
Reviews.Content: If you want tranquility, Paradise Point provides! There are individual "bunglalows" which offers plenty of privacy and no noise from guests above or below you. The location is ideal-you can walk to Sea World, and there are 2 restaurants on site. Very tropical-almost Hawaiian. At night, Tiki torches are lit, and almost every imaginable palm grows here. Koi ponds with quaint bridges and pitcuresque fountains. The staff is extremely helpful and polite. I am a travel agent by trade, and would recommend this to anyone-from families to couples.

Reviews.Title: “Local excursion felt like a real escape”
Reviews.Author: jwmoose
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live about 30 minutes from Paradise Point and chose it for a locat getaway / overnight break from our two young kids for her birthday. We were at a Bali, Indonesia resort in 2008, and surveying the Paradise Point property upon entering the grounds brought me back to those tropical days. The initial positive impression continued as everyone from valet to the front desk courteously ensured that we knew where we were going and what we were doing in pursuit of some R & R. Our bungalow was spacious, well situated, and super clean. Time slowed down (needed that) as we walked the resort, climbed the observation tower, and had a drink at the restaurant bar. The resort is centrally located not far from the heart of San Diego, so we were in Coronado for dinner in no time. We didn't even get to take advantage of the pools/jacuzzi, outdoor activities, and fire pits and s'more kits, so I can imagine that families would find ways to stay entertained for longer stays.

Reviews.Title: “Delusionally (prob not a word) over-priced”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyBoySB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding. Property was nice, definitely a little dated. The rooms were fairly clean and quiet. Staff was friendly. One night including taxes/resort fee/parking hit a grand total of $280. A financial reaming considering the age of the resort and the condition of the facilities/rooms etc. You could do a lot more with that amount of money in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Jess_in_DC
Reviews.Content: So I am not a resort type of girl but I really enjoyed Paradise Point. It was chill and relaxed. Their customer service was excellent, truly excellent. My sister (who admittedly can be demanding) called to ask for microwave delivered to our room so she could heat up her leftovers. 10 minutes later we had our microwave, no questions asked. Our room was great - clean and spacious - with a lovely patio we ate breakfast on. It felt private and secluded. It was also easier to explore San Diego from the resort than I expected. The resort is on the bus line. It's also a long walk to Mission Beach (about 2 miles) but a lovely walk if you want to eat out in Mission Beach. There's a nice running loop of 5 miles too from the resort. I was running a conference for work there and their conference staff was amazing. Seriously every request was granted quickly.
