The food and coffee were really good too. They let us eat our meals as a group out on the patio overlooking the bay -- and they also gave us the flexibility to move the group inside if needed. We really enjoyed having our meeting there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection within perfection. Never wanted to leave.”
Reviews.Author: Pat and Tami D
Reviews.Content: It has been a very long time since I have felt so relaxed and well cared for while on vacation. We traveled to Paradise Point to attend my nephews wedding - little did I know that this unique facility would capture my heart as well. Each staff member that we came into contact with really seemed interested in our enjoyment and well being. There was no rush, rush of other hotels. The minute you arrive, you feel calm, relaxed and in a different world. I would not hesitate to hold ANY event here as the staff is completly capable of handling any party and any request. Marc would be the man I would request as my Bell Captain as he is charming and very attentive. Cannot wait to return. Thanks all!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Milwgirl24
Reviews.Content: The resort is very beautiful, everything from the rooms, lobby, grounds, pool area, etc. It's a very relaxing place and would be somewhere I would love to stay for a few days & not leave. My only complaint is the mandatory $17 resort fee they tack on for the "convenience" of using the fitness center, etc. and the steep parking costs. The girl checking us in said "it's normally $28/night but I'd be happy to cut that in half for you." Ok thanks, even $14/night is steep when you're already paying alot for the room. Either way, if you can get a good rate it's worth staying.

Reviews.Title: “Garden of Eden”
Reviews.Author: Edward B
Reviews.Content: Resort name is an understatement. It was like living in The Garden of Eden for three days. Harbourside room was awesome! Easy access to all of San Diego, #5 and #8.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent space for conferences, friendly staff, beautiful resort.”
Reviews.Author: jesmick
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort, well maintained, with excellent amenities. The food on site is a bit pricey, but good. The staff is fantastic. I didn't walk past anyone who didn't smile and say hello. It felt like they were all glad to have me there. The conference facilities are very nice and could fit anyone's meeting needs.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: kjayw
Reviews.Content: We came here for a wedding and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Fun to walk around the bay; the area is wonderful. The room was large enough for my wife, my two teenage boys and myself to share comfortably. Amenities at the hotel are good, including the pier where you can rent a waverunner-which my boys loved. They had a good deal if you rent before 2 pm - you get an extra half hour for free. Price included breakfast, parking and resort fee, so it was very competitively priced. Will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this resort”
Reviews.Author: NativeNYer39
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point is always my "go-to" when visiting SD. I have stayed here a number of times and am never disappointed. Great location and easy on/off freeways, beautiful grounds, lovely beach, extremely attentive and friendly staff. Dining: I've eaten at the Barefoot Bar & Grill on previous visits and was not that wow-ed so I haven't been back to eat - only for drinks, and I would absolutely recommend it for that (outdoor patio on the water? Hell yeah!). This visit we ate breakfast at Baleen and it was delicious and service was great. Oh, and thank God for adults-only pools :)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Paradise Point!”
Reviews.Author: MontaukFan
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. The breakfast at the barefoot grill was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Staci W
Reviews.Content: My husband selected this resort because, after a few days downtown for business, we wanted more of a get-away. We found Paradise Point the perfect place. It's just secluded enough to be quiet and comfortable, but still close to attractions and dining. I read other reviewers' complaints about the high cab fares, and they are pretty steep, but it was so economical to stay at the resort, that it really off-set the higher cab fares. (And it was worth it to use be in a quiet bungalow!) We walked to Sea World and a whale-watching expedition and took the bus up to La Jolla. I recommend both. If you don't want to, there is no need to leave the resort. We also enjoyed running around the small island and sitting by the fire on the beach outside our bungalow in the evenings. The only negative (and I don't know what the hotel staff could do) was that at this time of year (February) they only have one pool and hot tub open and people had their babies and small children (ages 9 mos. to 3 yrs.) in the hot tub! This was just so inappropriate, unhealthy and unsanitary we left and didn't get to enjoy the hot tub. Again, not sure what the staff could have done except enforce an age requirement, but it was disappointing nontheless.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Lost”
Reviews.Author: SHanson12
Reviews.Content: Over-rated and over-priced. I gave up superior lodging at half the price to come in early based on the misleading photos and promos. The room was musty and the a/c and decor was from the days of Ozzie and Harriet. The patio was like you were sitting on cheap Walmart white plastic patio furniture in the midst of an overgrown jungle. Then they have the audacity to charge you a daily resort fee on top of a daily parking fee for the priviledge of parking your car by your dual sided hut. The eateries are way overpriced and just average. Denny's, KFC, and Red Lobster are but a few miles away and no less than comparable at half the price. Poolside menu item prices are out of sight. The whole "resort" is event and conference driven for those on expense accounts, so buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect destination hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Diego1
Reviews.Content: It's somewhat cliche and maybe I mentioned this in my last review but they really do make you feel as if you are in some type of tropical paradise. Everyone was extremely pleasant and welcoming - not the fake forced hello at most hotels but the genuine aloha type hospitality. The rooms are great (very clean) and the grounds are very well manicured and look incredible. Seriously, it's a little paradise. I also spent a lot of time exploring San Diego and the location made it easy to get to the cliffs or to head up north to Torrey Pines.

Reviews.Title: “This was the very best vacation me and my husband ever took, the staff was wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: maxiegirl01
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went for our anniversary, and we were so happy we chose paradise point resort enjoyed everday!!! We will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: pressonjh
Reviews.Content: The resort has a great stay and play location, nice pools and gardens, decent food, nice spa, marina rentals, walking the beach.... The rooms/bungalows are a little sub par for such nice grounds. We found them clean with decent beds, flat screen, couch and fridge. The staff accommodated us with a microwave upon request. The 1 king bedroom we had (304) was a non-view rm (almost literally), with windows facing the hedges along the access parking roads. If we return here we'd probably pay the extra 100 p night to stay in beach side accommodations or ask for a noisy poolside room for the kids to enjoy. Housekeeping was not the best, just perfunctory. Ice machines are at pools, so it can be a little jaunt. I recommend this as a place to stay and play. If you're away exploring very much, you're missing what you pay for here.

Reviews.Title: “A fun time for the family at Paradise Point!”
Reviews.Author: hawaiifun2
Reviews.Content: My family had a great time at Paradise Point recently. The staff was super friendly and responsive - quite possibly the best at any resort we've stayed at. There are lots of reasons to stay there - activities on-site, proximity to major tourist sites. We walked down to the beach only once, and briefly. From what we could tell, it was not in good shape. Maybe just the time of year, I don't know. Anyway, if we were looking for beach vacation next time I would inquire about the state of the beach, and maybe look elsewhere. However, if we were looking for a resort with a lot of services and activities on-site, we would definitely return to Paradise Point!

Reviews.Title: “trip to paradise”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly W
Reviews.Content: My stay at Paradise Point was exceptional. I had a great time. It was relaxing and made me feel like I was on an island retreat getaway. The scenery was beautiful. Hotel staff was very knowledgable and welcoming. I will return for future vacations and would recommend this resort to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, wonderful venue”
Reviews.Author: mlewsimpson51atyahoo
Reviews.Content: We got a great off-season price on a very nice location and stay at Paradise Point Resort & Spa - my business associates had great privacy, peace, views in an environmentally aware and sensitive location. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Reg B
Reviews.Content: I had the great opportunity to stay at the Paradise Resort & Spa and it was fabulous. The staff from drive up to exit were outstanding. The grounds are immaculate, the breakfast, lunch and dinner menu's were complete and offered a variety of great dining choices. My room faced the harbor and what a relaxing sunset with the beach, water and boats. This was a business trip for me and I travel extensively, one of my biggest gripes is not being able to work in peace. That was not the case here, I was able to work and enjoy the tranquility together. I enjoyed room service with hot food delivered, concierge service with knowledgeable people. The list of my great experience goes on. I would suggest this Resort for Absolute Relaxation, Business Meetings and Corporate Events.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point is paradise!”
Reviews.Author: S W
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we knew we had found someplace special. An oasis on the edge of the bay that makes you feel like you are in a tropical resort and not in an urban city. There is beauty all around. The grounds are manicured and maintained beyond belief. Everything about this hotel is first rate. The staff have a fantastic attitude and are there to make your stay as memorable as possible. I cannot say anything bad about this treaure. I hope it is around for a very long time!!! On a more detailed note, no bedbugs! No bugs at all and considering we were next to the pond, is amazing. We had a beautiful garden suite and it was stylish, clean and very comfortable. The food in Baleen was extaordinary. The tenderloin was one of the best I've had. My only disapointment was I didn't get out at night to try the bonfire on the beach as I had a cold. We did try a sail on the bay with a captain for hire. It was a great experience, my only recommendation would be to bring towels to sit on if you go for the two hour tour. Hard seats get harder by the second hour. We will return to this hotel every time we return to San Diego and recommend it to all our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Terri W
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay at The Paradise Point Resort and Spa in the Spring of last year as a reward for my husbands great work for his company. The resort was beautiful!! We stayed in one of the bungalows that were located right on the bay. It had a separate living area and a closed off bedroom with a front patio that faced the bay. We took advantage of the spa service, cocktails and dining at The Barefoot Bar and Grill, and even had a gathering around our own private beach bonfire one night. We would HIGHLY recommend this beautiful property to couples, families, or corporate events! Thank you for a most memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great retreat, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: mommountain
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. The rooms are little duplexes, so they have a nice private feeling. We traveled with a 3 year old and a 1 year old. My children loved feeding the ducks and seagulls every morning right out the back door of our room. You wouldn't even have to leave to hotel to have a great vacation. You can rent a boat or go on a sail trip right from the hotel. The staff was very friendly and accomadating. The Hotel is a perfect location for San Diego, everything is minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Never have to leave the property”
Reviews.Author: YEGirl
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay of nine days in early February. It was very quiet, for most of the trip we felt like we had the place to ourselves. Friday & Saturday nights were a bit noisier as there was a business conference being held, but there were no problems. The staff are all very friendly, smiling and waving and saying hello. We were upgraded to a beachfront room, and it was so nice to walk out the door and down to the water. Our toddler loved building sandcastles just in front of the room. Other highlights for him were feeding the ducks that hang around on the pond (and they sell little packages of duck food in the island market), climbing the lookout tower, going swimming in the main (heated) pool, and roasting marshmallows on one of the fires they have. As parents, we appreciated the onsite laundry (which was located by a pool, so you can go swimming while your clothes are washing), the good housekeeping staff who were accommodating to our child's naptimes, and the feeling of quiet & safety. I felt no hesitation wandering around the resort after dark. The food at Baleen was good, we ate there every day as the Barefoot was closed for renovations The staff were understanding about having a child in tow, and promptly brought to go containers, and supplied us with the extras (ketchup & peanut butter) that toddlers appreciate. We had an awesome stay, I'm sure I'm forgetting things but can't say enough good things about this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be Happier”
Reviews.Author: Dan F
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place - clean, comfortable with grest amenities, full facilities and stellar staff. Styaed for 3 days in off-season and found everything to be close to perfect. Spacious rooms in well tended grounds. Friendly and helpful staff though never obtrusive. Left some important documents in the room when we checked out and they had them in a UPS envelope to me later the same day!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: Running_Erin1078
Reviews.Content: The grounds of this resort are absolutely beautiful, especially at night. There are paths amidst the lush foliage and numerous little sitting venues, around ponds and fountains, on gazebos, etc. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are fairly large, very clean, and are decorated in tastefully minimalist fashion. The on-site restaurant, "Baleen," was excellent. Breakfast was a bit expensive but very good, and they had a farmers market pizza that was to die for! The bay near the resort is very calm and has beautiful views. Overall, a fabulous stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lloyd S
Reviews.Content: Stayed 13-nights - excellent staff - beautiful property - large - very well maintained - takes army of people to run the place - large employer - significant contributor to local economy (they do their part - important to me). Very much enjoyed the resort, our lodging, our stay - we were well treated. Resort parking costs a little steep - adapted - however - and - utilized the excellent SD tranit system. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Very cold room”
Reviews.Author: yvonne5175
Reviews.Content: We arrived Dec 223rd, 2011 after a long flight and arrived to the beautiful tree lined resort, all the trees were decorated with lights which was lovely. Day 1 we found our room very cold and reported to |Reception. Xmas night we were freezing and went to bed fully clothed!!!!! We both got sore throats from the a.c and made an executive decision to check out the next day. We were booked in for 10days, reception were apologetic but for our own health sake we left. On reflection we did not check out how far it was from the city and it was costly popping in and out. It is a lovely resort and the food and staff the excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Very relaxing and Very private. After a long day exploring San Diego it was the perfect place to come back to and relax for the next day.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to get away, conference, and /or do the family vacay.”
Reviews.Author: MyAbundance
Reviews.Content: The property is huge, serene, divided good, and has an amazing offering of amenities. I stayed for a several day escape and decompression and glad I came to the right place. It is ridiculously easy to get off property and visit mission beach, the gas lamp, old town or wherever. Sea World is a walk away. I had a snafu with a room and the staff handled it amazingly well. Sometimes fitness. Enters seem to be haphazard and run down, this one is sorta "mama bear" and just right. Outdoor heated pool, multiple pools, paddle boards, bikes, boats, great beach, just super nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Secret gem from a long lost paradise called California”
Reviews.Author: Gigantalope
Reviews.Content: Paradise point is a hole in time. It features mid century architecture, whimsical buildings with roof-lines shaped like the waves of the Pacific; luxurious private bungalows from the era of film stars like Doris Day, and an thick jungle array of mature tropical plants to rival the best botanical gardens of Jamaica or Hawaii . The fare available there is excellent The seafood is wonderful and portions ample. It's in a perfect location for day trips to normal attractions (Padres, micro brew tours, Old Town, Seaworld, Gas Lamp...) but it's so quiet and private, it's as if you really are on your own holiday isle. There are Bungalows available right on the water where you can even have a cozy fire, listen to some Martin Denny and enjoy the best life has to offer. The little store in the resort gives a mulligan to those (like me) prone to forgetting items, like sandals firewood, or wine. (beer selection could be improved) The place was built in the post war era, with ample space which was the custom then, and if you are into vintage stuff, you can get a bungalow and park your vintage car along side setting up the perfect tableau from the glorious past, and still enjoy the luxury and comforts we expect now (hot tub, spa treatment, good coffee, wired & wifi...) The staff is proud of this city, and proud of the property. They are warm very knowledgeable, and happy to find event the strangest details out of what's going on locally. On my visit, much work was being done to update. If you are planning an event of any sort, especially if you want a dose of Big California, this place is unparalleled.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Devoided
Reviews.Content: Was in San Diego to celebrate 21st birthday of my daughter. I had never heard of Paradise Point I am now glad that the website I booked through selected this property. During check-in the fact that it was my daughter's birthday came up, the clerk immediately presented my daughter with a large bag of chocolate pretzels and upgraded our accommodations to a bay-side suite. the patio door on the room opened up to Mission Bay. The beach was 25' feet away and the water about 100'. This truly made the visit special...thank you Paradise Point. We didn't have time to partake in any of the free activities, such as, swimming, tennis, horseshoes, etc. Even though the grounds are a little dark, we felt very safe. I constantly saw security driving around the grounds. We ate at Balleen for breakfast one morning and it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical paradise a few hours from home”
Reviews.Author: Melinda W
Reviews.Content: I was planning a trip to San Diego for my boyfriend's birthday and his brother told me about the Paradise Point Resort and Spa. At first I thought they were a little too pricey and I didn't want to pay that much for two nights (which is why I gave them 4/5). But I said why not. It's his birthday and I want a nice hotel. I am SO glad I decided to stay there. The place is amazing! The staff were so nice and welcoming and the rooms were great. If I go back to San Diego I definitely want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: G0Bucks78
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at the resort and had a great time. The grounds are amazingly beautiful and staff was the most genuinely friendly we have ever encountered. From feeding the fish and sharks to swimming in one of several pools or playing on the beach, this resort has it all. Can't wait to be back!!! I've heard their catering staff is unbelivable too!! If you want to host an event, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Another trip to Paradise”
Reviews.Author: cpersonporter
Reviews.Content: Awesome bellhops, front desk personnel, restaurant staff/food, pool and grounds area plus quiet. Love the inland waters and the activity that it draws. Close to Sea World. Really stayed at the resort a lot this trip and enjoyed the main pool. Watching the sunset by the marina is priceless. We'll be back for a 4th visit someday!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Richard G
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort. Staff really friendly & helpful. Was able to rent a boat out & sail around the waters.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with our two young girls (2 and 5) to stay at Paradise Point last summer and we found it to be the PERFECT family vacation spot! A huge part of our enjoyment was due to the fact that we LOVED our room!!! We had a Bayside Bungalow in Paradise Cove and the room was smack on the sand looking out on the beautiful bay with a fire pit right outside our room for nightly s'more making! The water on the bay was very tranquil, which allowed my husband and I to actually be able to sit on the sand and relax without worrying about our 2 year old running into the waves. It was a dream! The girls had so much fun playing on the beach and we loved that we could put little one down for nap, and we could sit and read on the waterfront patio and watch our oldest on the sand playing on the beach. We also loved that there was so much to do! There were 4 pools that we could use (5 total on the resort - but 1 is adult only). My daughters loved picking a different pool to use each day, and to our surprise they actually liked going to the small ones vs. the big main pool, which was fine by us. All the pools had a graduated entry, so my two year old could wade and splash around, which I loved. This is a truly FAMILY-FRIENDLY resort. One day we rented a surrey bike and cruised around the property, which was a ton of fun, and we just had so much fun exploring the grounds. It is the type of place where once you check in, you don't really have to leave! But the great thing is that if you want to go "off campus" for an outing, the location is phenomenal as it is close to a ton of San Diego family attractions. The room itself was amazing. It had a kitchenette, dining table, and separate bedroom, so we could put the girls down to bed early and stay up later without disturbing them. The bathroom was also fabulously designed, as you could shut off the door and be able to use the bathroom without disturbing little ones as well. It was clean and beautifully decorated. Again, the Bayside Bungalows were AMAZING! We drove to the resort so we were able to pack our girls' scooters in the car, which was fun to let them cruise around on. And one night we played a little mini-golf which was close to our room. If you are looking for a family-friendly resort, this property had a ton of activities for all ages. Plus you just can't beat the beauty of San Diego! Our family will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Four Days in Paradise..think Gilligan's Island meets San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: rev123
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 days in Paradise...kinda sorta. This resort is so unusual-sort of like Gilligan's Island meets San Diego! Think tikki torches..water falls..palm trees and glitz. Favorite things: 1. STAFF-extremely nice and helpful 2. GROUNDS-beautiful -especially at night 3. QUIET-you'll sleep great! 4. LOCATION-perfect place to do San Diego from 5. EXERCISE CENTER/POOL-amazing! Not favorite things: 1-HOTEL PRICE...Crazy expensive!!! (check out hotwire.com for a possible deal) 2-PARKING PRICE...$35!!!!!!!! Really?!?!?!?!?! Can you say...RIP OFF?? (to be fair, I did get comped due to it being my birthday and as I said...super nice staff! advice...go on your birthday!) 3-"RESORT FEE"....$15!!!!!!!! Again..really?!?!?! All you really get for that is internet. Yikes! 4-RESORT NEEDS UPGRADE..I think Paradise Point was probably much nicer back in the day. It's great still, but you can tell things haven't been upgraded in a while. It does look like they are starting do do this (they were ripping up the main lobby when I arrived and redoing it). Bottom line...I enjoyed the place alot and will go back if ... 1-I get a good deal from hotwire.com again 2-they wave the ridiculous parking fee again 3-they reduce the $15 resort fee/internet fee Loved the place...just potentially way too expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Great Get Away”
Reviews.Author: flynomore
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at a beachside bungalow here. Although the property is old, that just enhances the charm by providing mature landscaping and a nostalgic Southern California feel. Also, old does not equate with dated or run down in this property. Everything is kept up to impeccable standards, very clean and updated for the most part. The bathroom tub looked like it was from the '50's, but that was overlooked by us in favor of all of the positives of this resort. The grounds are beautiful, and make you feel like you are in Hawaii with tropical plants and flowers all around. With 5 pools, I can't imagine they are ever over crowded. So much property to stroll through and very convenient to most of San Diego. It's a great place.

Reviews.Title: “A Winter Paradise”
Reviews.Author: FitzySyd
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our 3 night stay here in early January. The rooms are fairly basic and the resort is in need of a general refurbishment of areas, eg spa flooring, but the Resort exudes a relaxed colonial charm with lovely pools, good tennis and basketball courts, pleasant lagoons and appealing restaurants. To charge for parking in the off season is a bit rude, although we did get a bit of a discount. Bonus was a coin laundry by one of the pools where I could finally get some washing done, in a very pleasant environment! It was pretty quiet being Winter and we had lots of facilities to ourselves which was great. Staff were all friendly and helpful, especially the Lobby Cafe Barista and the Receptionists.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, with a lot of exceptions”
Reviews.Author: avideno
Reviews.Content: We ended up here after deciding to gamble on Priceline. We were impressed at first, but there were a few surprises and disappointments. The Good: Very pretty grounds with lots to do and 2 restaurants Large rooms Pool and jacuzzi were nice The Bad: *Parking fee (for us it was $32, but I heard another person get charged $27. This was on top of Priceline fee.) *"Passport" Fee (this is $15/day per person on top of our Pricelined charges... would have been fine if we had arrived early enough to use the services or if we had just known that was a charge on top of the Priceline fee.) This fee is for using the grounds, like playing tennis/etc. The Annoying: When we arrived, we instantly liked the hotel and decided to ask them if we could stay another night for around the same price that we got on Priceline. We weren't expecting to win a bid on a hotel with so much to do (spa/tennis/ping pong/pools/etc.) so we thought we might like to stay another full day so we could actually enjoy the hotel instead of just sleeping there one night. The woman at the front desk was friendly but said she wouldn't be able to let me know until later that night or when the manager came in the next morning. I didn't hear from them in the morning, so I called the front desk. A different woman told me that she would need to check, but no matter what, she would call me right back. She did not. I finally decided to pack up our stuff and check out. We were disappointed to leave, and wondered why no one ever got back to us. The hotel did not seem very busy, we only saw a handful of people during our stay... an extra night seemed like it would work well for everyone, especially if we kept the same room. Upon check-out I was told that we couldn't have the room another night because there was a conference coming in and all the rooms were taken. I didn't believe this last-minute excuse because if all the rooms were booked, then why didn't they just say that when I first inquired? The woman at the front desk said she was sorry, but whenever I wanted to come back, she would make sure we were taken care of. Sadly, I don't think we'll be going back. It was a cute place and we were excited in the moment about spending the day in the spa and using the Passports for tennis, etc., but we wouldn't go out of our way to return. Tips: Ask for the parking fee to be waived. I just happened to read the reviews on Yelp and a few people mentioned the ridiculous parking fees. A few people said that if you asked about it, they usually would waive the fee for you. I did this and it worked. $32/day was a hefty hidden charge in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: Timmius
Reviews.Content: I kind of feel sorry for Paradise Point. It must have been THE spot in the '70s. We specifically asked for a room that was a suite and had a rom that could be closed off so our 21 month old could sleep and we could still hang out. Thats not what we got. Also, the room was musty smelling and their was old food in the refrigerator. Single room, junior suite. Thankfully, they graciously fixed it. The room was ok. It looked as if it was upgraded in the last 3 - 4 years. Again, the amenities were dated. The walls in the bedroom were bare. The bathroom set-up was weird. The room was definitely not small child friendly. The front door had no dead-bolt or "chain", so evertime my son would pull on the handle, he could open the door and walk outside where the water was 100 feet away. That was pretty scary. Overall, everything was mediocre. We really didn't use it as a resort, and we may have missed out on that. One great benefit was it was 5 minutes to Sea World and less than 15 minutes to the San Diego Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: WCZ
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. It is very centrally located to attractions in San Diego. Loved te easy in, easy out. I did not do enough research when booking room, thought a Jr suite would be a bedroom with a living area. It was just one big room! With 4 of us from 8 to 50, this did to fit sleeping arrangements. Would not stay here again because of this. Also was very spread out, we drove to the hot tub and pool at night because it was to cold to walk! Otherwise, service was great and we enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed in room, but decent resort.”
Reviews.Author: monksters
Reviews.Content: I I travle often for business trips and have had the opportunity to stay at several outstanding resorts. When I recieved the info regarding this conference, I was excited to take my family along from everything we saw on website. Unfortunately, our room was the most damp and musty room I've ever stayed in. The air conditioner didn't really work too well, but the smell was almost moldy smelling. The bathroom floor was a bit dirty on arrival and the walls weren't all that clean. The location was great for Sea World, but other than that, cab fare will drive you crazy at this place. There is really nowhere close to the resort as far as local attractions and restaurants. On the flip side, the onsite restaurants served really good food. The bell hops are extremely friendly until you decide to walk to your room. Then the attitude begins. Also, beware on taking their recommendations on cabs. We took their "preferred" vender and later found out by hailing our own cab, that we were being overcharged compared to the local yellowcab. If you are looking for a place to just hang out and enjoy the resort, you could probably get it, as others at the conference were very happy with their rooms, but make sure you get an updated room. Afterall, it's San Diego, and there's not much bad you can say about that. Be sure to count on a $25 cab fare to anywhere from the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Give yourself the gift of paradise - you're worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Becci G
Reviews.Content: The really great thing about Paradise Point is location, location, location! It's very clean, self contained, close to any amenities you'd want, the service is great, the spa is unforgettable and each unit is like it's own little property with wonderful views no matter which unit you get. Unlike staying in a hotel, this is property has the charm of individual dwellings spread througout the area.

Reviews.Title: “A vacation inside of a vacation”
Reviews.Author: Todd2PS
Reviews.Content: This is truly a resort hotel on it's own island. The rooms are spread out so you really feel like you're on some tropical isle. The plantings help. My room faced right on to the water. What a treat to be able to walk right out the room door and be on the beach in literally two steps. The room also had a refrigerator and microwave. I have to admit I enjoyed using both and just enjoying my own little bit of paradise. There is a very nice restaurant right on the water with terrific views, a exciting menu, etc. But, a bottle of wine, some cheese and bread and I wasn't goin' anywhere. There's an outdoor place near the restaurant that serves breakfast right on the water. I'd love to know if there's anywhere else in San Diego where you can have breakfast outside on the water.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome honeymoon experience. Get a bay view to appreciate the whole island experience.”
Reviews.Author: Susan L
Reviews.Content: We loved the bay views. Full Capricorn moon over the bay just made our morning. Bed was so comfortable and room large with every need met.

Reviews.Title: “Old resort, made over.”
Reviews.Author: TheClems
Reviews.Content: This is clearly an old resort that has been very well maintained. We were able to upgrade to a suite upon arrival and we were pleased to find it was a bungalow, on the sand, with a fire pit perfect for roasting marshmallows. Our kids loved that part. We loved that it was modern and stylish. Drawbacks: the little kitchenette has zero supplies. So don't expect as much as a paper napkin. The TV get's terrible reception. The door locked us out one night and we had to call maintenance. Thankfully we had a cell phone on us. We were at the fire pit and needed to go in due to light rain. They were able to fix it pretty fast and brought us two bundles of firewood to make up for the inconvenience. Tip: if you are going to Seaworld, buy your tickets from the hotel shop. When we took them into Guest Services to get them converted from Length of Stay tickets to the year long pass the man at the counter said tickets bought at the hotel are the best because they come without a name printed on them. He said they can be used all week and then converted in to anyone's name for the year long pass. If you knew you would not be coming back but have a friend who is, you can put the friend's name on it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay, if you can afford it.”
Reviews.Author: euroUSA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times. Not cheap, but really nice. Pools, jacuzzis, even some waterfront sand. Service not bad, and the beds comfy. Nice tropical village feel, even on dry, cold California nights.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Somers1
Reviews.Content: This was absolutely the most loved of all the properties we have visited in San Diego. We are from North Carolina and thoughly loved our stay right before Christmas 2011.Room was VERY clean, staff was VERY courteous, food was excellent at both restuarants. It was a summer vacation in the middle of our winter. We would certainly go back if the opportunity comes around again. The parking fee was completely a nuisance. That is the only piece in my mind that was not justified. But, we knew it upfront so we accept it. Anyone from NC who asks, we will highly recommend. We have already spread the word to Moorpark, CA and Union , WA, to our extended families!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Jim T
Reviews.Content: This resort is fantastic, a real prize. We arrived early for check in and was greeted by a friendly staff willing to check us in early. In addition, we requested an upgrade which was handled in a great way. Sitting on the beach outside our suite was fantastic I would recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Decision”
Reviews.Author: gal-gallivanting
Reviews.Content: This resort is a real showpiece, crème de la crème & our favorite! I use to live in San Diego, so I know all the other hotel choices, but this is our favorite and 3rd time back. Our little family of 3 stayed during the 2011-12 New Years/Christmas break for 6 days. I think all the rooms are wonderful even if you don't get a beach front one. You can still walk over to the sandy beach & sit in a chair or lay on a towel. Surprise, surprise, we were the only ones on this wonderful private (yet public) white, clean, sandy beach just steps from our room. Upon arriving, we did have a problem with our room's toilet & they very quickly accommodated us to another working room. For our inconvenience they waved our parking fees. Our room was very nicely appointed, very fresh clean sheets too! The resort has 5 pools & lots of things to do. But then, all of San Diego has lots of things to do! At the hotel's Baleen Restaurant, I had the best Pork Chop dinner I've ever eaten, and my husband really enjoyed his fish dinner too. We also enjoyed every mornings breakfast sitting outside in the sun on the waterfront at the Barefoot Grill (morning cafe), you can also eat inside. Bottom-line, we would return to this resort in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Party of 11 had a great stay. The perfect place to relax and enjoy San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: Jannelford
Reviews.Content: The perfect place for a family gathering at Christmas. Paradise Point is beautifully landscaped, the main pool was heated, clean and surrounded by palm trees.......A really lovely setting from which to explore San Diego. Our rooms were very clean and comfortable and were close to the pool (which was perfect for our three children........if you don't have children stay away from the busy pool and opt for a sea view instead). There are adult only pools too. The only downside was the restaurant prices. We would have had breakfast at the beachside restaurant more often if it hadn't cost $95 a time (for 5). However, there is a great supermarket nearby. Sea World is over the road and all major San Diego attractions within half an hours drive. We all loved our stay and would highly recommend it as a base to explore the area.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: J M
Reviews.Content: :Our visit brought back memories of childhood stays at the same property in the 1970s, with modern upgrades, extraordinary service, and delicious food! We were tempted to skip the Zoo and just stay on the beautiful resort grounds. The room decor was unique, and a perfect blend of old and new, with a bit of an Agatha Christie flair. Our family (3 generations) has been staying at this site (in all of its former and current modes) since the 1970s, and are planning to return with all 3 generations together next year, as our experience in January of 2012 was so incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Five-Star pretender”
Reviews.Author: sakgan
Reviews.Content: Whenever we travel to a new city just to vacation and have no first hand reviews of hotels to stay in, we stay at the Hyatt just so we can be guaranteed five-star service. just this once, we thought that staying at a downtown hotel beats the purpose of travelling to SD, since the fun to he had are at the beaches and looked out a 5 star resort style place and came across Paradise Point. but, to our dismay they were nowhere near 5 star. The beach front villas are anything but. they face a cove and nothing else Even basic amenities like a microwave is not included - had to pay $10 / night to warm up the baby food Housekeeping did not clean anything except make the bed Bathroom door only locks from the outside and not from the inside $4 delivery fee for a pair of plastic silverware key card did not work for half the trip (we got a $50 credit for that though) rooms are good sized, but if you book the villa thinking that you will have total privacy, you will be disappointed The only thing that kept us from having a totally ruined vacation was the awesome city of San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed at!!!”
Reviews.Author: LC C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at plenty of hotels during my life, and this one was my favorite of all time!! I have decided from now on I will never listen to negetive reviews and only decide for myself! I was expecting the worst to the point, I packed my own coffee pot and cleaning supplies, cereal, cutlery..... WHY did I waste al that room! My family stayed in the King Garden Junior suite and it was flippin fantastic!! The closet was the size of my sons bedroom at home! The room DID have in room coffee and was beautifully clean! Everyday we came back the room was spotless! Of course there may be a spec of sand, considering you do bring home 40lbs of it after playing on the beach which is a 2 second walk away! The room view was amazing, a little pond with ducks all waiting to greet you! Of course they are looking for a little snacky, but they are adorable! There were 5 pools with thier own hottubs that were all amazing. Did our laundry on site and while we waiting had a nice cocktail and hottub! The barefoot bar and grill food was awesome, never had a bad meal and we ate there a lot! Items were around 12-15 bucks (steak/entres more$), and kids menu items were 5-8. All the staff were super chill and friendly at the resteraunt and service was top notch, The guys out the front of the lobby were awesome, Tony was beyond helpful. He would remember what we did that day and ask us about our daily activities! That is very uncommon! We rented a Surrey bike for 25 bucks an hour, which was extremely resonable. 1 hour was more then what you could really use it for anyways, We stopped and played croquet during our bike ride! You can play horseshoes or bocce ball on the beach if you want! We didnt get a chance to do half the stuff we wanted! All in all I had a great christmas and am counting the days till I can go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Tammyk63
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came down for a short get away after the holidays. I read many of the reviews and have stayed at a few places in SD in the past. All in all, inspite of a few of the more recent reviews, we feel this is a wonderful resort. Yes, it's older, but the grounds, relaxing atmosphere and large rooms more than make up for it's age and not so luxurious bathrooms. I walked the whole resort and didn't find a bungalow in a bad location - every one has either a pool, water, or garden view. Lots of walking paths and activities to do right on location. It's a great location as it's easy to hop on the 5 or the 8 to head somewhere and just down the road from the Beach communities and the Pt. Loma area. Can't say enough about this resort. Would love to come back with my whole family!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: chamarsam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what we were looking for. This was our second time there. The rooms are spacious, bright, nicely decorated. Beds and amenities make for a comfortable stay. The rooms were super clean. I like the fact that they had tiled floors. It felt and smelled clean always. We had breakfast in our private lanai in the mornings. The staff was very welcoming, helpful and efficient. We ate at the barefoot grill a couple of times and enjoyed the setting , the menu and the service were great. We were mostly visiting and hiking in the san diego area , during the days. Coming back to the hotel in the evenings felt like coming home. We had a great winter vacation !

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - great people, shabby accommodations for the price”
Reviews.Author: Joseph Y
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 units, an executive suite and a connecting with 2 bedrooms and a living room, Unfortunately, the physical accommodations were a big let down. PPR bills itself as AAA 4-diamonds, but the AAA tourbook only gives it 3. It was vastly overpriced for the quality: - The much-touted multimillion dollar renovations had the feel of being done on the cheap, just enough to be attractive at first glance, but actually pretty shabby upon closer inspection (chipped paint, unpatched drywall dents, falling-down mirrors, cheap mismatched door knobs, etc.) - The heater in 1 room was a very noisy wall unit from the 1970s (not central air) that roared loudly all night long - Only 2 pools were heated, the other 3 were not. - The main pool’s hot tub was filthy – filled with brown, cloudy, murky water. - One of the first rooms we tried (we switched it to an “executive suite” at a significant upgrade fee) had broken curtain rods and many other cosmetic issues - The living room furniture was unmatched, and dirty (sofa cushions) - The furnishings included a broken mirror leaning (not hanging) against the wall, a rickety lounger that rocked when sat upon, and a filthy sofa (once green seat cushions turned brown with dirt) without any throw pillows to relax on. - The only shampoo was in a wall-mounted dispenser in the standalone shower, but no bottles for those using the tub (when we asked the maid, she said sorry, there wasn’t any) - The bath towels were very uncomfortable – not soft and fluffy, but hard and uncomfortable, with weird, ½” wide “ribs” that were annoying to the touch Think of an older, time-worn resort, with a superficial coat of make up. It would have been OK at half the price, but not what it is charging. The next time in San Diego, we are going back to the Del or the Hyatt, both of which we have visited in the past, and are much better values. The only first class thing about Paradise Point were the people. Front desk manager Irina was incredibly helpful and friendly, and so was afternoon clerk Wesley. The bartender/waitress at the Barefoot Grill was terrific. In fact, everyone was very nice and helpful. Still, the good personal service could not make up for the poor quality of accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Howard60811
Reviews.Content: We loved Paradise Point. The spacious grounds in a big city created a tropical paradise. The room with its secluded paio, huge bath room and dressing area, was very inviting. The breakfasts, especially the oatmeal crusted french toast, was a treat, as was the view and outdoor dining. And Tony, the bellman, was so helpful with everything on the grounds and also with insightful tips about places in San Diego. Our stay at Pardise Point could not have been better. Sue and Howard Needle

Reviews.Title: “Had a real good time we LOVE it there we go every year for the past 4 years for christmas....”
Reviews.Author: Fancy684
Reviews.Content: Looking forward 2 our next time out there again. Also will be inviting more friends out there 2 visit and enjoy it like we do.

Reviews.Title: “Best winter vacation in US”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: My entire family stayed here for 4 nights over Christmas and enjoyed every minute of it. The weather was perfect -- sunny and high 60's during the day and 40's at night. The hotel staff were friendly, the rooms were spacious, land and sea recreation activities were plenty, the food was excellent, and the resort grounds was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort!”
Reviews.Author: amanda s
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great service, great location. We had a wonderful time and will definately go back. We would recommend this resort to everyone. The kids liked the resort so much that they just wanted to stay at the resort the entire vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: Minh T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Lanai. This place is excellent and conveniently located; could walk to Sea World and about 10 minutes to San Diego Zoo. There are also lots of activities for family and kids including boat rental, tennis, fishing,.... Their restaurants are also very good and price is reasonable. You have to pay parking fee though ($28/day). Also, there is a $15/day fee for using tennis, basketball, internet, long distance calls,...

Reviews.Title: “Respite!”
Reviews.Author: Mary T
Reviews.Content: I can thoroughly recommend the experience at the Paradise Point Resort. This was a "staycation" as we live in San Diego: it was such a wonderful, relaxing escape! We especially enjoyed walking on the beach and admiring the variety of shore birds, including a whole flock of Black Skimmers - amazing birds! Feeding the ducks on the lake was great fun, too! Also, watching the sunset from the viewing tower and enjoying a mojito and a delicious dinner at the Barefoot Bar and Grill just feet from the water was not too shabby either. The staff are friendly and helpful. I have already booked for February!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, central location with lots to do!”
Reviews.Author: Franciswasthere
Reviews.Content: We chose this resort for our "staycation" due to a special online promotion. I live in San Diego and had never been here nor did I know of this resort. It is quite nice. I stayed in a beach bungalow which was spacious and right on the beach. The weather was beautiful so we spent a lot of time outdoors. The service was great and the place was very clean. I can recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A true island”
Reviews.Author: marydel d
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to San Diego and our stay at this resort was lovely. The resort is on a big island, the rooms are spread out giving great privacy. The grounds are beautiful. The rooms are ok, not luxurios but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Jim G
Reviews.Content: This resort is amazing. The service was very friendly, the landscaping is very lush, the rooms are comfortable and the location is very close to Sea World. This was our first visit to the Paradiseresort and we are looking to coming back with our kids for Spring Break.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: mdurakjones
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paradise Point 12/1 - 12/4 for my sister's wedding. The grounds were beautiful and well maintained. We were in a recently updated room (224) which was very nice and large. We even had our own private patio area. All of the rooms seemed to be layed out differently, ours being the largest I saw in the same booking class. It was a great location on the bay and close to many things. The only complaint I can make is the room heater. While the temperature was warm during the day, the evenings were cold. The heater in the room did not have a temperature gage. So when it was on, it was on. At night when I turned it on I'd wake up in the night sweating. If I left it off it was too cold. All and all this was a small thing. Overall beautiful property, friendly and accomodating staff and a good value for San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: Very relaxing resort. Was greeted by staff. Enjoyed the lush green environment and tropical feeling it brought.They had fire pits at the pools during the night which made it nice and enjoyable. The resort is within 10 minutes of everything. I would defintly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “a true paradise in a america;s favorite city”
Reviews.Author: Travelingan
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with this resort. The location is fabulous. The restaurants are great, especially baleen and the staff is very friendly. There is so much to do in San Diego and to top it off they have so much stuff to do a the resort itself. They offer surfing lessons, you can go for runs along the perimeter of the property and outside if you like, they have water taxis that take you from the hotel to sea world, you can play golf around the property and the list just goes on. The rooms are really nice and comfortable, the only thing i was disappointed about was the bathtub...i mean for a room this nice and a huge bathroom you cannot have a tiny bath tub ..thats just me...i like big bath tubs ;-) Anyways if you are in San Diego for a few days with your family (especially one with kinds (young or older)) this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleasantly surprised. It's a well-maintained property with some fun casual features like fire pits.”
Reviews.Author: SinafromSF
Reviews.Content: We had a nice bungalow room on the lagoon, seeing the ducks was fun. We jogged around the property in the morning, quite a workout on the sandy parts! Overall clean and well-maintained. SUPER nice staff with genuine good service. I would go back

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: While the grounds are beautiful and well kept, most other amenities are disappointing. Here's the list: 1) In the bayside bungalow suite where we stayed (the most expensive units in the complex) the amenities included a 2 cup coffeemaker complete with paper cups, no cutlery or dishes, plastic drinking cups, cheap soap and dated towels and blankets. The fridge froze everything no matter how low it was set 2) carpet was dirty and furniture well used. Interior decorating in the living area was reminiscent of the '60's, albeit allegedly redecorated in 2010 3) the wireless internet service was marginal, hard to connect and downloads impossible unless hardwired at a ridiculous location in the room 4) the "market" was really just an overpriced gift shop. Only food items included sandwiches @ $6.50, drinks @$2.75, etc 5) parking @ $28/ night is ridiculous 6) room heaters were loud and walls paper thin so adjoining guests could be heard easily 7) cabinetry in the kitchen and bathroom was antiquated 8)towels were old, even the toilet paper was cheap and no paper towels in the kitchen. 9) room information booklets were poorly done 10) draperies were old 11) light fixtures were cheap 12) there was a musty odour every time we entered the room We got tired of calling the front desk for help and just put up with things. Staff is friendly and tries to accommodate but there seems to be a management problem with this place as it does have the potential for a superior resort if only the little things were addressed. Not good value for $350 a night !

Reviews.Title: “Your own amazing, private island!”
Reviews.Author: SCG1234
Reviews.Content: Everything was amazing! Truly a resort versus a hotel. The bungalows are very private and comfortable. This island resort has multiple pools, including adults only pools and jacuzzis. Bike & boat rentals as well as many other activities are available on site. They even have a mini golf green for putting! We spent many hours just walking around enjoying the various vistas the resort has to offer. The staff is super friendly and helpful. There are many restaurants, cafes and bars on site. We tried 4 different establishments and all were very good to outstanding. the Barefoot Bar has a salt water fish pond that includes sharks. Our room was spacious with a separate sitting area, kitchenette and dining table.The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom is in 2 sections: shower and toilet in one, and double sinks in the other. A walk in closet made our bike storage (we brought our road bikes for a century ride) easy and kept them out of site. We also had a private patio where we fed and watched the various water foul. Great Blue Heron's, Greater and Lesser Egrets and all sorts of ducks and gulls were up close and personal! The only complaint was that parking is a bit steep at $25 a day, but everything else was reasonably priced. We would return again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the natural ambience which was very relaxing to us city folks. Special mention to Katie at the frontdesk”
Reviews.Author: tian0
Reviews.Content: for an excellent job in accommodating us especially since we were celebrating my Mom's 80th birthday. Wish we could have stayed longer, but perhaps someday, God willing, we might make it. Amy

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: King L
Reviews.Content: Great stay, rooms are clean and the staff excellent. The housekeeping did an excellent job

Reviews.Title: “Such a great place!”
Reviews.Author: James S
Reviews.Content: I manage a soccer team of 16yo boys and we stayed here for 3 nights during a recent tournament. Everyone was so great and attentive. The pools, hottubs, fitness center, rooms, everything was amazing...we needed to replace a remote control; a guy was there in five minutes! Stuff like that... I'd come back in a second. Oh yeah, we won the tournament too!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations from the moment we walked into the lobby.”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer C
Reviews.Content: Without even asking, they gave us a complimentary upgrade to a bay view room with a hot tub and a fire place. They also reduced our daily parking fee to $15.00 per day because we were staying for a week. Our room was beautiful and clean. The view was great. The bed was comfy with high quality sheets. We enjoyed our fireplace every night and loved the privacy of our room. The patio is blocked from other rooms with shrubs and trees without taking away from the view of the bay. The Baleen was expensive, but the food was wonderful. I highly recommend the tuna and wasabi mashed potatoes. One tip: be sure and ask the spa prices before going. I was shocked when I saw my bill for a treatment and facial, but it was quite relaxing and the spa staff was professional and courteous. I would stay here again it ever in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Simply awesome”
Reviews.Author: karl o
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time. The resort grounds are beautiful, the rooms comfortable, and the amenities are outstanding. This resort is a perfect getaway for families. There was so much to do. We rented bikes, visited the pools, fed the ducks, used the Spa and especially enjoyed taking the resorts water taxi to a private entrance at Sea World. I read some of the online reviews that say that rooms are not up to snuff, but I disagree. If you are expecting a high rise cookie cutter hotel, then this is not for you. The resort is located on a private island and the bungalows are spread over many acres, so you never feel like you are in an overcrowded resort. The staff is extremely friendly and really gave us the feeling that they tried hard to help us with whatever we needed. Don't forget to visit Barefoot. The kids will be entertained looking at the fish and sharks in the ponds while you sit and relax watching the sunset over the bay. We definitely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Decemner Trip”
Reviews.Author: Patricia M
Reviews.Content: The resort was very clean, the beds very comfortable, the staff very accomadating. Although the resort is older it had beautiful landscaping. The trees and other foliage made you feel like you were in the tropics. We rented a pontoon boat and toured the bay area. Jet Ski's, speed boats, Kayaks, and bikes are available for rental. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Party”
Reviews.Author: pharmboyak
Reviews.Content: Remarkable food and service, a great facility! Variety of beer and great cocktails at the Bare Foot.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderul experience,”
Reviews.Author: KTRP
Reviews.Content: We loved the resort, the staff, the views, the restaurants, even the marina. We had a pleasant experience when checking in..without asking, Matt upgraded us to a room with a bay view at no additional costs. I will say, the resort was half empty..which we got to enjoy he resort that much more because no one got in our way ;) We even were able to get a huge break on that terrible parking fee (got it for $7 instead of $28). My 3 yr old had a ball feeding the ducks at the pond but beware, those ducks are not shy..they will take food out of anyone’s hand, so don’t let them get to close to your children in case they get nipped. We also enjoyed the fire pit on the beach.. we didn’t pay an arm and a leg at the store on the resort..we bought firewood at a nearby gas station and the rest at the local shopping center (had to make our own sticks out of wooden kabob skewers & tape which my son really enjoyed that project). We went to the zoo, seaport village (really neat place-highly recommend), at at Konos for breakfast a few times.. cheap, seat over looking the beach, and great food. Also enjoyed eating at the Fish Shop and Fat Fish grill. We also very much enjoyed Barefoot grill on the resort. Our waitor was awesome. Cute little bridge that connects to the marina..lots of fish and two little sharks on the water. Had breakfast there as well and then rented a paddle boat. We really enjoyed our vacation there. Not sure if I persobally would go there on peak season.. we were able to enjoy anything and everything without a crowd. I did not like the bed.. but my hubby and son didn't complain though. It was too hard for me because i'm a side sleeper. Room was clean but floors get very dirty when tracking in the sand.. they really should provide a matt for the doors that opne up to the beach. BUt the floors were cleaned every day while we were out. So it made up for that. Also, the floors are very very cold..maybe it was just the time of yr. The room was modern (see pictures), but a little bare. But we couldn't be happier with what we paid for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Attention to Rooms”
Reviews.Author: lgbav8r
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night (a Friday) for a wedding booking the "Bed & Breakfast" package which included parking and breakfast. We were initially pleasantly surprised when we checked in as we were told the room we booked was oversold and we would be getting a complimentary upgrade and in fact it was 2 levels (We booked the Lanai room and ended up with a Lagoon View). The room was pretty out dated. The easy things to upgrade (TV/alarm clock/internet) have been upgraded but the core structure of the room is in great need of attention. The heater/AC wall unit made a large amount of noise making it impractical to use when sleeping, the paint on the bathroom door had peeled in about 50% of the area and they simply repainted it (leaving behind all the markings where the paint had peeled and looking very lazy/tacky). In addition, the walls are paper thin. We could hear our neighbors TV prior to going to bed and were again awaken by their TV at 5:45am. The package "included" breakfast at their bar. The inclusion is really a $36 credit to your room for breakfast. For 2 people, you can exceed the $36 cap quite easily ordering a plate and juices (we only had coffee which was a little cheaper). So depending on what you order, breakfast is really "mostly included." Finally, the resort charges $28/night for parking. This happened to be included with our package but is astronomical! Not to mention there are plenty of spaces (one space reserved for each room plus a large general parking area). Our room charge for 1 night was $260. We will most definitely choose another location next time we vacation in San Diego as we were sorely disappointed. For that rate, I expect more modern, more private (not hearing the neighbors noise) accommodations. Quite honestly a Hampton Inn or similar would have likely been much better at roughly half the price (breakfast still included).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort! Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: EricDanielsiqpc
Reviews.Content: I was at Paradise Point for a Conference. I have to say that Paradise Point is one of the best properties that I have ever had the chance to visit. My clients were happy as was I with the beautiful scenery and wonderful convention center. One saff member in particular (Tony "The Bellman") was AWESOME! He gave me a tour of the property upon arrival and suggested local resteraunts (including the 2 on property) which were great! He always went above and beyond to make sure my clients and I were enjoying our stay there. I will definately be back to Paradises Point, the next time I am in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Paradise (Lisa J)”
Reviews.Author: Lisa J
Reviews.Content: This resort is so beautiful you truly feel like you are in "Paradise" while you are there! The view is amazing from any bayside bungalow in the cove. Excellent customer service since the first time I visited this resort in 2001. If you are traveling with a family or friends, this resort is a great place to go and literally not have to leave the property at all unless you use the water taxi to visit Sea World. They have many activities to keep the kids busy from sunrise to sunset (bike rentals, miniature golf, basketball & tennis courts) two pools and miles of beach for the kids to play right outside of your door. One of my favorite resorts to visit!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Gained”
Reviews.Author: Martha L
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service! I wanted to upgrade to a Bayside bungalow as a surprise for my brother and his wife. I was promptly switched to reservations (no waiting on hold with elevator music!) and everything I requested was taken care in a professional and efficient manner. A perfect escape-weekend for the snow bound!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic get-away.”
Reviews.Author: L V
Reviews.Content: Stunning resort, beautiful landscaping, gardens/pools/beach. Excellent service, private bungalows. Very central location - rent a car and get to Balboa Park (Zoo), Sea World, Coronado Island, Gaslamp area and Little Italy, Mission Bay and the Ocean Walk and La Jolla very easily. Favourite thing to do: catch breakfast at the 'Best Breakfast on the Beach' restaurant just behind the RollerCoaster at Belmont Park, right on the beach next to the Ocean walk. From 7am in the morning, everything from omelettes to waffles to fruit bowls - watch the surfers catch a wave, relax and enjoy the food and the view.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: sued619
Reviews.Content: This is our all time favorite San Diego spot! Beautiful grounds, spacious rooms and the friendliest staff ever. From Janelle at the front desk to the bell man Marc Garner we could not have been better taken care of. The resort is amazing and we will definitely return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise without a flight to Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: NYCbacktoLAhooray
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our bargain (mostly) deal via a bid-on-a-room website, which shall remain nameless. Unfortunately we were only there for one night, when going to check out colleges in the San Diego area. Paradise Point is an easy spot to stay when touring UCSD, USD and/or San Diego State. WOW. Paradise Point really is a stand-alone destination. You get off the freeway, and wend your way (five - seven minutes?) to the long driveway that takes you onto the island, then wind around to the reception area/lobby. Extremely nice staff, very cordial in spite of our cut-rate room price, gently confirmed the bad news (I already knew about from TripAdvisor, thank you!) that parking was $28 (oh PLEASE) per night, and the non-waiveable "resort fee" was $15 additionally. IF one can negotiate the room charge, even with this additional cost of FORTY-THREE DOLLARS per night, this is still an outstanding value. Because we were occupied during the days and evening with college tours and family visits, we did not avail ourselves of any of the shops or restaurants or room service, so can't comment on the quality/value of those resources. Despite our bargain basement room charge, the very nice front desk clerk upgraded us (do they do this for everyone?) and we had a lovely lagoon-side spacious room with two queen-sized beds. The bathroom was a little dated, but clean and good-looking. Plenty of towels, good shower. Shower gel, shampoo and conditioner provided in stationary pumps in the bath, but no bar soap - only outside in sink/vanity area. Hardwood (or laminate) floors looked new in our room, with tropical/primitive wall art - kind of weird but added to the ambiance. We were awakened in the morning by the ducks and/or other birds squawking nearby, outside our room. Kind of cool, but stay away from the lagoon if you want to sleep in. We only wished we were staying another night so we could walk around the grounds that really do look and feel like one's idea of Hawaiian tropical paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Best place EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: JulieG-in-Cali
Reviews.Content: I love this lush, tropical, beautiful place so much, we stay here every time we come to san diego. They have so many activities, love the bungalows on the bay, all the pools, feeding the ducks, the outlook tower... the bell staff is AWESOME! It was raining when we arrived and they escorted us with umbrellas right from the car to the entrydoorway! They are there in a heartbeat if u need help starting your fire in the pit on the bay, or a ride on a golf cart to the bar n grill or poolside. Keith the bellman was super-extra helpful, everyone is so friendly and accommodating!

Reviews.Title: “Almost Paradise”
Reviews.Author: scottbridger_123
Reviews.Content: Impressed with the staff. Always accommodating, helpful and eager to please. The campfires on the beach were great, the grounds are impressive, the food at Barefoot good but pricey for the atmosphere but understandable for the convenience. We ordered takeout twice which was great. We stayed a week so we also stopped by a Trader Joe's to get some fruit, yogurt, drinks and snacks for breakfast etc. The lobby needs to be spiffed up it looks like they are going out if biz... Needs fresh flowers, plants, books, magazines, games, a guest book, comp coffee, music, it's way to stripped down... Makes a bad impression ESP after the beautiful drive in! Culinary garden seems a no- brainer come on it the new millennium!Sustainability peeps! the bungalows are great but for the paper thin walls! Did I say paper? I meant onion skin! Loved the spa and the sweet lady that did my nails. The fitness center is great too- bright, airy, lots of equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Marta O
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice and this time we were upgraded to a bay front suite. My kids talked about it for weeks!

Reviews.Title: “STAY ONCE AND YOU WILL NEVER STAY ANYWHERE ELSE IN SAN DIEGO!”
Reviews.Author: whatever003
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a second stay at the resort and it was just a great this time as it was the first time. They had a $99 a nite room sale, which I jumped on. Requested the $10 upgrade, if available, which I got when I checked in. This time I had a 1bed suite on the Cove side which was just a nice as when I stayed in a Jr. Suite located on the Mission Beach side. Everything was just a great as my first trip in May. Just because it's "off season" doesn't mean the staff is. They took care of my every need during my 4 days. Had the spas and pools to myself, as well as, the beach. Close to shopping in every direction and a great 18 hole putting course.

Reviews.Title: “Lush tropical setting, classical resort on an upswing”
Reviews.Author: Michele L
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Paradise Point Resort several times over the past five years, and have found that they are upgrading the experience and resort. The rooms have been recently remodeled, which eliminated much of the dank feeling the rooms used to have. Some new furniture, a fresh coat of paint, and upgrades to the lighting, internet, etc., and you have a mostly refreshed resort. The location is beautiful, and during our most recent visit it appeared that the grounds have been getting some TLC as well. The resort celebrates its 50th anniversary next year, which should be an exciting time to visit. We also visited the spa and had a very enjoyable experience. My only criticisms, and they are a bit nit-picky, are (1) the bathrooms could still use a little more updating, especially the showers, (2) some of the room details still need attention like paint at the baseboards, (3) the mattresses feel a bit old and could use replacing, and (4) the charge for parking is very high, especially when the spaces are really small and there is a high likelihood that your vehicle/rental car will get door dinged.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort, but somewhat isolated”
Reviews.Author: pennywilliams
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked to stay at Paradise Point for 4 days due to it's proximity to Seaworld, but ended up checking out after 1 night. The room we had was very nice, and the staff were friendly, but the resort felt very isolated, we had driven down from LAX after flying from Australia and the last thing we wanted to do with our 4 year old was to get back in the car to find a shop that was open, so we ended up having to order very expensive room service ($75 including tax, tip and delivery fee for a couple of burgers, a couple of beers and a kids meal). When my jetlagged daughter was wanting to watch kids telly at night I had to pay $10 to access a handful of childrens programmes, the choice of channels was very poor, even for adults. And when she wanted a snack there was nothing open in the resort and no way of getting her anything without getting in the unfamiliar rental car in the middle of the night to drive on unfamiliar roads to I don't know where...Add in the charge for parking ($28 - very expensive), the charge for internet ($15 - disguised as a Paradise Pass, which covers everything which should be free in a resort like this), our one night stay here cost over $300, despite the fact we booked online for $159. After we checked out we went somewhere else with free parking, free internet and free breakfast that was closer to downtown and it was much better. On a side note, while the room looked nice, our towel rail actually came off the wall and my feet were filthy walking around barefoot in the room, the floor felt very grimy.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Paradise Point and will definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: miki08
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful and the location is convenient to San Diego. Our room was amazing, as were the views. We were treated like VIP's. We've recommended our friends and family book a stay for themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Seth D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 4 nights and 5 days and loved it. We had a Bayside Bungalo and were very happy with our room and the resort as a whole. The people were nice and helpful. The restaurants on the resort were fantastic. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Great Customer Service.”
Reviews.Author: Spike1958
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights begining Oct 30, 2011 and was very satisfied with the overall experience. The location was very good and the staff was extremely helpful. The firepits in the pool area were a nice touch and the outdoor bar was comfortable and the food better than expected. Rented a car for one day with the assistance of the staff and they took care of the car return when we were finished, no hassles.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, and close to the city”
Reviews.Author: Bob R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 4 nights for a business meeting. The layout is unique with each room almost like its own bungalow. For being so close to a major city it was surprisingly quiet and private. I read some other comments about the rooms not being up-to-date but mine was very nice, clean and comfortable. Excellent water pressure in the shower! The staff was very helpful without being overbearing. The woman in the gift shop learned my name on the first day and greeted me personally every morning thereafter when I came for the newspapers. I'm not easy to impress but this did it for me. The location was excellent for running - there is a bike lane / pedestrian path on the road outside the resort and all around Mission Bay - great for running any time of day or night.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort to stay all day”
Reviews.Author: JOSE A
Reviews.Content: This is the kind of resort where you can stay all day and have a lot of things to do, for children and adults as well. From restaurants, bicycles, beach and many other amenities you will have a wonderful and fun stay. Rooms are in excellent condition and mattresses and pillows are very comfortable and high quality. We will come back many times. Arroyo Family from Ensenada, Mexico

Reviews.Title: “It was ok...wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: Fele
Reviews.Content: We went here with family and had a couple rooms...the rooms were updated, looked pretty, but they were a little runned down...let me explain...the first room we had was moldy and mildewy...smelled really bad. How does a resort not know this when the maid cleans? We switched rooms 3 times and finally got a clean room...bathrooms need updating. However, front desk, bellman and maids are very quick to help...hotel needs a major maintenance overhall! Stay somewhere els eif you prefer a 4 star or better hotel/resort since you will not get one here...

Reviews.Title: “Great bungalow suite; an even better view!”
Reviews.Author: woohoo_family
Reviews.Content: With a child just under two, we wanted a bedroom with a door. So I booked the garden bungalow to guarantee us the room. We were luckily upgraded to the bayside bungalow which was great. Each morning my daughter enjoyed feeding the ducks, steps from our front door. With the mini kitchen, I was able to wash her feeding dishes/utensils each day and warm up any leftover food. Facilities that a family with young children always need. The resort passport that they charge, covers local and long distance calls; however, it doesn't indicate anywhere that it does not include calls to Canada which I made. The manager on duty credited my bill with no hesitation. This hotel strived to meet my needs, from the staff that delivered my room service to the front desk staff to the ladies at the Island Market. We will be back for another family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda B
Reviews.Content: My extended family came to visit San Diego and we recommended Paradise Point for the weekend. The room was spacious and the grounds are very tropical and well-maintained. We ate at the Barefoot Bare & Grill, which is one of the restaurants at Paradise Point, and had a lovely view overlooking the bay. The food was reasonably priced and tasty.
