I would highly recommend staying here if you are visiting San Diego. It also is close to many attractions such as Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Incidentals”
Reviews.Author: FrancesD952
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay on Priceline.com (and got a great deal) and every employee who pulled up our reservation at the hotel made sure to mention that, and to state that is why we were getting a certain room type. I was told Priceline dictated our room type. At check-in, my debit card was charged $200 for incidentals. I am told it would have simply been a "hold" had I used a credit card. We checked out 3 days ago, however those funds have not been returned/credited to my account. In addition, we were surprised by the $28 parking fee, per day, for "convenient parking right outside your room". We were unable to park in our space due to flooding from the rain. We also incurred a $15 passport fee, per day, for local and long distance calls, wireless internet, use of the fitness center and recreational room. We did not need or use any of these services, however it is a mandatory fee. So, our great deal on Priceline.com cost an additional $134.67 for parking and the passport fee and I have yet to receive my $200 incidental refund. We wanted a nice, relaxing weekend without the kids and then had to deal with money issues and being treated like second class citizens at a resort for booking a room at Priceline. Our first room smelled like a nursing facility and we were moved to a new room upon request. I do appreciate that.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and Downs”
Reviews.Author: DOCJAE
Reviews.Content: The room was surprisingly nice. I was concerned after reading some of the reviews. The only problem was an old toilet that ran and ran and was very loud. We weren't in the room enough to complain. I'm sure they would have done something had we complained. Baleen left much to be desired. My fish was undercooked. They refired the same piece and over cooked it. The server was decent. Seating was nice near a fireplace. I wish we would have eaten somewhere else for dinner. Room service was good. It was timely and tasty. Overall, I can see going back for a few days. I highly recommend it for families. Couples, expect to see a lot of kids. It is big enough that it isn't bothersome though. If you are not in San Diego to see new things or go to a game or other event, this is a great place. I don't know that it is worth the money if you won't have time to take advantage of the entire resort. Pacific beach is a nice walk if you are fit, fyi.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous. Everything you need at your finger tips.”
Reviews.Author: EMUP
Reviews.Content: Every member of the family loved this hotel. It had something for all of us. We actually saw less of San Diego than anticipated because we didn't want to leave the hotel. We were only there for a couple of nights at the end of a 3 week CA road trip and what a great way to relax. I upgraded us on check in to one of the beachfront rooms and it was so worth it. The kids loved going out in their pajamas in the morning and playing in the sand. We did smores on the beach both nights in the fire pits and it was one of those moments in life I knew I would remember how happy we all were at that very moment. Restaurants were great. We actually preferred the more casual one. Staff throughout the hotel were fabulous from the bellman to housekeeping to the shop ladies. My husband booked me in for spa treatments as a surprise and that was fabulous. I just can't say enough. My only regret is we didn't stay longer. Don't forget to feed the ducks! And to those who moan about sand in the room.....that's the price you pay for being at the beach!!

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise.....”
Reviews.Author: 42Eyes
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay on Haute Look and got this great deal for 2 nights. The Lanai garden view. but, to our surprise when we arrived it was the lanai side but it was the other half of the bungalow to the "Bay View" so, a few steps to the private beach!!! The rooms were re-done in a dark wood, more modern feel. Beds were four poster feet. Way too high for a 2 year year old. Enough space for our playpen. Downfall was the crappy doorstep mat. It didn't wipe your feet clean of sand! So, you wear your shoes in along comes all that sand. So, now you need a broom to sweep up after yourself. We love feeding the ducks. But, boy someone needs to be on poop patrol! There were alot of spots where I didn't want my little one stepping in... They have a nice little breakfast spot near the water. Good Service, but a bit pricey. Not your everyday spot to eat. They said the pool was heated but not really..Jacuzzi was nice to warm up in. They do offer the gym to workout or spa next door. This time a year is great because less crowded except Sea World was packed!! They were having kids trick-or-treat in costumes and passing out candy.

Reviews.Title: “Great service after we left”
Reviews.Author: Theresa S
Reviews.Content: The landscaping at this resort was absolutely lovely. The room was clean and neat, but more importantly, the service received after we left the resort was great. My grandson left a small, scrawny, beat up but beloved stuffed dog in the hotel room. Needless to say he was upset, so we called the next day and reported it to security. I spoke to two people at the desk who were very courteous and assured me that security would contact me. Security actually called me back to tell me they were able to find the dog which had been turned in by the maid service and would send it back to us with no charge. We received the dog a few days later. You can't ask for better service than this!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Brad M
Reviews.Content: I went to Priceline and bid on a hotel room saying I wanted at least 3.5 stars and my bid was accepted by Paradise Point. What a nice surprise. For probably less than what it would have cost at something like a Day's Inn, we got a great room in a wonderful locale. The hotel is situated on it's own tropical like island and the grounds are immaculate. The room was large and well appointed but still quaint. It's in a great location that is very close to many attractions in San Diego so it was a breeze to zip around town. I will definitely stay at Paradise Point again and recommend it without reservation (no pun intended!)

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend it to others.”
Reviews.Author: John F
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the resort was very nice and exceeded our expectations. The staff was great, the resort was beautiful and I would recommend it to other travelers. The beach on the bay was quite great, the food at the resort was good and fair in price. While the rooms were small they were updated nicely and the beds were very comfy. The kids loved all of the things to do around the property and I felt they were safe and they were very sad to leave. The resort was close to the ocean and seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely start to finish”
Reviews.Author: NaseemA4
Reviews.Content: Had nothing but great experiences here! We got a bayside room and literally walked out our door onto an almost private beach (it was the off-season -- early November) and yet the weather was a beautiful sunny 80 degrees! Everything was clean and it felt like living in a lush garden. Staff were friendly and competent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful aesthetics inside room and lush landscaping with attractive birds and views.”
Reviews.Author: Biernacki
Reviews.Content: This resort deserves its name by offering an away-from-it-all experience. It is virtually a secluded island, but has easy bridge access to key destinations in San Diego, including downtown and Sea World. The grounds are meticulously landscaped yet attract wild birds that lend the place a natural feel. Many rooms, even standard, offer lagoon views at least, with the sound of running streams. The rooms ARE old structures and some lack cross-ventilating, but from the outside they are classic modern and inside they have been beautifully redecorated to remain current. This resort offers real value to families due to the mini-golf, bocce ball, croquet, and other activities. DRAWBACKS: the parking fee is so excessive, I would consider dumping the car in the residential neighborhood located on shore just north, a fifteen minute walk away at most, and enjoy the views the whole way back. Overall the resort has the feel of Disneyland -- old, but so well-maintained it feels beautifully retro rather than dated.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point Could Be Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Nancy R
Reviews.Content: The Positives: Grounds are beautiful! Very nice impression driving in. Location is great...15 minutes to Gaslamp, airport, colleges, La Jolla, ect. Staff seems really friendly. The Negatives: The rooms (called bungalows) are basically rooms in concrete squares. They desperately need to update them. Some may think they are charming but to us they seemed incredibly dated. Some are overlooking the bay & are probably more appealing but ours was basic, the bathroom was very small, the heat/air conditioning is from a wall unit, the tv wasn't a clear picture & the menu function option didn't work. The room had the odor of an old hotel room although it appeared clean. There was a sitting area with a couch & coffee table so other than the bathroom the size was fine. The hotel itself is motel style in which if your room isn't facing the bay you will have cars driving past to get to their rooms. I travel to SD frequently to visit my college age daughter and I've tried many hotels in the area. The rooms here are definitely Holiday Inn quality although the grounds far surpassed the ordinary hotel. The rates are incredibly reasonable so the room quality was not a huge surprise. For a quick weekend it was fine and if you know in advance that the rooms are just a 3 star you will enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect anniversary getaway”
Reviews.Author: killutch
Reviews.Content: First off it's on an island!! Love the setting and the overall feel of the resort. The lady at the front desk upgated our room to a suite for our anniversary for free. This would set the tone the rest of our very enjoyable weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Stay!”
Reviews.Author: David T
Reviews.Content: My wife chose Paradise Point as the place where she wanted to spend a very special birthday. We stayed at the resort 26 years ago when it was under a different name. This time we clearly noticed that the entire staff was extremely friendly. It started before our arrival as I ordered flowers from the Island Market to be delivered to the room. Kathleen made several calls to florists and found a perfect arrangement. When we arrived Alexa, at the front desk, went out of her way to find a Bayside Jr. Suite overlooking Mission Bay. (The room we were originally assigned did not have such a view.) I highly recommend this type of room for couples, especially if you enjoy a waterfront view and beautiful sunsets. The room had a microwave and small refrigerator to store and reheat food. The grounds are immense and well kept. The bell staff was always willing to offer a ride in their golf extended golf carts wherever we wanted to go on the property. The food was good and room service was always prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina F
Reviews.Content: Seriously all the basics and then some were covered for us: relaxing retreat, great location, great food on-site and wonderfully appointed rooms. Add to that an attentive wait staff and there you go. Worth it, especially close local places like Sea World down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Alanna D
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great Rooms. Great staff. Hope to stay again really soon. Recommend to any traveler for business or lesuire.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point was the best place we stayed in the San Diego area.”
Reviews.Author: AvantgardeAdventurer
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point was the best place we stayed in the San Diego area. It felt like were on an island in the South Pacific, as the resort is very beautifully landscaped with tropical foliage and ponds and it is located on an island in Mission Bay. We reserved the Lanai Bayside room, but they upgraded us to the Lanai Bayside suites. We had spectacular oceanfront view and great access to kayaking. The accommodations were very comfortable and spacious. The staff went out of their way to make our visit comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great get away!”
Reviews.Author: Cookie E
Reviews.Content: Was better then I expected a great resort and the staff were really friendly. The resort is really pretty at night and you do have your own patio. Beautiful resort.

Reviews.Title: “HONEYMOON AFTER 18 YRS TOGETHER, BEST TROPICAL SURROUNDS, BEST FRIENDLY STAFF, MOST BEAUTIFUL PLACE IN THE COUNTRY.”
Reviews.Author: Linda N
Reviews.Content: The most beautiful tropical surroundings in the country, If your planning a honeymoon this is the place, Its a dream come true.

Reviews.Title: “A great "staycation"”
Reviews.Author: Monica0902
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our little one-night getaway but would step it up a notch and get a room closer to the bay, or at least away from the main road for the next time (was only reason I didn't give an "excellent rating" for sleep quality) The bed was very comfortable, room was decorated nicely...only the shower area needed an update. The grounds, pools, restaurants etc were exactly what we expected for a paradise retreat..tropical, friendly staff (EVERYONE!) casual, relaxing. We did not use the Spa or the other activities ($15 charge that's included in your bill for Fitness center, Tennis, Horseshoes, Bocce ball etc) but will the next time we come. The resort is nicely spread out, making for great walks to enjoy the gardens and beach areas. You can call for a golf cart to pick you up at your room and take you where ever you need to go on the resort if you'd rather. The restaurant prices were what we expected at a resort but since there is a little fridge in the room, we will bring our own room goodies the next time. Looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: JRA_10
Reviews.Content: A very beautiful location on Mission Bay, San Diego, CA. The grounds, rooms and dining facilityes are well done. However, the staff, while friendly and clearly interested in making our stay enjoyable, lacked the detailed focus that would make the place top notch. As an example: We had dinner at their best restaurant and were seated next to a table of 25 diners who were having a business dinner. The conversation was very loud, as one would expect of such a large group. We asked to be moved to a table further from the group, one we had walked by as we were escorted to our table. The table setting included three extra forks placed on the side of the table, obviously left there in error. Additionally, there was just a salt shaker on the table with no salt and the pepper was missing. The price of the meal exceeded the value of the meal/ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Spot!”
Reviews.Author: carrie m
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old son and I just stayed at Paradise Point for a weekend getaway. The hotel was the same as it looked on the website. We got a great last minute rate of $191 (incl taxes) for a lanai room. The hotel was sold out so that was all we could get. The rate we got made our stay worth it. If you have the money, I'd stay on the bay in a bungalow. Our room just overlooked the parking lot but was a good size, clean and decently decorated. Beds were comfortable. Room good location to pools, fire pits, restaurants, gift shop etc.. Ate at Barefoot Grill which had good food and drinks for a good price and nice atmosphere right on the bay. The plus is there's lots of activities to do at this resort. The minus is they all cost something. There is a golf put course but it costs $20 to rent clubs in the gift shop. Parking is $28 and there's a resort fee of $15 which is supposed to include internet but ours was never able to be connected. My biggest gripe was paying $3 for a tiny bag of potato chips and $3.50 for a kids soda at the pool bar. This was outrageous!!!! Paradise Point is not cheap to begin with so to be nickled and dimed makes it very upsetting. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would go back again if the price was right and we could stay on the water.

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further”
Reviews.Author: Patrice P
Reviews.Content: What a great stay. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. The room was clean and quiet. I was on a business trip, but I will be bringing my family back to take advantage of all the activites provided. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Great destination resort”
Reviews.Author: PatSnyder194
Reviews.Content: We just spent a long weekend at this resort and were totally happy and pleased with everything about it. We were upgraded to a lovely suite, the service was amazing both pleasant staff and very quick response, especially considering the size of the venue. Used room service food delivery for two breakfasts and not only did it arrive in a shorter time than promised, all was hot, everything needed was there as well. We ate in both the restaurants and the food was very good. The landscaping is gorgeous, lots of water features, gardens, just lovely. And lots of stuff to do, several pools, a spa, tennis courts, basketball, ping pong, etc. I highly recommend it and plan to make it a regular yearly stop.

Reviews.Title: “Third Year”
Reviews.Author: sandraflorene
Reviews.Content: This was our third year. My son always wants to spend his birthday here. He brings a new friend every year to show them Paradise Point. The grounds are fabulous for all kinds of outdoor play. And the shark pond it always a hit. We are looking forward to number four.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Venue!”
Reviews.Author: Alan S
Reviews.Content: Our daughter was recently married at Paradise Point, and we could not have chosen a more perfect place. With scores of friends and relatives assembling on the premises from all over the country and myriad details to be worked out, we were initially concerned at the possibility of things not going as planned. We needn't have been! We were blessed with a most accommodating and professional staff person (Banquet Manager Karen Cipolla), who solved challenges even before they appeared and ensured that no detail was overlooked, This personal service, combined with excellent accommodations and superb dining for all, resulted in a thoroughly enjoyable and unforgettable life experience.

Reviews.Title: “geared to a special audience”
Reviews.Author: scott b
Reviews.Content: When looking at their web sight I was excited about staying, and upon arrival the grounds seemed to exceed my expectations. Once in the lobby you begin to question your choice. I'll start by saying We were 3 adults meeting for a reunion from different parts of the country. When you arrive the front desk service is excellent and accommidating, the lobby has that odor of a classic older hotel without the charm. Our first room was terrible, looked as if it were once a confrence room with funky sliding wall dividers perminantly attached to the wall and a very awkward floor plan, as well it was next to a convention facility and on a court yard that seemed to be grand central for a wedding and a multitude of kids. We asked to be moved to a more private location and were accomidated immediately. The rooms are nothing like the web sight, furnishing are old and a mismash of african looking decor. The sofa sleeper is terrible and any remodeling since the 70's was new floor tile and paint. The grounds are wonderful and if you have a family there are sand beaches, pools and endless amenities to keep kids busy. Be prepared for additional costs, 25$ night to park and 15-25 a night for use of the amenities (not an option) so why not just include it in the price and not look deceptive. Resaurants are nice but expensive and there are boat and watercraft rentals. You will be 15 minutes to everything, old town, gas lamp, seaworld, zoo, airport and downtown. If you are an adult looking for a special experience ask for a bayside view as 80% of the units have a view of a grassy courtyard, small plantless pond or a hedge. The baysides seem great and much more private. Overall, if you are a family looking for a resort experience you will not be disappointed, if you are adults looking for a private getaway it's a toss up, depending on the room you get. I think if we would have had a bayside room and furnishings from this century it would have been worth what we paid but for the cost I would stay in town on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Setting”
Reviews.Author: Jo_Ann000
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation months ago from an advertised special. I live in San Diego and thought it would be fun to get away--locally. My husband and i had a fantastic time. We were steps from the sand, on the bay. Our room was a great bungalow, with a patio and plenty of privacy. We had friends come down one evening, and had a great time hanging out, and making smores (which was included in our reservation). We ate breakfast at the Barefoot Bar and really enjoyed being right on the water. We also spent a lot of time walking the beautiful grounds. It's like you are in a tropical paradise. The staff was so accomodating, and we will definitely be coming back for more weekend getaways.

Reviews.Title: “A week at Paradise point”
Reviews.Author: botbuilder2000
Reviews.Content: Had a great week here. Good food, great location, great service.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra M
Reviews.Content: 2 adults and 2 kids (4 and 1)great place,walking distance to seaworld,right on the bus route,we used bus to get around the city($5 for an adult daily bus pass-great transit system,similar to vancouver),we definitely will be back,small separate bungalows,beach nearby,you can make fire on the beach,private and not alone at the same time ,this hotel is something for everyone,highly recomended,if you want to ask anything specific you can email me at pohyb@aim.com

Reviews.Title: “Hidden San Diego Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Enrico K
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat afraid of booking this hotel after reading a mix reviews. But it all went away once we got there. Beatiful, beautiful resort. I've stayed at Hilton Hawaiian village before and this resort is close in comparison. Easy check in and checkout but make sure you ask for a resort map and direction how to get to your room. The resort is about 44 acres. Easy to get lost if this is your first time. Not only the hotel staffs are nice, but other guests are very friendly as well, maybe since it's so relaxing in this resort. Location is close to major attraction but nicely hidden in its own island. Parking cost $ 28 but there is a free parking spot if you don't mind the walk, depending on where your room is. There are five different pools that I believe are heated but make sure you checked out the main pool that my 2yr daughter loves so much. We stayed in the garden king room that looks exactly like the pictures on their website. Not super luxurious but clean, updated, comfortable and safe. I do have to agree with other reviewers that mentioned about the quality of the towel. It was as smooth as a rug. The other thing that I'm not too crazy about is the use of soap and shampoo dispenser in the bathroom. It might be good for the environment, but I still prefer using those disposable tiny but new soap and shampoo package. Resort fee is $15 that includes the use of their tennis court, basket ball, internet and local call. Restaurant and Market Place item price seems reasonable to us, not over priced like some other resort. We will definitely come back again for a longer period. This place is amazing and very romantic with lots of things to do for Family, Couple or Group retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Great employees”
Reviews.Author: CaboTina
Reviews.Content: I checked in after attending a funeral for a Seal Beach victim. The gentlemen who checked me in knew I was upset. He was kind and helpe put a smil on my face. Wish I remembered his name. Liked the location and the food at the Barefoot resturant was excellent. We had a suite bunglaw was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: CJohnson4
Reviews.Content: The front desk people were very accommodating as we returned to Paradise Point for a second honeymoon. October was a beautiful time to visit. Our weather was sunny and warm. We appreciated the quiet of the adult pool, but the livelier large pool looked like a fun place for families. The fun of Mission Beach was a short ride away, as we're all other major attractions of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rosie O
Reviews.Content: The staff was good, the rooms clean and comfortable, the weather didn't cooperate stayed misty while we were there, but we still found lots to do. I would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views and Excellence Services”
Reviews.Author: Calvin H
Reviews.Content: I absolutely wonderful place to stay for get away but unfortunately I was there for business trip. I did not have enough time to enjoy the ocean views. It’s very convenience location 15 minutes to San Diego downtown( Gas Lamp) and airport. Spectacular room. very clean and very quite. The best conceirge services I ever had, also friendly staffs waiters, and waitress. I can’t says enough about the beautiful ocean view. My biggest regret is did not stay long enough but definitely I will return for near future.

Reviews.Title: “Super staff, splendid setting”
Reviews.Author: DiscriminatingPalate
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend there for a friend's wedding at Paradise Point. I felt a "Hilton Hawaiian Village" vibe upon arrival. It seems like everything you need is on the site. The facility is very nice, and the staff is among the very best I've ever encountered. They're extremely upbeat, personable, and professional. Check-in and check-out were a breeze, and our nicely appointed room was very functional. The spa/gym had enough to offer for good relaxation and/or a solid workout. The pool and pooldeck had lots of room to accommodate a big crowd. The catering facility was very nice, good food, ample drink, and the sunset setting made for a wonderful outdoor, waterside ceremony.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay here!”
Reviews.Author: KMariko103
Reviews.Content: It's really great for families due to all of the activities available, but as a mid-20s couple, my fiance and I loved our stay! We only got to make use of the tennis courts because we were really busy meeting up with old friends who live in SD, but the hotel is in a great location, right by the 8 fwy, Sea World, Mission Beach, etc. I really want to come back again to experience all the amenities (fitness room, different pools, bikes, s'mores on the beach!)

Reviews.Title: “A true Paradise Island”
Reviews.Author: Jim S
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time. This resort is very unique. It is situated in the heart of San Diego on an island in the middle of Mission Bay, close to may attractions. There was plenty to do for our family of 4. We rented bikes, enjoyed the beach, went to Sea World which is only a few minutes away, and my oldest even went jet skiing. The restaurants are both on the bay, so we had wonderful views. The staff was very friendly and always offered to help us find our way around. The rooms are comfortable and spacious, but not luxurious. We will certainly be back.....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, friendly, great value.”
Reviews.Author: travelinghopefully1
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our four-night stay, which included a free upgrade to a spacious bungalow and exceeded our expectations. This resort offers excellent packages (which can be a little confusing to find on the website), so be sure to check carefully for all options.

Reviews.Title: “Great, comfortable option”
Reviews.Author: Mike95128
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point in a very good choice for your stay in San Diego. I got the best rate by calling the hotel directly... Better than all the many websites I tried on line. There was a special autumn package or something like that. The grounds are well maintained and really quite beautiful. The location is great, too. It's on a bay, not the ocean, so don't expect waves and other oceany stuff. The rooms are far better on the inside than they are on the outside. The architecture is really quite unfortunate: cheap cinder block construction. But the rooms themselves are modern, updated, clean, and comfortable. The service was friendly and earnest but not very knowledgeable about restaurants when we asked. I think the nice young lady was looking at Yelp recommendations behind the counter. Good for her .... She got us an answer and we ended up at a nice place in Little Italy. All-in-all it's three star quality with a five star location. To me, that's a good deal, especially considering the fair price we paid and the spacious, comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Blueygirl1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a birthday weekend at Paradise Point Resort in late September. We reserved a bayside bungalow so we could have a view of the bay. While the view of the bay is incredible, I'm sorry to report that the bungalow is basically a disappointment. The bungalows are very dated and many things in the rooms are missing or don't work. I know the bungalows have been remodeled but, in our opinion, they were awful. The bathroom flooring doesn't match the rest of the bungalow and theres no carpet whatsover, so when you come out of the shower its very slippery. The grounds around the complex are beautiful, and the staff is more than helpful. The expensive rooms however, are not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time theres pro's and con's”
Reviews.Author: nursekc909
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here this past weekend, I always make an effort to write both pro's and con's of the places I review in order to help others make a good decision. We had a pleasant experience here, staff was nice and helpful. What I loved about this place was the atmosphere and enviroment, very vacationing feel =). We put on are reservation a request for a room with the best view possible for the room we were getting. Paradise point did a great job, we had a bayfront view steps away from the sand. At night we sat on the patio drinking wine and listening to music while watching the beautiful old fashion big paddle boat float in the bay, beautiful scenary especially sunset. The adult pool was great we practically had the jacuzzi to ourselves the whole time. I love that you park very close to your room. Did I mentioned we had just got married and this was our mini honeymoon, well paradise point had a staff member bring complimentary wine with chocolate covered strawberries to our room with such a nice card congratulating us on our marriage, i thought it was so nice of them. I loved that you call for a ride to get around the resort and can call from everywhere from the resturants, the pools, the island store etc. The rooms were very nice as well, we got a junior suite. You dont need to bring shampoo, conditioner or body wash ( unless you prefer a particular brand) because they dont supply you with those tiny bottles most places do, they have decent size refillable bottles in the shower, nice touch. the food was decent too. very nice atmoshere here cons: sooooo expensive!!! the prices are so ridculous, we spent alot and it as just us two and we didnt even do much, cant imagine a whole family.The resturants are extremely expensive $20+ plates, I suggest bringing snacks/drinks and microwavable food so you dont spend so much on food there, the room had a frig and microwave. The bike rentals our expensive as well, we paid for two hours but were tired by 30 minutes lol so returned it at 1 hour, they were very nice and refunded us back 1 hour since we didnt use that hour, with no hassle. Other than pools, bikes and food, not much do to there, but it was relaxing doing nothing for us both. I think the passport to paradise was a waste of money other than pool and parking that was included =/ You have to leave a $100 room deposit, but you dont get it back right away and it takes 5-10 business days after you leave to get it back =(.. Im not sure if we would go back again, but Im not unhappy we came here and glad we came once our time was nice, relaxing, and scenary was goregous.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: gail b
Reviews.Content: We loved the Bungalow rooms, all the activities that are available if you like. We think it is the best place to have a wedding! We loved the atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: M S
Reviews.Content: Been to many resorts over the years, all I can say is WOW. View from our room to the Bay was unbelievable. Room was georgeous and immaculate. Would return again in a minute. Don't hesitate book it it today

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: asalmasryi
Reviews.Content: If you feel like taking a vacation to a tropical island locally, I HIGHLY recommend this hotel. My friends and I were shocked at how gorgeous it was and how nice all of the staff were! I plan on visiting again and I've already recommended this to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Csippel10
Reviews.Content: My husband and i were looking for a place to celebrate our first wedding anniversary and where excited by the photos we saw online and on facebook. Sadly however, they were a quite misleading. The room we booked had king size bed. When we checked in she said they had us in a 2 queen room. We insisted that wasn't what we booked- and she insisted there were no upgrades or other rooms available.....not off to a good start..... When we arrived at our room.....it looked nothing like the pictures show online. We stayed in a room called the ''Lanai Garden.'' It was to "have views of the garden" but it only had about 10 feet of grass and tall trees- that we soon realized just camouflaged that our room backed up to the main road. Our bathroom was quite dated and didn't match the rest of the room. It looked like they half-assed updating the room. Our pillows were terrible....after 3 nights.....my neck and shoulders had had it. Now tell me what the point of staying at a "resort" is when there are no resort perks. We had our own parking spot right outside our room.....yet we had to pay a $28 parking fee PER DAY??? There was also "resort fee" of $15 PER DAY. This included internet, the pool and fitness center.... Needless to say, this place was a BIG disappointment. I would NOT recommend this place. We spent close to $800 for 3 nights.....and we will stay downtown next time in a highrise hotel. You may still pay for parking, but at least you will get what you pay for as far as "Luxury Accommodations" are concerned.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: larazoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Paradise Point for our 10 year anniversary. The resort was lush and well maintained. The lagoon and beach areas provided a romantic and secluded atmosphere. We were upgraded to the presidential suite, and it was gorgeous! We are considering coming back with our family and staying longer to enjoy the other amenities (pool, boat rental and bikes) since we ran out of time. Beautiful resort in a beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: D C
Reviews.Content: The is a beautiful resort to stay at and relax or work. The grounds are immaculate and service immpecable.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty location and resort”
Reviews.Author: Love2travel1960
Reviews.Content: First visit to this resort. It was for a business meeting in early Sept. Close to airport. Beautiful entrance and lobby. I was taken to my room by golf cart - good thing! It would have been a very long hike! The staff was friendly and accomodating. I had a beautiful bungalow on Mission Bay, just steps to the sand and water. Two adirondack chairs and table on a small cement patio outside front door. This was an upgrade room and had a large flat screen TV, sofa, chair, dining table and small "kitchen" with sink, and regrigerator. No extra towels, sponge or wipes. There is a coffee maker. Separate bedroom had an king size bed, large screen TV and separate bathroom with closet and then a separate room for toilet and bathtub/shower. The room was clean, may a little dated but it looked like it had been renovated. Unfortunately, the checkin desk did not give me a map, nor did the room have any book about the property... like room service menu, etc. So I had to go search for a bar/restaurant. With no car, it was at least a 10 min walk back to the common areas. It was confusing to walk, not well marked and night was really a challenge! They should try to do more to help travelers with signage. The staff was extremely friendly, and cheerful. The food in the restaurants (both dining and bar) were great and for our meetings, the same. The only disappointment was we had one fair day (the weather all week was a real bust - cold and overcast). We sat by the pool in hopes of some sun and wanted a drink. Everything was closed! We called the front desk and were told they close during the week after Labor Day! It would have been nice to tell us. Considering the property was booked solid, and they charge a resort fee, they should have just one person at the pool bar. The little market was really fun! Lot's of clothes, gifts, food, drink - so we went over there and got what we needed to make some drinks! The staff there was also wonderful. An interesting place - maybe not the shiekest, but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for Business and Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Rich107
Reviews.Content: I had an incredible time visiting Paradise Point. I was there for several nights for business meetings held right on the resort, and I plan on going back for a personal vacation before the end of the year. During my stay I always had a great time at a number of locations on the resort. During this trip, the entire city was caught in a large power outage that shut down power from Arizona to Central CA. I feel obligated to write a review on how well the entire Paradise Point staff reacted to this event. The staff's professionalism and "calm-under-pressure" attitude helped me remain calm as we waited for power to come back on. As great and relaxing as the resort was...the professional staff helped me enjoy my stay even more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice landscape,dirty room”
Reviews.Author: footguy
Reviews.Content: Checked in last night. The grounds are really nice and lots of free extras, Internet etc. However our bathroom had great big black hairs all over the tub and toilet. There were used coffee cups in the kitchen. This is an older place that they've remodeled but definitely don't stay here if you're a clean freak! They did have lots of activities and pools.

Reviews.Title: “ABCs”
Reviews.Author: james r
Reviews.Content: Amazing, Beautiful, and Captivating. These are the ABCs that I look for in a hotel, and Paradise Point definitely knows their ABCs.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, all-bungalow resort. An affordable, relaxed, tropical paradise, only minutes from downtown and the ocean.”
Reviews.Author: andrew z
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a junior suite, which was huge. Good value. Our two small kids slept on the very comfortable sleeper sofa. We had a kitchen area which we didn't use as we drove to Pacific Beach for breakfast every day, and dined in the Barefoot Bar and Grill which was about average for price, and very relaxed. Patios were a bit pointless. Great for Seaworld as it is literally across the street (still about a 30 min walk though or a 4 min drive) and you can re-enter for up to 7 days for the same price!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME RESORT!! A MUST STAY!! Gorgeous grounds, delicious food, impeccable rooms, just all around great!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica C
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful resort!! It's located in Mission Beach, central to everything. We live in La Jolla and wanted a quick get-away for the weekend, celebrating our 1-yr anniversary. We loved the grounds, totally didn't feel like we weres still in SD...felt like our St. Lucia honeymoon a few months back. Highly recommend!! :)

Reviews.Title: “A great stay during a three-day conference”
Reviews.Author: Hofstrafan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paradise Point for a three-day conference. The conference facilities were very comfortable, food was excellent and service was great. The accomodations are comfortable, each guest in their own bungalo with separate entrances. The surroundings are very relaxing with plenty to do and the staff very helpful. Cabs also seem to be on site regularly for transport around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for family trip to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: spacewrangler_uw
Reviews.Content: The grounds are really beautiful at Paridise Point, the rooms were nice and clean. They had great accomidations on site and we took advantage of the jets I rentals. The Barefoot Grill was over priced and service was horrible. I would stay here again only if the trip was centered around Sea World, otherwise I would stay elsewhere in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax!”
Reviews.Author: Linda M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been vacationing in San Diego at Paradise Point for many years. We love the fact that this is not a high rise hotel but a place where you can just go out your door and find paradise! We always stay in a suite with a patio where we can sit and relax right outside our room. The grounds are beautiful and green and very well attended. As you are sitting and reading, you may be visited with ducks that are very comfortable being around us humans. There are lots of things for kids and parents to do. The rooms are comfortable and very clean. There is parking available for a fee right outside your room. A great place to relax!

Reviews.Title: “Island vacation! This hotel is like none other.”
Reviews.Author: Kelly J
Reviews.Content: Loved the landscaping, beaches and separate bungalows. Just a walk around the property is relaxing and beautiful. 5 pools and private beaches. The bungalows are truly unique.

Reviews.Title: “Walk -- don't ride!”
Reviews.Author: Dan L
Reviews.Content: Attended 2 day conference. 2 nights. Great bed, room, service, etc. The staff is solicitious in trying to please. Head Conciere actually RAN to get luggage as he felt we waited too long. Front desk supervisor moved me to a great room immediately upon request (1st room too close to highway). Keith anothe conciere was most helpful in laying out the map. Beautiful grounds. Walk -- don't ride the free golf carts. Spa needs more room and AC! Conference food, meeting rooms, AV, temp's -- all excellent. Want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Glad I didn't pay for it!”
Reviews.Author: Allison B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights because I was attending a conference located at the resort. So glad it wasn't me paying for the room. The rooms are dark. A lightbulb was burned out and needed to be replaced, which it was after leaving a note for the cleaning staff. There were moths and spiders in the room, which didn't bother me, but it may some people. The shower was horrible. Basically a small trickle comes from the shower head. Asked to have that fixed. I believe someone looked at it, but it wasn't fixed. On the second day of my stay, after being at the conference for eight hours, I came back to my room and it hadn't been cleaned. Within five minutes, they showed up, but I was in the bathroom. I yelled out the door that someone was in here, but they proceeded to continue to clean the room, while I was in the bathroom! Weird. I've never had that happen before. They usually come back. One thing I did like, because access to the bungalows is from the outside, you don't hear people walking up and down the hall and doors slamming when you're trying to sleep. However, the curtain for my door didn't cover the door all the way and someone could easily look into your room while you're sleeping, so I had to rig the curtain to completely cover the window. The grounds are beautiful. It was too cold to try any of the pools.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: Richard M
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice place. The grounds are incredibly inviting and so peaceful. Walking the grounds was a joy. The facility seems to be in need of a little repair simply due to age, but our room was fantastic, clean and well layed out. Great patio and nice view to rea.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but somewhat dated exteriors”
Reviews.Author: dbundes
Reviews.Content: This place has been here for quite a while. The rooms have been updated but the resort itself might consider a facelift. Outstanding location with nice meeting rooms, even if the halls were awfully crowded. Great service and staff throughout the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Shellee R
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the Paradise Point recently. It happened to be at a time when a black out affected the entire city of San Diego. The staff handly this situation beautifully and turned what could have been a stressful event into a fun, memorable event. They directed everyone to the main pool and cooked burgers on the gas grill and handed out cold drinks....all with smiles on their faces. We were still able to spend quality time with our family and friends that had travelled with us. Kudos to the staff for handling that situation with such grace!

Reviews.Title: “We were upgraded to their stunning Bayside Suite!”
Reviews.Author: Jen B
Reviews.Content: I wish we could have stayed here longer, but we had spent 2 nights prior at Temecula Creek Inn, which we were upgraded as well right on the 1st tee on one of their 3 nine holes. I had mentioned in my original 24 hour hold that we were celebrating our 5 year wedding anniversary. I got the more affordable 20/20 promotion with a lanai garden view room 20% off room deal and $20 off any service per day, most likely the parking which is i think $16/day. But I failed to called in 24 hours. So my husband called back to reserve and didn't mention our anniversary. Although our 1st room was beautiful already, and not to complain by any means, it was up towards the entrance and just not as close to the restaurants. We decided to check out the property and figured we would go ask the front desk if they could do anything special for our anniversary. More than we could have even imagined, we were graciously upgraded to their awesome bayside suite. It truly became own private paradise point! Our 23 month old son just enjoyed himself immensely on this beautiful little island, and so did we! Thank you so much Paradise Point! We live in Orange County, and it's a great getaway! Can't wait to come back!!! Oh, only thing we were kinda sad about was that the water taxi was open to take us to seaworld :(

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations in every area. When can we go back???”
Reviews.Author: Karen L
Reviews.Content: Beautiful gardens and views. We thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of our stay and just wish the weather was sunnier and warmer so we could have enjoyed the pool areas more. The room was updated, very clean and a pleasure to relax in. Great resort and location. Would love to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Totally surprised.”
Reviews.Author: Daniel H
Reviews.Content: Was apprehensive about staying here due to some reviews but upon arrival I was totally blown away by the tropical grounds and convenient location. Rooms were extremely clean and accommodating. Our room had a slight musty odor upon arrival, but was alleviated after we turned the air on. Employees are extremely friendly and helpful. Grounds were extremely clean and well kept. Pool/spa area was very tropical and up to date. Barefoot bar and grill was very well situated with views of the bay. Definitely would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Brooke I
Reviews.Content: We got a deal on Priceline for this resort for our anniversary. We walked to Sea World..it was THAT close. Wish we could have stayed longer and used all the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Started off with a whimper, ended up with a bang”
Reviews.Author: SofaKing_GoodKarma
Reviews.Content: Okay, this was it -- The Summer mini-vacation we held off taking until right before the kids went back to school, and we were sooooo gung ho. We'd booked our stay a couple of months in advance and were happy with the rates. Everything was fine with check-in, the grounds made you feel like you were really getting away from it. After a great day at Sea World, with the kids ready to grab a second wind at the resort, our positive outlook took a quick turn south when we got to our room. It was tucked waaay back into a little corner by the banquet facility, well away from any of the pools or amenities. It felt like we had been relegated to the forgotten step-child suite. If it was up to me we'd have complained and left that nite. Thank goodness my better half’s cooler head prevailed. After a long wait and hold with a busy front desk, plus a plea to help our family's collective frown be turned upside down, we were moved to a nicer suite, between a pool and the bay! After that quick changeover, the rest of our stay was MAGNIFICENT. We took advantage of many of the amenities including the four seat bike rental (“easy around those corners!”), a 60-hp boat rental for dinner in the bay (“Daaaaaaaaad, we change our minds about the speed zone!”), playing at the pool all day (“the sun came out juuust for us”), and s’mores kits by one of the poolside gas fire pits (“Who wants fourths?”). All in all, a great trip and getaway. Thank you Paradise Point for a wonderful family vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Chrisj319
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and found the resort very comfortable and inviting. It is a laid back place with focus on the family from the ducks on the numerous ponds that you can feed to the pools and bike hire, lots to do if you atre that way inclined or just chill at one of the pool. Great resort and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: BR58
Reviews.Content: This location is perfect, the grounds are stunning. Since this property has been here for years, the rooms, although updated,are not quite what you may expect for these prices. Close to a lot of activities or you can stay there and have plenty to do. The pools and waterfront dinning are great. We have been several times and always enjoy our stay (they shuttle guy's are great) but there are small things they could do to improve the experience. The $15 Passport (a fancy way to charge a resort fee) is something they should do away with. The Internet access is extremely poor and for over $300 per night, come on,they should not charge for it. A make up mirror in the bathroom and do away with the pump soap in the shower. All in all a nice weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “One night ok - probably wouldn't have stayed longer....”
Reviews.Author: newtravelgal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight during a road trip from our Anaheim vacation. The room itself seemed nice, but if you looked closer, your could see it was a little run-down, perhaps could use a little reno in the bathroom, etc. The rooms are very spread out, which makes it hard to get to the pools for a quick swim, etc. We asked several employees how to get to the beach and we got very vague answers. We finally figured out a way to get down there (with a stroller) and was not impressed. I expected a little picturesque spot where we could sit and watch boats for a bit, but what we got was spongy and rocky. And quite a climb back up the embankment (with a stroller) to the rooms. The main restaurant was good (Barefoot Bar), although the chairs and railings (overlooking the pond) could also do with a refurb. Food was decent and service was average. Seemed like a decent place to lay your head for a night or two, but I would have been disappointed with a longer stay here, expecting to use the beach and pools often. The big plus for this place was its proximity to Sea World! And yes, the resort fees were a little high.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend! Great for families or couples!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful, relaxing experience celebrating our 10 year anniversary sans kids. The food at Baleen is awesome! We highly recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Only if the rooms were kept clean.... terrible value”
Reviews.Author: SteveFromBelmont
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Paradise Point twice. The first time in 2010 we ran into a number of issues - the most significant was the bathroom in our first room was very dirty. We managed to switch rooms and get thru the trip without too many other issues. Management was responsive (this time). So, we tried Paradise Point again this year and - guess what? Upon checkin, the room smells really bad! We get maid service to address this. Next day is Seaworld (nice location for this) and we return about 5p. The room is not made up. Maid service is called and they make up the room. Next day, same issue. This time when I call maid service, I'm told that I have to wait until the maid gets around to us. At 5pm? After the trip, I wrote a detailed email to management describing these events and I essentially got back a canned email saying " sorry and hope to see you next time". No reply to my follow-up email. PS. Their location near Seaworld is nice but since everybody has a car anyway, I'd drive a few extra minutes for much better values.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property!”
Reviews.Author: Perkymum
Reviews.Content: The Bayside rooms are fantastic! Beautiful views, right on the beach...very family friendly. They offer a variety of different activities right there on the property! Great restaurants and pools!

Reviews.Title: “Add on room fees...”
Reviews.Author: CA-Thor
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point has a GREAT location with the Bay just steps away and beautiful grounds. My rant is the fees they tack on to your room rate PER DAY, $15 "Resort Fee" and $25 parking fee. These fees can not be opted out of except parking if you do not have a car and how many people go on vacation to So. Calif with out a car. So plan on an extra $40 to be added to you room rate, why not just make these fees included in the room rate?

Reviews.Title: “Pretty scenery.”
Reviews.Author: sskny
Reviews.Content: I didn't get to use a lot of the resorty stuff from the hotel, so I didn't really see the benefit of the hotel. It was really easy to get lost around the hotel and it is more for families than couples.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding At Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: jilldanna
Reviews.Content: We had the joy of having a wedding at Paradise Point a week ago! It was a fantastic experience from the first day of arriving to see the site and talk with Julie Arroyo the catering manager to the day of the event. Julie helped us plan our event and was very patient since we were so new at planning a wedding. On the wedding day Julie was very attentive to our needs and the service of setting up the ceremony site to the reception was incredible. The food, especially the tray appetizers was terrific! (We chosed the plated service, chicken dinner and it was perfect) We truly could just enjoy our even as much as the parents of the bride are able to do this on such a big day! Thank you Paradise Point for making such a special day for us!

Reviews.Title: “A resort that cares”
Reviews.Author: Tesstravels_21
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Paradise Point Resort when San Diego was out of power - in fact the entire southern end of CA was out of power. It looked like it could have been a long time for the power to come back on. The management went out of their way to provide food for the guests. With very fast thinking and a lot of hard work, the staff pulled together and turned a bad situation into a great time for everyone. I look forward to staying there again! Tess

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: Zonie083
Reviews.Content: A great place to visit for a long weekend. Splurge a little and get a junior suite - don't worry if you can't get a water view as the grounds are just as nice. The big rooms allow parking right up to your door and you can bring your own bike and rid all over the grounds. (You can rent bikes too, but why if you're able to rack your own?) The resturants at pretty good. Bare foot bar has great drinks and a really good breakfast. Belens is good too, but the specialty that night was the martini's (Martini Night) which were well mixed and stiff with top-shelf libation. The rooms may seem out dated to some, but I've been traveling to SD since I was a kid and these rooms are update with nice beds and linens, good TVs and clean. Even the five star originals are out dated if you count the quality of the ageless building (including places like the Hotel Del Coronado and La Valencia in La Jolla) Staff was friendly and helpful, and there's just a lot to do there if you like a slower but interesting pace.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty on the outside, ugly in the inside.”
Reviews.Author: Shan143
Reviews.Content: The property and the grounds are gorgeous. The hotel rooms are old and outdated, The restaurant cannot get a room service order right to save their lives.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point Resort vacations”
Reviews.Author: Danmo05
Reviews.Content: I had reservations about staying here after reading numerous accounts over the past couple of years, but was rewarded with one of our best stays in many years by this resort and their staff. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a bungalow overlooking the bay. This was quite unexpected but very appreciative. The property does show some age, but overall the facilities were in good working order. We did not eat at the property since we had our own transportation but I noticed quite a lot of guests did. The beach surrounding this property was kept clean of debris and clutter and we enjoyed the fire pit outside on one of our nights. The staff was always supportive in answering questions. We did have one surprising event occur on our 2nd night. This was the day southern California lost all power from 3:30PM until 4:00AM. The resort had the guests go to the pool area and served food from the gas powered grill free of charge. They also went out of their way for us to see in our dark rooms by supplying "glow sticks". Again, without charge. My only negative comment was that in the middle of the resort is a large flag pole flying the American flag that we used as a focal point if we got turned around. The flag disappeared after our 2nd night and was never raised again by the time we left 2 days later. The staff joked that it was stolen, but I never did get a serious answer to what happened to it.

Reviews.Title: “roaches, blood stains, and evictions, oh my!”
Reviews.Author: William B
Reviews.Content: Billed as a family friendly resort, we chose Paradise Point as the place to stay when we took our 3 year old to San Diego for his first family vacation. Placing our reservations a month in advance, I decided to splurge and reserve the bay view junior suite. We arrive with an exhausted, nap-ready kid at 2PM; we were told that our room was not ready yet, we're given pool keys, and told that we could visit any of the resort's pools while we wait. I ask for our room # so that I we could park and visit the pool closest to our room... we're told that they could not disclose our room #. Huh? Things got worse from there. At 3:30, we were given the go ahead to check in. We picked up our room keys, opened the door, and discovered that we had been given a garden view suite, not the bay view I had reserved. Strike 2. Going to the front desk and requesting a new room at this point is untenable...our child is exhausted...we decide to speak with the front desk the next day. That night, after the boy went to sleep, my wife and I decide to enjoy a glass of wine and some quiet time. We discover that we're not alone...another tenant, a 2 inch long cockroach is sauntering across the floor. This roach was so big, that I could have either smashed him with a shoe or put a leash around him...he does go very well with the three spiders in the ceiling. Strike 3. The roach successfully dispatched, our wine drank, we decide to call it a night...did I mention that we had to go to the store to buy plastic cups to drink our wine because the wet bar in our suite had no cups, no plates, no silverware, nothing? We crawl into bed and discover a blood stain on our duvet. It's not an OJ Simpson sized blood stain, but large enough that the maid should have caught it...we feel the benefit of the doubt slowly shrinking away. Morning. Surprised the coffee maker works, I have my morning cup and climb into the shower. When I get out, I reach for a towel to dry myself only to discover that it is as soft as a roofing tile. Seriously some free beach towels we got at dodger stadium that we use to dry our dog are soft as silk compared with ones. After a big day we return during naptime (1:30 PM) only to discover that the maid hasn't made up our room yet...so, off to the pool we go while we wait for housekeeping. Strike #?? I've lost count. My lovely bride stays with the boy (and her cocktail) at the pool while I visit the front desk to discuss my first day at PP. The guy at the front desk promises the maid will be earlier tomorrow, to report the insect infestation, and that the OJ duvet will be replaced. And the bayview room? He tells me that we got a free UPGRADE from a Bayview Junior Suite to a Garden View Suite. How thoughtful. It would have been nice to have been asked if we wanted this generous upgrade. Day 3. The towels are still exfoliating me, housekeeping had finished by the time we returned from Seaworld, and no signs of any other 6 or 8 leg co-tenants...maybe they're turning this thing around? Fat chance. That night we ordered an early dinner so we would have time to make smores at the fire pit in the main pool area with our son. We arrive at the fire pit at 7:30 PM. No fire. A couple sitting nearby tell us that they have already put in a request to have the fire lit. Not taking any chances I go to the front desk. The woman behind the desk tells me that she'll "put in a request for the service." When I ask her what that means, she tells me that she punches in the request in the computer which will cause someone to show up "soon." Not very reassuring. 7:45 PM. No fire. I return to the front desk. This time there are three parties ahead of me checking in. The woman at the front desk knows why I'm there, but she pretends she doesn't see me to make me wait. When I get to the front of the line, she explains that she doesn't know why the fire hasn't been lit yet. I suggest, impatiently, that perhaps she should pick up the phone and call someone. Her manager beckons me, promises she'll have someone there right away. 8:15 PM. Still no fire. My son is doing his best at waiting patiently for smores. I am no longer patient. So I bring him and his marshmallow laden stick to the front desk. The women there still have no answer for the delay, and seemingly no empathy for my problem. Exasperated, on my way out, I tell them to "light the damn fire pit." The manager behind the front desk threatens to evict me. Unreal. 8:30 PM. We talk with a security guard walking through the main pool area. He gets on his radio. The fire pit is lit within five minutes. Was that so hard? 10:00 PM. We decide to crawl into bed for our final night at the hotel. We pull down the sheets and see the familiar blood stain on the bedspread. Well, I guess I cannot complain lest my evicted family has to spend the night in our car.

Reviews.Title: “Fulfilled all our expectations”
Reviews.Author: CrazyCatLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paradise Point for the last 6 days of a 2 week California holiday and really enjoyed ourselves. We nearly didn't book here given some of the earlier negative comments (especially regarding cleanliness) but I'm very pleased that we did. We are avid travellers having been to every continent and would say that our experience stood up to standards set by similar luxury resorts around the world. Having clearly also stayed at the same time as some of the negative reviews below (during the power outage) perhaps we were lucky, but I'd like to offer our positive views to provide some balance. Our first impression which lasted throughout our stay, was that this was a luxury resort with beautifully kept grounds, amenities and rooms. We were in a Lanai Garden King room which had a serene private patio overlooking a pond. Although probably towards the bottom of the rooming price range, our room was mopped every day, towels were changed when needed and after leaving a polite request for our housekeeper, extra complimentary coffee was left for us. We were very close to the waterfall pool which suited us as it was very quiet. Although I agree that the main pool did look murky, I don't think it could have been as dirty as alleged in previous emails if it was treated the same as the waterfall pool - the latter was attended to every day at regular intervals by a legion of staff. I do agree that the additional daily parking and the 'passport' resort fee were annoying but this was made clear at booking so we computed it into the cost of the holiday. Unlike many all-inclusive holidays elsewhere there are relatively few activities which are complimentary so be careful as extras can add up. We took out a sailboat from the marina for 4 hours and we didn't feel the charge of $30 per hour was unreasonable. We chose to pay the $28 daily parking fee and keep our hire car as it provided us with freedom to eat out and see San Diego which we preferred. Without this you would be pretty much committed to eating every meal in the hotel and in fact we didn't do so once as there are so many restaurants within a short driving distance. We felt that we did more than offset the parking fee by buying in both breakfast and lunch items from a local supermarket and storing them in our spacious fridge. Contrary to an earlier comment, I was impressed by how the Paradise Point staff dealt with the power outage. Considering there was no electricity at all in California, and parts of Mexico and Arizona, I'm not sure how possibly they could have anticipated an outage of this magnitude or have been entirely prepared for it. Having said that they dealt with the situation admirably by keeping one restaurant open in running a series of gas barbecues and drinks in iced coolers. They managed to keep going until 8.30pm by which time most families with young children had been fed. All in all, we had a fabulous stay and would definitely return or recommend Paradise point to others looking for a relaxing holiday.

Reviews.Title: “great resort!”
Reviews.Author: kmh_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for a wedding that was onsite, and had a fabulous stay. The grounds are nice, our suite was amazing and roomy with a view of the bay. We enjoyed the bonfire pits that they have available for use on the beach. The gift shop sells s'mores kits (which feed 10) for $25, and firewood bundles for $12.99. The Island Market gift shop has everything you could need. Our suite had a microwave and mini fridge. Each room has a patio and two adirondack chairs. The food at the resort was great, and we enjoyed the pools too.

Reviews.Title: “tropical”
Reviews.Author: davidHullUk
Reviews.Content: this hotel was lovely didnt know what to expect after reading the bad reviews our room was lovely decorated clean and comfy could have been a bit bigger ,the grounds were lovely it was nice on a night doing the smores at the fire pits i we ate at both restaurants we would stay at this hotel again if in the area all the staff are very helpful and its a good location

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Audra P
Reviews.Content: LOVED our stay and will be back. Wonderful clean room, staff and restaurants! Beautiful garden grounds. Cool pools and walks along the private beach. Fire pits and smores at night. Could you really ask for more? Will be back as soon as we can! I really don't understand the "bad" reviews. The staff was always happy & helpful. The restaurants were awesome & the service quick. The grounds are SO easy to get around. It really not that hard! WHO CARES about TV! Come on! I didn't go on vacation to sit in my room and watch TV!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but definitely not a 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: SeattleLou
Reviews.Content: There were both good and not so good aspects of our experience at this resort. The hotel is in a great location, especially if you are planning on visiting SeaWorld or The San Diego Zoo. Our two rooms unfortunately faced the parking lot which did not provide a very scenic view. We definitely recommend requesting a room that faces either the pool or is on the water. Upon checking in one of the rooms, there was an overwhelming smell of paint in the room, as if the walls had just been painted. We tried to air out the room for a few hours but the smell was too much. We called reception so that we could switch rooms and we were moved to another room about four to five doors away. When we entered our new room, it literally smelled like a wet dog or smelly shoes (not very pleasant). We found the room change frustrating because we were traveling as a group and did not want to be split up from our friends. We ended up staying in the new stinky smelling room after airing it out for two days because we did not want to be moved any further from our group. The other room which our friends were staying in smelled fine, no issues. We also found the resort fee and parking fee a little steep ($15 a day "Passport to Paradise" resort fee and $25 a day for parking). We did receive a discount on the parking fee from the reception desk which made it more realistic ($10 a day). The reason why we felt that the resort fee was unnecessary is because we did not end up using any of the "inclusions" in this fee. (The fee includes the following activities: Bocce ball, croquet, ping pong, tennis, basketball, the fitness center and Wifi). The activities that we wanted to do, Miniature golf and the surrey ride were not included. The Surrey ride is $35 an hour which allowed all of us to ride together, four adults and two children riding in the basket on the front of the surrey. We really enjoyed the bike ride and would recommend doing it. The kids liked it the most. We also really enjoyed having a bonfire on the beach, on the last night of our stay. You can buy the wood and the items for making Smores in the resort gift shop or if you want a wider selection of snacks for your bonfire you can go to the store (Vons) a short distance away and buy your own items. Moving on to the interior of the rooms... We liked that the rooms had hardwood floors which is generally cleaner than carpeting. Unfortunately, the floors were not swept or cleaned during our stay! We had to literally wash our feet after walking on the floors, every time we walked barefoot in our room.That was both unecessary and quite annoying. The room includes a small refrigerator and coffeemaker. The beds were comfortable and the water pressure in the shower was good. There is a flat screen tv mounted to the wall which offers movie rentals for either $14 or $16 per rental, depending on how new the movie is. We must note that the tv reception was not good in either room. Several channels were quite fuzzy.If we were in our room more often, we would have found some of these issues unacceptable, especially for a hotel of this reputation. As we were rarely in our rooms, we didn't call attention to them. We did enjoy the grounds of the hotel. The landscaping is well done and pretty. The staff that we encountered were professional and nice. Although, we will note that some of the reception staff needs to be better informed of the check in process. Upon first checking in to the hotel, we were told that there would be $100 authorized on our credit cards for any misc. fees for each room (which is standard at hotels and wasn't an issue). Upon checking out of the hotel, my friend's card had the $100 held as previously mentioned but my card had $840 held. Not only was this unexpected, it was also very annoying to have to call the hotel after we had already left, in order to clarify the situation. I spoke with someone at the front desk, who said that the person who had checked us in should have told us that it was $100 authorized per NIGHT, not all together. This did not add up though, as we had stayed five nights, not eight plus and it was an odd amount held on my card, completely different from my friend's charge. Let me note that we didn't have any room charges, such as movie rentals or anything else that would have accounted for any charges. The staff member told me that the charge would come off in a few days. I did not make an issue about it, as the charge came off after about 4 days. It was simply an annoyance for me and a lack of training/communication on the part of the reception staff. All in all, our experience was average here. We would recommend this hotel on the basis of location, as it is so convenient to the beach and SeaWorld. Also, it is a short drive to the airport, Zoo and Old Town. Although,we definitely would not pay full price to stay here, it is not worth the full amount. Look for a package deal if you plan on staying here. *Tips for SeaWorld: We went to SeaWorld twice, using the two day pass that you can buy on the SW website. We really enjoyed the convenience of taking the water taxi from the resort even though it was pricey in comparison to parking at SeaWorld ($46 for four adults and two small children). It takes you to the back entrance of SeaWorld so that you are able to beat the lines and the quick trip over is relaxing. What we would recommend is: if you are visiting SeaWorld more than once: take the water taxi from the resort on the weekends when lines are the longest, park in the SW parking lot during the week when the wait is almost nonexistent (Parking is $14 a day or $19 for premium parking - i.e. Rows 1-6). Have a great trip to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice....but that's about the best thing about it.”
Reviews.Author: knobskittie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon. We did receive a free upgrade upon check-in to a bay front room, which was nice. The view was great from there. We rented a car, which was good considering that this hotel is completely secluded from any other businesses. The problem was that it was hard to get around the grounds in the car. There are very narrow roads, which are also the walkways for people. There are constantly DOZENS of golf carts with resort staff driving around. It was just really congested with all of the golf carts, vehicles, and people walking around in such narrow pathways. Some of the paths were one way, but some people seemed to completely ignore these signs, as they were pretty confusing, and there were people driving every which way. I guess I'm trying to say that a rental car is needed if you want to eat, shop, or see any actual beaches; however, navigating a car around the grounds can be quite difficult! The first night we went to the adult pool, and it was not heated. I called the front desk and was told that all pools were heated. We decided to go back two nights later and it was heated that time. The hot tub in the adult retreat was the only one that we could go to because the one in the main pool area was super dirty! We happened to be staying at the resort during the blackout in San Diego also. This was no fault of the resort at all, but they seemed very ill prepared for such an emergency. Food was made available for a short time. But while we were waiting in line to order, they announced that they wouldn't be serving any more food as it was getting "too dark". So if you were lucky enough to be in line early, you got supper, if not, you were turned away with no other options for the night. We ended up going back to our room and going to sleep and thankfully the power was restored in the night. I would have thought that they could have at least made snacks available to the guests. It was very frustrating to see all of these other people with food and then have the rest of us turned away with no other option. In the end we were charged $80 extra for parking our car and for a "resort fee" which covered extra activities that we never even used. This resort looks good in photos, and has some good qualities....the scenery is beautiful and the pools are nice. Our room was clean and towels were kept stocked. However, it should be much nicer for the price. The location is not convenient at all....especially if you want to get out and see San Diego. The beaches at the resort are on the bay and they were rocky and littered with bottles, towels from rooms, and trash. The fire pits were full of trash as well. Next time we'll spend our money on a hotel closer to the real beaches and watch out for hidden fees!!

Reviews.Title: “Lights out in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: KKoerber
Reviews.Content: I was at the Paradise Point Resort for a business meeting this week, and the service was wonderful. The power went out all over San Diego County, and the resort went treated us very well. I had to pack my clothes quickly in the dark, and I forgot something. I called them the next morning (when everything was working again.), and they are shipping me my item. They also moved all of their food service to the outdoor grill, and fed us dinner. The power outage closed every restaurant and grocery store for about a 50 mile radius, so we really needed it!! Paradise Point is great when everything is working well, and when everything is not working!!!

Reviews.Title: “NO BAD DAYS IN PARADISE.”
Reviews.Author: allan s
Reviews.Content: why would anybody want to spend their vacation anyplace else.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Monica Z
Reviews.Content: Being the manager of a 4 Star Spa Hotel in Canada, I have pretty high standards on holiday. Call me a hotel snob - I have been in the industry for almost 20 years. I was a bit skeptical reading so many unpleasant reviews but decided to give it a go as the price was right. After spending a night sleeping over at the Safari Park with the elephants, we checked into a Lanai Garden King (room 776) which was just fine as we spent all of our time at the beach or by the waterfall pool across from our bungalow. The room was recently updated,freshly painted, and the king bed was extremely comfortable. I loved the sink separate from the bath/toilet. Every single staff member we encountered was professional and friendly. We loved the Barefoot Bar and Grill so much, we ate there every day. Tim is a great bartender and Jessica is a great server too. Annabelle seemed to work every shift of every day. Bottom line, shop for the best rate and stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Pool was AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: SaraW3
