Reviews.Content: Paradise Point was an excellent get away for our family. Our son spent an entire day in the sand and pool! We didn't even make it to the actual bay for sand and swimming. The putt putt golf was great fun! It was a relaxing time and we actually felt like we were able to "get away."

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sea world”
Reviews.Author: hallage
Reviews.Content: This place was a grower with us ....on arrival being charged to park next to your accommodation $28 per day is just daylight robbery ......and then the drive up to your challet to find the outside with peeling woodwork was not great. What was great was the location - so close to sea world and 10 mins by water taxi to a private entrance was fantastic. However the beach bar was expensive $21 for a main course of meatballs and again drinks expensive and service lacking!!! by the end of our 4 day stay we quite liked it and sitting on the jetty watching sail boats with thes sun setting was great.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and outdated”
Reviews.Author: frankin7666
Reviews.Content: Way overpriced for the value, they charge 28.00 a day for parking and 15.00 a day for activities even if you don't use them! Resturants were just so so and everything in the room was just barely passible. housekeeping was less than impressive! dirty bathtubs, spiders in room !

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: westcoastla
Reviews.Content: I remember the first time I visited the South Seas themed Paradise Pointe. It was thirty years ago and the name of the resort was Vacation Village. My mom won two nights in a sales contest and this was one of the fanciest resorts we had ever experienced. My eyes widened as I gazed at the lagoons, tropical flowers and cabana-style one-story cottages. Located on 44-acres, the tropical island, situated on Mission Bay was filled with families riding bikes, building sand castles and swimming in the pools. I excitedly bounded out of the car and walked over to the lagoon filled with ducks and admired the observation tower. Many years later Princess Cruise Lines purchased the property when the popular television show, THE LOVE BOAT was one of the most watched television shows in America. Princess was going to sail to Mexican ports from the port of San Diego and package cruise and land vacations. Guests could cruise on their ships and stay overnight before or after the cruise at their resort. I never stayed at the San Diego Princess Resort, however in 1998, the resort was purchased by LaSalle Hotel Properties and one of San Diego’s top vacation destinations was renamed Paradise Pointe. Since then, I’ve been returning throughout the years. With one-mile of beachfront and 462 spacious rooms, the resort hasn’t changed that much since my first visit. The decoration is more Balinese then I remember from the past. There are the Lanai Garden rooms with your choice of a King-size bed with a sleeper sofa or two Queen size beds. The semi private patio has two Adirondack chairs for reading a good book or sitting outside and enjoying a pre-dinner cocktail. The Garden Suites offer larger patios, walk-in closets and dining area with a wet bar. The Lanai Bay side offers nice views of Mission Bay and are situated near blazing fire pits for evening s’mores. The Bayside Junior Suite Premium Lanai Suites offer more square footage, greater views and more amenities. One feels as if they are in Hawaii walking around the lush grounds. It’s not the fanciest resort in San Diego and you will notice deferred maintenance, yet its fun for all ages. There are five pools sprinkled around the grounds. All the pools have been updated and the main pool near the lobby has a sandy beach. The family lagoon pool has a hot spa, as does the quieter adult lagoon pool. There is also a meadow and waterfall pool. The tennis/basketball/croquet and ping pong area are underused, however guests seem to enjoy renting Surrey bicycles and playing on the golf putting course. There are two excellent dining options. The Barefoot Bar and Grill is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner offering glorious views of the sailboats, kayaks and paddle boarders on Mission Bay. For dinner, the elegant Baleen Restaurant was my choice for a birthday celebration. Even though the night air can be chilly, the restaurant has outdoor heaters to keep guests comfortable while sitting on the patio overlooking the lights of Mission Bay. Paradise Pointe is a successful wedding spot with at least three weddings going strong during our one night visit over Labor Day weekend. Guests wanting to spend a day at Sea World can leave their car at their designated parking spot and hop on the Sea World Water Taxi at the dock. The 15-minute cruise will take guests right to the exclusive back gate. A round trip ticket for adults is $9 and children $5. 1404 Vacation Road, San Diego (858)490-6365, www.paradisepoint.com

Reviews.Title: “Well located San Diego family hotel but a little dated for price”
Reviews.Author: PlayitaTravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a very good location. It was easy to get to SeaWorld, restaurants, etc. The registration went smoothly. All the employees are very helpful and take time with you. We received a room upgrade upon check-in. The room was a good size and had a small refrigerator. We were a family of 4 so the refrigerator comes in handy. The bathroom was large but had a musty smell and the bathrooms need updating. Overall not a modern room-just average. Room air conditioner is old and made lots of noise during the night. The wood floors in the room were extremely dirty. Our feet were black from walking on them. Even after housekeeping came, our feet got dirty. The $28 parking fee per car per day is ridiculous. But we knew about the parking beforehand so we paid! The main pool is nice. We were there during a busy weekend and there were still plenty of lounge chairs for everyone. Also waitress service and bar service at pool was very good .

Reviews.Title: “One of the best vacations we have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: Phyllis N
Reviews.Content: We had a bayside room, the water was right out our back door. We have a boat and we could moor it right by our room, it was fantastic. The service was excellent, everyone was very nice. Theres alot of ameneties. Theres Tennis, Basketball, Ping-Pong, horseshoes, minature golf I know I'm forgetting other things that they had also. They charge you an extra 15.00 dollars to use all these things, but other places charge you for each service you want to use. In the long run it was cheaper. We had a wonderful time, I would recommend Paradise Point to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Third visit, would come back again!”
Reviews.Author: iwanttogoonholiday
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family of four (two 'kids' in their twenties) for a week at the end of July. We have previously stayed here twice before and it is one of our favourite places to visit. We are always a bit wary of going back to places we've loved before, in case they've changed (for the worse) since our previous trip. However, aside from a couple of minor niggles, we had another great stay here. The grounds are absolutely beautiful and we love the resort feel. The location is very handy for all the San Diego attractions, and whilst you do need a car to get around, you can tell this from the location when booking. San Diego is also much nicer and easier to drive around than LA (for us Brits at least!) The rooms had been renovated since our last trip in 2007 and whilst the comments about the dusty floors did have some validity, overall we were very pleased with the standard of accommodation - after all, you're walking about in flip flops/sandals or barefoot, so you're bound to bring in a certain level of dust and dirt. We were given 'adjoining' rooms which basically meant that we had a bungalow to ourselves which was an ideal set up. The beds were huge - and high! Having fridges in both rooms and a microwave in one was also really handy. We loved being able to sit out on our patio and have breakfast overlooking the pond. It's a shame that they've changed the toiletries, as the old ones were lovely, although they've obviously wised up to everyone taking them home! The new ones are still really good though. We never had a problem getting sunbeds by the main pool, even if arriving in the afternoon after going out for the morning. Part of our Virgin package meant that we got free parking (always appreciated - especially when it's right outside the room), didn't have to pay the 'Passport to Paradise' fee and got $25 per room, per night resort credit - which equated to $350! It seems ironic that they are trying to introduce the mandatory 'passport' fee, but none of the staff around the resort seemed to know what to do with the slips of paper for mini golf, bike hire, etc. We were however able to enjoy two meals at the Barefoot Grill (including two free desserts for one meal) and two lunches by the pool with our resort credit and still had some leftover to treat ourselves with in the gift shop! The food at the Barefoot was delicious as usual, although we were slightly disappointed to see the menu had changed - we loved their Philly cheesesteaks and pulled pork! Nevertheless, the relaxed atmosphere and beautiful bayside location were perfect for that San Diego feel. If we are to return to San Diego again in the future, we'd definitely look to book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Wedding Venue”
Reviews.Author: P S
Reviews.Content: We recently held our daughter's wedding at Paradise Point. Both the ceremony site and reception site were beautiful. Thanks to Julie, the Catering Sales Manager, everything was perfect. We could not have asked for things to go more smoothly. Working with Julie was a pleasure. She was thorough, helpful, attentive to our requests and preferences, and went the extra mile to ensure the event was extraordinary. The reception staff was also excellent and made sure that everything was to our satisfaction. The food and wine were also excellent. I would recommend Paradise Point without reservation for a wedding or similar event. The only negative was related to the lodging. We booked three rooms the day before the wedding so that we could get ready for the rehearsal. In spite of requesting early check-in and getting to reception at 1230, we could not get our rooms. They told us they would be ready shortly but we got one room at 3:00 P.M., one at 3:30 P.M. and one sometime after 4:00 P.M. which did not allow us adequate time to get ready for the rehearsal. Fortunately, we did decide to check in the day before the wedding. If we'd had the same experience on the day of the wedding, it would have been a disaster. As it was, we were only late for the rehearsal dinner. When they say check-in is at 4:00, they man it.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Gauchoman1990
Reviews.Content: A beautiful bungalow style resort, the Paradise Point was the perfect stay for my wife and I on our anniversary. It's located on the water of Mission Bay. You feel removed from the hustle and bustle but are very closely located to all the attractions that San Diego has to offer. It would be great for families as well !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort on the beach”
Reviews.Author: joycekwong
Reviews.Content: The resort has lovely bunglalows on large resort grounds with direct access to the beach and waters. We stayed 1 night and only wished we stayed longer! The room was spacious and decor modern. Beds were comfortable. We loved the resort grounds, especially the beach and access to the waters. We also enjoyed our dinner there. Would recommend this unique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “BETTER THAN A HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: michael c
Reviews.Content: Very nice grounds with lots of trees, plants giving a nice tropical feel. Staff was very pleasant . Minutes to Sea World. Separate pools for family with kids and adult area. Boat rentals available to tour the bay. Separate beach area with night time fire pits was nice. Restaurants were good, service a little slow. Good value for money, definitely would return if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience. Be careful to ask if the "GARDEN VIEW" room is really facing the garden or the PARKING lot.”
Reviews.Author: ClaudioArriola
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience. Main complain, we booked a GARDEN VIEW (room 306) but it was actually facing the PARKING LOT. Rooms 305 and 307 had a real GARDEN VIEW terrace. It seems that one room faces the parking lot and the adjacent one the garden. Make sure you ask if the view is to the terrace or the garden. Besides that, we had bad luck twice on the restaurant where the chef made a mistake with our orders. The waiter was extremely kind and apologized for the mistake and offer free desert or a free drink. No big deal really. We stayed with our 2 1/2 years old girl and she really enjoyed our holiday. Was great.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Pointe- a little piece of paradise. We loved it & so will you!”
Reviews.Author: Angela G
Reviews.Content: Perfect place for family time! Nice rooms, great hotel staff. The entire Bell Staff- you rock!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise close by”
Reviews.Author: Krikor D
Reviews.Content: Took advantage of early booking discount, truly a great deal and very easy. Got upgraded from junior suite to 1 bdrm suite, on the beach - wow!!! Just great!! I first had some hesitations from some of the reviews, but on e I arrived the location and service live up to it's name - paradise. Even the drive gradually transitions you from the city to laid back beach city to beach town and then Paradise point - removed from everything. They have pools, tennis courts and Mission Bay. Could have used e Tennis courts, but Mission Bay is a gem. paradise point has a front seat view. The service is truly first rate. We got there early, walked in on the cleaning crew and they bent backwards to get ysnin ASAP. The cleaning staff are great, especially when there are 5 kids and party every night. Rented the bike carts and took a ride around - recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: OilerRob
Reviews.Content: Awesome place. Would go back next time I'm in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A unique location which is great for families”
Reviews.Author: Whatleytupper
Reviews.Content: -great island feel with lots of beach access and views of mission beach -lots of different pools for kids including an adult only one -good access to everything if you have a car; not so good without - rooms were clean and modern though the buildings are older so everything is not in perfect condition such as our weaker ac unit -good food at barefoot grill though a touch pricey -a very expensive foodstore and rental place so bring your own stuff -a good family vibe; safe and contained -careful with paying for upgrades as prices can get steep with little benefit; we liked the north cove because it's shielded from the wind though closer to a public, less secure beach

Reviews.Title: “Check it out for yourself!”
Reviews.Author: DLinc
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews before going to the hotel. I would have to say anyone reading these reviews should definitely check out the property for themselves. I've seen really good reviews and really bad reviews. I had a very pleasurable experience. People have different expectations and so it's hard to base your decision on what a few people say (good or bad). I did bring my own food for breakfast and lunch as I was scared the prices at the hotel would be too expensive to eat every meal there. My only real gripe is that I wish they would update their bathrooms. You can tell the property is older so keep that in mind when staying there. But overall, I really enjoyed my stay. It was really nice to wake up and walk 50ft and be at the beach out the front door and have a pond at my back door. That in itself was worth the price I paid to stay. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Good conference”
Reviews.Author: Kevin G
Reviews.Content: Conferene stay in August 2011 was very good. Excellent food, unique facility and site, great staff, all needs taken careof quickly and without hassle. Many pools and hot tubs to use. Nice facility. Good beds. Get a room with a view though, some are small and no view.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off Point Resort on Tourist Trap Island.”
Reviews.Author: tomBCN
Reviews.Content: This resort would be great if it was a low budget all-inclusive holiday destination, but instead it was outrageously expensive. For exemple: more then 100$ for 2 persons breakfast, 500$ a night for an outdated 2 person bungalow with very poor ameneties, $22 for a smores kit + $15 for the wood to make them,...

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort”
Reviews.Author: marissacocores
Reviews.Content: Great kid friendly pool. There are two great restaurants there. We enjoyed the bayside bar (more casual). Lots of fun things for the family. We went there for our anniversary without the kids, but will definitely go there again with the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort - very relaxing and as the title describes "Paradise'!”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: Fantastic resort - very relaxing and as the title describes "Paradise'! Resort had lots of amenities and staff were very friendly and courteous... glorious weather helped.. but resort very clean and feels 'tropical'.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Outing”
Reviews.Author: Indy_Bing
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Paradise Point and had a wonderful experience. The staff was very attentive to our request during the stay. We had a few meals at Barefoot and the staff was very kind. The food was AMAZING (I had the cheeseburger and fries) we all enjoyed our selection. The grounds are very well kept and we loved how close it was to the cove. Our daugther did fall and cut her knee. The Security Officer was quick to respond to the injury and did a wonderful job making her feel better. We will definitely be back in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel scratched our vehicle and refuses to pay for repair”
Reviews.Author: a069024
Reviews.Content: We parked in our assigned parking place which was near the hotel laundry facility. A sliding chain link gate was opended to access the laundry facility and it scratched the front bumper of our vehicle. We reported the incident to security and they took pictures promising someone would get back to us the following week. After no response I contacted them and was asked whether we were planning another stay with them because sometimes these things can be resolved with a resort credit. I said no because we live out of state. They asked me to provide a written estimate whcih I did. After another couple of weeks I got a call from their insurance carrier to take my statement. After another couple of weeks i get a denial letter! Funny thing is that on the day we checked out the hotel had already installed a parking block in our space to prevent this from happening to a future guest. I guess since I live out of town and was not planning to stay with them again they denied my claim.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Get-Away”
Reviews.Author: Ncll01
Reviews.Content: Many "Kid-friendly" hotels feel like you are trapped inside Candyland; with cartoony characters, frenetic colors, and placating child-like activities/offerings. However, Paradise Point offers a family vacation experience; with activities and tastes for all ages! For example: > Dive-in movie night: The kids splish, splash and see a favorite showing, while most parents, lounge poolside over catch-ups & cocktails. > Bonfires on the Beach: S'more's by the sea allows for nightly quality "family time" to connect over silly stories or games, in an unplugged beach setting. > Bungalows-All very comfortable with modern decor, updated amenities, and a "front porch" sitting area, on/or near the bay. > Food-Most resorts dumb-down their menu's to offer kid-fare; however, the meal options at Paradise Point, are more mature to satisfy adults, but still hold the interest of children. They do offer some of the typical, cheeseburger/chicken nugget staples, but also include more healthful fish, fruit and pasta options. **And, the outdoor restaurant on the bay is surrounded by streams of Koi and other sea life; which allows adults time to enjoy their own meals with a relaxing, almost tropical water view, while the kids are captivated in their surroundings. My nephews complained when we had to leave lunch, because they were having so much fun watching crabs crawl in the rocks and the sea birds steal fries from nearby vacant tables. > Grounds-The resort is not a Four Season's/Ritz caliber, however, there has been thought put into making the grounds feel like a get-away location. There are exotic florals/landscapes, "wild" marine life (ducks/birds/fish, etc.) roaming the property, and a quiet, serene feel throughout. > Activities-There are numerous on-site options such as boat/jet ski/paddlebike rentals, games, 3 pools (including an adult-only option) and beach sports. As well, SEA WORLD is a mile away, which is a fun alternative-especially, with the summer promotion of 2-day passes, which allows a more leisurely experience of the park. **There are a series of lagoons/lakes connected through the resort which are stocked with ducks and fish; armed with a box of crackers and left-over breakfast toast, my nephews and I spent 2 hours hand-feeding the critters and taking pictures. The ducks even started following us through the resort and the boys were thrilled with their new-found friends! *****Note: feed the ducks open handed, or you might get a slight nip. I have stayed at several kiddy hotels and always leave with either a headache, toothache, or purse-ache from all of the saccharine, screaming & spending! And, while Paradise Point is NOT cheap, there are mid-week less expensive and/or package options available. (If you sign up for their e-mail list, they send discount offers.) However, for me, I prefer to ENJOY family vacations, so paying a bit more for a little sanity and satisfaction, is worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “website misleading”
Reviews.Author: Jayne M
Reviews.Content: A brilliant website that really doesn't give a true picture. We left after one of our six booked nights. The ocean is more of an estuary and didn't make you want to jump in, neither for that matter did the swimming pools which were all very small. The whole feel is more tired holiday camp rather than paradise. There were a couple of positives, the staff were lovely and dinner in the barefoot restaurant was very nice. Much cheaper and nicer alternatives available in San Diego. Jayne UK

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: Digimom
Reviews.Content: Very private but centrally located. The rooms have a beach town feel and the bathrooms are a litle date but very clean. The home run is the setting and the privacy. It's a hideaway with very nice amenities

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware”
Reviews.Author: Tracey R
Reviews.Content: Out of the 9 hotels we stayed in during our holiday to California, this was by far the most disappointing. First impressions were not great. Our "garden" bungalow, overlooked a car park albeit an expensive one as we were all paying $28 a night on top of the room rate. It is not a bungalow, but a similar room to every other hotel we stayed in. It has no microwave, four paper cups, a coffee machine, a fridge so small you can barely get milk in it and two glasses - not exactly luxury. You pay $15 for "extras", which includes calls and some activities but not pitch and put golf, which most kids want to do, which is an extra $8 per child - more for adults. The pool is adequate but stark and concrete looking and the beach was awash with litter, discarded towels and debris. It has the look and feel of a 1980's resort which is living on its history rather than its current state. The fires around the complex are fine but subject to quarrels as families try and stake their pitch early. I am not sure how it gets five stars from any review and makes me wonder how valid they are. All in all, save your money, find somewhere cheaper but with mor integrity.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoy being there !”
Reviews.Author: Elya87
Reviews.Content: . It was so good in hotel ,(hotel has many interesting things ) that we did not go out from hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort”
Reviews.Author: CaptainHefe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the family for a weekend, can't wait to come back. The resort is in the perfect location and has its own beach access. There is plenty to do at the hotel alone with boat rentals, pools, and a full 18 hole putting golf course. The Barefoot bar has delicious food literally right on the bay. The last thing I'm going to say is that the bed is the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. I'm coming back just for that.

Reviews.Title: “We fell in a Love with Paradise Point and I look forward to go back for next August .”
Reviews.Author: Sevki15
Reviews.Content: This is the best island Resort in San Diago, La Jolla . We just fell in a Love with Paradise Point resort and especially our private unit plus services. It is a cute and unique place . I would not want to say anything wrong with Paradise Point and stay in this place with out saying Noo. It gives you privacy , calm environment and no toxicity . We still talk about Paradise Point and definitely will go back . Thanks loads to GINO KESER who works at the reception as a Reception Manager. He was very professional and welcoming us every second with his help also guide. Many Thanks and look forward to go back next year to the Paradise Point. Sevki

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Get the bayfront room in the cove to avoid wind and to enjoy the beach.”
Reviews.Author: Don C
Reviews.Content: Remember that May and June means morning and possible all day fog. Late summer, Fall and Winter are best weather months.

Reviews.Title: “Truly is a tropical paradise--beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: RoxanneRustand
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort. Excellent food--loved the blueberry bread pudding and crab cakes at the Barefoot Grill! Excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “If you have family, stay here”
Reviews.Author: adigerol
Reviews.Content: This hotel/resort is self contained. It has everything you need from an 18 hole putting course, multiple pools, restaurants and a store. The rooms are smaller if you go for more of a value option but well remodeled and awesome. You can also order pizza to your room from a multitude of pizza shops in SD. Well worth the price of admission. Kids had an absolute blast and we stayed mostly at the property.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Reunion”
Reviews.Author: mommatimbo8
Reviews.Content: I just returned from spending a week at Paradise Point Resort & Spa with family and absolutely hated to leave there! Some of my family joined me in "Paradise" and we all had the best time ever! Every employee seems to be ready and willing to help their guests have the best vacation you ever had. The employees are so friendly from the wonderful bellman, Ben, to the bartender at the pool, Bryce, to the great people at the dock where you can rent boats, boards....whatever you like. Matt Quick, the Rooms Manager and Priscilla Garcia, the Front Office Manager, helped make our stay perfect by clustering our family in rooms all together. I stayed in one of their wonderful rooms on the bay and my family was right behind me! We all had the best time and now want to do this every summer. Even my nephew and his wife and their daughter and son-in-law came over from Arizona and stayed at Paradise Point and loved it. Paradise Point is perfect for the old to the very young. Beautiful surroundings, many pools and spas to choose from. We started coming to Paradise Point in the late 1970's when my children were little and just wouldn't stay anywhere else. Now my grandchildren are coming and having the best time ever. If you want to have a wonderful vacation and be treated royally, come visit Paradise Point. Great place for a family reunion! I even got on a jet ski and absolutely loved it! Visit Paradise Point the next time you're looking for a vacation spot! You won't be sorry. I highly recommend Paradise Point Resort & Spa!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: AZSMF
Reviews.Content: I recommend the rooms on the beach, a bit dated but nice! Walk out of the room onto your porch with lush foliage and old trees surrounding you. Pour a glass of wine and enjoy the view across the beach to the water. Excellent for a relaxing weekend. Dine at Baleen where we found the cuisine to be just what the Dr. ordered. The barefoot bar and grill was also nice and right on the beach, cool

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: waggers999
Reviews.Content: The weather wasn't great for us but we had a wonderful stay. The pools were lovely and the food at barefoot was delicious although expensive. Good location but you need a car; highly recommend green flash to eat up the road at pacific beach. Would highly recommend pacific point, lovely!

Reviews.Title: “very dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: zimmermannm
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a lagoon view bengalow . isolation is very poor as there were 2 connecting doors in our bengalow. we couldn't sleep during the first night as neighbours had a party until 3:00. the third night the neighbours watched TV all night. every noise in bathrooms are also audible.. Cars are parked in front of everybengalows.. which means that a walk across the resort is equivalent to a walk in a parking lot! overall dissapointing! I don't recommend

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place lots of lovely scenery”
Reviews.Author: rayrockytwo
Reviews.Content: we are from england and we like to walk took 40 mins to mission bay/boulevard didnt want to hire a car but you prob need one for groceries although there is no kitchenette and the shop hardly stocks anything.. we had a bay view room after asking nicely at reception and paying a very nominal subsidy it was shear pleasure opening doors in the morning and seeing the bay and the birds/ducks and the smell of the sea. we believe a holiday is what you make it and we cetainly chilled, walked and even hired bikes , 15 mins to belmont park/ mission beach . the barefoot bar/grill is certainly good value for breakfast/ dinner and the adult pool was truly great no kids !! you can get taxis freely available and they will do a deal to downtown/ gaslamp area all the staff from the bellboys to the housekeepers were friendly and knew their work . overall i think the people who complain are serial complainers and look for faults in everything thank you paradise point it certainly was ....

Reviews.Title: “I´d definitely stay in this hotel again, very pleasant gardens and atmosphere, comfy rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Dulce1965
Reviews.Content: I´d definitely stay in this hotel again, very pleasant gardens and atmosphere, comfy rooms.

Reviews.Title: “So little time for this amazing resort!”
Reviews.Author: with5
Reviews.Content: We booked this amazing resort through Priceline for a one night stay in San Diego. The only downside we experienced was not being able to spend much time at Paradise Point. Check in was fast and the employees were extremely nice. We were not expecting much from our room based on other reviews of Priceline customers. We were blown away when we finally found our room. It was very clean and plenty big enough for the 4 of us. Not to mention we were just steps away from the beach and a fire pit! Unfortunately we had just enought time to unload our stuff from the car and head to the trolley station to catch a Giant's game. The game ended up going 14 innings, so we didn't return to the hotel until 12:30am. It was wonderful to be able to grab our chairs and a drink and walk a few steps to the beach to relax before bed. My husband and our girls had a little over an hour in the morning to explore the resort and loved everything they saw. Would love to go back and enjoy the bar, bike rentals, mini golf, beach, etc. at some point. We highly recommend Paradise Point for an amazing stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy service and wait 4 hours for room”
Reviews.Author: Frequ
Reviews.Content: 4pm checkin is rule . We arrive early-noon. Told they will do their best to get room ready earlier. Come back at 3pm- we are told that the room next to ours is almost done - ours will be next. Why would they clean rooms down a line when guests have been waiting for 3+hours? The room next to us may not check in until much later?!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place, and will return many many more times.”
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: You do get what you pay for, and yes this place can get expensive during peak times. However, this place truly showed its worth to us. We came here for the first time in May for our daughters 2nd birthday. We wanted a beach vacation and I found this place while searching hotels near Sea World. I instantly thought how it reminded me of our trip to Hawaii, and how perfect this place would be, being right on the bay and with a room feet away from the sand. It did not disappoint for a second. The pools were great, the bike rentals on sight, the restaurants, quick room service, other activities, ducks and fish all around the property, but most importantly the fire pit on the beach 10 feet from our door and water another 10 feet, this place provided such a wonderful time for us and our 2 year old, that it quickly became one of the best places we have ever visited, and we travel extensively. As a side note: we wanted to come back to San Diego the next month for a quick getaway, and this place was a little too pricey being that it was June. I found the Hilton, across the street almost, and thought it was similar in features. We had such a terrible experience there that we checked out the next morning and I called Paradise Point. We were upgraded all the way to the Presidential Suite, and they saved our vacation which had so been nearly ruined by the Hilton. I can not say enough about this place, and with all that they have done for us, and how we were treated both times, this is my FAVORITE place to stay in San Diego, and should not be missed. We are going back in September. My only mistake in June was not going with Paradise Point to begin with. Don't second guess this place. Find a good rate, go with AAA or Destination Delivers, or call them, but choose this place for a real great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: rita11
Reviews.Content: First, the grounds were beautiful!!! We picked this spot because of the presentation on the internet. We thought we were getting a quiet resort spa sort of place, but it was not. It was very busy, lots of commotion and we had several rowdy families in the rooms behind us!! Several things in our room needed attention: the tub didn't drain, the air conditioner was not working, the patio table was broke, the sink was cracked , the hair dryer wouldn't work and the last morning the toilet wouldn't flush. When we called for service everything was taken care of right away, however, we felt that for the price we shouldn't have had to deal with all those issues. The resort was isolated and because we did not have a car it was an issue to get anywhere. Thus, we were inclined to eat there more and buy items from the gift shop, which was pricey. The floor in our room was very dirty, as someone else has stated. The first night I walked around the room in my socks and the bottoms were black after 2 hours of walking on the room floor. It was quite a walk to get anywhere on the resort, so if you have trouble walking this would not be the place for you. Overall, it was a very pretty place and generally the staff was exceptional. The food was good and the beach was quiet and clean. Downside - pricey, isolated and not quiet. Shuttles would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: beachmum99
Reviews.Content: The person that described this as "an 80 year old former super model with a facelift" is accurate. The lush grounds are beautiful, reminded me of Hawaii. The view from our room was incredible. We had a bayview junior suite and had a huge wall of windows. This is a big difference from the standard bayview room. The room updates were nice, but could have been better. New floors were put in as well as sink, but rather than replacing old trim work, it was just painted. Air conditioning needs major update. It is a wall/window type unit and next to the pull out sofa where the kids slept. We had to build a "pillow wall" to divert the cool airflow around the sleeping kids or die in the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Very Underwhelming and will not be back”
Reviews.Author: beatlesclark
Reviews.Content: This is a family holiday, 2 adults and 2 kids. Booked over the internet.......and from the pictures displayed thought it would be fabulous.......NOT SO!!!! The pools and facilities were nice, but our room was not. We were assigned one overlooking the carpark and my first thought was " caravan park". The rooms although roomy were dated and as we adjoined another unit could hear EVERYTHING going on. From showers, and crying kids to flushing the toilet. We travel alot and in comparison to other accommodation we have stayed in, this place is extremely overpriced. We understood there was a parking tarriff ($25 per day) , but were also charged a non negotiable $15 levy per day for use of internet and basic facilities. I am convinced there are better deals and resorts around San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, but they nickel and dime you!”
Reviews.Author: Eastcoast2
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and nice. Resort is beautiful being right on Mission Bay with many water features and much space to walk or ride bikes. Very relaxing atmosphere. Resort rooms had been remodeled but done in a "quick" remodel way with many older features still showing. I am really picky and still found it nice and comfortable. Staff is friendly and helpful. Upon check in we were informed of a 25 dollar a night fee for parking which is ridiculous seeing each unit has its own space (it's not like there was a parking garage or lack of space for parking) but we were told this was because there were no resort fees. However, they charged 10 dollars per person per day to use their gym, they charged to rent bikes and to play golf on their miniature course. With no resort fees, we thought these activities would be free to guests. One heated pool (there are more on property but not heated or as large) fills up quickly each day. The resort is located in a convenient location, out of the city but only 10 minutes away and was easy to get to any of the local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love!”
Reviews.Author: karenb9236
Reviews.Content: The resort was great, but the SPA was outstanding... great space, great massages, fabulous all the way around. A+++++

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Amy2366
Reviews.Content: Great resort....the staff was super friendly and helpful. Room was beautiful...very family friendly. We have 2 kids (ages 3 and 4)...they loved it and had a great time. Barefoot Grill was very good and reasonable priced.

Reviews.Title: “Already Have Return Reservations; Best Spa Treatment Ever”
Reviews.Author: KRuthless
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, family-friendly resort (although this trip I went with some women friends). I definitely felt like I was in Hawaii, without the plane trip. The main pool by the spa is designed to be like a beach and I can't wait to bring my 5 year twins here -- I made reservations to return in three weeks. The suite we had was very nice; there is a little "fraying" around the edges (like in the bathroom), but it was still lovely and very large. We also had spa treatments, which were fabulous. I received a treatment from Lea, who is among the best "therapists" I have ever had. She literally anticipated my needs. The rest of the spa staff were friendly, helpful and informative. The two steam rooms were terrific; when/if the spa is remodeled, I vote for an in-spa jacuzzi. One small negative about resort: very steep daily parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “We are already planning our next stay”
Reviews.Author: llevybuch
Reviews.Content: My three best girlfriends and I came to Paradise Point last weekend to celebrate one of our birthdays. None of us had been to the property before and we were all very impressed by the beauty of the property and how it truly takes you away into a feeling of being surrounded in paradise. We had a wonderful room and found all of the staff to be helpful and accommodating. The second day we went to The Spa and each treated ourselves to a 50-minute spa treatment - and that was the highlight for all of us. From the minute we walked into the spa and were greeted by the warm and welcoming staff, to the time I literally feel asleep in the peaceful relaxation room before my treatment, to my appointment with Annette for a skin wrap, it was a truly lovely experience. Each of us tried a different spa treatment and had different therapists, and each of us came out with the same satisfied feeling of having been given a gift. We will absolutely come back, and in fact, we started planning our next visit (this time with our kids) before we left that afternoon. We are going back in a few weeks from now.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point is the absolute best!!”
Reviews.Author: caroline4444
Reviews.Content: My family and I always look forward to our stays at Paradise Point Resort and Spa. We have held our family reunions at the resort for the past four years, at times my family and I have stayed twice a year. We love to stay at Paradise Point because it offers us Paradise. The tropical plants around the resort are gorgeous. Paradise Point offers so much that there is no need to travel elsewhere; such as biking, sailing, jet skiing, motor boating and our absolute favorite kayaking. The resort has five pools, our favorite pool is the main pool beause it offers movie night, what matter than swiiming under the stars while watching a family friendly movie. My family and I also love the breathtaking ocean views, the whole resort is surrounded by the beach. At night we all go down to the fire pitts and make smores, and just have fun. The staff is friendly, kind and helpful. Paradise Point really offers the guest PARADISE!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect, the good, and the bad”
Reviews.Author: birdand2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Paradise Point on our honeymoon. For the most part it was fantastic! I'll start with the Perfect. First and formost the grounds, pools, daily maid service, and the friendly employees were perfect! They waived the 25/per day parking fee for us! These things were more than we expected! The Good: Our room was good, nothing special. The bathroom was a little out-dated. Very spacious and private though. The Bad: The overall cost of things on the resort was a little much for us. We were hesitant to do anything because of not knowing what it cost. It is a luxoirus resort so the cost should be somewhat expected but any food/acticities were very expensive. Also, they charge a 15/per day activity fee, which does not cover all the activities. Bascialy we paid 15/per day for internet because we didnt use much else. Overall, it was a great trip. We spent more than we expected, but had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Veious
Reviews.Content: This was an unexpected and pleasant surprise. All of the rooms were bungalows which provided for a much quiter and relaxing stay. The staff was first rate, and were eager to assist. I will definitely return with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Jamkal
Reviews.Content: We are beyond impressed with this resort. From the lush location and all of the amenities (Great Pools, Mini Golf, Beach Front rooms) this place has alot to offer. We are so happy and can't wait to come back again. This has been the location for our family vacation for the past 4 years and we will always come back! Thanks for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: runningmom_11
Reviews.Content: We scored a great deal on Priceline but after reading other reviews, we were concerned as they were not stellar. But we found the grounds gorgeous, the bungalow right by the water in prime location, and the service excellent! We shared with them it was our anniversary and they comped one day's parking, upgraded our room, and even brought us a bottle of wine on the house! The bungalow did need some repairs, but still a very nice room. We enjoyed our stay and only wished we were staying more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Island Style Resort in the City”
Reviews.Author: kmcmurray
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed 3 nights and 4 days at this property. I was somewhat curious about the location since it was merely 10-15 minutes from the airport and didn't seem anything like the "paradise" promised on the website. We turned into the resort after traveling through a less than desirable looking part of the city and the scenery completely changed. The lush grounds opened up and we ended up in the middle of a different atmosphere. We were immediately greeted by one of the staff (Mark) and it was perhaps one of the best client service experiences I've ever had. From beginning to end he helped us unload, drove our car to our bungelow, made sure we were always taken care of. Big plus in my book. We had a series of bungalows that connected and sat alongside the "beach". Don't expect this to be the type of beach you see in other parts of San Diego, it doesn't appear to be made for swimming like beaches along the coast. It is located on the bay and the waters are calm and good for wading. Certainly an awesome view from our rooms though! Every morning we made sure to close our doors or the inhabitants would make their way into our rooms...so please, if you don't want ducks, geese and other wildlife in your room, keep your doors shut tight! We took advantage of the delivered s'mores kits and beach fire pits. Word of advice, these pits are first come first serve and most people tend to set up in the early AM and leave their things there all day which limits how many can enjoy the pits. We found that sharing with other families or couples would ensure at least some time at the pits. Rooms are spacious and decorated beautifully and all of our rooms had kitchenettes and living rooms. You can tell there have been major renovations and/or updates because the paint on the walls seems a little worn and repainted with several coats. Due to the style of the bungalow rooms, there doesn't appear to be central AC, units are featured in each room and it got a little stuffy during the day but nothing that couldn't be easily remedied. The grounds are amazing and makes for good walking after dinner or activities. The onsite dining options are varied. We ate at the casual restaurant Baleen's; service was so so, food was ok, drinks were good! During our stay, Prom was being held in one of the Ballrooms and they were having a blast! It was such fun to see all of the students dressed up and enjoying themselves. Overall, defintely a different type of hotel in an unexpected part of town. A real pleasure!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun 4th of July stay at Paraddise Point Resort in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: lori8brink
Reviews.Content: We experienced our first stay at Paradise Point 4th of July weekend... The room was beautiful comfortable and with all the ammenities of home.. There was so much to do, bike rentals,pools, spa,golfing,corquette and so much more and we did them all.. Not to mention the great restauarants great menus and unbelievable staff.. Security director was "Super Great" he completed our stay as did the great staff Ludy at Island Market along with Mary & Alyssa at front desk and the gentleman with our bike rental... Thank you all so very much for a stay to remember.. I will be ther againvery soon and recommended you to friends that will be staying there in August... Again thank you all so very much.. Lori Jim and family...

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Dr Den
Reviews.Content: The website looks tremendous But We booked a family room, which turned out to be a double room, and a rickty old sofa which opened up. Room was small, smelt of stale stuff, would never recommend . Complained, and was offered the 'only' free room, which was a great suite, kitchen, lounge, room for kids, but cost me another £2000 for the two week stay upgrade. Cleaning staff were great, laundry which was good, but would not recommend to worse enemy Sorry guys. The promised that a refurb was due soon, but was an expensive holiday to begin with, turned out to be an even more expensive holiday. Still, live and learn, don't believe all you read on the net, other than trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Super holiday but watch for the hidden extra charges”
Reviews.Author: magsB
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel and checked in easily. The room was a great size and the bathroom spotless. The bungalow type accommodation is very pleasant. We had some patio furniture to sit and enjoy the sunshine. We ate at the barefoot grill. The food was quite nice but the service leaves much to be desired. I don't normally complain about service but my husband and I both found that the waitresses were more interested in flirting with the waiters than seeing to their guests. We ate here at different times of the day and found the behaviour exactly the same, perhaps they need a supervisor in charge. It is not cheap but not too extortionate. Lots of restaurants in San Diego so wouldn't really recommend it. We didn't try the Baleen restaurant because it was always empty and we like a bit of ambiance. The room was lovely and quite spacious. The bed was enormous and very comfortable. The bathroom was spotless and plenty of towels. We had to ask for extra coathangers as there was not enough. No problem, we had them within minutes. There are 3 pools, we didn't really use them but what we saw was really nice. They were clean. The grounds are very nice indeed and well kept. It is very relaxing. We walked everywhere and used public transport. We had no car and found this not to be a problem as the public transport is excellent. One word of caution, watch out for hidden charges. We were charged for the passport to paradise, even though we did not use any of the facilities. When I enquired about this, it was removed from the bill. However I was warned by the young lady at reception that if I return for another visit I would have to pay th $15 charge each day. Not really a recommendation to return. I cashed travellers cheques each day and heard people complain about hidden charges every day. We did not have a car but they charge for that as well. Still it is a beautiful place which is well kept and we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved it. We will definetly go back!”
Reviews.Author: ArmAno074
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful scenery. I loved the resort style of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: chris6333
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Paradise Point annually for the last 7 years. It is a beautiful "island" getaway in the middle of everything in San Diego...Shamu is literally across the street. My family enjoys it here for the following; room, location on beach, activities, pool, and friendly staff. It is great for young families. The only negative is the price keeps rising every year. Tip: become a member and look for deals.

Reviews.Title: “great, would go again”
Reviews.Author: timothylwhitelaw
Reviews.Content: and the best part is, if there is a problem they will go the extra effort to make it right. This was a family vacation, the first of this length ever, nine days total. We stayed the first five nights here and the resort is very nice, but do stay on the water, the difference is beyond comparision. We spent the first night after driving all day in a "garden room", too crowded for the four of us (two teenagers). They had sold out of the two queens we had already paid for, so we were stuck for that night with a rollaway. The next morning they made us a great upgrade for a discount due to the trouble. The beach front bungalow is awesome, you step out your front door on to the sand. On our last day some rude inconsiderate selfish jerks that were not even at the resort (its all public beach) camped their fat pontoon boat and fat arses right in front of our unit. We complained. Hotel could not do anything, but did make it very worth our while in their response comping our last night and the head of security, Phil, personally delivered an armload of beach goodies to us as we spent the previous day making a sandcastle that the family of 12 was now parked around. He came over again as we were leaving the next day to see how the day had gone and was truly great. We would highly recommend this place and will return. We left all of the beach goodies for other families that were just beginning their vacation as we were checking out. Oh, do plan on having bonfires and smores if that's your thing. The front of the cabanas are totally set up with fire pits. The casual restaurant, the only one we went to, was very good. The gift shop had just about everything from aspirin to boutique clothing (as in, from simple, inexpensive necessities to nice expensive things). We would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: jimmyathwal
Reviews.Content: My wife, 18 mth old daughter and I stayed at Paradise Point for 4 days and definitely enjoyed our stay. It was definitely a nice break to stay at something different than your standard hotel. The property is beautifully landscaped. When we checked into our room we did notice some rust on the bath tub which was something we did not want when bathing a baby. The front desk staff were very understanding and upgraded us into a massive executive suite. Once we settled in, we really enjoyed sitting by the pool side. There could have been another server or two around the pool area for drinks and food. We mainly ate all three meals a day at the Barefoot Grill and found the selection and quality to be pretty good. After drinks at the pool, eating at the resort was a very good option! I found the beds to be a little too soft for my liking...back was sore each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: Melody026
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved staying here. We had a room overlooking the pond. Loved sitting on the patio while the kids fed the ducks. Bike rentals, surfing lessons, mini golf, sailing....Will never stay anywhere else while in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time - kids loved the beach.”
Reviews.Author: 7373Houston
Reviews.Content: The beach was great. My kids had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point is just that, instead going to a far away place”
Reviews.Author: jf_kent
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this beatiful resort located in a major city instead of in the Carribean some where. Elizabeth at the Island Market, on site gift shop, was wonderful. She went over and above the call of duty to make sure our trip was nothing short of fantastic. She put together a list of things to do, places to eat and various happy hours. She scheduled activities and continually called to tell what was planned next and to make sure we were having fun doing each and every thing. She should be doing this as a living and not stuck in gift shop letting her talent, expertise and enthusiasm go to waste. Elizabeth is major asset of Paradise Point.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay at! stayed in a villa. very roomy/”
Reviews.Author: craftyNj
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference here in july 2011. also had time to enjoy the resort. we stayed in a villa with bedroom, living are (which was quite large) and bathroom/kitchen. very nice and clean. the grounds are beautiful! the bed was soooo comfortable. went to the main pool which had a hot tub and a bar if you needed a drink:) Excellent. beautiful pool:) Had a drink at the barefoot bar and grille. it was good. friends of ours ate there and said the food was delicious. this resort is in a great location. across the bay from seaworld so you can view the fireworks from the resort. some rooms are on the beach and you can have bonfires on the beach. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Cassbeats
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked a room for my birthday. We are San Diego locals and although only a few miles away at Paradise Point we felt as if we were far away in the tropics. Gino at the front desk was super helpful and made our arrival as smooth and welcoming as can be. Hospitality and service was above and beyond! Highly recommend this place thank you Gino!

Reviews.Title: “Our 5th Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: PeeweeontheRoad
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for families. We had 4 rooms next to each other. The grandkids all had a blast. Swimming, pool time, just lots of fun. However, it's very expensive! When you're spending over $2,000 per day (for all four rooms), and that they call themselves a "resort", it seems that they are really missing some resort items. For example....no bathrobes, no slippers, no turndown service in the evening, poor (even bad) housekeeping, no lotions, shower cap, soaps, and other bath amenities. Housekeeping is very disorganized. Watched supervisors and all they did was reassign staff to rooms that were screaming the loudest for service. They should have spent their time checking on the quality of the work - which is spotty and not consistent. One day, they even forgot to leave clean towels. Disappointing, to say the least! Will we come again? Probably. But, the management needs to focus on improving so that more value is seen for the huge cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good property letdown by underwhelming service and overwhelming cost”
Reviews.Author: Traveller32Sydney
Reviews.Content: We were one of three families meeting at Paradise Point. The grounds are quite nice, well laid out, good pools. All three families had the same experience - very poor in-room service. For instance, our 1 bedroom came with a "kitchenette", which had nothing additional of use to the normal suite - there was no cutlery, no dishes, no glasses or mugs. We had to request these to be provided, which took several calls. Calls for any in-room service were consistently responded to in a friendly fashion, but there was often minimal follow through (requesting something that arrived 7 hours later). The resort was quite expensive for the value delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Magnificent - Hawaii in California - All You Could Wish For!”
Reviews.Author: enelraonaps
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice at Paradise Point this year and the resort is magnificent. It is like Hawaii when you go into the complex - gorgeous and lush! There are 7 pools - all fabulous - adults only pool, and poolside dining at the main pool. All the rooms are beautiful and within easy access to a pool. The bayside bungalows are gorgeous with awesome views from the private terraces right on Mission Beach. Restaurants are terrific whether casual or fine dining with outstand menus and service. The resort offers every amenity you could want from biking on a 4 person bike, basketball, miniature golf, and other activities to all water sports. They also offer pickups at rooms to transport guests to different areas in the resort. Ferry over to Seaworld and San Diego Trolley Tour Bus Stop right on premesis. Note: Catch the Tour Bus at 8:30 at the Gift Shop for a great day of sightseeing. Don't miss Balboa Park (San Diego Zoo) and Old Town, Del Coronado Beach, and some tours of ships along the bay in the city. Also, public buses stop right outside the entrance to take you many places if you don't have a car such as Pacific Beach. The staff are absolutely wonderful, and made every effort to get us everything we requested. Gino was exceptional and made our anniversary a memorable occasion and one we will always remember. We have travelled to San Diego twice a year for the past 11 years to visit our son, and Paradise Point is THE BEST resort in San Diego! We have stayed at various beach and city hotels and none compare to Paradise Point. We tell everyone going to the San Diego area about it and absolutely love it! You will too!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Paradise, Truly Relaxing, Truly the Destination Vacation must!!!”
Reviews.Author: ittybittyboo
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor and book this resort. It's absolute Paradise. The bay is gorgeous, staff is #1, plenty to do on "Paradise Island" or just relax on the beach. Must have the bonfire with smores kit after dark. Room service is fast and delicious one of best hamburgers.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Indeed”
Reviews.Author: photoiq
Reviews.Content: I wavered slightly after finding a handful of lukewarm reviews on Tripadvisor for Paradise Point. I’m glad I’m a glass half full kind of guy and went with the many 5 star reviews, booking 2 rooms for 6 nights in July. Our stay here was faultless. Lush planting, covered gazebos, fire-pits on the beach, beautiful lagoons and swimming pools, bike hire and all 5 mins from Seaworld (by water taxi from the hotel restaurant!) We booked base rooms (half price offer on Expedia) and they were great – overlooking the main pool (pictured) . If you are going for a special occasion book a cottage on the beach front – unforgettable I’d say. Only negatives – 25 dollars a day parking, no booking system for beach fire-pits and fairly limited dining options for a resort this size. These are the kind of niggles you encounter everywhere so I just sucked it up and had a relaxing time in San Diego. My wife had a spa treatment which was excellent, food in the Barefoot Grill was excellent and atmospheric under fairy lights by the beach, I used the fitness center every morning (busy) and the main pool always had free sunbeds and clean towels. None of us wanted to leave.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TIME, WONDERFUL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: SbSbi
Reviews.Content: Just completed a deltightful stay at PPR with family and friends. We dropped several teenage girls on the resort and let them have some rare autonomy. We felt perfectly comfortable allowing them to enjoy the various pools and many activities. Ortake the water taxia to the private back entrance at Sea World. The highlight of each day was the sunset fire pit and smores combo. The kids loved it. By day's end they were happily exhausted. It was even possible for mom and dad to enjoy some rare quiet time together. It is also worth noting that the staff at this busy resort really trys to go the extra mile. We visit many such vacation spots in a given year, and we can honestly say that PPR has some of the best, most caring folks on their team that we have experienced.. We'll be back again next year! RC Duncan

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Chaseme303
Reviews.Content: I was quite nervous staying at Paradise Point after reading all the mixed reviews here at Tripadvisor but I had a few real life recommendations for this place and decided to give it a try...so happy we did! The front desk staff (Alexa? Alexis?) was awesome, our room was clean and housekeeping did a great job the whole 5 days we were there. We broke a bottle and called for some help, left for breakfast and it was taken care by the time we got back :) I loved the bungalow style rooms, it was much quieter than a standard hotel, I'm a horribly light sleeper but slept well the whole trip, no ice machines, slamming doors or kids running down hallways all night. The grounds are BEAUTIFUL! Loved having the beach right outside my door, I could have never left the resort and had a great vacation. We kayaked the bay, rented a speedboat, smores at the firepits and swam in almost every pool onsite. Yes, it's not cheap....but nothing in the Mission Bay area is! The parking fee stinks, but it's the same price charged at all the hotels in the area. The $15 a night resort fee should just be included in the room price, but again these fees are the norm in that area :/ We ate one meal at the The Barefoot, the food was okay, the service was slow, I was enjoying my beer and the scenery so much I didn't care. In comparison I Pricelined the Hilton Resort and Spa for one night during my trip, it is a nice hotel, exactly what I expected from the Hilton, but I enjoyed Paradise Point a lot more!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: jamhut
Reviews.Content: Went for a one week getaway to San Diego with husband and 8 year old daughter. The resort was nice, pools were nice, rooms were average, but clean. We did find everything very overpriced I mean everything ( 5 dollars for morning coffee) The cleaning staff would show up everyday at 5 or 5:30 to clean our room just as we were returning to the rooms for showers before supper. There was a 15 dollars per person fee which we did no about before we arrived; however, this fee we used so we could have free ping pong and tennis something I have never seen charged at any other resort! Would not stay here again as you do get what you pay for and we didnt get it!

Reviews.Title: “"Over-priced ~ Underwhelmed"”
Reviews.Author: lalucyboom
Reviews.Content: The property is tired and overpriced. There are several other high end resorts close by with exceptional features at half the price. The property location is very nice for Sea World, but not worth the premium. The big pool and spa were cold. The Barefoot restaurant food was very average, but expensive. Breakfast was the best value. Our room was spacious, but house cleaning was sporadic, late, and not thorough. The landscaping is very nice, and provides some space between neighbors. The noise between rooms was an issue, as we were able to hear our neighbors shower, and snore at night. All in all, a big dispappointment for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty grounds, friendly staff, great spa”
Reviews.Author: spalovingirl
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely stay at Paradise Point this month. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, and the ponds, gardens and walkways well maintained and great to walk- early in the am especially. It is very family friendly- I do not have a family, and so sometimes do not have patience for this- but the presence of an adut only pool area and morning or evening strolls around the resort kept me relaxed and enjoying "adult time" If I did have children, I would take them here in a HEARTBEAT. Lots for kids to explore and safe places to run around and play The spa is cozy and charming, one of the best parts of the hotel. Well trained therapists and a fantastic spa menu. Try the lime body scrub or bamboo massage- you'll love it! I enjoyed a satisfying sandwich- BLT with avocado-(yum)- upon my late check-in and dined at Baleen the next night. The sea bass dish was to die for, and the service was great, friendly but not intrusive. I was traveling alone, so I enjoyed the water view and atmosphere while dining there, sometimes it can feel a bit awkward when dining alone as I was, but not here. The room was comfortable and clean- nothing fancy but everything was in great condition and it resulted in good nite's sleep. There were guests in the bungalow next to me, but I never heard a peep. I have paid less for more lux rooms, it's true, but the location and grounds are the best in the area, and worth the extra few dollars. I stay at fine resorts all of the time, and did not think the prices for parking, facilities, etc to be more than other resorts of this caliber, as some other reviewers reported. I am looking forward to returning as soon as I can!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Pt. Is PARADISE!”
Reviews.Author: keepItReal04
Reviews.Content: More than excellent. Best Cust. Svcs. in a long time. Every detail is thought of. We've stayed in many hotels/resorts in San Diego & I'm a native of S. CA, but Austinite now! I highly recommend Paradise Point Resort & Spa. (we didn't use child care or Spa, so I can't rate those), but food, pools & resort activities were so fun for our family of four. We stayed five nights & even saw a few wedding parties! They try to accomodate it all!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back if they paid us...”
Reviews.Author: L8BarLVR
Reviews.Content: So incredibly disappointing from almost the first moment we arrived. The property itself has a wonderful curb appeal, and it does look like a tropical paradise, as long as you don't look at the area around the bungalows too closely. (the rooms are set in bungalows as opposed to a central hotel tower or building) This was our one family vacation for the year (we have 3 children - a 14 year old, a 12 year old and a 3 year old), and we arrived on July 3rd for a 5 night stay only to find that they wouldn't be able to check us in - the computers were down. They weren't keeping a list of who had arrived and was waiting to be checked in, so it was up to us to sit there in the lobby and wait until they were ready to check in again. They told my husband that we could go to the pool - as if that would somehow make us go away happy - but if we'd done that, there would have been no way to know that the computers were back up. Silly and a sign of poor management. As we were waiting - I was sitting in the car answering some email, and our car was hit by a bicyclist. We were parked, so yes - the bike hit us. I jumped up because the noise was really loud - and I saw someone riding away. So I got out of the car and proceeded to ask the person riding if there was damage - because he hit pretty hard. Well, I didn't see that a child was down on the ground beside our car (I was on the passenger side and this was on the drivers side). I felt horrible because my goodness, it was a child - and I have 3 of my own! As it turned out, the child was fine thank goodness - but the Bellman who had heard my initial reaction saw it fit to be extremely rude to me in the process. I didn't need that after having already been waiting for over an hour for their precious computer system to be up and running. Then another bellman passed by our car and I overheard him saying to another guest that the computers had already been down for a couple hours, that it happens all the time, and that he'd be surprised if people would be able to check in by morning. Seriously?!? Finally, two and a half hours later, the computers started working - but oddly - NO one working the front desk announced this to the people waiting. You had to go up to them and ask. By this time, my husband and I were very upset, and our children - including our three year old - were starving. As a way to appease us, the manager offered to comp our parking and cut our room rate in half the first night, which was very nice...if the room had actually been worth even the CUT rate. By this time, it was dark and yes - the tiki torches are a nice touch, and it did remind me of Hawaii. We get to our room, and the keys don't work. Annoying. We go back to the lobby - by car because the property is very spread out - get new keys, come back to the room, and they don't work again. At this point, I'm furious. My husband calls the lobby from his phone, explains the situation and they say they're going to send a bellman with new keys and he'll stay to make sure they work. 15 minutes later - we're still standing outside. Finally a security guy drives by in an electric car by chance, and he lets us into the room. About 5 minutes later a bellman shows up with new keys and presto - these work. As far as the room goes, it's nothing special, although it's a decent size. Two queen beds, a dry-bar area, a small table, a large dresser or credenza thing - a wall closet, small sink area outside the toilet and shower area - which had water damage on the walls that they'd tried to cover up with paint. Oh, no door to the sink area - just a slider door (that didn't work well) to the shower/toilet area, which also had mildew damage. Oh...and no carpet at all. Just a tile floor that was supposed to look like wood - and let me tell you, it was FILTHY. We'd shower, walk on the floor barefoot and our feet would be black afterward. We wore shoes the entire time, only to take them off when we'd get into bed. Gross. My husband was set that we were staying no matter what at this point, so we unhappily got dinner and got ourselves into bed for the night. The next day we got up and hoped for the best - we were planning to spend the day at the large family pool in the middle of the property, and I have to say - it was the one redeeming quality of this entire resort. We did eat breakfast at the Barefoot Bar, which truly needs to expand it's menu and include LUNCH type items that aren't $26.00. I don't even mind paying the money as much as I mind the lack of choices. There's one other true restaurant on the property called Baleen - we never ate there because they weren't able to accommodate us any time we requested a table. The afternoon was spent at the pool, which is also where we received our best service for the entire trip. The food was good, the drinks were good but of course resort-pricey, and the pool was a lot of fun for the kids. We headed back to our room about 3:30 to get ready for dinner, but lo and behold the housekeeping service never made it to our room. We decided to just get ready for dinner and call as we were leaving our room, which we did. After finding out that Baleen refuses to seat people unless you already have a reservation (and by the way - the restaurant was completely EMPTY when we arrived) - we ate at Barefoot Bar again. The food was so-so for dinner, but we made the best of it. Got back to the room after fireworks - 9:45ish - and once again, the room wasn't cleaned. We called yet again, and finally someone arrived to clean our room as my three year old was sleeping on my shoulder as I waited outside. It seemed to take quite a while - so we went around the backside of the bungalow to wait. Turns out, our housekeeper was taking a little TV break. We could see her watching The Bachelorette through our slider window!! As soon as she saw my kids looking at her, she closed our drapes, and we walked back to the front door to wait. As she walks out she tells us that she just washed the floor - so it was wet. This also gave us the opportunity to be able to see just exactly where she washed the floor - and let me tell you - she literally made one swipe past the beds, through to the bathroom, and that's about it. Disgusting. Next morning we get up, go about our day - come back to the hotel at about 7:30, and no, the room still wasn't cleaned. This time, when housekeeping arrives, we start asking questions - come to find out, they won't clean your room unless you specifically request it, or put a sign out that requests service. I've stayed in many resorts - never once have I had to ASK for housekeeping service. While the room was being cleaned, we decided to go to the pool near our room to swim. We get there to see that although there ARE lights in the pool and spa, they aren't turned on. That's a dangerous situation if I've ever seen one at night. It's not well-lit, and if someone like my three year old fell in and went to the bottom, we might not have seen her. We didn't stay long, just long enough to see a few people come, coolers in tow - to sit in the spa and drink beer. They were clearly drunk, and while I have no problem with people drinking, they were slurring their words and I wasn't comfortable with the kids there. I could go on and on. I should have realized when we booked that it was odd that there didn't seem to be a limit as to how many people you could have in your room. It was very clear that this was the type of place you come to party it up with as many people as you can pack in - and it's not high class - definitely not worth the $300+ per night tab they wanted for each room. Thanks Paradise Point - trust me when I say I'll be making sure to tell everyone I know about your "fantastic" service. Friends don't let friends (or strangers for that matter) stay here. No way.

Reviews.Title: “Listen to What the other critics say as well....don't waste your money here”
Reviews.Author: 2boyz1girl_11
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at Paradise Point for 3 nights but we should have checked out after the first one and moved on like we did for our 4th night. While the property is beautiful, especially at night with all of the tiki torches in the common areas our room itself was not pleasant. As soon as we walked in the door the odor in the room was very musty. When I went to make a phone call I noticed that the phone was dirty and completely dusty. Our bathroom was very outdated and not clean. Our refrigerator did not work and the air conditioning unit leaked water all over the floor and ran very loudly. The maid left a dirty sheet on top of my luggage after supposedly cleaning the room. While trying to utilize the chairs on the back patio the sprinkler system kicked on and the chairs were completely soaked. The layout of the resort is very confusing and poorly lit by the individual units making it very hard to see our room number. When you check in they give you a "passport" detailing all if the "free" activities you get there compared to other resorts. That was a total gimmick as they charge a daily resort fee on top of a $25 parking fee to park directly outside your door. It is not as if they are valet parking your car in a secured garage. We were very dissapointed with how much we spent to get a sub par room. We will never return to the resort. We spent the last night at the Marriott on Coronado Island and I highly recommend that hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Wow! 5 star really is there such a thing as 10star!! Resort is an amazing 10 star hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Watsontravel
Reviews.Content: The staff at this resort are more than just amazing!! We had friends visit us for the day, when tragically their 12 year old dog ran away from their vehicle on arrival. The resort staff worked so well together and found and returned her in less than 7 minutes . Remember this is a 44 acre resort !! How amazing and kind for them to respond to our friends pet as if it were someone's child. Bless everyone who helped!!! Return a Childs bestfriend

Reviews.Title: “Great Setting”
Reviews.Author: Sonny30
Reviews.Content: Adjacent to Seaworld, but will need a car for downtown visits. Suggest the trolley tour which leaves from the main lobby, very informative! Enjoy your stay, I did every minute. Great meals at the Barefoot restaurant. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful property, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: AGPtravels
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point is located in one of the most beautiful seaside communities in the world. It's a large resort with many well maintained acres of subtropical landscaping. It's a real shame that the folks running the place don't have their act together. We stayed there a week and we had to call housekeeping every single day for something they didn't do, like clean the room, leave us clean drinking glasses, or provide toilet paper. The spa is mediocre; currently they are renovating the saunas and while one tries to enjoy the $200 massage, you get to listen to drilling and hammering.
