Following this expensive massage, the therapist offers you an 8 oz. bottle of water and tells you to "stay hydrated." you'd think for $200 they could offer you all the water you want. They charge extra for EVERYTHING: parking, internet, most activities except pool swimming. But the pools are filthy, full of trash and hair. The restaurant is mediocre. Room maintenance is poor - the arbor over our door was falling off when we arrived. No amenities in the room, not even sample sized hand lotion and only 1 bar of soap. This place is a rip off. The only reason we came was because my husband had a business meeting here, and if he does again, I'm not coming along.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Old, Smelly and Bad Service, stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: enmichels
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I traveled to the Paradise Point Resort in San Diego to celebrate my 25th birthday. We are frequent travelers, taking around 3-5 vacations per year (please see my other reviews) we stay at the most luxurious hotels so I have a lot to compare to, and let’s just say I wouldn’t even recommend this hotel to my worst enemy, that would be too mean! Airport: The airport is very small, around 20 minutes from Paradise Point. We rented a car from enterprise, it was quick and easy. They had a bus waiting to take us to the nearest Enterprise location, and we were able to pick out our car. We had GPS so it was easy to get around, and the traffic is not bad at all in San Diego. Check-in: Our check in person was Gino, wasn’t he pleasant….not. He first started with asking us to upgrade to the beach suite, I thought he was giving us a free upgrade for my bday, so I said is this for my birthday? And he goes No, we only have 1 left and it would be $150 extra per night (which we passed on). Also the Lobby smells like Mold, you will notice the entire resort smells like mold! We had a room right next to this filthy lagoon; this resort would be pretty if they kept it clean! Our room had a Full bed (which they call a queen), sleeper sofa, tiny bathroom, and a desk, the run and table were missing for the couch, what a basic room for 350 dollars per night, not microwave even! The next morning after sleeping in this tiny bed, I looked at my fiancés travel documents, to see that he actually paid $30 extra per night for a king size bed. I called to speak with the manager Matt Quick, he apologized and said that he would switch us to a new room, and not make us pay for a parking for our 3 night stay. We switched rooms, the new room was bigger about 100 sqft or so, with the worst smell ever, it just hits you as you enter. The air conditioning was broken, the refrigerator did not work, our bathroom was covered in rust and mold (I took the quickest showers of my life there because I was so disgusted), but the bed was a king! We called about the air conditioner, and they replaced the entire thing right away. We actually left that day to LA and Disneyland so we did not have time to change rooms again, but there are no windows that open to get fresh air, just a patio door with no screen. There is Shampoo, Conditioner, Body Wash, Hair Dryer and Coffee Maker, no other amenities offered in the room besides the wireless internet that you will pay for when you check out. LA/Disneyland: The road trip was beautiful, we took the Pacific Hwy all the way there. It was only a 1 hr 45 minute drive to Anaheim where Disneyland is. We love Disneyworld, and we loved Disneyland just as much. We started at downtown Disney, $15 dollars to park there and only a short walk though to Disneyland. We ate at the ESPN Zone, which is our favorite. Disneyland also had a park called Adventure Park that we did not go to, but they have Tower of Terror, and a lot of fun roller coasters. The lines at Disneyland were very long, 80 minutes per ride; we only were able to go on 4! But the experience was well worth it. After Disneyland we met with a bunch of our friends that live in Manhattan Beach. We went to Hermosa Beach to have drinks and dance, The Shore was so much fun, great music and great crowd. We ended up staying out late, so we got a deal at a near Wyndham hotel for the night to sleep, even that hotel which was $100 dollars a night was nicer than Paradise Point; at least they had a microwave, working fridge, living area, and clean! Downtown San Diego: So beautiful! I wrote down a few hotels that were there that looked nice, Marriott Marquez, and the Omni. We ate at Lou & Mickies, the food was excellent, the service was good, and they had a wonderful wine list. And the price was not very high, for the two of us with wine our bill was $68 without tip. Next time we visit San Diego we will be staying downtown. Barefoot Grill: The first night of our trip we ate at the barefoot grill in the Paradise Point. What a disappointment. It was a 30 minute wait, and when we were seated we waited another 20 minutes for our waiter to come with our drinks. After we ordered, it was like he forgot about us, never came back for another 45 minutes, all we ordered was a burger and turkey wraps. We had to ask the bus boy to find him because we thought he might have gone home. Finally when he came back with our food, which was all seasoned with something that tasted similar to Dill, I ordered my free dessert that the hotel gave us tickets for. I had the S’mores Chocolate Cake, and I must say that it was beyond delicious. Beach/Pool: The Beach is quiet, and it was nice to have right at the hotel, but it was filthy, there was trash, glass, sand flies everywhere. We decided to sit there for an hour, then head to the Adults only pool. We had a Friend who lives in San Diego come visit us for the day to lay by the pool, we are between the ages of 25-27. When we arrived, the ‘security guard’ asked for our ID’s, we don’t look like we are under 18 so it was ridiculous. Then I had my room key, since you need that to get into their gated pools and she still asked for my room number. Then when she saw that we only had 2 people on our reservations, but there were 3 of us, she told us our friend could not use the pool. So we were told to leave! I didn’t even know what to say at this point. We just went back to the beach. Check Out: The day before we left I called for a late check out, and Stephanie informed me that I need to call back the day of our departure (our flight did not take off until 6pm). Typically this is not a problem for most hotels, they will give you an extra hour or two, especially if they do not have the facilities (shower, etc) to use. When I called the day of our departure, Stephanie answer, and I started asking for a late check out, literally before I finished my sentence, all she said was “NO, we are booked, sorry!” I said all we want is until 2:00 pm (check in time isn’t until 4pm and It doesn’t take over 30 minutes to clean a room and half the people arriving aren’t arriving at 4pm anyways). After telling her all of the things we dealt with on this trip, the moldy smell, the broken air, fridge, and given a downgrade in the room, she said sorry you are disappointed but we don’t make exceptions. I asked for her manager, and she was eager to get him on the phone. Matt Quick was the manager I spoke with again, and he did end up accommodating me 2:00pm request. So if you call, do not speak with Stephanie, she was horribly rude. I did inform her I would post her name on Tripadvisor for her rudeness and she said “go for it.” At check out, we knew we would be charged the $15.00 fee for absolutely nothing, but it is not just $15 it is $15+Tax. They also charged us $25 per day for parking which Matt Quick said we would not be charged for. I did have her take that off the bill, we were just happy to check out! Overall, our experience was horrible, I read reviews before we left, but the resort looked so beautiful online and was so deceiving I ignored the bad reviews, I know better then that. Just take my word for it, choose another hotel, you will be disappointed in The Paradise Point, this hotel makes Motel 6 look nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it appears”
Reviews.Author: rwhitson
Reviews.Content: When I called to book a San Diego vacation with your company, I went with the advise of your attendant. So I am writing this review so you may know the real dealings behind Paradise Point so more formative information can be conveyed to your clients. The only Paradise in this place is to the owners and stock holders. There is nothing free in this place and if you do decide to eat, lounge or use there facilities it will cost-not just a fair amount but they gouge you. A smoothie at the pool restaurant is $6 served in a small cup, bike rental for one hour is $25 and to play putt-putt in their make shift little course was $10 a person. I have stayed at many resorts and I don't mind paying a reasonable amount to play but that was ridiculous for what you got. Now let me tell you about the room, the room was very small and the bathroom was made at an angle which shortened one side. It was also connected to an adjoining room, you could hear everything that was going on in the other room-not very restful. The refrigerator barely worked and if you wanted a microwave it was an additional $25 a day. They tell you at check-in that you have this so-called passport which offers many free services compared to other resorts-its bogus. Once you check out, a hidden charge of $15 dollars is added to your bill for each day of your stay whether you used them or not. They also charge $25 dollars a day for parking which I new about but that is crap-there is parking every where available, just another means to rip you off. Now let me tell you about the service. My son and his girlfriend ordered a grill cheese and tomato soup entree from the Bare-Foot restaurant (it was a little cold outside) and it took a hour to receive their food, then instead of soup they gave him a cup of marinara sauce (spaghetti sauce). I questioned the waiter and he just blew me off like I didn't matter. The whole 5 day stay that I was there the pool was never cleaned. When I arrived, the bottom of the pool was covered with dirt and during our stay, it only got worse. Paradise Point is a big resort; however it only has 4 washing machine to accommodate hundreds of families-they are not even centrally located. they were located way on the other side of the resort and the only way to get there was by foot unless you were staying in that section. I was in San Diego for 9 days, I stayed at the Holiday in Express and the Sheraton by the Harbor. I got way more for my money- which by the way was half the price- at both these places. Free internet, refrigator, microwave, breakfast. The sheraton even had activities for the kids to do-we loved movies every night by the pool. The food at the Sheraton was reasonably priced with good portions. One last thing, I charged a plain coffee to my room one morning. it cost $4 and some change. When I checked out, I questioned a charge on my bill, they said some one charged $43 to my room from a coffee cart or something. They were accusing my kids of doing it. I assured them they didn't and I wanted to see the receipt. It took awhile but they found the receipt, they charged my room $43 for my regular coffee. I have a lot more complaints but out of time :)

Reviews.Title: “We look forward to many more Trips to Paradise”
Reviews.Author: kimberlyhw
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked through the fromt door we were greeted with exceptional customer service. Your staff is a great example of Team work and excellent management. My 6 year old daughter absolutely loved all the bellman and their eagerness to make her giggle. It was great every day walking to breakfast and being greeted by your staff with warm smiles and well wishes. We never left the property other than to take the water cab over to Sea World. What a fantastic visit to paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hotel but I understand the complaints”
Reviews.Author: Romano70
Reviews.Content: I'm not the pickiest person in the world, I rather say I'm very practical and easy to please, so I want to say that the hotel grounds are beautiful and there are so many things to do that make it an extremely fun place to go. However I noticed so many details that were missing that I imagine a more discriminating customer would rant about them it a heartbeat. My wife and I went there for a romantic weekend getaway. We arrived late, around 10:30p; front desk girl was very pleasant and fast to check us in, driving to our room the driveway was very dark, it looked like the campground in a horror movie. My wife and I were hungry so we call room service and were disapointed to find out it ends at 10pm, the person gave me the phone number of a place that delivers pizza late. Not a great dinner to start our weekend. I have read about the cleanliness problems in your rooms so the next morning I went into the bathroom first and was able to confirm there were hairs left from a previous guest to that room, I cleaned them before my wife could see them (she is picky). also I noticed several dents in the wall's paint that made the place look like it was very old and poorly maintained. We had planned to go out to san diego but after walking around to see the grounds the pools were so inviting that we decided to stay the whole day by the pool and then walking by the beach. It was beautiful. We also met our next door neighbors, a family with 4 kids, my wife and I were kind of embarrazed because we had been kind of loud the previous night and the bed's headboard is not mounted to the wall so it sounds like a drum against the thin walls. Hotel manager, please nail the headboards to the walls In the end I would recommend this hotel for a family vacation with the kids or with friends. I would not recommend for a romantic weekend (unless you're 60). I would also not recommend to people that I know as very picky or cleaniless obsesive. I hope you find this review useful.

Reviews.Title: “dirty”
Reviews.Author: bbanks1582
Reviews.Content: gardens were very well maintained on a daily basis its just a pity the rooms were not shown the same care. after waiting 2 hours to get in the room because it was being cleaned,imagine the shock when we went into the room and the very large rug was thick of food,hair and debris from the previous occupants the coffee table still had cup stains all over it. I then checked the kitchen the benches were full of old food in particular tomatoe sauce as was the fridge. the microwave was splatted with all kinds of food and had a bad odour.Due to the poor service we recieved at the front desk i decided to clean it myself with the exception of the microwave( i had no intention of using it) Throughout our 6 day stay the sinks, floors,funiture and kitchen were not cleaned or damp dusted although the bed was made. the saving grace was the view and the fact we didnt spend much time in the room. would not recommend this hotel at all if you like things clean great if your not botherd.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay, nice room with beautiful views.”
Reviews.Author: kcat24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for half our our honeymoon and were very pleased. When we checked in we were greeted with a great surprise - our room had been upgraded for free and our nightly parking fee had been waived. We got to our room, which was right on the harbor with beautiful views of the bay, and found a bottle of champagne and a plate of chocolate covered strawberries. The room was gorgeous and much bigger than we had expected. We spent hours sitting on our back patio watching the harbor and enjoying the sunset. The room itself did have a little bit of a musty/humid smell and feel to it but nothing that was really much of an inconvenience. The resort was very nice. There was a ton on the resort itself to do. The swimming pools and hot tubs were great. However, they did charge a $15 a day fee for a bunch of stuff that we had no interest in using. Also, there is a hefty nightly parking fee as well. If our fee hadnt been waived, we would have been charged an extra $25 a night. Those start to add up quite a bit. So be prepared to pay an bunch of extra when you check out. The resort is very close to so many things: Sea World, the Airport, Downtown, Mission Beach etc..... Couldnt ask for a better location. The staff was friendly and helpful as well. No complaints at all other than the extra fees.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: AdrianLloydy
Reviews.Content: We booked Paradise Point for 4 nights as part of a trip as we were renewing our vows after 10 years of marragise and to celebrate my wife's 40th birthday. With the initial part of the trip being 5 days in Vegas, we wanted a place to 'relax' and recharge and Paradise Point certainly met this criteria. The resort was fantastic with a beautiful room in a fantastic location. The resort is so clean and fresh with fantstic views, delightful service and excellent breakfasts !! The close proximity to San Diego downtown, Sea World and the breach, meant that we could put away the car and enjoy. We loved it and are already planning as trip back to the resort next year, which considering the distance from London, speals volumes for the resort and San Diego as a whole.

Reviews.Title: “Best place ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: catcon33388
Reviews.Content: Of Course I read the reviews so we where a little nervous about the Paradise Point...But what a great vacation we thought we where in Hawaii. (for half the price and no long flight) We had a wonderful room. We did request a room by the adult pool since this trip was without kids. Not only got by the pool but close to the ocean also. Staff was very helpful and nice! (Mary) My boyfriend lost his jacket and they stayed on it until it was found. Had a great waitress (Lauren) and the food at the pool restaurant Tropics is great. We ate at all 3 restaurants and loved the food. Take your family or just your other and enjoy we sure did!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced motel with "resort" stamp”
Reviews.Author: M0mmyG
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point looks beautiful in pictures and from far away, but up close, it is NOT nearly worth what the resort charges per night. We used various special offers (conference and credit card member rates), and got great deals on all our rooms for a 1-week stay. The rooms were spacious and fairly clean. Pools were adequate/small, and all the "recreational" activities included a sky-high deposit. Parking was close enough, but the roadways in the different villages are worse than a bumper car course! In truth, Paradise Point Resort reminded my family of an older Hawaiian hotel - insanely high rates for the ambiance, but no real substance or bang for your buck. A few times we took advantage of the water taxi to Sea World, which was fun and convenient enough, but honestly overpriced as the park tickets were sold at face value so there was no real 'savings' by buying from the resort. The nightly Sea World fireworks are fairly visible from the entrance to the resort and from the observation tower by the lobby. We also ate at the Barefoot Bar and Grill three different times (for breakfast, for drinks and appetizers, and ordered room service). This place is.... again, adequate. Serves a purpose, but you better bring your patience along with enough money to pay the bill. Food is subpar and service is slow, but it IS all delivered with a smile. My group of 7 people (ranging from ages 2 - 70) stayed in 3 adjoining rooms in the Hibiscus Village (where you see and hear EVERY car that enters and leaves the resort). Each room either had plumbing that leaked, tile that was uneven, missing door screens that let in huge mosquitos; and ALL the rooms had phones that didn't work right, hotel tv menus that never functioned (we couldn't even check out from our room!), and old fridges and microwaves that should have been replaced 5 years ago. Rooms were cleaned daily, but at various hours, and we never had the same maid twice. However, there were plenty of times when other cleaning staff dropped by to chat while the maid worked (while we were sitting outside with little kids, waiting for the room to be done!). Cleaning staff also drove their carts way too fast, all while chatting on their phones. The bathrooms were also very small and sparce, almost like a motel room bath (in fact, one of our rooms didn't even have a door closing off the bath/toilet area from the sink!). For as much as the grounds staff mowed the grass (which we could hear for hours and hours in the afternoons - NOT at all a quiet and tranquil resort!), there were huge spiderwebs everywhere - on the flowers, all over the patio furniture, along the gates, etc. Seriously? THIS is what the resort is charging almost $400 a night for?!??! If you're still going to book at this resort after reading these reviews, do yourself a favor and make sure you snag a good deal from Priceline or Expedia. By no means is Paradise Point Resort a bad place, there are just much better and smarter options for spending your money if you do your homework. Paradise Point needs to seriously fix the problems at this resort. My family doesn't regret staying here, but we're definitely not planning to return any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “High Priced, but great Location”
Reviews.Author: BrokerPaul
Reviews.Content: Signed up for the Paradise Point Club program last year. Thought the program was a good deal when enrolled but a different program rules and regulations showed up with multiple restrictions and blackout dates. Not happy with the outcome, because the desk clerk fought you for redeeming coupons. Great idea, but a Poorly run program left a bad taste in my mind. Great location and nicely kept grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Strong Potential, Great Stay, Recommended Impovements...”
Reviews.Author: IL2AZ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent four nights here celebrating our 1 year wedding anniversary. Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly staff who were eager to make our stay special. After a short conversation with the woman who checked us in, we were given a generous upgrade of our reserved room, and managed flexibility with the parking fee. This left us with a good initial impression of the resort. The young man who showed us to our room was also very friendly, and extended himself as a resource during our stay. We were quite impressed with the aesthetics and location of the room, as it sat facing bay with two Adirondack style chairs on the linai. There was a small private beach with fire pits, and while we didn't use them, we did benefit from the smells of the fire enjoyed by the other guests. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The food was above average, as well as the service. The only aspect that we could offer some constructive criticism towards is that there seems to be some lacking in the attention to detail. For example, doors were difficult to open, fireplace in room had very low flames, beer can left on linai from previous guests filled with ashes and cigarette butts, somewhat non-thorough room cleaning. We only say this, because we feel this place has too much potential for these kind of things to be overlooked. We really thought the staff and grounds were wonderful overall. If something was not to our liking, we have to say they were responsive and wanted to correct any problems. We would return and recommend a stay without hesitation. Plus we were sent a bottle of champagne to celebrate our special day, and this was very appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “A Saved Vacation”
Reviews.Author: litllady
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 3 day vacation and here is our story. We sadly could not stay with you guys at the beginning because you guys were all booked up so we had to go elsewhere. Well, our elsewhere was horrible and they treated us very poorly and just when I thought our vacation was over, my husband said let me check with Paradise again maybe there might be an opening and so he called and you guys were able to save our vacation! You guys were able to get us in without any hassles and you made one little 2 year old very happy along with her parents! We can't thank you guys enough and I already have told all our friends and family to go down and check you guys out whenever they get the chance cause I know they will have a fantastic time, just as we did:) I will recommend you guys to everyone:) thanks again:) Danielle

Reviews.Title: “Pics misleading, not a luxury resort”
Reviews.Author: EricAnaheim
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the website make this place look like an upscale luxury resort but it's far from it. This place used to be called Vacation Village which were (and still are) a bunch of brick boxes situated in tropical-style landscaping. I wish I knew this; I was expecting an actual hotel especially because of the pics, rating, and price. The rooms were "renovated" but that only means a new coat of paint and furniture. We reserved a bayside room but upon check-in they said they didn't have any available and that Orbitz overbooked it (I've never had that happen before). Therefore they gave us the executive suite that was large but had a slow-draining sink, 30 year old fridge, a microwave from the 1960's, slow-flowing shower, smelly sheets, hair & crumbs on the carpet, creaky bed, squeaky door hinges, thin walls, and a slight musty smell. Had I known this was a bunch of brick boxes from the sixties that had a new coat of paint I would have gone elsewhere. Ya, the grounds are nice and there are a bunch of pools and some activities for the kids but those are the only redeeming qualities but definitely not worth the price. I don't know how so many people can give this place such high ratings. Maybe they think brick-box rooms and superficial renovations are luxurious, but it absolutely does not justify the price. If this place was going for $100 - $150 per night and if I knew these were brick boxes instead of an actual hotel I wouldn't complain. Oh ya, parking is $25 bucks per day to park next to your room and there is a $15 per day mandatory resort fee (when you check-in they hand you this "passport to paradise" showing how the pools, internet, gym are free but they didn't tell us about the $15 per day fee, but it's not like you have a choice). You'd think for the price per room all of this would be included but it's not. Bottom line: I feel misled. I wish I knew these were 1960's brick-boxes with new paint. And all the high ratings for this place really surprise me. I don't know if they're reviewing the same place or have different standards of what luxury and resort means. I could not in my right mind call high-priced brick boxes luxurious, paradise, great price, fantastic, outstanding, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience Across The Board”
Reviews.Author: whatever003
Reviews.Content: My suite was clean, well furnished and perfectly situated in front of the fire pit. Service was excellent and room service menu was exstensive and resonably prices. My bed was luxurious, as well as, the bath towels. I will spend my vacations here from now on. A must stay resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business or families”
Reviews.Author: sancarlosdoc
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days at medical conference. Nice conference facilities. Hotel has lovely, mature tropical grounds with water views. Rooms are bungalows. Clean but feel a bit dated esp the bathrooms. Our towel rack had been pulled off the wall and the area where it came off was not repaired. Refridge so loud we had to turn it off to sleep. There were no windows that could be opened for fresh air. This is an expensive place so you expect more. Nice pool areas and good gym. If you arrive late bring food as there is no late night dining in the facility. One of my pet peeves is the extra $15 fee for things that should be free like the gym-reminds me of airline baggage fees. Parking fee steep. Overall an ok place if you can find a good rate on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort!”
Reviews.Author: Keely0207
Reviews.Content: Beautiful little place. We had a huge room and garden area. Room was decorated lovely and we had plenty of room to spread our stuff out. There were 4 pools, we mainly went to the adult pool which was dead most of the time, so had a lot of peace and quiet. Hot tubs could have done with being open a little later than 10pm. Beaches were great - again not too crowded and noisy. Staff were really helpful. Considering the distance to any local amenities, such as shops etc, they didnt have a great deal on site. There was 1 overpriced shop and i think 3 restaurants. Would definetely recommend getting a hire car here as there isnt a great deal to do within walking distance. All in all a good stay and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We loved every moment at Paradise Point Resort and Spa!”
Reviews.Author: Eciccoianni
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped out of our car to the moment we left we were greeted with kindness and open arms. We had an amazing experience. We played, we relaxed and we enjoyed every second. Paradise Point had everything we wanted as newly married couple. We rented waverunners, bikes and dined eating great food and awesome service! Paradise Point is great for families too and retailed about bringing our family some day! Loved it there so much and was sad to leave, but excited to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: barefootmemories
Reviews.Content: We've lived in San Diego for decades, but we'd never been to Paradise Point. With airfare so high, and already living in a vacation town, we decided to go for a "staycation" in our home town. The resort is AMAZING. The staff is SO friendly. The Barefoot Grill was definitely a favorite, but the highlight for my kids was the jetski/waverunner rental we did through the resort's marina. SO FUN. We will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: gmamaof2
Reviews.Content: Our 3 nite stay at Paradise Point was memorable. Our 2.5 year old loved feeding the ducks and the fish (ask the front desk for food and they'll give it to you for free). Even though the resort imposes fees (eg parking, microwaves for non-suites and resort fee), you can ask the front desk to waive them. Housekeeping didn't clean our room until 8:30 one nite so I requested they waive the resort fee. My bill came out to less than a dollar at checkout. The Barefoot Bar and Grill wasn't great, but you can buy certificates at Restaurant.com which made the meal very reasonable. Overall we had a very lovely stay, and we would recommend this hotel to family and friends. We booked a vacation package on Southwest and got a great deal on this hotel. If you need anything printed out (eg airplane tickets) call concierge and they will print and have someone deliver it to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a getaway”
Reviews.Author: Mary47087
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were treated wonderfully. The rooms were clean and the employees were so friendly and helpful. This was our first visit to California and we had a wonderful experience. I would recommend the Paradise Point Resort and Spa to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on a Travelzoo special and really enjoyed this property. The room was large and included a sitting room with a pullout couch, chair and desk. The bed was really comfortable and had high quality linens. The room included a safe, which is pretty unusual in the USA, but comes in really handy. One little nitpick is the TV doesn't get great reception and doesn't have that many channels. They do have pay-per-view, however. The landscaping reminded us of Hawaii and it was really pleasant to walk around on the property. They also have boats and bicycles for rent. The kids we saw really seemed to be enjoying themselves but after dark it definitely became more of an adult resort, so I think you will find whatever you are looking for here. We don't swim, but noticed an adults only pool along with a pool for kids, which is a great idea. We had several meals and cocktails at the Barefoot Bar & Grill, which is part of the resort, and recommend it highly. My husband liked the gym and said it was a cut above the usual hotel gym. Bottom line is we loved it and plan to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great finish line for a mrathon”
Reviews.Author: shoelesssean
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon Paradise through Hotwire.com. What a gret find. The grounds were beuatiful, the staff freindly and extremely helpful in finding places to go and things to do. I ran in the 1/2 marathon and could not have asked for a better place to retreat to. Definately a wonderful sight driving in at night.

Reviews.Title: “Take extra fees into consideration when booking”
Reviews.Author: Elkenel
Reviews.Content: I had booked this room through a third party and paid in advance. At check-in I was informed of additional charges:$15/day resort fee and $10/day for parking. The rooms and grounds are nice and the beds are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in all areas”
Reviews.Author: paulberg
Reviews.Content: This was my wife and my second stay in the past year. We had a great relaxing time. Both times we were upgraded to suites on the bay which is right outside your patio. I have read several negative comments but the staff could not have been more helpful. From the front desk to the housekeepers nothing but friendly people with smiles. The Barefoot Bar is intimate and I enjoyed talking with the bartenders. I was even able to call the market and have them deliver firewood for the fire pit outside our room. I would recommend this resort to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay for the family”
Reviews.Author: TexKS
Reviews.Content: I picked this resort after much seraching and was pleased with the result. I took the family - my wufe and I, one daughter and husbanc, and older daughet with husband and 2 kids. We were there for 6 restful nights. I never heard any late night noise. The grounds are closely monitored and the pool area was cleared around 10:00. Location: As a base for our daily activities, we wre never a long way from anything. We sailed in the bay, toured on the trolley, went to baseball at Petco, enjoyed the wildlie at the zoo, and surfed at La Jolla - each event was no trouble to reach. Facilities: A very large complex of smaller units with 2-6 rooms each, the grounds are expansive, but that tends to mask how busy the facility may be - we arrived the day before the San Diego marathon and there were no rooms to be found, but ours were prepaid and ready. The rooms were all spacious with our junior suite the largest. it's not really a suite, just an extra large room. All of the beds were comfortable and sized as advertised. The pools were convenient so we ended up using only the small one near our room the entire trip. One small negative was the housekeepping. The tile floors never really were totally clean. Our 1 year old grandaughter had filthy feet whenever we let her roam without shoes. I could tell the facility was built many years ago, but the recent updates makes it more than acceptable. for a first time visit, I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: phvenab
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point is physically beautiful! Lush, mature landscaping greets you at every turn; there are several pools for individual taste; and the location cannot be beat. What is lacking is customer service, and service problems can ruin any potentialy great vacation. Room cleaning service was marginal - had to call several times for cleaning that just was not done initially. One of the staff at the Barefoot Bar got so frustrated at our questons about the bill that he actually threw the menu in a corner and walked away. With comprehensive staff training in customer service, this would be a world-class resort! Without it, it's just another place in San Diego that's beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: sext9652
Reviews.Content: I was very worried about what I would find when we went on our vacation due to all of the varied reports on this resort. I'm glad we never changed our mind. From the time we checked in to the time we checked out this morning EVERYTHING was wonderful. We were put in a garden villa for the first part of our vacation but opted to upgrade on our anniversary and was upgraded to an executive suite (which is a double upgrade which was a surprise). We explained this to Mary at the front desk who helped with the upgrade and sent us champagne and choc covered strawberries for our anniversary. She also gave us a break on the parking charge. The resort is VERY big but set up so that everything you need is in the same area. Ate at both restaurants and the food was wonderful, yes Baleen was on the high side but you get what you pay for, it was outstanding. The bartenders at the Barefoot Grill are great and remember you when you return. Our room was cleaned by the time we came back to our room every day. If you have the time get a massage that was great too. I can't say enough about this resort. We will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “If you dont go to Paradise Point, I'll have a better chance of getting reservations the next time i go.”
Reviews.Author: jeremysparks
Reviews.Content: I have not met the perfect blend of service and location before I took my family to Paradse Point. Upon check in i notified the front desk that i would require another bed. it was there when i got to my room. The atmosphere is so laid back. I love that. Everyone is so helpful and nice. The pool area is amazing, and the grounds are immaculate. i wish I could have used the marina, but the water taxi to SeaWorld was the perfect answer. it drops you off in the rear of the park, and we got right into the Cirque show. It was perfect. Anyway, the bar ares at Barefoot was ok. Good food, but perhaps a bit overpriced. Everythiing was overpriced, but they coax it out of you because of the beauty. i loved it! i will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Our room was gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: sdchic421
Reviews.Content: The view from our room was fabulous! We overlooked the bay and had a private beach to lay out. The staff was courteous and the stay was well worth it! The room was beautiful and we were able to lay by the pool before check-in. All around a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point is the Hawaii of California”
Reviews.Author: AlohaCA
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point is an amazing and unique resort for the entire family. The grounds are beyond beautiful and we needed to keep reminding ourselves that we were not in Hawaii. The staff is awesome, from Pat who helped arrange our stay, Gino who checked us in, Maria in housekeeping, the team at the Barefoot Grill and Captain Bill who took us to Sea World on the water taxi - everything was first class. We were a little concerned about the one story bungalow type rooms but they are what makes Paradise Point so different from the average vacation hotel. There are pools scattered throughout the resort, bonfires on the beach, bicycle rentals and so much to do. We spent one day in Legoland, another at the San Diego Zoo and then onto Sea World. But what was the most fun, was coming back to the resort and spending the evening in our own private paradise. This was our first visit but we are planning to make this an annual family trip. And we heard about the resort in a promotional flyer so don't forget to ask about special packages. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Greendog7
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful. We really enjoyed our stay there. It was relaxing and enjoyable the whole time we were there. They have like 3 pools, one with sand- which was really neat. The rooms were pretty good size. We had double queen beds and it fit our small family of three fine. We ordered room service the first night, and it arrived promptly, and was very good. Although we had to ask the hotel staff twice to remove our tray from our room, as you can't leave it outside your door, because the seagulls will get the food. But otherwise that our stay was wonderful, the hotel staff made sure our room was clean early in the morning so when we returned in the afternoon we had a clean room. We also ate a couple times at the Barefoot Cafe, which had delicious food, and amazing views of Sail Bay. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to get away from it all, and staying in Paradise in the middle of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!! TOO MUCH FUN.....”
Reviews.Author: lovinlife023
Reviews.Content: One of the best family getaways that I've experienced.. No need to leave the resort, they have all the amenities right there. From Boats to Bikes, Swimming to Putt Putt Golf. My kids had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Decent property ... be ready to walk!”
Reviews.Author: Belasaria
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 days in January as part of my company's annual meeting. One of the appeals was that this was not a traditional "box" hotel. Each room is ground level and in singles and groups of two and four rooms, bungalow like. The property sprawls over 44 acres and it is VERY easy to get turned around. I got lost several times, especially at night while driving, since some of the signs were not well lit and obscured by foliage. I had a large bungalow facing one of the lagoons. It had a bedroom, walk in closet, full bath, separate sitting room, dining table and chairs, and a kitchenette with a microwave, sink and mini-fridge. My biggest disappointment was the bathroom and the bath amenities. For as much as one is paying for the stay, having shampoo, soap and conditioner on wall dispensers is kind of gauche. Housekeeping did a decent job although it was not as consistent as I would have liked. I didn't have issues with bugs, although there were a few flies and moths that got in while I had the door open. The rooms open directly outside, so this is going to happen. This is truly a resort hotel, not necessarily one for a business traveler. The wireless Internet was hit and miss and the wired connection was next to the plasma TV. There wasn't a desk, so I had some challenges taking care of business while I was here. The restaurants are a hit and miss on service. Baleen is expensive but has a decent menu. I recommend eating outside if the weather is pleasant, especially when the sun begins to set. Again, higher prices but the quality is there. The bar/lounge is OK and where I had the most issue with service. It took a while to get seated. The first time I was there, the waiter seemed to forget about me in favor of a larger group. The second time, I ate at the bar and it was much better. Again, this is a resort hotel. You pay for everything, including parking, which can be wonky with the numbered spots. This is away from San Diego proper -- about 15 minutes from the Gaslamp District -- but there are a few restaurants close by that are good if you want to take a break from eating at the resort. The biggest drawback is that the property is spread out so much and it's easy to get lost. Some of my group were concerned about walking alone late at night. The biggest plus for the property is the bell staff who have golf carts to help you with your luggage and to direct you to your room. These guys are really the unsung heroes of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous resort hotel for the family”
Reviews.Author: aurigin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for a family vacation. No need to leave the hotel - everything you need for a beach vacation is here. For those that want to venture out, attractions are walking distance or a short drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Oldie but Goodie”
Reviews.Author: Glenn0909
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at this hotel on our 25th wedding anniversary some 23 years ago so you can see that it has been there awile. Although old, it has been very well taken care of. The hotel itself sets right on Mission Bay and has easy access to the world fameous San Diego Zoo, Baboa Park with its many museums,San Diego's Old Town, and Sea World. We also took a short day trip to the San Diego Zoo Safari Park. The hotel grounds are beautiful and well taken care of. It is not inexpensive. In addition to the rate we were quoted, we found out when we got there that there was a $15.00 per night resort fee. If you have a special occasion that you are celebrating, it is great. If you are visiting San Diego to see the sights, you may want to book something closer to downtown (we took a hop-on/hop-off bus tour and it was great). If you are water oriented, you can rent both sail and power boats at the hotel or use one of the many pools that are spread throughout the grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: Diego1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of places around San Diego but Paradise Point is truly unique. Stayed here for the SD marathon and was surprised at how easy it was to access everything in San Diego. Very centrally located and the times I took a cab it was easy and reasonably priced. Overall it's a very nice place, very quiet, clean and a lot of privacy. That's just about all you can ask for, right? I didn't explore much of the grounds but they have all kinds of private beach areas, fire pits and a lot of watercraft. Looks pretty fun and I'll definitely take one of those barges out for a spin next time I'm in town. Thanks for a great stay Paradise Point!

Reviews.Title: “Truly the best family vacation we have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: randysamroper
Reviews.Content: Let's keep it real shall we. I was a bit sceptical when I first booked my reservation in May of 2011 due to a large percentage of negative comments about the place. We decided to give the guys at Paradise a try. Man are we glad we did. We spent five days there and we were bummed when it was time to leave. This island paradise is conveniently located near Sea World and Mission Beach, and it is breathtaking. The landscaping and wildlife alone is incredible, you truly get lost in an island paradise. I have to telll you that this is not a typical skyscraper hotel with huge lobbies and long hallways. This bungalow style community is a different type of experience, all the units are single storied buildings. The ownership/management group has obviously spent a great deal of time and money converting this community into something really special. Having trouble getting some gratitiude from your kids? Take them here to Paradise.... There is so much to do and see and so close to the beach and all the activities it can be hard to see it all. This place is the real deal. Thanks Paradise, see you next time.

Reviews.Title: “Phenominal!!!”
Reviews.Author: Heathvee123
Reviews.Content: I was scared for over a year to go here because some of the reviews I read. I took a plunge when the kids wanted to go to seaworld!! They want to go back NOW... right this very second!!! The place was amazing!!! Absolutely GORGEOUS!!!! Nothing like you will ever stay at!!! They have everything there to do & the beach is amazing!! I recommend jet skiing!!! The food is to die for & the service was out of this world!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: grampsg
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel, the staff is fantastic, and the location is terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Staycation fun in San Diego!!!”
Reviews.Author: schtuhead
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point is a great place for children and families. We loved the pools, beach and the kids really loved the Lagoon!!! Our room was pleasant and quiet. We will book another stay-cation sometime soon!!

Reviews.Title: “It has potential, but they have a long way to go”
Reviews.Author: travelmama36
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great Location, lush beautiful landscaping. The kids had a great time in the heated pool. Cons: 1.Understaffed; we called several times before anyone answered. We didn't even get an answering service, the phone rang and rang. 2. We got there late and had dinner at the Barefoot cafe 25 minutes before closing, one of the restaurants on their property. We were urged to be quick by the hostess and server they were eager to leave on time. THe server was impatient taking our order and kept clicking his pen and sighing. THe seat cushions,( without any cushion whatsoever) were absolutely filthy! My tomato bisque soup tasted like pasta sauce and we paid $78.00 for two kids mac and cheese a bowl of soup and an fish entree. 3. The shower still had hair from whomever used it before us and the showerhead had very low water preasure. 4. The entrance door to the room is glass with a very thin white curtain that you can see through, so you will be wakened every morning by the blazing light. 5. The walls are not sound proof! We could hear our honeymooner neighbors getting busy every night! His coughing kept him up all night and us too!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Paradise...”
Reviews.Author: poohbear1980
Reviews.Content: Pros: Jesus gives an amazing massage. The location is great and our bungalow was right on the beach. Cons: Our room was outdated and dirty. Got in bed and discovered ants all over it. Also found them in my suitcase. There was a very strong, bad smell that wouldn't go away. Everything is pricey (restaurant, spa services, daily fees...). Not a 4-star resort, maybe 3. Would not stay here again and considered leaving early.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice placr”
Reviews.Author: Jessalas
Reviews.Content: the resort was very beautiful and the staff was very kind and helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort - we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: shell7020
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our six day stay at Paradise Point. From the first day to the last, every member of the staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was wonderful, and was cleaned daily in a manner that exceeded our expectations. The plants, trees and flowers throughout the resort were beautiful, reminding us of a tropical paradise. Even though we stayed over Memorial Day weekend, the resort did not seem crowded or noisy. When we walked to the island market or by one of the swimming pools, we noticed a lot of people, but the way the bungalows are laid out on the property, it makes you feel somewhat private and isolated, which we liked. We had a garden room which is not along the beachfront, but the beach was just a short walk away. Our room did have a lagoon off our patio, with a cute family of ducks that came by several times a day to see if we happened to have treats for them, which we had purchased at the island market! The view from our patio was peaceful and beautiful. We ate twice at the Barefoot Bar & Grill; the service and food was wonderful! The gentleman at the Coffee Bar was great also! We called the concierge for tourist advice several times, and they were very helpful. The bell staff was informative and welcoming, especially Fernando, who greeted us every morning with a warm hello when we arrived at the main resort area. Everyone working at Paradise Point appears to LOVE their job! The only negative feeling we had was regarding transportation. We were wishing the resort had a shuttle service to transport guests to the downtown area at least, because we ended up spending a lot of money on taxi service. We attempted to take the local city transportation system with a $5 per day pass. The price was right, but it took us 90 minutes of bus and trolley riding to get to the zoo. The city bus driver was less than helpful and not very friendly. We ended up walking around the transit station for a while until we found a transit official who offered us a map and further information. This does not reflect poorly on the resort, but made us wish Paradise Point offered a shuttle service. We enjoyed Paradise Point very much, and would definitely stay there again in the future if we ever visit San Diego again!

Reviews.Title: “Overly priced and poor service resort, which should be rated no more than two and half stars.”
Reviews.Author: Fortgreener
Reviews.Content: My husand and i stayed there for my marathon run during the rock and roll marathon. We first got to the garden view room we booked. As soon as i got there i found there is a big dust with hair ball in the room so i didnt even want to unpack. Then we turned on the shower which i got an headache right the way because it made such a loud noice. The next day, i complained to the front desk, who quickly offered to upgrade us to a differet room. This quick update was the best service during our whole stay. They dont clean the room unless you put the service request out or even though they "clean" it there were still empty beer and water bottles left where you left them or the sticky bathroom floor due to spraying sun lotion would remain sticky after the clean. Finally, your bill would have extra 50 or so extra per night due to 25 parking fee, 15 resort fee and some misc fees. You suppose can park at your own parking spot but if your room is close by the restaurants or conference room like ours, poeple woundnt know that as there was no sign about that rule. As a result we always need to look for parking. When i told the recepionist when i check out about the parking situation, all she said was "ok". I would not return to this resort even though they upgrade to the president suite.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty...Terrible Customer Service...Still Waiting on Deposit....”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTrav111
Reviews.Content: To begin with we paid in advance on Priceline and arrived late. We gave the "resort" our bank card for incidentals and they charged us $100 for a deposit because we did not use a credit card. It was late, my husband was tired and he just handed them the card we used to pay for the room. BIG MISTAKE. Parking fees are a joke. We rented one movie. I am still waiting on the rest of the $50 plus dollar deposit that was left. I have called and called and called. I have left messages and sent an email and we still do not have our money back and it was over 3 weeks ago! They keep returning my call with an over the top sweet message to please call them back almost as if they are mocking me. Why do I need to call them them back. They KNOW what I want AND EVERYTIME you call them you get the machine. The sheets were disgusting. I changed them MYSELF and the room floor was so gross I had to wear my shoes. Do not get me started on the gross stuff on the bathroom wall. DO NOT STAY HERE! At one time I am sure that it was a very nice place, but not now.

Reviews.Title: “Like Maui in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: joncrx
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our time at Paradise Point. Ample room to wander in beautiful surroundings, great views and delicious smores. My wife and I actually had a problem with our shower not being that hot on our first day. Matt Quick, the rooms manager, was prompt, and more than helpful to resolve it with a beautiful room that had the working hot water, and one incredible view. We'll definitely go back and will be looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: momof4invegas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to San Diego for a four-day anniversary weekend. Having never been to the area, we chose Paradise Point because it looked cozy and seemed like a safe bet for a nice room and facilities. Plus, we were traveling over Memorial Day weekend, and I'd heard the beach areas got very busy. The private beaches and marina seemed promising. Our room was a regular garden view with king bed. It was nice enough, but nothing extraordinary. There was a coffee pot, a safe and a small, dorm-sized fridge, which we didn't discover until our last day because it was designed to look like a door on the desk. Had we actually used the fridge, it would have been nice to have a microwave available, but there was not one. The best part of our stay, hands down, was the room service. We ordered breakfast every morning, and I was skeptical about the prices being a good value...but they were. Everything we order was delicious, they were quickly delivered, and the portions were huge. Two of the days, we didn't even eat again until dinner because we were so full. The main pool was heated, but not the smaller pools in each grouping of rooms. The weather was uncooperative that weekend, so the unheated pools were out of the question. There was plenty of room in the main pool, but we didn't swim because it was where everyone had headed and we were looking for something more private without children splashing about (ours were staying with grandma). We visited the onsite store (The Island Market) several times. It was well stocked with snacks, souvenirs, and trinkets. They were priced as you would expect at a resort. The Barefoot Bar and Grill was a nice place to hang out if you are staying on the resort, but in retrospect, I'm sorry we wasted a meal there when there are so many choices in town. We walked past the marina, but it seemed to be mostly small boats and a couple of jet skis. We were more interesting in snorkeling and parasailing, so we ended up going to the public beaches anyway. About the only thing we did on the resort was renting bikes one day (I think they were about $20/per hour for each bike). The resort website is deceptive in this area because they provide a very detailed map of Mission Bay bike paths, but when you fill out the rental contract, there is a section which states you can't take the bikes off their property. It was okay, but you can only do so many laps around the parking lots. I would have enjoyed it much more if we'd been able to go cruise along the beaches just across the street. If I could do this over, I would walk over to the beach and look for a bike rental off-property or bring our own. In hindsight, I probably wouldn't stay here again. Our total bill for 2 people for 3 nights was just over $1,000. That included our three breakfasts, 2 in-room movies, $25 parking per day, and a resort fee (maybe $15 per day?). Considering that there were so many fun things to do in the San Diego area, we didn't spend $1,000 worth of time here. What little we did do (eating and bikes) was extra anyway. Next time we come to San Diego, I will have a better idea of the "nice" areas and the areas I wish to avoid and will just book a regular hotel with a year-round indoor pool! The "resort & spa experience" really doesn't justify the premium price of this location over any nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous fees, in the middle of nowhere, kind of a rip-off”
Reviews.Author: pickyeaterblog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at paradise point over the Memorial Day Holiday for a wedding. Other than the fact that the hotel is located right on the water and is a great location for a wedding, everything else about our stay was an absolute disappointment. To start - our arrival experience was sub-par. We arrived somewhat late at night (around 10pm) -- and we were checked in extremely quickly and given almost no information by the front desk. Key things that were omitted included: 1) We weren't given a map of the property or told what was on the property or available for us to use 2) We were led to believe that the "passport to paradise" services (internet, phone, fitness center, etc.) were free when in fact they are not - you get charged $15 extra per day whether you use them or not! How outrageous is that? Then we were told to "wait outside and the bell staff will be right with you to take you to your room." We ended up waiting for almost 30 minutes with no updates from the front desk on where the bell staff was or when they would be arriving, we weren't invited to wait inside where it was warm - we were standing outside in the cold because we thought the bell staff would arrive any minute to take us to our room. It sucked. Then - our room: The main issue we had with our room was that when we arrived, the body wash in the shower was basically just water -- and when we alerted the housekeeping staff of this issue they said they'd refill it but they never did. I ended up using the shampoo as my "body wash" for our entire stay. Also it's clear that the facilities are old and only parts have been renovated -- case in point: the shower water pressure was pretty bad and the shower head was not adjustable at all and super high up and kind of crooked which was frustrating for me as I'm only 5'0 and the entire shower went right over my head. Also - the drain in our bathtub was really gross looking - it had rust all over it and was clearly part of the "original" pre-renovated room. Now the random added fees. I already mentioned this before - but let me reiterate what a rip-off this hotel is. First - the room itself costs at least $220 / night. And this is just for a basic room. Then - the "passport to paradise" - we weren't told that we'd be charged $15 per day ($45 total) for these services whether we used them or not. We were led to believe that they would be free when we checked in. We didn't bring our laptops so we didn't use the internet, and we only made one phone call during our stay. We didn't use the fitness center or any of the other amenities as we were there for a wedding and didn't have time to use the facilities. This was completely misleading and unacceptable - and we felt totally ripped off. There are also random "resort" fees that get added to your bill every day that you don't know about and aren't told about when you check in. Room service is pretty slow (and as with all room services, totally overpriced). One morning I just ordered tea for two people - and it took 35 min to arrive at the room. I was also slightly annoyed that when I requested milk instead of cream with my tea that I was charged extra for it ($3.50 extra) Also - as with all room services - the service charge & additional fees applied to the bill are way too expensive. Next - the location. This hotel is in the middle of NOWHERE. We were staying at the hotel for a wedding, and we were there for 4 days. The hotel has basically 2 restaurants on-site - and for 4 days, you really can't just eat at two restaurants the entire time. All food options are a $25 cab ride away (or you have to rent a car - which we hadn't - so we ended up forking over the cash just to get a meal that was different from the two menus available to us at the hotel). The hotel doesn't really give you any helpful transportation tips on how to get to the downtown area of SD without spending a ton of money either. Overall I wouldn't recommend staying here. There are a ton of other great hotels in San Diego that will probably give you much better value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: ArtandNancy
Reviews.Content: The resort was full of beautiful gardens and waterways. You can easily walk around the property to the various pools, gardens and along the bay watching the sailboats and such. Although we did experience a couple of issues when we first arrived the Supervisor of the Front Desk, Priscilla Garcia, attended to our concerns and moved us to a more peaceful area in the resort. We do understand that some disruptions can not be avoided but she was not only willing but able to make our stay more comfortable. We were also able to go to the Bare Foot Bar on the property for an evening of socialization and breakfast also. The staff was excellent and the food was very good, they do not skimp on the portions. Overall we enjoyed our stay at this resort and would definetly stay here again. You can spend your whole vacation there and never leave the property although they are very close to places like Sea World, the San Diego Zoo and many Museums.

Reviews.Title: “The Prettiest Rip-Off in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: i983Jen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Paradise Point for the long Memorial Day weekend. After 6 hours on airplanes, we arrived at the hotel just ahead of the 4pm check-in time. The front desk told us their computer systems were down, and they were unable to accommodate us. They did not offer to hold our luggage or invite us to relax by the pool; it was "Sorry, come back later!" When we returned after 4pm, there were lines of frustrated guests in the lobby waiting to check in - plenty of people were as unimpressed as we were. Previous reviews are correct about the outrageous parking fee - it is $25 per night. This would be reasonable if Paradise Point was within walking distance to anything in San Diego and we could leave the car behind, but it's not. The hotel is set back quite a distance from downtown or the beaches. The fee was a surprise to us. We had booked the hotel through Orbitz and thought we were paid in full, so we weren't happy. There is also abundant parking - every room has an assigned spot, there's a large general parking area, and a large parking lot for the banquet hall. Parking's not at a premium so it just felt like a big rip-off. Speaking of ridiculous fees, this hotel charges for EVERYTHING. Internet has a fee. LOCAL telephone calls are $1 for the first 30 minutes, and $0.10/minute after that. Fitness center is $12/day (but it's free if you spend $75 in the spa!). It even costs money to play basketball. We joked that we wouldn't turn on the TV because they probably charged for basic cable. To add insult to injury, the room is stingy with extras. We had no soap in the bathroom, no lotion, no water bottles, and no robes. Housekeeping didn't show up until 5:30pm on our last full day (and didn't collect our neighbors' dirty room service dishes for 2 full days. Gross.) The most deceptive fee of all is the daily resort fee of $15 per day. Upon check in, you receive a "passport" that says for $15/day, guests receive internet, free use of the fitness center, free outdoor games, free local phone calls, and a few extras. It's worded to make you believe that you need to ASK for this bundle, so my husband and I purposely avoided all of those things to avoid the fee. We had already paid for the room once and were annoyed by the secret parking fee, so imagine our surprise when our check-out statement had the $15/day fee, for an extra $90. When my husband went to the front desk to complain, the girl admitted that lots of guests were surprised by the extra $40/day (parking + resort fee), but there was nothing she could do. In all fairness, the hotel is very pretty and well-manicured. The pools and spas are nice, Barefoot Bar & Grill is a decent place to eat, and the beds were very comfortable. But we just couldn't get past the feeling of being nickel-and-dimed to death. Basically, a very pretty, very overpriced, and borderline deceptive resort. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service and Outrageous Fees”
Reviews.Author: beta1839
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to stay at this resort but are quite turned off by their poor customer service and all of the fees that we are forced to pay. After leaving our room at 9am yesterday and returning after 6pm it was still not serviced by the housekeeping staff. Called to get fresh towels and not even an apology was offered. Returned to room again today and the beds were made but trash cans still full. Once again, no apology from maid service or front desk. The fees here are also outrageous. $25 per day just to park your car here. That is $10 to $15 high. The mandatory $15 resort fee is a little high but atleast you get something out of it. The parking is just a way to stick it to you. Will have to see if things get better but it is looking like we will switch back to Dana Point and not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixing Business with Pleasure was easy at Paradise Point!”
Reviews.Author: tgduran
Reviews.Content: I was on site for a conference held at The Paradise Point resort and it was such a fantastic experience. While there were over a 1000 people in attendance, the property maintained a sense of privacy and relaxation that combined business with pleasure to the max.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: Sharpgeorge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I met at this hotel 33 years ago. I was the Security Director and she was a server at the Barefoot Bar. We have been married 32 years. This is the first time we stayed there as guests. The landscaping is amazing. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The restaurants are top shelf. Once you drive in and park your car its like you are on an island. There is no need to leave the hotel. Everything you could want is there.

Reviews.Title: “5 year old surprise birthday party”
Reviews.Author: Kidang
Reviews.Content: I decided to take our family to Paradise Point to celebrate my daughter's birthday. We had a bayside premier room that was breathtaking. Fireplace, flat screen TV, jacuzzi bathtub, among other amenities. We invited a few families to share the day with and they were so impressed with the grounds and location and the room. We definitely would come back again. My son and I got to feed the ducks and fish which was quite an experience. One of the ducks was so friendly, it ate from his hand. We played a round of golf on the putting green. We only live 5 minutes away, but it felt like we were on vacation on a tropical island. Loved it and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely tropical escape”
Reviews.Author: 1WineLover54
Reviews.Content: Coming up the drive to the "lobby area" of the hotel is impressive. Very lush and tropical. The hotel is secluded, the closest area is Sea World., which makes it nice for families. One of the first things you notice, besides all the flowers and trees is the people riding "surries" or bikes thru the property. Then you see people playing miniature golf on a small course that is along the side of the entrance road. No windmills or water hazards, just little putting greens connected like links of a regular golf course. Next to the lobby is a lovely large lagoon with waterlilys and plenty of fish and water fowl. The lobby is a little dated, but according to the front desk staff, will be renovated sometime soon. Next to the lobby is a market and gift shop that has lots of cool things to tempt you. The bike/Surrey rental area is right next door. The fine dining restaurant, Baleen is a short walk from the lobby and the prices are not too bad. The most expensive is the Steak and Lobster at over $50.00. Not too far from their is the waterside restaurant that is open all day. Not a huge selection but the 4 cheese grilled cheese with Tomato Basil soup combo is excellent. Be aware of the heron's, they like to snatch food off your plates. Didn't see this first hand, but was advise to watch out for this one sneaky bird who liked to surprise you and make off with part of your meal. The rooms are 1950's bungalows that have been updated inside. Very Hawaiian themed with cheery bright yellow walls. There are refrigerators in the rooms, which makes it nice to keep your leftovers or a bottle of wine. The coffee makers are the type that use the coffee pods and make either one or two cups at a time. The beds were incredibly comfortable. Housekeeping comes by later in the afternoon,evening offering robes to be used during your stay. The sink area is very small. Barely big enough for one person to put their items on, much less two. The lighting is terrible, until you realize that the hotel is using the CFL lightblubs that take a while to warm up and brighten up. They don't offer little bottles of shampoo, conditioner and body wash. They have gone green and installed bottles of aforementioned items in the shower area. Body lotion is not offered. Most if not all rooms have a patio of sorts. It is either in the front of the room, or our the back door. Ours was out the back door and over looked a pond with a fountain and was right next to one of the many pools on the property. Two Adirondake chairs and a small table were on the small patio. No fencing between the patios but it felt secluded anyway. Nice little area to sit, drink a glass of wine and read a book or visit with a loved one or friend. Each room is assigned their own parking space number that matches their room number. The meeting rooms were very nice and plentiful. Many options for a business meeting, a wedding or a prom. (all of which were going on during our stay). While the resort is spreadout, you can easily walk from anywhere on the property to the meeting rooms, and if you have driven to the hotel, you could always drive from your room to the meeting area. Very pretty place, very nice people and I will be back very soon! P.S. this property used to be the Vacation Village in its former life.

Reviews.Title: “"Tres Beau Sejour"”
Reviews.Author: normpich
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this Resort was "Superb", and the weather complemented the Flora/Fauna/ ambiance of tranquility in excellent facilities, with a Bay/Ocean view, offered by very few Hotels in, and outside the San Diego area. This is my 2nd and definetely, not my last!!

Reviews.Title: “We will definately be back!”
Reviews.Content: This was a great vacation place for a family. We stayed in a bungalow on the bay. The water was calm and perfect for small children. We brought our own toys - kayak and paddle boards. The pool was warm and perfect for our small kids. Outdoor beach showers would be a great addition! Also brooms in the condos would be great although they do offer maid service, it would be nice with kids to stay on top of the sand! The Barefoot Restaurant was great - great service and food. Marc the shuttle driver was the most personable guy we have come by traveling! We used the fire pit for smoores every night and met great people during our stay! We rented bikes, played minigolf.....We will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “i love it!!”
Reviews.Author: Boomer1971
Reviews.Content: my honey and i spent 4 awesome days at the resort. didnt want to leave. so much to do. love the lush tropical landscape, quiet too. my favorite the fire-pits on the beach. great food at barefoot bar. ate there many times. the rooms were clean and inviting. we stayed at lanai garden so pretty. thank u. we will be back. great birthday present to me. got to see grandkids too. family friendly pool. and close to mission bay. liked that. :)

Reviews.Title: “Radical San Diego Resort”
Reviews.Author: TahoeRick
Reviews.Content: I made the trip down to San Diego from Lake Tahoe, Ca and was not dissapointed with my stay at Paradise Point. My girlfreind and I, along with her friend/roommate, stayed there for my birthday and couldn't have been more pleased. We had a casita on the beach with our own private patio and lawn connecting to the sand. The room was perfect and very clean with well sized flat screen TV's in both the living room and bedroom. The bathroom well excellent and came complete with the two seperate sink/vanity areas. However, the main point of note was the customer service. The desk had beer delivered from their store directly to our patio area so we could conitnue enjoying ourselves, they fixed the sink we broke within minutes of calling down to the desk, and one of their staff even took our inner tubes to a compresser for us to fill them up with air without us even asking. All in all this was a great to spend a few days and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a great time in SD.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to vacation for romance or family fun!”
Reviews.Author: waltnshell
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff from check in to check out were exceedingly helpful and friendly. Housekeeping and groundskeepers are doing a wonderful job. We had a wonderful time and will happy to come back to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family resort or a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: kaciep
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon night here 5 years ago and have been back a handful of times...now with our children. We are never disappointed. The resort is warm, inviting and casually elegant, the staff is gracious and helpful and the food is excellent. I can not think of a nicer place to stay when you are in San Diego. Also, the location is a short walk or 5 minute drive to Sea World and not far from the San Diego Zoo and Balboa Park.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing environment”
Reviews.Author: AnnMarieGottlieb
Reviews.Content: When my family decided that we could get away for a few days, but didn't have time to fly anywhere for a lengthy stay, we knew that the only place in the area where we could go and really feel that we were truly away from it all, was Paradise Point. We have stayed there several times in the past, and we have always felt as if we are a world away from our hectic lives. This time was no different. Matthew, the rooms manager, was very helpful in recommending the perfect accomodations to meet our needs. He hit the nail on the head (Thanks Mathew!) Our bungalow was right on the beach, our kids could play on the beach and we could see them from our room, we were close to the pool and store, and best of all the bungalow had been newly remodeled - it was just gorgeous! As always we had a very relaxing stay at Paradise Point and would highly recommend it to anyone who wants to get away from it all!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: 4Traveling4
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our two night stay at a Lanai Garden room in Paradise Point. The highpoint of our stay was the sailboat trip we made on the bay; absolutely awesome! Boats were in good shape and service was very friendly. The Barefoot restaurant makes very good burgers (my husband had the same one two nights in a row) and is an adventure on its own with the creepy looking birds preying on your food and the leopard sharks and bat rays swimming right behind you. Obviously, very good times with an 8 and a 6 year old! A thing that we really appreciate; the hotel is trying to go "greener" than the average hotel, which makes you feel good about your choice of luxury. Our room was clean and was a joy to come back to after the maid had been in. We'd go again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time, great location”
Reviews.Author: vinas12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in a lanai bayside room. Paradise Point is in an excellent location, minutes from Pacific Beach and downtown San Diego. We had a fabulous time at the resort - the rooms were clean and room service came once during our stay. The drinks at the pool side bar are decently priced and stiff! We had a great time - the only down side, there should be black out curtains on the back and front door. It was VERY bright early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for a family vacation, very child-friendly”
Reviews.Author: Dg6yhw11
Reviews.Content: We had 2 adjoining suites right on the beach. The rooms were large, the bathrooms nice with 2 separate vanities and closets. Furniture was first-rate. Free internet and iPhone-friendly alarm clock, and OK TV on large screens - signal quality varied by channel. Each suite had a tiny kitchenette and a large dining-room table that easily held 4 adults and a toddler's high chair. The master bed was extremely comfortable and the overall impression was almost bucolic. Ducks wandered in the grass, there were fire-pits and the sand. Even the Heat and A/C was not the usual railroad-train quality, but were quiet and even had a fresh-air option. The rooms were very quiet. So quiet that we didn't even know that a prom party with over 80 people was just next door until a HS Senior asked if they had kept us awake!
