The staff was very friendly and helpful, all the staff, not just the front-desk and wait staff. Even the landscapers and cleaning staff smiled and said hello. We used room service for breakfast a few times. They were friendly and fast, the food was good and delivered hot. Did I mention that it is within walking distance of Sea-World? My son walked it with ease. I downgraded the resort for its restaurants of which we tried two, a casual one with a beachy theme, and a white tablecloth starched-napkin variety. Both feature extremely-high prices. The casual restaurant is in serious need of updating. The bench seats on the booths are padded with worn-out paper thin cushions that might as well not be there. The menu was dull as was the actual food. The drinks were watery. Apparently room service comes from the same kitchen - it is 10 times better. Also, there's a live band on Saturday night. The other restaurant is very much a mixed bag and almost seems to depend on the waiter. We ate there twice. The first time were were served by Brent and the experience was worth every cent of the $100 each we spent. Drinks were strong and well prepared, the appetizers arrived quickly and were delicious. Same goes for the main and dessert courses. Our second experience there was the dinner from hell. The drinks and appetizers went fine. Then we were forgotten. Really. After 3/4 hour my son had to take his toddler son back to the room. I finally managed to attract our waiter from the night before who brought over the manager. He really didn't seem to get it saying that my grandson's food was brought quickly (true). We did eventually get our main courses and the bill was discounted but I would not recommend eating there if they're busy. We didn't try any of the many other amenities. This is a great place to bring the family. Kids can play in the sand, the bay is smooth a glass most of the time, and Sea World is nearby. The area is safe and the staff is alert, both very important to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great birthday present”
Reviews.Author: SeaDog24
Reviews.Content: Our kids got us a weekend at Paradise Point for my wifes birthday.We arrived about an hour before check-in time.At the desk they gave my wife some cookies because it was her birthday.They then informed us that they were upgrading us from a bayside bungalow,to "The Governors Suite". WOW!!! That place is huge.The view was great ,and just steps from the beach.The only problem now is that we are completely spoiled!! We had a great time and the staff there was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: RShepard
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort! On arrival we were greeted by 6 baby ducks at our door, that continuously visited throughout our stay. The island reminded us of Hawaii where my husband lived for many years and yet it is just a few miles from our house, what a perfect staycation. We ate a Barefoot Bar and Grill numerous times during our stay and the food was always amazing. we especially like the breakfast, the Green Eggs and Ham and Blueberry Muffin Pancakes were our favorite...we had to order them every time! It was nice that there were multiple pools so if you didn't want the hustle of the main pool there were places to escape. Personal suggestion, bring your bike or rent one, it is a great way to get around. Also Paddle boarding is great fun!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: 2totravell
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful time at Paradise Point Resort. We stayed a week and also brought along our entire family including grandchildren. We found the grounds to be absolutely beautiful and very well tended. The staff upon arrival were very helpful and extremely gracious in helping our large group. The resort has recently completed a renovation which was very noticeable. There are a few things still needing to be updated, but a conversation I had with a resort marketing rep assured me that these items would be completed within a few months. Our stay was not affected in the least. The rooms were clean and as shown in the pictures we had seen online. The kids really enjoyed the pool and beaches. I can't say enough about the friendliness of the entire staff that we interacted with. Even the barista at the coffee bar remembered our coffee preference in the mornings. The dining was somewhat pricey, but the food and service were great. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dirty room, hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: jerretired
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled 3 thousand miles to celebrate our 40th anniversary. The location of the resort was wonderful. Upon arrival, the desk clerk informed us that the parking fee was $25 per night. We were able to negotiate it down to $15. She then informed us that the "Passport to Paradise" package fee was $25 per night. This was a fee for using things like the pool, tennis courts, putting course, etc. I informed her that we wouldn't be using these facilities but it didn't matter. She said the fees were automatic, whether we used them or not. Again, we were able to negotiate it down to $15. So right off the bat, $150 (plus tax) would be added to our prepaid bill before we even got to see our room. Upon arrival to our room, we discovered that the TV did not work. After calling the desk an engineer came and had to fix it and replace the remote. After touring around during day 2, we arrived at our room late afternoon to discover that the air conditioning did not work. After calling the desk and waiting 45 mins. the engineer came and told us that the air conditioner needed to be replaced. Another hour wait ensued and the job was done. Also, every day when I stepped into the shower, dirt would wash off from the soles of my feet to the drain. Interesting because the only place I went barefoot was in my room. So much for efficient maid service. I write this review only because I hope that maybe someone would get the message and possibly use some the "extra fee $" to replace worn out utilities and hire more or better maid service.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise point is the most amazing, relaxing beautiful resort ever!”
Reviews.Author: sharivizz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 11 year old son just got back from a 4 night stay at Paradise Point Resort in San Diego. First off let me start by saying our son has Asperger's (high functioning autism). We were really wanting a vacation since it had been over five years since we'd taken a "real" vacation. Our son likes places that are nice and quiet and not too noisy. After doing some research on the Internet I thought that Paradise Point sounded like a perfect fit for our family. I had read some negative reviews on here before we left so I have to admit I was a tiny bit apprehensive but let me put those fears to rest for you. Paradise Point is the ultimate resort! They have everything!! They have five amazing pools, two awesome restaurants (with gorgous water views), and a beautiful private beach that stretches all around the property. They have firepits all along the beach as well and you and your family can make schmores there at night. The room we had was absolutely amazing!! We were steps from the beach and we had a beautiful room equipped with a fridge, king bed, computer table, nice dressers and two big screen tv's! We were thrilled!! We had a beautiful deck equipped with patio chairs that we sat in every day. Our son loved the fact that there were ducks wandering all over the property and was ecstatic that the same group of three ducks came to our door everyday!! You can buy some food at the gift shop and feed them. Very reasonable price at only $1.50 per bag. Now I mentioned before that our son has high functioning autism so we found this resort to be perfect for children with special needs because of the serenity of it all. Definately not overstimulating and noisy. I have to also mention that I believe this resort is perfect for ANY family!! I think kids of all ages would love it! We are already planning our next trip back!! The customer service is impeccable and all of the employees go above and beyond to meet your needs. They can pick you up in golf carts at any time to take you and your family to one of the pools or dinner..etc. Did I mention there is an awesome store there with everything you could possibly need? My husband and son bought me a beautiful bracelet for an early mother's day gift! Oh and so many activities.... Bike rentals, mini golf, basketball and more!! Not to mention the onsite marina with boat and jet ski rentals. This was the most awesome vacation we have ever been on and I want to spread the word!! Go to Paradise Point for your next vacation!! The location is perfect too!! Two minutes from Seaworld!! Last but definately not least the manager Pat is really awesome! He makes sure everything is running smoothly and that your happy. We love Paradise Point!!!! :) oh forgot to mention the cleaning lady we had was extremely friendly and efficient. Our room was spotless everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: adamsmail
Reviews.Content: The excellent service started with the reservation personnel. We booked two rooms with Amy's help and it was hard because we had a long list of what we wanted location wise on a busy weekend. She spent a good amount of time with me making sure it was all just right. We had a wonderful stay and we will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “It's "paradise" at Paradise Point !!”
Reviews.Author: Darrydo
Reviews.Content: I LOVE Paradise Point and have stayed there often. I live only a few blocks away but with the beautiful grounds and rooms I may as well be transported to (mentally) many miles away and I'm home in a few minutes. If you're coming from out of town and it's your first visit you will be in heaven !

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: pooltimeya
Reviews.Content: LOVED this resort. I came with my young daughter and other famiy members and this suited all of our needs. Loved spending time at the resort and it was very convient to head to activities in San Diego as well. If you want to enjoy your time in San Diego - this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “An anniversary to remember.”
Reviews.Author: JimJoannDiamondBarCA
Reviews.Content: We spent our 30th anniversary at Paradise Point and what a great decision it was! The hotel is impeccably decorated, the grounds are lovingly cared for and our accommodations were clean, large and the beautiful view of the bay was the icing on the cake. Thanks also to the great staff who made us feel very welcome. It really did feel like paradise and we will be back sooner than later.

Reviews.Title: “Love at first everything!”
Reviews.Author: adenunzio
Reviews.Content: The HJotel grounds, room, staff, location and amenities are incredible. AMAZING views make it even better. Loved out stay and we will definitley be returning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Great”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_Dawes
Reviews.Content: We were 95% happy with our experience at Paradise Point. The location was great (5 minutes from SeaWorld). The beach access was perfect. The rooms were nice, the staff was helpful and friendly, and the amenities were good. Our only complaint was that the floor in our room was very dirty. Hotel staff attributed this to dust from a blower used by the maintenance staff. Also, we found it almost impossible to keep sand out of the room because there is no outside shower or even hose to wash off the kids feet coming in from the beach. At the very least the hotel should include a broom and dustpan in each room so that guests can help keep sand outside. All in all, it was a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to get away in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: pboone01
Reviews.Content: With all the things to do and see in San Diego, why not stay at an island resort where you can truly relax with the beautiful scenery, multiple pools and hot tubs, fire pits, on the bay or at some of the pools and excellent restaurants. You also have the bay surrounding the resort where you can take those nice long walks, pick up some shells or rent some boats! The resort is no comparison to a hotel with thick walls where you don't hear anyone, no one in a room above you and the friendliest staff which I'm not saying this from a onetime visit but we have been there 6 times in 3 years and it's always first class service.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: lozzag2009
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed from the moment we arrived at this 'hotel'. After a late journey down from LA we were both tired and hungry and frustrated that no food what so ever was available at the hotel at any time after 10pm. We arrived at around 10:30pm and were given some Pizza take out menus - however these only deliver up to 11pm so no luck there. We had to wait 10 or 15 mins at this late time just to check in as well as the receptionist was dealing with a complaint on the phone - we should have realised then what we were in for. We stayed in a Lanai Garden Bungalow and it was GROSS. Extremely dirty - in fact there was dirty tissue stuck to the bathroom wall and previous guests shaving gel on the shower fitting for the entire 4 night stay. There were dead flies stuck to the ceiling of the bathroom too which was very unpleasant. My partner left a pile of coins - mixed currency on the side the first day when we were out - and out our return we were surprised to find that the maid had taken it! Fair enought it wasn't a huge amount of cash, but surely by the sheer volume of coins that were there was (50+) and the fact that we had not left would make it clear to the maid that this was NOT a tip? We would certainly not tip the LACK of cleaning anyway. Additionally - watch out for the refrigerator in your room. Ours was very loud, so much so that we needed to unplug it in order to get to sleep. We let the maintenance team know and they simply came over the necxt day and replugged it in. We left it unplugged for the remainder of our stay. The walls are also paper thin - if your neighbour runs their tap you'll surely be woken up - you can hear everything that it going on around you from the room which makes for some poor nights sleep and very little chance of a lie in. To sum up - this hotel is very beautiful on the outside (grounds / restaurants / lobby etc) - however the owners a clearly too tight to invest on the inside. Over priced and absolutely not 4*, more like 2*.

Reviews.Title: “A true and beautiful resort with all the amenities”
Reviews.Author: typomonkey
Reviews.Content: I went to Paradise Point Resort for Spring Break with my husband and teenagers. I did not expect the hotel to be as good as it was. It truly was a pleasure to stay here. Because the rooms are bungalow style, our stay was very peaceful with no noise issues the whole week. We were able to send the kids off on a surrey bike, they loved being free to roam without us. We felt comfortable to let them go on their own since the whole property is private. The rooms were newly renovated, and the theme was cute. The beds were super comfortable. There was plenty of towels, and drawer space. I loved the coffee makers- they were the single cup brew style, so the coffee would not get stale. The shampoo, conditioner, body soap were really nice- pump style so we did not run out. The 18-hole putt-putt golf was a fun bonus. We loved the beach, the water-sport rentals (we rented a speed boat and paddle boat at reasonable prices), the many pools and hot tubs dotted throughout the property, the beautiful park-like setting with water fountains and whimsical artwork all around, and the fire pits on the beach and some of the pool areas. I liked most that they did not enforce the pool hours in a super strict way; the guests that stayed on were very respectful of the quiet hours... it was a win-win. The poolside bar, waterfront cafe, and waterfront restaurant were all wonderful, good ambiance and good food (but a little overpriced). I bought multiple things from the store (including the replacement for a forgotten swimsuit), they had everything there; we even purchased zoo tickets from them since they were the better deal at the time. The negative drawback, was that they nickel-and-dimed their guests. They added a nightly parking charge and the prices in their restaurants and shop are high, we have no choice but to pay since the property is on an island. Still, the next time we are in San Diego, I will do my best to get a room at this hotel, God willing... since everyone in the family really enjoyed their time here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds - Not Clean - Rooms Run Down”
Reviews.Author: viper915
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in our recent two night stay at Paradise Point. Our family has been staying at this resort since our teenage kids were very young. The grounds are beautiful, the staff is very friendly, and the overall appearance of the resort is four star. We had a bayside bungalow and paid $650.00 per night. This is reviewed as a four star property and it is 2.5 stars as far as I am concerned. The cleanliness of the rooms was terrible. I agree with all of the "black feet" comments. The bathrooms are dingy, and the room smelled like mold and mildew. I kept the door open to air it out and tons of mosquitoes invaded the bungalow. My daughter has bites all over. I agree with lack of security and had reservations about letting our teenage daughters wander the property or the sit out on the beach in front of the bungalow as I saw so many people walking the beach - especially at night. My main complaint is the rooms. Very old and dingy for the prices they are charging. I will not be returning to Paradise Point.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: BillRhodeIsland
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and had some doubts. When we got there, it was obvious that it was not a brand new hotel. However the grounds are beautiful. When we got to our room, the air conditioner was making a racket. (The room was spectacular, though.) I thought that we were going to have problems, and I called the desk. Within 10 minutes two maintenance men were there. They said that they did not want to disturb us by working on it, so they replaced it with a brand new one, smiled and went on their way. Any time I asked for anything, the response was similar. It was taken care of right away and done right. The only problem I had was with wake-up calls. They missed two out of the three I requested. The resort is on an island in a tropical setting. I noticed one review that complained because there were bugs. I did see some. I also saw sea gulls, fish, and other types of wildlife that have a tendency to live in a place like that. I can live with that. Each day the room was spotless. I requested extra coffee each day. It was always there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location & beautiful! Not clean!”
Reviews.Author: taves7
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Paradise Point Resort. It was such a beautiful location and very centrally located. The front desk staff were so nice and helpful. The pools were nice, but the main pool was CRAZY with children. I went to the smaller pools to get away from the hubbub and relax in the hot tubs. Towels were provided, which is great, and our duck friends visited frequently. Everyone in my party liked the resort, but we were all disappointed with the lack of cleanliness in our room. We too experienced the black feet syndrome after walking around our room barefoot. Kleenix and toilet paper were not replenished. I had to beg for more towels before getting sent more. The maids didn't do a great job in cleaning up the bathroom, etc. They pretty much made our beds and took out the trash. We were very disappointed in this aspect of the resort. Our rooms were humid and the bathrooms were a tropical nightmare. The shower curtain couldn't contain the water so it would end up all over the floor. Crazy. The resort really is beautiful and we did head over to the Barefoot Bar. The bar was fun and had heat lamps to keep you warm at night. Enjoyed that. The business center charges an arm and a leg for internet access, FYI.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: Karla408
Reviews.Content: Resort is lovely. Well maintained. Gorgeous grounds filled with meandering pathways, ornamental ponds and tropical flowers. Fabulous location & scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Would not suggest a visit if you like cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: makememories00
Reviews.Content: Best way to review this resort is: Grounds-beautiful Main Pool-water was yellow and area was overcrowded Restaurants-excellent Rooms service-very good Locations-very convenient to Gas Lamp District, museums, Sea World, Legoland, airport Rooms-dated, had mini-kitchens but you can't cook unless you can only use a microwave, floors were so dirty that I made my children wear flip flops otherwise their feet were BLACK!!! Bathrooms were gross and minimal, beds were comfortable. Unfortunately I couldn"t get past the disgusting floor and would like other Moms with young children to know about it. Staff-very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Questionable cleanliness and somewhat poorly managed.”
Reviews.Author: Ribar1
Reviews.Content: We selected Paradise Point because of the 4-star rating and reasonable price. We found the grounds to be beautiful, but the hotel and room lacked the amenities I would expect with a 4-star hotel. The hotel room floor was filthy, and the room very humid. No amount of cold air could limit the condensation that formed on our windows and keep our clothes from feeling damp. Maid service never seemed to make it around to our room until late afternoon or evening. We often just sent them away because their timing was so poor. The hotel did not appear to be at capacity, so I was never sure why our room could not be tended to during the day. Twice we went to the outdoor bar and were told their would be a long wait - the first time we were told the wait would be over an hour. We found that curious as no other people appeared to be waiting for a seat and the restaurant was less than half full. The second time we inquired as to why there was a wait. Their response was that the kitchen was learning a new menu and could not handle a busy crowd. Huh??? How can an established business not be prepared to seat their guests. i could understand this with a small business but Paradise Point has a conference center on premise. And the menu was quite simple and not extensive - after all - it's a bar! How complicated can it be to make a pizza or tuna sandwich?

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, like a hidden island, beautifully charming”
Reviews.Author: 2thdiva
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 1st San Diego visit at this 4-star hotel via priceline. It was so worth it. It's truly a resort: after a busy day out and about, we came home to a very nice, clean, comfortable hotel, that's inviting from the entrance. Located across from the Mission Bay Beach & Sea World, and 15 min to La Jolla (north), and 10 min from downtown (south), Paradise is very conveniently located in San Diego. Here are the pluses: 1) Parking is right in front of our suites (5 yards). 2) beachfront view, peaceful, with walking/running trail 3) fire pits in the sand--we roasted marshmallows (and if your room is beachfront, perfect five star camping ground:) 4) plenty of activities to be outside: running/jogging, pedalling around the complex, kiting and segway renting along the Beach (across from hotel). 5) swimming or picnic-ing. 6) contemporary decor, marble bath, just as the photos on website. 7) the hotel staff waived our parking fee 8) free wi-fi! 9) one level rooms, no one is above you, and no noisy hallway like other high rise hotels. 10) we got free upgrade to Garden View! we were thrilled! One Negative: 1) you have to pay $12 to use the hotel's gym Will definitely try to stay at Paradise again!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Landscape but Pricey for a Resort”
Reviews.Author: lookingforthebeach
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week here with my wife and while we enjoyed ourselves, I'll have to admit, I was expecting more. Have you ever walked into a hotel and had to wait in line for a long time? I had to do that multiple times here. They never had more than two people working and for the life of me I never figured it out. Anyway, not a big deal in the grand scheme of things, just not the service I was expecting. Next, the room. We had a "garden" or non-beach room, but it ended up with a great view so we were pleased. The beach there is very nice, so again, great plus. The floors in the unit, however, were disappointing. They were dirty and I'm not sure when the last time was they were mopped and cleaned. To make matters worse, our ceiling in the bathroom had black stuff all over it along with yellow spots. It looked like no one had cleaned it for months. I was literally astounded, again, this is supposed to be a top-notch resort. I complained the next day and they fixed it right away - and did a great job. Other than that, the room was fine. There was wireless internet so that was great (it was free, or you could pay in your room for cat-5 connection.) The resort is very pretty. The landscaping is gorgeous and the pools and hot tubs were great. It's great for the kids as they have the "ocean-type" walk-in to the pool, if that makes any sense. All the kids were having a good time for sure. Major plus. On the flip side, and this could be just me so maybe this isn't an issue, but when I've stayed at other resorts, the reason why your room charge was so high is because everything is included. Not so here. You have to pay for everything: Bike rides, mini-golf, etc. You had to pay for internet (until I found the wireless internet the resort provided), and the gym was $12/day. I was really taken back by this, for when comparing it to say, Club Med, once you walk into the resort, everything is included. I know it's not apples-to-apples, but I think I was expecting a Club Med type service/situation and I just didn't get it. The food though was terrific. The grill was ok, but the Baleen was fantastic (pricey, but well worth it - Dinner and drinks for me and the wife was $120 before tip). All in all, it's a nice place. The beach looked nice, but it is so cold this time of year in SD don't even think about getting into the ocean. The resort seemed over-priced and I doubt I would return. It's ok, just nothing to write home about - and that's what I thought was getting. Maybe I'm the one in the wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Not luxurious enough for the money.”
Reviews.Author: MightyMFamily
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at this resort. I picked this hotel because of it's location and because we wanted a suite so we could attempt to sleep comfortably. (aside...it is really hard to find a suite with more than a king bed and pull out couch!). We had a beach side bungalow....but we weren't quite on the beach, just slightly off. The suite was spacious and provided plenty of room. Housekeeping was inconsistent. One day they didn't show up at all and I had to call (because the rooms are very humid when you are running the shower and it tends to stay that way all day we went through a lot of towels wiping up the bathroom floor). The curtains had mildew.....a result of the humidity of the room I am sure. Our floors were not (as far as I can tell) vacuumed. There was debris under the couch. We had a kitchenette...but there were no glasses ever provided to our room - and we saw them on the housekeeping cart so I know somebody gets actual glasses. We made do with paper coffee cups. The hotel grounds are beautiful and the staff is very friendly and helpful.. We had a wonderful trip. But overall we were disappointed with the housekeeping at our room. Oh - the pool bar service was a little disappointing too. I spent 3 different afternoons there and not ONCE did the waitress come and ask if I wanted to order anything. I'm fully capable of walking to the bar and getting my own drink, but still - I assume she was working for a reason. There was also a huge event at the hotel Saturday night and I wish we had somehow been informed that this was going to cause traffic and parking issues at the lobby/restaurant side. I would recommend this hotel....WITH reservations to consider. I think all their problems are fixable and from a prior review it sounds like they are working on it.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind dirty rooms you will enjoy your stay...Just keeping it real”
Reviews.Author: Tamerajean
Reviews.Content: My expectations were not high after reading resent reviews. I at this point didn't want to stay here but was stuck considering I paid for two rooms in advance with no refunds. When we arrived the front desk staff was really friendly and made you feel welcome. I told them we had two rooms and wanted connecting since one room was for the teenagers but I didn't want the room that was moldy smelling that I had read about in a resent review. She told us one of the rooms was ready but we had to wait a while for the second room to be cleaned. We went to the room to unload our luggage and take a peak at the room. No mold smell this was good, went to wash my hands and noticed the counter was dirty so I took one of there pretty white wash cloths to wash it down with and it turned black along with hair it picked up. Then a problem we could not live with: no connecting door for the kid’s room. So off we go back to the front desk, they were so nice and right away gave us another set of rooms. We are now loaded back up and head for the new rooms, we walk into the first room to be greeted by the smell of MOLD (they must have known this was a problem since they had the bathroom fan on) so off we go to get another set of rooms. This time a gentlemen helped me, he took off our parking charge and gave us a resort credit for the incontinence and offered to upgrade us to a nice room on the beach but we would be sleeping with the kids on a roll-away (give us one room instead of the 2 that we paid for). I declined since I didn't want to sleep with the teenage boys, so he gave us two rooms in the back 40. (We got to listen to the work crew cutting stuff up and trip over the extension cords left out across our walkway). By this time I was just done changing rooms and ready to get on with the vacation. The room was fine except they were so dirty, at first I thought well these just must not get used so it will be better tomorrow after they clean it. After returning the next day from our outing I noticed that nothing had been wiped down and they even left us with dirty glasses. We all were walking around that night in bare feet after showers not thinking the floors would be dirty, our feet turned black! So don't forget flip flops for everyone if you don't want to shower twice before bed. It was like this everyday, on day number 4 they didn't leave us clean wash cloths so I stopped by the front desk to ask for some explaining the reason about black feet. The supervisor talked to me telling me it was not expectable and she would have our room cleaned in detail the next day including getting those floors mopped. I then went to the spa to have a pedicure and manicure done for $258 why not since my floors would finally be clean (it was worth the cost Jennifer was amazing). Needless to say the cleaning we were told would be done WAS NOT. Dirty floors, dirty tub, dirty glasses, dirty counter tops, dirty chairs, and they never wipe down the tables in the rooms. Six blissful days of a dirty room, I'm just keeping it real. Love the fact too that a moldy butter knife set outside the front door on the ground for 6 days (it was there when we got there), you would think the housekeeper would at least pick it up after walking over it everyday. When we were leaving I told a housekeeper as she was going by, she says "NO NOT MY JOB". Upon check out they gave us that long excuse about the changes in housekeeping. On the plus side the property itself is beautiful, the front desk staff in wonderful, the guys out front are really friendly and more than willing to help with anything you may need including directions :)

Reviews.Title: “Happy family getaway”
Reviews.Author: Julielevans
Reviews.Content: We arrived and went to check into our room, we had requested a 2 bed and got a 1... We went to the lobby and they UPGRADED us to the lagoon view with 2 beds!!! It was so beautiful! Our 2 year old had the funnest time feeding the ducks and the view was priceless. We took many walks throughout the day, our 13 year old rode around on a beachcruiser and the staff gave our 2 year old fish food every day we were there! He got to feed the baby sharks and fish. The pools are well kept and the main pool is heated which was nice. We had so much fun making smores at the firepit at the pool. It was nice not having to worry about all the sand on the beach to make our smores with a 2 year old and a 4 month old. Naptime was easy for the babies since housekeeping provided us with a portible crib free of charge. Housekeeping did a great job at keeping our place tidy during our stay. I was surprised at any negative reviews I saw on the rooms or the grounds, we expirienced nothing bad! I would recommend this place to anyone! It was alot of fun!

Reviews.Title: “If I could have given 0 stars, I would have. worst place ever”
Reviews.Author: lcoe
Reviews.Content: We thought the website would look like the rooms, but don't be fooled!! It looks NOTHING like the pictures! We read all the bad reviews and did not believe it- mistake for us! Do you expect a clean room when you check in? Here is what we found when we checked in. Crumbs in the bed, dirty soap dish with dirty soap in the safety vault, old sticky coffee from that last guest under the coffee pot... just to name a few things... Do you want to sleep at night? We did, but the bedroom has an adjoining door to the neighbors and you can hear every word they say all night long! Awful! The ugliest room I have ever seen and the BATHROOM is HORRIBLE! The rooms are supposed to renovated and there is no way that is true. The bathrooms are disgusting. The list price is a joke. They will offer way less in a second! DON"T STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Was our paradise away from home”
Reviews.Author: holidaymode76
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful time at the Paradise Point for four days ... We spent time on the beach everyday walking...the views were amazing.We enjoyed the main pool and hot tub. It was nice to have a laundry($1.50 to wash and 2.00 to dry?) at the resort ,for catching up with the kids clothing. The staff was friendly and everyone accomodating even down to mailing your postcards. We spent most days sight seeing. Sea World is not to far and could easily be walked to in about 20 minutes. Phil's BBQ is a 5 minute drive away straight south of the resort. We didn't go to the onsite restaurants,but people were coming from outside the resort to eat there ,so they must be good! The room was roomy with two queen beds ,flat screen tv and large dresser/table with a fridge underneath . The sink area is through a door, with a large closet off that on one side and a bathroom off the other side. The grounds look like a tropical location and we really enjoyed just walking around. The Tower was a must to go up and get a view of the surrounding area. Our family would love to stay here again when we come to San Diego!!Thanks Paradise Point

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point lived up to it's name and then some”
Reviews.Author: hillkokonis
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Lanai Garden guestrooms for 2 nights in late March. The room was beautiful! It had been freshly & tastefully renovated very recently. It was EXACTLY as the picture shows on their web-site which in my book is all that one can ask for. The bed was very very comfortable and made for a great nights sleep, the linens were top quality. Our room was at the back of the property with the lanai and patio doors backing onto a beautiful green garden space with lots of privacy. We used the tennis courts and they were very well maintained and in very good condition. For the price that we paid, the value that Paradise Point gave us was a 10 out of 10. When you deliver what you say you are going to deliver and even surpass that? As I said, that is really all that you can ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Lush beautiful unique but some issues.”
Reviews.Author: minnesotajul
Reviews.Content: Rooms: Not a typical hotel, these rooms are ground-level bungalows. The mildew on the drapes and overpowering mold smell of our first room forced us to move (further away from our friends and the convention center). The second room was better but there was still a bit of mildew/mold on the lower walls and one morning we woke up to a very wet floor as the rain had come in under the door. There were two locked doors to adjoining rooms and we could hear the plumbing from the our neighbors very early in the morning as if they were in our bathroom. The beds are okay, a bit squeeky. We had our own little patio with two chairs and a tall hedge for privacy. Grounds: Grounds were lush and tropical--bird of paradise, palm trees, just gorgeous. But we spent a good amount of time on our feet being lost, as the roads curve around all over the place and the units look the same. You can sometimes catch a ride on a golf cart. The beach is lovely but it was too cold to enjoy it even fully clothed. Service: We found the service to be excellent from the front desk, gift shop, bell staff, etc. Food: Only 2 restaurants on property. Although pricey, we got tired of Barefoots and wanted to try Baleens but it was closed that night. Having no car and being there for business, we ate at the Barefoot a lot. Good food but I was hoping for more "California fare" and the service varied from good to not great, depending on the server. It was a huge problem for them to give separate checks. They need to fix that issue. Overall, for the low group rate we got, I would stay again, but not at the rack rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in a Beautiful Tropical Garden Setting”
Reviews.Author: shellvacation
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our March Break vacation at the Paradise Point Spa & Resort. The staff were very warm and friendly. They were able to answer any questions we had about the surrounding area. The amenities and grounds were beautiful and very well maintained. My children enjoyed the basketball courts, the outdoor ping pong, and swimming in main pool -- one of five that they have to offer. The room was comfortable but on the smaller side for a family of four. Unfortunately the sound proofing is non-existent and as a result, noise from the television, phone, and even regular converstations are clearly heard between the walls. We were woken on three mornings at 5:15 am due to noise from the neigbour's television and kept up to midnight once due to a Friday night party. On the one evening we were forced to call the front desk. The response was immediate and very much appreciated. We would definitely consider returning to Paradise Point but only if they were able to provide a quieter room.

Reviews.Title: “Taking the benchmark to another level...”
Reviews.Author: sonia_london
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the fabulous Paradise Point for 5 nights. It was ultra luxurious! I cannot recommend it enough. Highlights - Gorgeous mini villa's facing the seafront- personal and makes it feel like home! - You can light a fire on the beach or near the pool and have toasted marshmallows. The hotel provide all the ingredients. - Go and have a Balinese massage- totally divine! - No interruptions- you are left to holiday in peace. -The entire hotel is beautifully groomed all the time Final note: I would not stay anywhere else when I re-visit. Well done Paradise Point.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point was a true paradise.”
Reviews.Author: mkhines
Reviews.Content: This was our family's 1st trip to California. We chose to stay at Paradise Point without knowing what to expect. We read some reviews prior to booking our stay. We arrived at night and could tell it was going to be beautiful. The grounds were amazing and exceeded our expectations by a mile. There was even a movie crew on site making a commercial. Although the appearance on the outside of our building was nothing spectacular, the interior had been updated with current decor. The bathroom was not fully updated, but nothing to complain about. The pools were heated and clean. There were palm trees, lily pads, ducks, huge beautiful trees along walking trails with bridges. It also had a private minature golf course (which we did not take advantage of...but wished we did). We would highly recommend this location for business or leisure. It was a wonderful retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Like Something from a movie set”
Reviews.Author: tohellor
Reviews.Content: Its a nice hotel and alot of effort has been put into keeping it look well, however found the staff to be a little rude and not very helpful. Pool area is very nice, however its very e xpensive to buy food/ drinks and you are not allowed to bring your own in. Situated about a 10 or 15 minute drive from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Off the hook!!!”
Reviews.Author: travel_bunny3838
Reviews.Content: I took my family to Paradise Point resort and spa for 2 nights in March. We absolutely LOVED this resort. Stunning does not cover it! Great location (5 minutes to Seaworld) and minutes to Old Town, Beaches and restaurants. Greeted by friendly, helpful, adorable staff members. Room was ready as soon as we arrived (approx. noon). We had the standard Lanai Patio room, was very impressed, large, clean, modern. Views from private beach was incredible. Grounds are impressive, took many photos of beautiful gardens. Food was ok, expensive, but fairly good. Although was not impressed at paying $63 for room service breakfast, 3 muffins, 3 juice, 2 coffee. Pools are gorgeous, loved the outdoor fire pits and tiki torches. The main pool is best, heated, sandy beach area and hot tub to die for. MUST STAY in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved it.......parents...depends on your expectations”
Reviews.Author: easthamcapecod
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 nights at paradise point. The kids loved every minute of our stay. My husband and I enjoyed it once we accepted it for what it was (not a luxurious resort with upscale service and amenities) Pros: Grounds were pretty, kids enjoyed running about feeding the birds and playing in the pool. Spa was very nice my daughter and I had ice cream pedicures Michelle and Amanda were delightful! Main Pool was kid friendly and fun Cons: For the money (beachside bungalow over $300.00 a night ) we expect a higher level of amenities and service. NO CONCIERGE Room was nice enough although odd. Microwave (didn't work) fridge and sink. A Kitchenette without a single dish, utensil etc. Bathroom was old but clean although our room was not cleaned until after 5:00pm and a phone call and they did not fill up the empty shampoo, soap, etc. two days in a row . another phone call.. Restaurant service was horrible of all the meals only once did they get our order right. Repeatedly had to ask for things. Tea came about 20 minutes after dessert and that was only when we reminded the server (again) 5 Pools HOWEVER only one is heated during march. poolside bar/restaurant not open. $3.00 charge for duck food since the lobby was "out" of the free duck food???? We met a number of people who were very unhappy with their rooms so I would only recommend this resort with caution and only after you have done much research. For $300.00 or more a night there are better places. May be fine for half that price.

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful and relaxing resort with the most welcoming and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: rosegang
Reviews.Content: I was planning a very spontaneous trip for three friends and I to celebrate our friendship and help us heal from some rough periods in our lives. We came upon Paradise Point Resort and Spa and decided to celebrate a week there and enjoy the city of SanDiego. The resort itself was beautiful and welcoming and provided us with a the relaxing environment we were looking for; yet close enough for easy access to all the sites of SanDiego. However, the absolute best part of staying at this beautiful beach front resort was the caring and helpful staff. Every one we spoke to, before our trip and during, had our best interest at heart. We want to particularly mention Elizabeth Markling and the staff at Island Market. She was always there for us in directing us to the best places to eat and things to do, and would follow up with us to make sure we got there and enjoyed it. One time we were walking lost trying find a restaurant North of Paradise Point when Elizabeth called to check on us and helped get us directed to the right place. She and the staff at Island market helped us daily mapping out our adventures for the day . Elizabeth's skills and knowledge were most helpful, but most of all she did it all with a smile and personal touch. Thank you Elizabeth, Island Market Staff and Paradise Point for the most wonderful vacation stay! Mary, Ann, Mary and Judy (Our rooms were magnificent! Know that our travels have included Africa, Hawaii, Alaska, Dublin and throughout the United States)

Reviews.Title: “Best Place EVER!”
Reviews.Author: shannonlafayette
Reviews.Content: We had such an amazing experience at the Paradise Point Resort. My husband and I flew in from Austin on March 10th to have a couples romantic weekend before the birth of our second child. When we checked into our room, we realize something wasn't right. The room hadn't been cleaned! However, we called the front desk and the manager, same lady who checked us in, made it right in every sense of the word. She was extremely apologetic and explained that an error had occured and the room we were given wasn't ready to be rented. She then upgraded us to the most amazing bay front room. It was perfect, and everything else from that moment on was perfect. Awesome room, lots of privacy, excellent food, very clean room and great maid service. We were beyond happy with our stay here and will certainly tell everyone we know about this place. Thank you again for such awesome hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: huntingtonbch
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews, I wasn't sure about staying here. But since we got pretty decent rates for rooms with access to the bay, we decided to give this property a try. At check-in, Matt, upgraded us to a suite with a bayview (probably available because it's the off season). The rooms were recently updated, painted and decorated with elegant modern furniture, so it was pretty nice and clean, although the bath tub needs some work. Room service replaced our towels and cleaned our suite on a daily basis, which was great because our kids constantly dragged sand in. The resort is nice and secluded and the pool was very kid friendly. One of the three pools had two fire pits, a great feature if you like the outdoors. The location of the resort is a short 5 mins drive from Seaworld, 15 mins from the Zoo and Balboa Park. The staff was friendly and curteous. We didnt try the restaurant (baleen) on the premise since it was only a quick 10-15 mins drive downtown (without traffic). Just about the only thing we didn't like is the $25 nightly parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Venue with Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: AimAtw
Reviews.Content: San Diego weather in January cannot be beat. Paradise Point gave the feel of being away in a tropical paradise although convenient to the airport and downtown. The conference facility was well maintained and flowed well within one building. From top down, the service was unmatched. Each and every person who supported our conference was polite, respectful, professional, and at the top of their game. We wanted for nothing. Our needs were anticipated each step of the way. The staff took the ball and ran with it and never looked back. Paradise Point MADE our event a success!

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: CKarnitz
Reviews.Content: Loved the resort, loved the location to all the San Diego attractions. Fabulous marina staff, huge thank you to Rob and Matt! Two on site restaurants, gift shop, heated pools ( though not heated enough for the kids to swim in windy March). The rooms were lovely and spacious, the grounds well kept, and the staff was exceptionally friendly. I did have to call and have the room re-cleaned. Also, don't leave any food out, small black ants!(our fault- the kids had donuts). We had room service one morning, fast hot food. Helpful concierge, cabs waiting to drive you anywhere. Not luxurious, but I would say 3.5 star experience. I would stay here again with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: Esca51
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at the resort. All I can say is wow from check in to check out it was fantastic. The property is beautiful and more than I expected. It's close to downtown, Seaport Village, and many other places. We ordered room service each morning and breakfast was delicious. Our room was very nice and clean. The gift shop was great and the employees were very courteous. I highly recommend this hotel. We plan on coming back with our children and are considering having our anniversary party here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: curry1305
Reviews.Content: When first booking out trip I know the resort looked beautiful though I had no idea the treat we were in for. From the moment we walked into the resort we were treated like royalty. Our kids were in awe with the many things to see and do just within the resort. Playing at the beach, collecting sea shells, feeding the ducks and the list goes on and on. This is definitley a trip our family will always remember!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to relax”
Reviews.Author: francisvg
Reviews.Content: After finishing classes for law school and taking the BAR this was the perfect place to go relax and unwind. The noise level was nonexistent, the staff was friendly and the room was nice. The grounds were beautiful and made for a calming and beautiful walk every night. This hotel was not far from many of the places we normally visit when in San Diego which made it even more delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Charge for everything”
Reviews.Author: Mopower
Reviews.Content: Grounds are 4 star, rooms are 2.5 star. Bathrooms are in serious need of an upgrade, You can hear the TV next door plain as day. The only thing included is the Pool, everything else is extra. Fitness center $12, Parking $25 per day, Internet $10, Mini golf $10 per person, bike rental $10 per hour, you get the picture. They have mastered the art of extracting money. On the upside the grounds are wonderful and the location is excellent,

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach in room...”
Reviews.Author: jms760
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Paradise Point several times before and been pretty happy with my experience. This time, however, was different. I checked in late one evening and the next day, housekeeping never showed up. I was out on business pretty much the whole day and they never came. Also, there was a HUGE cockroach in my room that I couldn't manage to kill (but managed to the next morning). The hinges on the doors were rusty to the point that there were streaks of rust running down the doorjamb onto the floor. One of my towels was dirty. The bed was comfortable but I could hear my next door neighbor's TV through the wall. Also, the garden area outside my room had some small pieces of trash that hadn't been cleaned up. Don't think I'll choose to go back with so many other good choices in San Diego. I used to recommend this place to friends. No longer. Oh, and parking is $25 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family destination”
Reviews.Author: fwksr
Reviews.Content: Spent a pleasant family vacation at this resort having had a previous business meeting here and enjoyed the resort. Lots of heated pools around the property with miniature golf course, tennis and basketball available. Very friendly and helpful staff. Right across the street from Sea World and a 10-15 minute drive to down town. Two restaurants on site, one of which is outstanding. I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A very relaxing and beautiful resort. I was there on business but wanted to play!”
Reviews.Author: robyngoby
Reviews.Content: This is the best kept secret. I am so glad we brought our company to Paradise Point. The service is exceptional and the meeting rooms are beautiful. So you can work and then relax in a beautiful setting. It's also in a great location -- easy to get to/from the airport and to local attractions and dining. I would highly recommend it for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Michi0509
Reviews.Content: I have a 5 & 1 year old. We stayed in a bayside bungalow for 3 days (2 nights). I love this place, it was our 2nd stay. The pools are saltwater, so our skin didn't get all dried out. I love being right on the beach, my son can just go straight out the front door to play. There's also a fire pit, we roasted hot dogs and marshmallows. I'm not a camper, at all, but this is a really nice compromise to have a luxurious, fun, active family vacation. We're definitely planning to go again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience overall...beautiful grounds...met our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: SassyGRL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband and 2 year old daughter for 2 nights. Went in having read all the reviews, so I didn't want to get my hopes up...got a great deal on Hotwire, so we didn't really have anything to lose...just wanted to get a place close to Seaworld and this place was right across the street. Check-in was a breeze.Lobby area was welcoming. ROOM: Yes, it was a little strange having our"beach-style" bungalow right next to the road where the guests would drive by. The view outside of our door was the road and then the lagoon. So not much privacy if you open the shades. Speaking of which, the shade covering the door was too sheer and the lights of the cars would shine really brightly into the room, which was a minor annoyance. The decor was tropical island inspired and modern. The flat screen was nice, the refrigerator worked well, bed was firm and comfy. No dresser for clothes. Like other people said, the renovation on the bathroom was a quickie one. Coat of paint slapped on. They should have replaced the showerheads. Looks old and outdated. The water pressure is awful. It took forever to take a shower. Killed some bugs each day. Not a big deal though. GROUNDS: The landscaping and lagoon was so lush and beautiful. That part really felt tropical. We loved walking around with our little one, exploring the resort. They have many little pools scattered around (some for adults only and some for the family) and fire pits. You can make smores and stuff on the fire pits (they sell kits at the gift shop for $25, along with firewood...really expensive....byo). They have bikes for rent and a miniature golf area....very family friendly, but everything is expensive. LOCATION: Very close to Mission Bay, Seaworld, LOTS of great restaurants. All of the places we ate at nearby were good. We just looked on Yelp for recommendations. Also ate at Barefoot Bar for breakfast both days and had no problems. DO NOT feed the birds. They are VERY aggressive and we saw this other guest who had left his table outside for a second and the birds swooped in and started eating his food. Baleen is the higher end restaurant, right next to Barefoot. Didn't eat here during our stay. We also went to Balboa Park which was only 15 minutes away. So everything is very convenient. CONS: Yes, parking is $25 a night. They charge for internet too. The items at the gift shop (Island Market) are expensive. Lots of activities cost something. Our experience overall was a really pleasant one. I think this place is great for families and I think I would come back when my kid is older. Easy access to many places, beautiful lush grounds and overall friendly service people.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveably beautiful”
Reviews.Author: dotennis
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed several nights to celebrate her twenty first birthday. Everything about the resort was fantastic. We stayed in the presidential suite, it was first class. The french doors opened up to the bay. I would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “This is why it is called Paradise Point....”
Reviews.Author: m_michalek
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point on Mission Bay is one of the few places I can really relax. You really don't need to leave the property! There's a beach, pools, spa, restaurant and acres of beautiful gardens to walk around and enjoy. We have been coming here for 10+ years with our kids -- and at every age they have looked forward to it. They can bring their bikes and razors and explore the tropical grounds or rent a quad bike there. There is also a small miniature golf course on the property that is fun for kids too. I would HIGHLY recommend this for a great family trip--it might just become a tradition like it has for our family!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Wonderland”
Reviews.Author: Marabesque
Reviews.Content: Our son who lives in San Diego was married on 2/19 to his fiance who hails from Ohio. We are from Maryland. She arranged for a 50 room block on the property with many extra benefits like parking, internet, etc. The property has recently gone through an ownership change after a complete updating. We had a lovely bungalow right on the water near many family members and friends, and planned a breakfast for all the out of town guests on Sunday morning at the Dockside Room of the Conference Center. The wedding and rehearsal dinner were offsite, but Paradise Point couldn't have been more convenient or helpful in allowing shuttles and accommodating the extra needs of such a large group. The breakfast on Sunday hosted about 120 people: good food, beautiful room and ambiance, and a fitting end to a lovely celebration. Kudos to the Catering Manager, Karen Cipolla, for helping me get that together!!!

Reviews.Title: “Manager Dave-You've got a long way to go buddy.”
Reviews.Author: Tad1000
Reviews.Content: I am at the "Resort" now. This is the 3rd room I have been in. The same ugly "painting" in each one. Not enough housekeeping staff and they are not trained. I have had broken glass on my floor for 2 days. Stayed the first night in a duplex and "upgraded" to a "private bungalow" which meant a quadraplex facing a stagnant lagoon. Puddles of water (I hope) on the floor when we checked in and the place reeked of bleach. Listened to babies crying, people fighting through the walls and the sound of the pond circulation pump grinding through the night. The same hairs were on the floor in the bathroom when we left as when we got there despite a note with a tip to the housekeeper to clean it up-she took the note and the cash, so I know she got the message. We also had room service the first night and the dishes were still on the table when we left 2 days later. Decided to downgrade if that was an upgrade. Now in a single room that is like being in a bomb shelter. Concrete block with only a door for light-no windows and definitely no view. Left a note for the housekeeper to clean up the broken glass and she just crumpled it up and left it on the night stand. I come to San Diego almost every year to see my friends and we are going back to the Mistral in Coronado next year. Sorry Dave. Hope you find a new job soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds - but the bathrooms need help!!”
Reviews.Author: jennyfromaz
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here over Valentine's weekend for a romantic getaway. The grounds are as pretty as the pictures....that's what attracted us....the beautiful pictures. Our first impression of the room was "whoa! What's that smell?" I beleive it was coming from the bathroom....it smelled like mold and mildew. The rooms have been updated nicely, however, the bathroom had a qucikie update.....the exhuast fan in the bathroom ceiling was so loud and annoying...I think the odor was coming from there. The bathtub was non-impressive....small and cheap looking....the shower head was so old and cheap...it obviously wasn't replaced. The water pressure sucked....I dreaded taking a shower each day....that sucks when you are supposed to be on a romantic getaway in "paradise" right? Also, the bathroom door was just painted and obviosuly desperatly needed to be replaced. Also, the bathroom vanity looked dirty upon our arrival. Not cool. So anyway, now you know why there are no professional pictures of the bathrooms on thier site.....because they are nothing to look at. That was dissapointing. With over 400 hotels in San Diego, we will be trying another one next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Room old in need of refurbishment.”
Reviews.Author: judielilylake
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful facility but the accomodations are far below standard for the price charged. Facility is under an ongoing refurbishment and if you plan to stay here be sure you get a newly done room. Ours was smelly, dirty and generally not satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: Italtraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in San Diego at Paradise Point and we were completely satisfied. We went to San Diego for tourism and unfortunately we didn't enjoy all the amenities that this resort can offer: once, early in the morning, my son and I walked around the pond....nice and peaceful. I really suggest climbing on the observation tower to enjoy the view of the bay and the wonderful skyline of this resort. The room was spacious and comfortable (a big walking closet is unique in a hotel!). Personnel are extremely courteous. The parking fee is right $25/day (probably pricey). In the night is quiet and you can really relax. Considering the spectacular place I release a 5 stars rating even if the room is in average 4 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service & attentiveness was terrific”
Reviews.Author: dtwo2
Reviews.Content: Held an annual conference at Paradise Point this year. A great property that offered all the features we needed to hold the event and the service from the staff was outstanding. Whatever we needed, a quick call was all that was needed and it was taken care of. Catering was fantastic. The property offered an nice, tranquil setting which was great for the non-business parts of the event and also featured an excellent array of meeting space that lent itself well to the various types of business meetings and functions that took place.

Reviews.Title: “We had such a great experience here! It was an unexpected surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Julie41297
Reviews.Content: I used Priceline to book a hotel in San Diego and as always it was a crapshoot, but they hooked us up with Paradise. I'm pretty discriminating and wasn't expecting much from a "vacation" resort, but couldn't have been more surprised with the experience. We were there during the week and were upgraded upon arrival and had a lovely room on the beach. The staff was incredibly friendly and the pool was lovely to sit at with NO MUSIC BLARING - in fact no music at all which was great. The bed was super comfortable as were the pillows and the grounds were so lovely to walk through. With all tropical plants, I felt like I was in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a family retreat and couples get away simultaneously”
Reviews.Author: aimeeallen
Reviews.Content: My experience was phenominal from start to finish. Making reservations I felt as if I was talking to a family member who was trying to get me the best location on the property for my family. I booked a party for my teenaged daughter's birthday party and it was a breeze. Hassle free. once there my room was not ready right on time (10 minutes late) and the front desk manager added $50 to my room tab for anything on the island. The rooms were gorgeous. we didn't want to leave at check out. the front desk gave us an extra hour not a problem. It is it's own island (you can walk around with cocktails in your hand) and there is plenty to offer. My daughter had fun with her friends at the pool and putting green - which is manicured better than any course I've been on - while my husband and I enjoyed alone time at the wonderful restaurants, adult jaccuzi and bayside bonfire. It was like a romantic get away and family vacation all in one. Personally, I couldn't ask for more. Oh and the fitness center was plush.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Paradise! Clean, beautiful and full of activities! No need to leave the property!”
Reviews.Author: hbmick
Reviews.Content: No reason to go anywhere else! From the moment of arrival the staff was friendly and attentive. Marc the bell captain always greets with a smile and an offer to assist. The front desk is consistently friendly and accommodating. The grounds are clean and beautiful and the newly renovated rooms are comfortable and stylish. The location is perfect being only a few minutes from Sea World but the property is quiet and relaxing. Lots of fun activities both for adults and children. The day could be filled with miniature golf, fitness, a leisurely bike ride around the property, fun at one of the many pools, feeding the fish and ducks or simply relaxing by the bay. On our most recent stay we did not even leave the property one time. Paradise Point is located conveniently close to many local attractions as well. I recommend the S'more kit at the gift shop (or bring your own supplies to save a bit). You can build your own fire at one of the fire pits on property or walk on over to the Lagoon pool to enjoy the pre built fire nightly. We have stayed here several times and plan a return trip soon!

Reviews.Title: “New high prices... same old place”
Reviews.Author: Vacannes
Reviews.Content: I was totally surprised to recently see a huge price increase in room rates for this family resort that has only updated its rooms (new furnishings and decor) and not that much more. We have been staying at at Paradise point for the last 5 years with our young children, and though it does have many advantages, the new rate does not compensate for this huge jump in price. If you want beach front access and a family style place to stay you can stay for the same amount of money at the Hotel Del Corando with greater amenities and a lot more atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay, loved the grounds, incredible staff”
Reviews.Author: Judyrae
Reviews.Content: What an awesome place to stay, we were celebrating my birthday and it was the best birthday present. The stafff was so accomodating especially Priscilla, Thank you Priscilla for helping us with the room change, we so appreciated it. The diner was amazing as well. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii like environment & great staff”
Reviews.Author: ReluctantTraveler00
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the second half of a 5 day trip to San Diego/ Tijuana for medical treatment and a few days of relaxation following. Spouse's parents stayed in a separte room and a good friend stayed in an ajoining room here with us as well. Grounds were beautiful. All of the staff we encountered were sincerely helpful and freindly, very accomodating. They do charge $25 per day for parking which seemed high to us but our charge was waived because we had an issue with someone knocking loudly at our door on the second night of our stay sometime after midnight which startled us out of a sound sleep. Parents had a little problem with light and noise in their room the first night but were accomodated with a move to a better located room. Laundry facilities are available which I really appreciated. There is a nice little gift shop that sells laundry soap etc... as well as all of the normal touristy stuff. My only complaints would be that ther isn't a normal coffee pot in the room, they have the type that uses the little pouches to make single servings and they charge for internet $10 per day which I was not willing to pay but would really have liked to have. There is a mini frigde in the rooms but no microwave. Nice pool areas. We didn't try the restaurants. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1judyblueeyes
Reviews.Content: We flew into SanDeigo. Our flight arrived late... We were so pleasently surprised to find that not only was there a smiling face at the desk when we arrived but John took excellant care of us and made us feel like we were important. Our room was more than we expected it to be!!! The veiw was breath taking!!!!! More than exceeded our expectations!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: HJ2010_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our honeymoon through travelocity to stay at Paradise Point Resort and Spa. I was a little nervous because when we normally book trips on-line, we are somewhat familiar with the city and hotels. For this trip we had to total trust customer reviews and the hotel website pictures because neither of us had been to San Diego before or heard of Paradise Point Resort. We got a great rate, and upon arriving at the hotel, the staff was extremely friendly and accomodating. When I happen to mention in passing that it was our honeymoon, they upgraded our room (even though we had pre-paid through travelocity). Throughout our stay they were accomodating of our needs and extremely helpful with suggesting restaurants, local attractions, etc. We enjoyed our guest room and found it very comfortable and cozy. We had a suite that you walked directly into from the driveway, and it had a private patio with a little creek behind it. It was very relaxing and very different from a traditional hotel experience. The location was great too. We rented a car and found it very easy to get around San Diego and its surrounding areas. It would only take between 2-10minutes to get anywhere, even downtown. And, our room had a parking spot right next to the door, so parking was extremely convenient. Although we were spending our honeymoon there, we were also impressed with how family friendly Paradise Point is (yet, we didn't feel over run by kids- definitely a plus for newlyweds just wanting to spend some quality-quiet time together for their honeymoon). We feel as though when we have a family we would definitely go back and stay there. Overall, Paradise Point was a great experience that I would recommend to family, friends, colleagues and anyone else. The pictures that you see on-line are a true representation of what you see and experience when you get there. I would go back in a minute and as my husband says....that means/says a lot considering that I am a picky traveler when it comes to cleanliness, comfort, and quality :)

Reviews.Title: “Secret Garden”
Reviews.Author: Traveler4TheWorld
Reviews.Content: Beyond the rich history of the property, the lush foliage, and the unique accommodations, all of which are wonderful, this resort is already spectacular with an upside that will put it in a class of its own in San Diego. It is the best kept secret for accommodations in the area. The hotel has some early-stage items on which they need to focus as it moves further into its first year as a Destination Hotels resort. Comparing it to L'Auberge in Del Mar, I'd have to say that Paradise Point is about to give that property and other throughout SD a run for their money. It is true that there are some needs for maintenance and repair, but what water-based resort doesn't? Yes, there are some staffing issues at the front desk, but that's a function of being new and transitioning. But NONE of the factors that create issues are true limitations. Baleens was very, very good. This place is a gem waiting to become the most popular resort in SD. Just wait. It's coming.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are highly overated”
Reviews.Author: bdlesch
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at this resort. The staff has been very curteous and helpful except for the girl who waited on us at check-in. The grounds of this resort are very tropical and the scenery is beautiful. However, the room has fallen far below expectations. The door frame at the entrance to our bungalow is rotted at the bottom, our first indication of neglect. We have had flying and crawling bugs in this room off and on during our stay. I found a spider crawling on my hair this morning when I woke up and found one crawling on the wall next to our bed, That is the final straw and prompted this posting. The air conditioning unit is very close to the bed. The fan is loud and cycles on and off continuously. There is one small towel rack in the bathroom. There are no hooks in the bathroom, not even on the back of the door. The flat screen tv had poor reception on 40% of the stations. I would not recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent”
Reviews.Author: Eggnog8610
Reviews.Content: This was the 6th Hotel we stayed at on our Honeymoon tour down the coast of California. The bottom line is we WILL return here. The resort is located on an Island in Mission Bay and is very clean and gives off very relaxing ora. On arrival we checked in, the member of staff on reception was extremely friendly and helpful. She asks what made us come to San Diego and we say we are on our Honeymoon and have been travelling down the coast from San Francisco. She congratulates us as do the other members of staff around the reception area. As it was our Honeymoon she very kindly upgraded our room. We are then shown to our room which was situated next to the beach. The room was spacious, relaxing clean and tidy with a great view over the bay. There’s not really much I can say about the complex, everything was immaculate, very close to what I would call Paradise. Staff always remember your name and always say hello and constantly make every effort to make your stay comfortable and relaxed. We had a problem with the Key card on our room, sometimes it unlocked the door sometimes it didn’t I advised the staff of this and they quickly rectified the problem. The beach’s are fitted out with fire pits and logs and food are available at the sight shop as is drink which is all very reasonably priced. If you prefer you can just sit around the fire pits next to the swimming pools in the evening and just relax. To round it off, this hotel was everything we wanted and more. Sea World is located about a mile from the hotel and if walked would only take around 20-30 minutes. Staff are genuinely friendly and don’t seem at all pretentious. The sight is clean and tidy and the facilities are great. I only wish we had spent an extra few days here as there is so much we didn’t get around to doing. I would definitely recommend staying here to anyone looking for a relaxing comfy holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Better than perfect...”
Reviews.Author: MABBERO
Reviews.Content: This place exceeded all my expectations in most every way. If in San Diego again I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else. Right from the beginning of the stay I was pleased with our experience. The resort itself is impressively located on an island in Mission Bay and was pretty much immaculate. Staff were friendly and helpful, even the gardeners went out of the way to make us feel welcome. Facilities on the island are great and the chalet type rooms were just what we wanted with great facilities and plenty of space. Everything was clean and tidy and we even had a patio with pond (and ducks)! We had a choice of five or so swimming pools, tennis courts, spa, etc so wanted for nothing on our stay. The resort is nice and close to La Jolla, San Diego downtown etc if you have got a car and also just far enough away, so that you can get some peace and quiet. I recommend wholeheartedly and really don't think I have ever enjoyed a stay away from home as much as I did at Paradise Point - I look forward to going back. We went at a nice quiet time of year (straight after New Year)

Reviews.Title: “Romantic getaway, indeed!”
Reviews.Author: agoodley
Reviews.Content: SUMMARY With stunning wrap-around bay views (from inside and outside our room), and plenty of comfy, plush space inside the room to enjoy it, we will surely be returning before too long. PROS 1. Your backyard is literally the beach- making sunrise/sunset strolls a breeze. 2. Rooms are spacious and tastefully decorated. 3. Located near Pacific Beach strip- good for going out- and Seaworld. 4. Restaurant is excellent, albeit pricy (approx 100 for 2 ppl w/alcohol, entrees approx 30 each) 5. Service is great. We requested more towels, more wine glasses, etc and each request arrived within 10 mins. CONS 1. It's a bit large and impersonal, so if boutique hotels are your thing, you may be put off. The size of the resort necessitates a car to drive around it- not nec a problem- but something to be aware of. 2. The pools, funnily enough, have no ocean views, and are a rather bland affair (but v warm in december- that was nice)!

Reviews.Title: “Best in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Richrandal
Reviews.Content: If looking for the best in San Diego coastal, here it is! I've stayed at Bahia, Catamaran and in my opinion, this tops em all! Kid friendly, but perfect for a quiet romantic getaway. Sea World is next door, but we never had to leave the property. The only downside is the restraunt / bar is a little pricey. But I guess that's expected for this quality resort. All and all, 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay if you have kids.”
Reviews.Author: ChaneyKay
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic! I was totally unhappy with my hotel when I arrived in San Diego. At midnight I called a couple places and had a hard time finding a last minute room. John at Paradise Point Resort said he would take care of us no problem. Thirty minutes later we were walking into a beach side bungalow with a kitchenette and living room. We were astonished that the winter rates were so low and how much we got for our money. The decor was excellent, the bed and bedding were excellent and the service was top notch. We started each day with breakfast in bed and loved everything but the weak coffee. We thoroughly enjoyed the 40 plus acres of resort, they have everything you could ask for from a vacation resort. Even though the resort is on an island, we found it very easy to drive up Interstate 8 to lots of food and shopping. My son had a great time playing in the sand just outside our room. We enjoyed the sunset each night from our little porch and we had full view of hundreds of sailboats, wind surfers and people kayaking. The atmosphere was full on recreation, vacation and fun. They had all sorts of spa services, equipment rentals and pools/water features. I can see coming back to this place for many years to come as my children grow up. It's perfect for all ages and anyone can find something they like even if they like doing nothing. It's around the corner from Sea World and many other San Diego must see's. I enjoyed my stay so much that I truly did not want to leave. This place far exceeds all the other places I have stayed in San Diego in room quality and cleanliness. The tile floors and pretty wooden Balinese style bed made me want to stay for a month. It is a huge resort and they have plenty of room during the winter, I am sure they fill up in the summer months.
