My complaints are minor. The shampoo smelled good but was watery. There was an unfortunate rust spot in the bathtub that kept leading me to think it was a huge spider. As I mentioned, the coffee from room service was more like tea, very very weak. Otherwise this place was perfect. The bed and bedding were my favorite part but the exceptional service really made our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Ellieczy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Paradise point twice now, and each time i've loved it. It's so peaceful and beautiful! There is limited choice of restaurants on site, but the food is ok. It is in a great location, right next to seaworld and about a 15min drive to San Diego, where theres great shopping. Paradise point has beautiful clean pools, and they were never that busy either. The rooms were great too,a good size and clean and the beds very comfy too. I would definately stay here again, it is a little pricey, but better than a lot of places in the UK

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, great family destination.”
Reviews.Author: Tradge
Reviews.Content: Great place but didn't like the fact we had to pay $25 for a car space when we were the only car in the lot, the resort was almost empty and there was a car space allocated to each room. Also $7.50 for 15 minutes Internet access is outrageous. If they included these costs in the booking rate I would have been much happier. The view over the bay makes up for the poor pricing structure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Bailstorm
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect place to stay after the chaos of Disneyland. We were able to check in at 10:00 am as it is the quite season. We were immediately upgrades to a bungalow on the beach with a kitchenette. The unit was gorgeous, clean, with gorgeous views of the bay. We had the resort to ourselves. With two kids, their favorite thing to do was feed the ducks in one of the lagoons or swim in one of the 5 pools that they had to themselves. The kitchenette in the room was basic with a coffee maker small fridge and microwave only. They should stock it with a few basic supplies. However, I called room service and they delivered cutlery, plates etc. for four people within 10 minutes at no charge. In fact, any time we called for something the service was exceptional. The coffee maker packed it in the last morning and we were given a $20.00 credit to our room. We took a cab to Vons grocery store 5 minutes awayfor groceries.The the ride cost $15.00. The food in both restaurants was excellent but expensive for a family. We opted to eat dinners in the restaurants. The San diego Trolley tour comes to the lobby each morning, which was a great way to see San Diego. We stayed 3 nights.... the kids can't decide which they preferred, Disneyland or this resort, that alone says a lot about the resort if you are coming with a family. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: lucky19691961
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very nice, Staff was especially nice and helpful, especially assistant front desk Manager Loic Pichardo who went above and beyond. The Location and amenities this property provides are awesome. Everything is immaculately maintaind including the pools, rooms, restaraunts, lobby etc. The property was built in 1962 so it has been there a while but it has been refurbished pretty well. It is very close to Sea World and beaches as well as oold town and gas Lamp. If possible try to get a room along the beach/inlet.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place, we will be back again and again!”
Reviews.Author: trlc2112
Reviews.Content: My now Husband & I live in San Diego and were planning our wedding and decided to 'stayhoneymoon' and support our local economy. We checked out several locations and we wanted a hotel with a lovely view, privacy, good food and a feeling of comfort and relaxation. We found it at Paradise Point. The service was great, the room was just right, and the memories are irreplaceable. We will definitely be back again and again.. Thank you to everyone for making our honeymoon fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Family Experience”
Reviews.Author: martinthefoody
Reviews.Content: .Paradise Point is perfectly situated for a visit to Sea World and San Diego sight seeing, its close to the freeway , yet enjoys a very lush and tranquil setting on picturesque Mission Bay. We visited with our two daughters and enjoyed the hotel, the Barefoot grill for lunch and Breakfast as well as Baleen for Dinner. The rooms were beautifully situated and had every convenience, easy parking and nicely appointed in a California beach meets Bali kind of ambiance. Lunch in the sunshine outside the barefoot grill was reasonably priced at about 80 dollars for 4 with drinks Beer and a cocktail or two. Suffering from acute hunger after a Freeway ordeal we dived into Wagyu burgers with relish, ours not the burgers, and passed up more adventurous fare which seemed to be pleasing our neighbors admirably. The first experience was excellent, good lunch , wonderful atmosphere and setting overlooking the bay. Great Start. We moved on to Sea World and came back in the evening to Baleen the signature restaurant at paradise Point. Gourmet food at excellent prices with inspired service led by Chris Kindig. Every dish was a highpoint from the split pea soup with smoked duck , the subtle apple brined pork chop and tomato and maple glazed salmon. There are good value possibilities in the choice too with Margaret River Semillon Chardonnay at 34 dollars a bottle and the 3 for 30 dining option which allows 3 courses for 30 dollars on a prix fixe menu. We were very impressed but had to finish things off with dessert - crème brulèe fans we went with the black bottomed Crème Brulèe and were well pleased. Our overall opinion of Baleen was well constructed and beautifully executed menu considerate of the value based diner as well as the would be gourmet in an elegant atmosphere that served well for both family and a more intimate occasion. The only short coming we found at Paradise Point was we only had one night!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Irritating”
Reviews.Author: KayOGee
Reviews.Content: Not a great stay, but not entirely bad. Wouldn't recommend it for others with small kids. Read on for a, hopefully, nuanced description of our stay. We are currently at the hotel and leaving this morning after a 4 day night stay. We rented a very expensive bay-side bungalow which has a "kitchenette" (more on this later), separate bedroom and living area. The porch opens out onto the bay beach. This is a family trip and we have two small children with us. Pros The location is right on Mission Bay with great views day and night. The beach is good for small kids to beachcomb with 19 fire rings for a late night smores fest with the kids. There are five pools and multiple hot tubs that are heated. The ambience of gas-lit tiki torches down the main drives is beautiful. You're within easy driving of restaurants/bars in Pacific Beach and not too far from La Jolla with a huge range of choices. Great location for seeing the sights in San Deigo and environs. Cons It's very irritating how the hotel nickles and dimes you on everything. They charge a $25/day parking fee (which they'll waive under certain circumstances) for parking in front of a $400/night bungalow. There is a fitness center, but that's an extra $12/day/person. There's a village store where you can buy a small wood pile for a beach fire, but, oh, did you want a starter kit for that. It's extra. Need matches or lighter, more yet. Did you want a late checkout? That's $50/hour. The service is horrible. The first night we needed extra blankets (none on the pullout in the living area) and had to call 3 times over more than a half hour. We had similar experiences later in the trip. However, the room cleaners were good and eficient.. The bungalow "kitchenette" consisted of a microwave and a small cube refrigeratot. No plates, no cutlery, nothing. The doors on the kitchenette are hanging badly on the hinges and wouldn't close properly. Hard to describe it as a kitchenette. The bungalows are in serious need of being refurbished. It's clear that someone made an effort and slapped a coat of paint on everything, but things are old and dated. A sink spigot in the bathroom was so broken that it was hard to shut off. Our bungalow was very near the noisy causeway crossing Mission Bay making the "sitting out on the porch" experience one of listening to the sound of Harleys and trucks go by.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Ashashin
Reviews.Content: Wow! so Much to say about this place! This is the last place we stayed at in the 7 days we were in California! 7 days five hotels! We came on a budget and no plans and no ideas! We used the priceline app after we planned each day! Great prices on mostly great hotels(all 4 stars according to Priceline)! One bad experience out of the 5 hotels at the Hilton in Anaheim but to compare them all to the Paradise Point Resort is next to impossible. The drive up to the front desk I knew my wife and I were in for a treat! The staff VERY friendly very helpful!!!! BEST experience of the 5 by far! Upgraded my priceline reservation to be on the beach! A beautiful suite with deck chairs to look at the ocean! A truly breath taking scene! Beach with fire pits and a paved walk to see more of the picturesque area! A tower in the middle to climb to the top for more spectacular views! The rooms were spectacular and spacious 2 bathrooms were a plus! Bed was also the nicest and most comfortable that we slept on too! I cant wait to come back to this place! MY wife and I have already are planning to come back next winter! With a 7 day stay at one hotel this time! This hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay again or advise anyone to stay”
Reviews.Author: freddie92
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a complete rip off, the room are old and smell of Mold. There is no comfort here. Bathrooms are old, cold and outdated. They have roaches and water bugs. You have to pay for everything, there is no luxury or comfort about this place. I was completely fooled by the pictures on the web site. If you plan on staying in San Diego this is not the place you want to be....

Reviews.Title: “Great Setting, Great Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rendezvous2011
Reviews.Content: We just spent four nights at Paradise Point. We were meeting friends that came in from Europe as a place to spent a little time to catch up. Aside from fact that we had rain everyday of our trip, the staff and property were just great. You'll definitely want a rental car if you plan to go off property (Parking is $25/night, but the only option). Old town, Downtown and beach restaurants are within a 15 minute drive from the property. This grounds are a well groomed oasis. I would highly recommend a "bay front" room or suite. Bed and linens were VERY nice, bathroom and kitchenette was due for a little remodel. Staff was cheerful even considering the weather. Phil (Director of Security) was extremely helpful!!!! We'd recommend it to friends and plan to come back when the sun comes out!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant property”
Reviews.Author: ynleung
Reviews.Content: Four days well spent, off season, recouperating from a high stress life. Reviewed hotels online and this was the best price for a 4.5 star resort in a park setting for my goal of walking, yoga, massage, reading and swimming. Good beaches, well kept. Multiple swimming pools. Two good restaurants but cheapest is a bit pricey still. Loved spa massage. My sleeping cabana was on an inside lagoon perfect for relaxed sun and reading. NOTE: December maybe in the 60's but its cold and damp so bring at least one heavy sweater or coat to enjoy outside. I flew in from -10F and still was chilled. Room heat was personal control and good. Loved discovering the baby sharks and skates in the small tidal pools.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel, wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jparc
Reviews.Content: I attended a meeting at the Hotel this past week. From the moment of arrival to departure the staff were friendly and helpful. It was really an outstanding stay. Priscilla at the desk and everyone else made you feel very welcome. I feel they were truly sincere. The hotel was beutiful, and very clean. Highly recommend...

Reviews.Title: “One of the best experiences I have ever had......”
Reviews.Author: sabrinaloves97
Reviews.Content: We chose this resort as our stay for the day before and day of our wedding. It was beautiful for pictures and great experience. The staff was amazing there. The best part of it all was: The day after our wedding my husband and I were to leave very early to LAX to fly out for our honeymoon. I turned out that I forgot several of my belongings. Some to be Jewelery that my husband had given me the night before the wedding and vintage jewelry that I rented for the wedding. I was going crazy looking for it. I finally decided to call Paradise Point to see if they had seen it. I get a call back within less than 10 minutes from the head of security telling me that they had my belongings and I should go pick it up. I couldn't believe it. ALL my jewelry and my couch makeup bag and more were there. I was so grateful. I would recommend this place to anyone, mostly because you can trust them to take care of your every need. SMG & GG

Reviews.Title: “Glorified campground.”
Reviews.Author: 60795Katydid
Reviews.Content: It was peaceful during the week but the weekend it was bombarded with kids running around all night, using the flower beds for a toilet. The rooms are comfortable but need upgrading. We had to call the desk as soon as we used the bathroom sink. It leaked all over the floor. The shower head didn't work very well and the heater in the bedroom did not work after the first night. They also overcharged for services we did not receive.

Reviews.Title: “It Could Have Been Great”
Reviews.Author: IvesinAZ
Reviews.Content: When planning my vacation to San Diego, I found a great deal on a hotel. The hotel was rated 4 stars and met my criteria. It was close to SeaWorld and had direct beach access. At that point it would not have taken much to impress me. Unfortunately, I was not impressed. While driving from Phoenix, we realized that we would be arriving much later than we anticipated. I tried to call to make sure our late check in would not be a problem. I also wanted to make sure the room had 2 beds. It has happened in the past where I have reserved a rooms with 2 beds and still received a room with only one. I was on hold for 20 minutes and when I finally got through I was told that there was no way to connect me with reservations or the front desk as it was after hours. The person on the phone informed me that I had been on hold for so long because no one was picking up at the reception desk. My call finally rolled over to her and she was at a different location. Upon our arrival, we found driving around the property a bit confusing. The small signs indicating where the check in location was, were not lit. In fact, the entire resort was not very well lit at all. I’m all for ambiance but I would still like to see where I’m going. During my reservation process there was no mention of the fee for parking, which adds $25 a night. I would have rather paid a little more for the room ($10 at most) then be charged for parking. San Diego is a place where vacationers have cars. That being said, pretty much everyone will be paying for parking. Separating it out is only beneficial to a small portion of guests. When we went to park our car in our “assigned” parking spot, there was already a car parked there! In addition, the $150 a night for incidentals was a lot. The receptionist had to reduce the amount by $100 as the total amount was higher than my credit card’s limit. The room was lacking in some conveniences. A coffee maker would have been nice. There was a coffee “cart” on the other side of the resort. I am sure I’m not the only person that does not want to have to get dressed to drink my morning coffee. The first morning I tried ordering coffee through room service. There was a fee for “delivery“ AND fee for “room service”, as well as a 20% auto-gratis that the attendant told me was pooled so I gave him an extra tip. This brought my total for coffee and 3 small pastries to almost $40. I ended up buying coffee and a coffee maker at a local CVS. I also bought myself a mug at the store, which room service took when they cleaned the room the next morning. I called the front desk to let them know but it was never returned. A pair of sweatpants that I had bought for the trip was also taken. The room was nicely decorated however I would not consider the room all that comfortable. The mattresses were lumpy and one bed had a cheap blanket while the other had a down comforter. Of course I was the unlucky one who picked the bed with the cheap blanket. The heating/cooling system only seemed to operate on hot or cold (no in between). There was hardly any pressure in the shower, even with the adjustable head. These things were aggravating however the problem I found the most frustrating was that there were ants EVERYWHERE. They were in the bathroom, under the bed and worst of all in the bed. I woke up with ant bites all over me, even after they came to spray twice. Honestly I think they should have either moved our room or compensated us somehow. The last night we were there we went to have drinks by the pool. Apparently the pool bar closed before the sun even set. We used the phone near the pool to order drinks through room service. It took almost 2 hours for 2 drinks to come. Everybody by the pool was ordering drinks through room service so I’m not sure why the bar was not staffed later. There were several amenities such as WiFi and a Fitness center however all were a significant additional price. The restaurants were decent but not great. If I am paying $70 for breakfast, it better be more than decent. Overall I would say I was disappointed. I would have rather stayed at any number of chain motels that has comfy beds, free parking and coffee in the room. I would have saved money and been more comfortable. My experience left me wondering exactly what makes a resort 4-star? I looked it up and the rating is somewhat subjective, however Paradise Point did not even come close to meeting the 4 star rating standards. Perhaps they have not been reviewed in a while? Maybe they were tipped off to who the reviewer was? Or maybe... they give service according to how much one pays for their room? The hotel emailed me and asked for a review and when I sent it to them, I never heard back.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point is my mini heaven!”
Reviews.Author: gusbeever
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to San Diego. A friend made the brilliant recommendation of Paradise Point. This is not your typical hotel stay. It's more like having your own little house, with your own little beach, in your own little world. The landscaping is beautifully upheld, all the pools are heated, and the staff would even wave (and smile) when we drove through the resort! The rooms have everything you need (fridge, fireplace, flat screen tv) but you will probably find yourself outside, sitting in the two wooden, white chairs placed in your little backyard area, staring at the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely setting for a vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: jer1275
Reviews.Content: The layout of the room was wonderful. We stayed in a bayside bungalow and were able to take advantage of the refrigerator and microwave. We liked the two dressing areas on either side of the bathroom. The room was comfortable and felt just like home. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like a movie star staying here!”
Reviews.Author: buz2727
Reviews.Content: This Resort was beautiful. The rooms were great, as was the service. Mission Bay and the surrounding area is awesome. There's lots to do or you can just stay in and enjoy the resort. They also have activities for kids (a full mini-golf course) and the resort shop was great. I didn't use the spa but I will next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family reunion.”
Reviews.Author: Kin_travel
Reviews.Content: It felt like going into a lush Polynesian paradise as we drove into the resort. Most of the rooms/bungalows were right on the beach and had been recently renovated. The reservations staff were able to give us rooms for 50 people reasonably close together. The entire staff was wonderful. Everyone was happy with the beach, swimming pool, spa, tennis courts and great location. It was so easy to get to the airport and most major San Diego attractions within 20 minutes or less. We'll definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Family Reunions/Groups!”
Reviews.Author: cheryl5418
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a family reunion at Paradise Point. A nice set up for family reunions or group meetings. Lots of connecting rooms and a variety of things to do. Also this is a good place if you're interested in Sea World, San Diego Zoo, Legoland, etc. If you're looking for a warm beach vacation, this is not the place. The beach isn't that great for sunning/swimming. The sand is gross and nobody swims in the bay -- the water is nasty. The bay is good for kayaking and sailing though. The resort has been recently remodeled so the rooms were nice. They all had a mini-fridge. There are fire pits out on the beach for campfires. Be sure to hit a grocery store for wood, s'mores, booze, water/soda, snacks and breakfast . The restaurant on the property was good, although it lacks ambiance indoors. The pools are heated, remodeled and most had hot tubs. There are bike rentals and put -put golf. It gets really cold at night - bring warm clothes!! Email me any questions.

Reviews.Title: “nice place but needs more attention to details”
Reviews.Author: nkf00
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the hotel for 2 nights because it was very close to Sea World. the location is great and it gives the feeling of being in an exotic place on a secluded island.The Front Desk are very nice and helpful. we were helped by a very nice lady, her name was Tobay I think. the parking is expensive ($ 25 a night). Our room is on a ponf, close to the beach but not directly on it.the room is nice, but it has low ceiling, I dont know why they opted for that, but low ceilings bothers me a lot. the interior is nice. The floor is like stone in a shape of hardwood so it is perfect for the summers but it is cold for winter..I wish they had slippers waiting for us, something that I would expect in a luxurious resort. the powder area is nice but the toilet/tub area is very mediocre, and the shampoo/conditioner/shower gel is low quality.our room was not clean when we checked in, had some food stains on the table and the shower had hairs..which was pretty disgusting for us. I cleaned the table and sprayed the shower myself..we were very tired and didnt feel like leaving the room so that housekeeping clean. I was very disappointed in that, I mean how can you expect this from a luxury resort. In addition, the coffee supplies were not complete and there was no tea provided in the room as an option. we asked for a pack n play, it was delivered with a sheet that has a huge stain..again, not up to my expectations...I suggest that they have some sort of a housekeeping supervisor that inspects the room after cleaning.We ate at the barefoot grill, the menu is limited and most of the items had pork in them. it was average, expensive and the portions are small, but the ambiance is very nice. our room overlooked the pond, but we wish the doors had screens, it is impossible to leave the door open if you have toddlers (dangerous), but we felt some mosquito around at night. we walked at night around, it is very nice and we saw bonfires on the beach..very nice environment, but it needs a lot of attention to details to ask for this price.

Reviews.Title: “What an incredible experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: skitownusafamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paradise Point for 4 nights and they really took care of us. We booked a basic interior room and they upgraded us when we got there not only to a bigger room but to one on the bay. It was large and roomy with a room even for us to change in without having to take up the bathroom. We ate at both restaurants and the staff is so friendly and the food is really good. The pool we used was warm enough, but the main pool was a little cold, probably because it was cold for that time of year in San Diego. Our kids loved renting a quad bicycle and driving around the grounds. It was only a 2 minute drive to Sea World. I would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and scenary”
Reviews.Author: ssmurphree
Reviews.Content: This resort is located in a stunning part of Mission Bay. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. We also liked the location which was convienent to the airport, downtown and the beaches. The rooms are located in 3 - 4 unit clusters scattered around the resort. They has some updated features like flat tv's, granite bathrooms and nice beds and bedding. The basic structure, however, was pretty dated. It appeared to be a '60s vintage and the couch felt like it had been there 50 years. The room also had a rather moldy smell - we couldn't tell if it had just been not used in a while or actually had a problem. The a/c was also ancient although you probably don't need to use it much with the beautiful weather. We ate several times at the casual restaurant overlooking the bay. THe food was actually much better than I expected from a place that really had a capative audience. Al in all, we had a very nice time and the hotel staff was great. With a major room refurbishment, this could be a world class resort. As it is, Paradise Point is a very nice place with a few things you must overlook.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, great location, and fun for all”
Reviews.Author: hejee
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a wonderful stay at the Paradise Point. Originally went for business and took the family but turned out to be a fun and relaxing trip for the whole family. We chose a one bedroom bungalow with king bed and sofa sleeper right by Paradise Cove (got a great deal). The spacious room was nicely renovated and had a mini kitchenette. We were just steps away from the sandy beach which the kids loved. We spent part of the day at Sea World which is within walking distance (but we opted for the short 2 minute drive since we have a little one), and then spent the rest of the day just playing in the sun and sand. At night, there are fire pits to keep warm and for making smores. The rest of the hotel has a lot to offer and service was excellent all around. There are several pools, two restaurants (ate at Barefoot which was excellent), miniature golf, bicycle/mini carriage/boat rentals, and more. Unfortunately, we didn't have time to explore a lot of the hotel since we only stayed three nights and the kids wanted to go to Sea World for two of the three days. We could have easily stayed at the hotel the whole time and enjoyed every minute. The only negative I can say is the high parking charge ($25 nightly), the beds were on the hard side, and the sofa sleeper was not comfortable at all but when are they ever comfortable. We will definitely go back and hope to stay longer to fully enjoy all that this place has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful , can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: kraziek234
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a business/leisure trip and I must say the resort is gorgeous. The service is fantastic and I can't wait to go back. My only complaints are 1) No real dresser to unpack your belonings. 2) the rooms are not very sound proof, it literally sounded like the other guests were in the room with us that's how thin the walls are. Overall everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jeanne7829
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point has been one of our best vacations! Breathtaking, beautiful grounds---feels much like Hawaii. The staff was exceptional. Very friendly and always helpful. The location is perfect---so close to everything. And you can park right by your room! The rooms were spacious. We had a bayside suite and were very comfortable. The buildings are older but very nice. The views are spectacular. Maybe could have been more variety with the food, but because of the location, you can go other places if you want other choices. Felt very safe there---very comfortable strolling around, day or night. Wish we could have stayed longer!!! Hope to be back.....

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Family Retreat can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Toothfairy1977
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort for 2 nights but wished we could have stayed longer. The grounds reminded us of being back In Hawaii with lots of palm trees and flowers everywhere and very clean. We were able to checkin earlier than their posted 3pm which was nice as we could enjoy the afternoon by the pool. The staff were always very friendly and accomodating to our needs with a 10mth old! We were staying In one of their lanai patio rooms which was newly refurbished, quite large and close to one of their 6 pools! We only tried one of their 2 restaurants and liked the atmosphere on the patio more than the menu but still worth It. The resort Is a definate must stay but beware of the $25 parking fee per day which we felt was a little steep considering the room costs to stay here. Would definately return though for a little longer next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly A Paradise”
Reviews.Author: dhamlin
Reviews.Content: This was a very relaxing four day getaway that I planned online and after reviewing the web site I thought this would make a great mini vacation. It was more than we expected. From the minute we got there until the last goodbyes it was a stay I will share with family and friends and we are already planning on going back. We only wish we had more time to take in all there was to offer. We ate the The Barefoot Bar and The Baleen's Restaurant and the food and staff were excellent. I especially wanted to thank Marc and Chad for escorting us around the grounds. We woke up several mornings to ducks greeting us at the door and the native birds and landscaping were over the top. Thanks again for a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ItsMelanie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were first time visitors to San Diego, and it definitely won't be the last. We were a little nervous about booking this hotel based on the reviews. But, we took the chance, and it really did pay off. The grounds are immaculate. Our room had been renovated within the last 6 months. It was spacious, clean, and very comfortable. The pools were lovely. The Bare Foot Bar and Grill was a pleasure. The employees were wonderful. The bellman took his time with us, and gave us plenty of suggestions of places to go and things to do. The young lady at the front desk made sure our room was ready within half an hour, even though we were there 3 hours before check in. I'm a New Yorker through and through and would never have thought there would be another place on Earth that I'd be willing to live. But, San Diego is extremely alluring. The city is beautiful, clean, and has tons of restaurants, I never felt overcrowded, or rushed. Between the dog friendly Balboa Park with all it's museums, the incredible San Diego Zoo, Hip Pacific Bay, the mountains in the distance, and the very chilly but beautiful Pacific, give me seven more years, and I may be looking for a transfer.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point delivered the goods”
Reviews.Author: AlexLopez113
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a weekend with my girlfriend. Walking around the resort, I felt like I was on some tropical island in the South Pacific. There are paths surrounded by different kinds of exotic plants, several ponds/lagoons with lots of native birds, and ducks walking around with children feeding them bread. There was a really cool nature vibe that fit well with the resort sitting right on the bay. I lounged by the pool while my girlfriend went to the spa, which she said was really nice. The exterior of the rooms look a bit dated, and a couple of the rooms have this quirky overhang above the doors. We stayed in room 212, which had nice interior decor. the back door opened up to a patio that had lounge chairs and we were steps away from the sand. There were also a couple bonfire pits scattered along the beach. Our room had an especially nice view of the sunset. For dinner we went to Baleen, didn't need a reservation and were seated on the deck right next to the water. The dinner menu was fairly expensive but the food was worth it; the Australian lamb prime rib was divine. The restaurant didn't have the stuffy feeling associated with other restaurants of that caliber. I actually felt a bit overdressed in a dress shirt and slacks. Overall I thought Paradise Point was well worth the price of admission. I wish we had a longer stay there, the resort offers so many things to do. Paddleboarding, putt putt, and jet skis will have to wait until my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “A great Fall value on Travelocity”
Reviews.Author: foodrie
Reviews.Content: This was a great place for the cost. It is sort of isolated, but that is part of the charm. We had a basic room, but we had access to all of the pools and baysides. The resort restaurants sort of have you as a captive, it is difficult to walk to any other places to eat. Their restaurants were right on the bay and have a great atmosphere, but they were sort of pricey and the food was just fair. The gift shop was also a very pricey place to have to buy your snacks. Parking is expensive and the fitness center wasn't free to guests. The rental of boats and water equipment was very convenient. All of the staff was very friendly. Overall we were very happy with our stay, but it wasn't without some cost.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic family vacaton spot”
Reviews.Author: Alexaknowsbest
Reviews.Content: We had a family reunion and stayed at the Paradise Point Resort in San Deigo and were pleasantly surprised by the activities availalbe for children. While the resort is now a bit dated we spent hours walking along the beach collecting sea shells, swimming in the shallow sand bottom pool and watching the fish and sharks in the reef pool. Overall a very good value and as my mom stated it feels like you are in Hawaii for a third of the price. She plans to go back with her sister in Feb 2011 so escape the snow in winter.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Wedding Weekend Exceeds Every Expectation”
Reviews.Author: kaacord
Reviews.Content: The incredible staff at this lush, lovely hotel provided for our every need with grace and charm. Their professional attention to every detail is truly noteworthy. The wonderful creations from their kitchen set a new standard for banquets. Can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort, warm and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dobermanSt_Louis_MO
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed spending two very relaxing days at Paradise Point; the staff is very attentative and caring; follow-up on requests was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “If the weather was better...........”
Reviews.Author: pepi4health
Reviews.Content: Have been to this resort twice in the past (across from Sea World) so when I saw it on skyauction.com I tried for it and WON! Stayed for 2 nights & 3 days. The grounds are just gorgeous; it's like a mini Hawaiian island. If only the weather was nicer it would have been perfect, but it was rainy, foggy and overcast. We had a Bayside Lanai room so you just walk out your door to a beach on the bay. Lot of good that did us this time! We had dinner at the Barefoot Grill & Bar which was yummy and satisfying. We have friends in San Diego so we got together with them & had a good time and our highlight was getting to see our son who had driven down from Eureka, Ca. for a friend's wedding. The room had a mini-fridge (no microwave) that made a noise & we had to unplug it at night to get to sleep but we brought a cooler so that worked out. Also they charge $25.00 per night fee for parking but I had read another review where someone asked for a reduction, so I did too & they reduced it to $12.00 per night. Hopefully next time will be better weather!

Reviews.Title: “Own private beach!”
Reviews.Author: paulie13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as part of our recent honeymoon. On mentioning this, we were upgraded to accommodation with our own section of private beach. Fantastic! Staff were very friendly. Not a single cleaner passed us by without saying hello. Breakfast was beautiful and dinner in the Baleen was out of this world. We liked it so much we stayed an extra night! Perfect location for a honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “JUST NOT WORTH IT!”
Reviews.Author: 31230Betty
Reviews.Content: oK, too much $ for what you get which is: rough towels, no phone book, or paper or pen. $25/day to park, come on now! You have to PAY for internet . ONE soap. I do not like shower gel. NO blankets, except a light one on the bed. But great location and as they say location, location, location! And at least they did not charge for tennis.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place to visit with young children”
Reviews.Author: Chicagotravel2010
Reviews.Content: Pros: - great location, minutes from Sea World - nice pool for toddlers Cons - Poor service: When we went to the room that had been given to us at check-in, we found that the "garden" suite had no garden but rather the patio looked onto a wall. We called the front-desk who said that they would send a bellman who didn't come. A security person came by who thought we were locked out and provided perhaps the only good service we received in a week stay. He stayed with us until we got a different room and called the front desk several times when a bellman didn't show up. Oh, one bellman who did show up, told us that he was "too busy" to help us. - Not kid-friendly: Beach has no showers to wash of sand, doesn't provide beach towels, walking from room to restaurants is a hike - Check-out: Tried to charge us for an upgraded room even though we were repeatedly told it was a complimentary upgrade - Room: "suite" is a misnomer for some of their rooms, sofa-sleeper in our room was stained and is impossible (very uncomfortable) to use as a sleeper. - Spa: My wife got an allergic reaction to the products they used! Overall - I wouldn't go back there

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: karinw9912
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 2 year old son on a 5 night/6 day trip to San Diego and wanted to stay close to the water so we booked a stay at Paradise Point. We paid $500 a night for "Bayside Bungalow." When we were taken to our room by one of the staff, we were told that the resort had recently been updated. If that is the case, I would hate to see what it looked like before. Here is our pro/con list and keep in mind the cost per night when reading the list. Pros: -Very good food. We ate several meals (including all of our breakfasts) at the resort. Everything was very good. -Helpful, courteous staff. Everyone was very nice and they went out of their way to give us excellent restaurant recommendations. -Location next to the bay with easy access to sand and water. This is helpful when you are traveling with a small child, especially one who likes to play in sand! Cons: -Poor quality physical environment. For the price we paid, we were VERY disappointed with what we got. It simply looked like they redecorated rather than refurbished these rooms. We have stayed in far nicer hotels for about half the price. Even our honeymoon at a luxury resort in Anguilla was cheaper and far superior to this one. -Poor quality amenities. Towels were hard and uncomfortable. Not many extras in the room. No notepad and pen. No lotion/mouthwash. One phone. These things don't sound like much but when you pay that much money, they had better be in the room. Even the Days Inn has a notepad in it. -Paper thin walls. We could hear the baby crying next door to us (as I'm sure they heard our son crying as well). Wasn't expecting an exclusive Bayside Bungalow to be connected to another one (perhaps this was my own fault). -Everything was extra. I know this is common for resorts, but parking was $25 per night. The gym was $12 per visit (hence we didn't workout) and internet access was $12.95 for 24 hours (also didn't use it). -Location is not the best. It wasn't bad and not hard to drive downtown but there is not much going on immediately outside of the resort. If we were to do it again, I would have either stayed in La Jolla or at a hotel downtown. Don't waste your hard earned money here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting but needs maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Jjrd67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a nice setting spread out over quite a huge piece of property. There are pools around each cluster of rooms as well although the main pool was a hike from our room but worth the walk. The lagoon area by the main pool was in disrepair but had potential. The outside of the rooms were not very inviting which made us nervous at first. However, the interior of the rooms have had a facelift (new pillows, furniture, etc.). The bathrooms needed more work - lighting, ventilation, tile. The front desk staff was very pleasant and service & food at the restaurant was fine. Also, the gift shop was quite extensive and was run by a very efficient and friendly manager. There was a neat coffee cart with yummy muffins and drinks each morning. We were traveling with our 10 year old daughter and 7 year old son so the proximity to Sea World was nice. The Zoo and Airport weren't far either. Our kids loved the pools.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location BUT.....”
Reviews.Author: scatmanHawaii
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 day stay at Paradise Point and here is my plus and minus review. Plus side Great location, Easy driving distance from the airport, Sea World, Old Town San Diego (great restaurants in Old Town), parks etc. The resort feels very lush with many pools to choose from, and the fire pits are a nice touch. Staff was helpful with directions and at check-in. (your on your own getting to your room) The Negatives: Stayed in room 158, the beds are the worst I've ever slept on. The beds in the room need to be replaced, they are saggy, and every time you moved the springs creaked like a cheap motel 6 bed. (Wife and I had the worst sleep ever on a bed here) As mentioned from a previous reader, resort is quite large and when we checked in, we got a map and basically had to fend for yourself to find the room. It was kinda funny watching people wander around looking for their room especially at night when its dark at the resort. Not cool. Their high end restaurant (Baleen) is way over priced and average food. Wife ordered the steak and I had the halibut dish. Both were very salty. This is to bad since the location is lovely and the waiter was nice. Their other restaurant (Barefoot) has okay, breakfast food nothing special, their dinner wasn't great. Again nice location. The waiter/waitresses were average Paying $25.00 per day for parking and $9.95 per day for slow internet is ridiculous. Isn't the rooms expensive enough?? My one major recommendation if you stay in their garden view rooms is request a room that isn't facing the road around the resort. Ask for the rooms that you have to park and walk around the building,they are facing the ponds, grass etc. They are a lot quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Safety and Security problems. Never again!”
Reviews.Author: SD1972
Reviews.Content: Management oblivious to safety and security of guests. Our stay was marred with numerous police and fire service members and their countless vehicles (last count was 6 police cars) including a police helicopter in the middle of the night. This due to young adults drinking and fighting in the middle of the night. On top of this, the cleaning crew (who did do a good job) left our sliding door open the day after. Management notified and again, not interested in responding, as the "interim manager" promised to contact me back. It is obvious they do not need the business as they do not care for the safety or security of their guests. There were countless non paying guests on property that entered from under the bridge to use guest’s facilities. This is unacceptable. They have a huge problem they are either ignoring or incapable of dealing with. NEVER AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, lush, and tropical!”
Reviews.Author: calimama902
Reviews.Content: This resort was amazing. We live in San Diego and actually felt like we were away on vacation on an island! Its very lush, and tropical. Has many awesome pools with sandy bottoms. Great resturants. Theres a fancier one which I heard great reviews about, but we went to the more casual one. It was right on the bay, outside seating, very cool! I'd definately recommend it, can't wait to go back myelf!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: skisy
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location! However it was oversold the day we arrived and they asked us to be bumped to a 2 star next door! The nice thing is you get your own bungalow with a tiny patio. Needs updating but the restaurant the nice one on the water was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: MRocha19
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to sea world, great for small kids with a fun pool, beach area. about a mile from the park, you could walk there..

Reviews.Title: “An anniversary to remember”
Reviews.Author: RenoHeather
Reviews.Content: With mixed reviews on this place, I was wary. But the location couldn't be beat and we wanted something a little special and private for our first anniversary. Boy was I glad we risked it. I'm not sure if it is the recent change in management, but it was FABULOUS!!! Since it was our first anniversary, I brought the top layer to our wedding cake with me from Reno. When I landed, I called the hotel to see if I could drop off the cake immediately so I didn't have to carry it around since we weren't checking in until the next day. Of course was the answer and they went so far out of their way from there to make our stay special. I dropped off the cake and they put it into their catering refrigerator for safe keeping. We also got our room upgraded to a prime bay front room, they delivered the cake while we were out on our anniversary with everything we would need including champagne! The room location was perfect with a quiet setting, a beach right outside our door with a fire pit for fires, vaulted ceiling with a wall of windows looking out at the bay. Parking was right next to our room and it felt like coming home each night rather than going to a hotel. The grounds are magnificent with lots of greenery, lagoons, pools, and beach. All rooms are in one story buildings and most are connected to only a few rooms per building. Views vary greatly by room and you pay more for the better views... but they are worth it! It's very relaxing to look out on the bay or even a lagoon... not so relaxing to look out onto a parking lot for the cheap rooms. We ate breakfast at the Barefoot Grille with great service and good food. A beautiful view of the bay on the deck came with heaters making it pleasant to enjoy the deck. We had quick service, but weren't rushed. The only downside to the resort is that the rooms are showing their wear. They have done a good job with new flooring, new furniture, and new granite counters, but the microwave was ancient, the tub was rusted, and little things like the peephole was cracked (although there was a window right next to the door). Even this didn't deter much though. It's an older resort which comes with the great grounds and larger rooms so it's worth it. Everything was clean, just older. I highly recommend staying at the Paradise Point. The staff are amazing, properties relaxing, and the location cannot be beat. It is 3 minutes from Sea World, 5 minutes from Old Town, Ocean Beach, Mission Beach, and about 10 minutes from the zoo and Balboa Park with downtown a quick 10 minutes as well. Easy highway access, but also easy neighborhood access.

Reviews.Title: “Like being on your own island”
Reviews.Author: Brnidgrl1961
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place to stay, with beautiful well kept grounds. Beautiful trees, shrubs & flowers, birds everywhere. Kind of like being on your own island! There were 5 pools to choose from and they seemed to be all kept up well. A few of them even had fire pits and tiki torches lit at night. Concierge's were very nice and helpful, especially Elizabeth who seemed to go out of her way to make us happy! We told her that my husband and I were there to celebrate our 30th anniversary and she had a bottle of wine sent to our room! Thanks again Elizabeth! The restaurants were all good, especially the Baleen, although spendy but so worth it. One thing we didn't like about this place was how far we had to walk to get anywhere. We did see a lot of other people getting rides from the hotel staff on golf carts, but we didn't know how to go about doing that and never asked or were told, so we just walked. At least we got our exercise! If you stay there, and don't have your own car or rental car (we opted not to since we were told there was a $25 per night parking fee), you do have to pay dearly for taxi's or the trolley. We liked the trolley and took that 3 times during our weeks stay. It took you to many places around San Diego (Little Italy, Gas Light District, Old Town, Balboa Park/Zoo, Midway Museum, Coronado Island) and you could get off and on as many times as you wanted providing you got back on at a certain time and it would take you back to your hotel. There was just one thing that made us kind of mad is that there were no phone books in the room, and when we called and asked for one they said they didn't have any. We feel that the reason for this was so you didn't call for food delivery from somewhere else, but we called googles free 800 # and got Pizza Hut delivery one night anyway! We also feel that the outside of the rooms/bungalows were kind of neglected. The air conditioner next to the entry door to our room had spots/dirt all over it and made the place look pretty dumpy from the outside for how nice the rooms were on the inside.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: travlspleasure
Reviews.Content: I read many of the reviews on this and other pages and had some reservations about staying here on our trip to San Diego. I finally decided to go anyway and see for myself. We arrived on a Friday and had no problems checking in. The staff was very attentive and helpful. I joked when I went in about the parking fee and asked if they would reduce the price and they did. The room was very nicely done and the grounds were great. This is an older established resort so don't expect everything to be perfect or completely pristine. Go into it with an open mind. It is a little pricey for the quality of room, but I found the grounds and location more than offset for the difference. The dinner we had at the restaurant was second to none. Great service and excellent cuisine. The full course special they had along with one entree was more than enough for two, and they have specials on bottles of wind daily. Look for specials and discounts on the rooms from travel dealers online. For me and my wife we able to spend three days there for around $600 dollars along with spa treatments. The location is easily accessible via the highway and we had no problem using the area. We will go again and next time we will take our two kids. They have lots of pools and jacuzzi along with adult only pool areas. After staying once we have been offered up to 20% discounts on return trips. They do have coffee makers in the room along with small refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Love this resort!”
Reviews.Author: jdsmithphx101
Reviews.Content: We went on Labor Day weekend for our anniversary and it was beautiful! We loved our room, the staff and the bar! It was a crazy weekend but not at the resort, very private place! We visited the zoo and the seals at La Jolla and could not have asked for a better place to stay! The bar had live music and a very friendly staff. The room was very clean and we got everything we wanted from the housekeeper, she was so great! We walked the grounds every night and stopped by the firepits at the pools, very romantic! We have stayed at many resorts but this one we will call our home in San Diego! Thank you friends for making our anniversary so nice!

Reviews.Title: “A little Hawaii in California”
Reviews.Author: KentwoodJD
Reviews.Content: Great Maui-like atmosphere with relaxing accommodations and a location close to everything. We stayed six nights in a bungalow suite on the cove -- with the front door opening right out to the beach. Our kids (5, 5 and 6) loved to get up and walk out onto the sand. At night, beach fire pits provided a venue for mixing with other guests and an opportunity for roasting marshmellows for S'Mores. The main pool was both kid-friendly (with a beach-type entry) and adult-friendly (served by a bar, plus adjacent to the spa where my wife and I could take turns). The resort is just a few blocks from an entrance to Sea World's parking lot and around ten minutes from the San Diego Zoo. Room service was fast and surprisingly good. It was hard to leave at the end.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Treatment!”
Reviews.Author: TemeculaTroy
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paradise Point Resort & Spa's fine dining restaurant, Baleen three times this year for special occasions and have been treated like royalty. The food and service are terrific. Thank you for making our special occasions really special.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: santorinibaby
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to the resort and we loved it. We traveled with our 2 small children who had a blast. Everything was perfect from the minute we arrived. We were greeted by extremely professional staff that knew our name and knew our children’s names, which made us feel extra special. We had a beautiful bungalow on the bay, which I would highly recommend. The bungalow was beautifully furnished and decorated. The bed and bedding were very high quality and extremely comfortable. The living room looked onto a beautiful seculded beach and right onto the bay, it was breathtaking and so peaceful. They had 2 low back chairs on the patio, perfect for enjoying a glass of wine and watching the beautiful sunset while the kids play safely and within eyes view at the water’s edge. The resort had numerous pools, which the kids loved, and we enjoyed the restaurant on the premises, they had live music and was a very busy and buzy hangout. We enjoyed beautiful walks on the beach; you can rent boats, jet skis, kayaks etc. Outside each bungalow are large fire pits, where at night you can enjoy toasting S’mores, which we did every night. They had a great gift shop at the resort and sold amazing S’mores kits. They also have mini golf courses and bike rentals. On our last day we were supposed to leave really early to go to Lego land but we couldn’t tear ourselves away, it was just so relaxing. We will be booking to go back next year and will make this our annual family get away! Loved it, Love it!!! The Orr Family Los Angeles

Reviews.Title: “World's best employee!"”
Reviews.Author: billophoto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paradise Point last weekend for the 2010 Bayfair Airguard Championship Unlimited Hydroplane Race. Because I was on an extremely tight time frame, I needed help leaving Sunday after the race. I called the concierge, Elizabeth Markling. She made certain that my airline boarding passes were printed accurately as there was some misinformation from Alaska Airlines. Elizabeth handled this, going the extra mile to double check the tickets. I needed a cab waiting for me at 4:45 and it rolled up right at 4:45! She also made sure that I knew which terminal the commuter airline used, so I wouldn't miss my flight. During the entire process, Elizabeth was courteous and was concerned that my Paradise Point experience would be great! Thanks to her dedication, the experience was wonderful. That's why I refer to her as the "World's Best Employee!"

Reviews.Title: “I felt like Dr. Dolittle........”
Reviews.Author: alindios
Reviews.Content: Please do your research before booking this place. Check in is 4pm, I arrived after 5pm and my room was still not ready. I had probelms with the parking, (thank goodnes it was complimentary because of the conference I was there for), but I got more than I bargained for once I got in the room. I had an infestation of ants, even after asking them to spray twice on different days. Ants were in my refrigerator, in my soda bottle and who knows how they got into my closed container of pastry sitting on my dresser. The spiders tried to take a shower with me and the silver fish were in the closet trying on my shoes......this place needs a MAJOR overhaul before they should even be given 1 star. The grounds are nice and the location to the beach and SeaWorld is awesome, but soooo not worth the money they charge.................. I would not recommend this place to my non-friends!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...could improve some small things!”
Reviews.Author: stronger123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days and liked the place. This resort definitely had a tropical feel to it, the property is huge and lush with lots of trees and plants, lagoons, pools etc. It was very confusing to get around though, I always got lost-I guess you could request a golf-cart ride to your room from the main lobby-if you find the main lobby that is! Propert appeared fairly clean and well-maintained. It was very nice to walk around the property especially around the private paradise cove in the evenings. The rooms are all bungalow style and our room had a walking access to the shore which was nice! Parking is quite expensive but right next to the room. Also, there is hardly any grocery store etc. within walking distance to this place. This resort is right next to sea world. Now the room itself: we got a newer room. It was one long room with a couch, flat screen TV, a king bed, a small closet space with a safe, a coffee machine and a bathroom area. The door and the adjoining wall was made of glass and covered with white curtains-no separate windows. The curtains look nice but did not offer complete darkness during the day. They also did not close well enough for complete privacy-especially the one on the door-it kept pinching on one side. The bed was comfy but oddly placed at a slight angle to the TV. The lamps next to the bed never worked. Internet was $10/day-needed IT help to set it up. The service was good most of the time except for the last day when the housekeeping did not come all day long (8-4PM even with "service please sign on") and then when I was back in the room at 4PM, trying to take a nap, they called and said that it could only be done in the next hour as the maids leave at 5. But they had extra towels, so it was no big deal. Also, if they could add a small bottle of lotion and a small vanity pack (q-tips, cotton etc.) in the bathroom, it would be quite helpful! The restaurants-baleen and barefoot grill were good. The tropics bar and the island markert coffee cart remained closed all days. They also offer golf, tennis, water sport activities and have a big spa which I did not try. They charged extra for the fitness center. The conference rooms were super-nice for our meetings. Overall, nice hotel, could improve some things mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “The most OUTSTANDING people and service!!!”
Reviews.Author: blosserl
Reviews.Content: This is a place I will always come back to. While San Diego is a place of dozens of perfect locations you can never really find THE one because it depends on what you want to be close to. I have opted to stay where I am treated the very best! From Check-in, shopping their lovely store, enjoying a blissful treatment at the spa, you are treated with professional focus and interest, and of course a smile that let's you know you are in Paradise. This will carry throughout your stay even with the minor details; such as a forgotten toothbrush, your desire for 'way too many feather pillows' (they would never point that out!), and dropping your purchases in your room to save you a trip. If they have not gotten to it first - all you have to is ask! I promise you, you will not be ignored or feel foolish. They will respond with such pleasure, as if they were silly not to have thought of it first! Try it and see for your self!!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Trip”
Reviews.Author: shyanuario
Reviews.Content: Great customer service from the Concierge to the Spa staft!! LOVE the Soa Staff!! Elizabeth in the Conceriege is very sweet!! Ron is great also!! Beautiful resort on the bay. Only ate from the Barefoot Grill, but EVERYING I ate was delicious!! Who would of thought of a vegetable panini using rosemary focaccia?? Since it was a birthday trip, I didn't use any restraint when it came to treating myself, but others may need to be aware, the resort is NOT inclusive. So, if you are on a budget, be wise when ordering and using services. Short distance to Mission Beach and area churches. Need a car to get around, but less than 1/2 an hour from Balboa Park and great museums, by taxi. Live in DC so used to FREE museums, once I got over having to pay, it was woth it. Not into the zoo, but the zoo is close too. I totally loved my birthday stay!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely overrun with ants!!!”
Reviews.Author: jptsr1
Reviews.Content: Bring a can of Raid! $500 bucks a night gets you a beautiful villa on the beach with an incredible view. Absolutely overrun with ants!!! I'm told this place has undergone a facelift with many of its rooms (ours included) being redone. The room we have is nice. Comfortable firm king bed, freshly painted and a large updated bathroom. The furnishings are a bit awkward. Leopard print throw rug, green couch and mismatched furniture. I'm not sure what the theme is for the art work but it's quite weird. The room is cabana style and opens up to a terrace that is right on the beach. About 5 steps and your standing in sand. Twenty more and your ankle deep in the bay. The grounds are immaculate with manicured grass and beautiful water features Now for the bad stuff. You can tell they didn't go all the way with the renovation. The walls aren't actually redone they are just painted over. The vinyl curtains definitely show their age. The refrigerator and microwave look to be the first models of their kind and I haven't seen this particular style of air conditioner since the 70ies. Also there are no utensils of any kind in the kitchen. Plates forks knives cups, are all absent. Worst of all was the cleanliness or lack thereof. There is a sticky film on everything and dust bunnies everywhere they could possibly be. The windows looked like they haven't been touched in years! The worst of the worst is the ants. They are all over the room and especially in the kitchen. We are contemplating leaving and finishing up our stay in the area at another hotel. It is that bad, the place is infested. The maid tells us all of the rooms on the beach are as bad. We have had a maintenance man come out and spray and they are still all over the place. The worst part is that the management knew about the ant problem and have not done anything about it. (Edit) Just when I thought it couldn't get any worse, we leave for the day with a guarantee from the staff that everything will be made right when we come back. We are back and nothing has changed. The room isn't clean, there are more ants and to make things even worse the door to our room has been left wide open. This has been the absolute worst stay that I have ever had in any hotel at any price. I wish I could give this place 0 stars.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful location but not worth the price and only for families”
Reviews.Author: Nucita100
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on an "island" in Mission Bay Park and sourrounded by a lovely beach. In front of the bayside rooms lies a small grass area then the beach, water is cold and not very clean. The hotel is huge and caters mainly for families, not ideal for couples or singles that seek out a bit of privacy (nowhere to be found). Service and room equipment is not what you expect for over 300 US a night, excluding parking (another 25)! Rooms are redone and nice. Bathrooms, however, are still very old style and cramped, even though newly painted. For the rate they ask one would expect vanity mirror, drink glasses with minibar (empty), body lotion, corkscrew, more than 15 tv channels, free internet etc., but nothing is provided (internet costs). All in all, not worth the really steep price. Pity, because it is a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “This is no 4 star resort”
Reviews.Author: relaxfam
Reviews.Content: I had booked this resort 3 months prior to our stay. The entire family was looking forward to this vacation. The web page for the resort was breathtaking. It made it seem like we would be on a tropical island. As we drove up the drive way it seems tropical. But as we pulled up to the lobby there was no bell man to help with the luggage. That should have been the first clue that this was not a 4 star resort. I walked into the lobby while my husband waited in the car with our kids. The lobby was small and looked a little out dated (clue number two). The gentleman at the front desk told me that we would be charged $25.00 a night for parking, that we had not been told at the time of booking. And if I wanted to park for free that it would be a 15 minute walk outside of the resort grounds. Once we had been given our room number we got back into our car and headed out to find our room. As we drove around we noticed the flat roof style huts with one door but two room numbers. They don't show you this at all on the web page (clue number three). At this point we don't like what we saw but hoped that the inside of the room would make up for the exterior of the buildings. We open the door to our hut and notice two more doors. One to our room and that of another room in the small hallway that connected us, the foor was discustingly dirty. It looked like it hadn't been swept in weeks. Cobwebs all along the walls with dead bugs in them. Once we walked into our room the smell of mold over powered us!! The beds where new with nice headboards and a new flat screen TV, but that couldn't block the smell out. The shower head was rusted and half falling out. All along the tub we could see the mold, crack and rust. The tropical view from our room was one of a fence with dried out plants that gave us a view of the busy street outside the resort. I couldn't believe this was the same resort I had seen on the web. I felt robbed and cheated. Who rated this place more then 1-2 star was crazy. We were not in the room for more then 15 minutes when I called the front desk and asked for a full refund and checked out. This resort is fine if you expect a 2 star place. But if your looking for 4 star or above look elsewhere seriously!

Reviews.Title: “super fun!”
Reviews.Author: akLowe
Reviews.Content: it was really fun and i loved how it was right on the beach. my favorite was the four-wheeled-bike-things!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: AXAORBUST
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 year old son stayed had an enjoyable 5 night stay at Paradise Point. We booked the hotel on Priceline for $99.00 per night under the name your own price page. We typically stay in 4 and 5 star properties when we travel, but wanted to save a few dollars on this vacation. After reading many of the reviews prior to the vacation, our main concern was the cleanliness of the rooms. The room was in great condition when we arrived. We were given the most basic Garden View Lanai room and throughout our stay, the housekeeping staff did a nice job keeping everything clean. The hotel is located in a great location and is close to all of the family attractions that San Diego has to offer. The restaurants were expensive so we ate most of our meals out at local restaurants. All in all, we had an enjoyable stay and would recommend this property to other families. For the price we paid, we thought the hotel was an excellent value (even with the parking expense). I would not pay $300+ dollars per night to stay hear as a Park Hyatt or Four Seasons would be a better value for your dollar.

Reviews.Title: “It's beautiful lush atmosphere made us feel we were back in Hawaii but without the airfare”
Reviews.Author: TeresaDulla
Reviews.Content: Truly enjoyed our stay at this resort. The staff was so friendly and helpful. I lost count how many times the landscapers would offer to take our photos and suggested areas for family shots as well. The Baleen was wonderful and staff was as well. The beach was clean and easy access to everything. We will absolutely return for another family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't feel like a resort”
Reviews.Author: scarr3
Reviews.Content: I went to Paradise Point for a few days to get away, but I should've heeded the reviews I read before booking. It was generally a nice place, but it's cut off from everything; there's nothing around. The place didn't seem like a resort but the prices were those of a resort. If you're looking for a quiet get away, this is NOT the place. It's packed with kids; all of the pools are loud and streaming with kids. There isn't much to do on the grounds of the hotel, and the beach that surrounds the hotel is on the bay; I went to the beaches on the ocean every day because they're MUCH nicer. But you have to drive. Parking costs $25/day, which is more than my local airport parking. All in all, I would call this an average hotel with nice rooms. It's not a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ellie2SanDiego
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned home from an 8 night stay at Paradise Point. We live in San Diego and have stayed in many hotels/resorts on Mission Bay within the past 2 years. This was our favorite. The hotel staff was exceedingly helpful and friendly (every single one of them). The room (a bayside 1 bedroom bungalow) was clean, roomy, stylish and very comfortable - with a gorgeous view of the bay and bridge. The property is expansive with many beautiful paths and lagoons to enjoy. The public parks that border the resort are equally lovely and offer endless places to just sit and relax and gaze at the bay. For half our stay we were joined by our extended family. All were as pleased as we were with their rooms (basic lanai and not on the bay) and with their experience as whole - including our 2 young grandchildren. It is pricey but no more so than other San Diego resorts. We booked 4 nights for the price of 3 (still available at the time of this review) and felt we got our money's worth (we stayed 8 nights for the price of 6). The restaurant (the least expensive of the two) was actually very well-priced for a resort; although the menu seemed somewhat limited. Reading some of the other reviews, I'm truly mystified. I can't imagine what more anyone would want from a resort, or a vacation. It was a perfectly wonderful experience from the first through the last day. We will be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “10th Wedding aniversary”
Reviews.Author: Dcdalton
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st time to Ca. after a lot of research decided to start our adventure of California in San Diego. We chose Paradise Point the same way, by doing a lot of research. We are so glad we stayed there and will again....our trip and celebration of our 1st 10yrs together, couldn't have been more enjoyable!! Everyone at the Resort treated us like we were one of their best guest....loved it..loved it....loved it!!! The resort was very clean, location was excellent, and the hotel staff was very prompt & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but not worth $300”
Reviews.Author: wicked51
Reviews.Content: Overall, the room was nice and clean. No problems as the other guests had experienced. Had to pay $25 for the parking. Decent room but was not worth the $300. Stayed at a Holiday Inn the night before and was almost as nice. The hotel charged an extra $10 per night for access to the Internet. Too many charges.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: happyKc
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a family vacation.The check in took about an hour,there were only two guests in front of us. The parking charge was $ 25 a night, there was plenty of parking around the resort.I don't know why they have to charge for parking. The garden lanai room was dirty. The pergo floors were extremely dirty. My socks were black on the bottom. The bathroom floors were dirty with dust and grime. The shower was dirty and the sink was cracked. There was cobwebs with spiders in the corner of the room.The a/c had dust and mold on it. Always had to ask for towels and tiolet paper daily because there was not enough. Tile was coming off the wall in the bathroom also too. The gardener was trimming trees at 8AM , Saturday, right outside of our patio room. Besides the low budget, dirty room , the grounds were beautiful and the pools were fun.We roasted s'mores at the fire pit at the pool every night. The kids enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced disappointment”
Reviews.Author: lawgalkc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Paradise Point Resort & Spa from August 4th to August 9th for a vacation/conference. We stayed in a Lanai Garden Room, the cheapest room at the resort, for $310 a night after taxes, etc, which was the negotiated rate for the conference. We didn’t have to pay for parking, internet or the gym as they were included in this price. I found the internet speed to be VERY slow and am very happy I didn’t have to pay for it. Room: The room was nicely decorated but the bed was hard as a rock. The bathroom had paint peeling off the walls and the toilet was way too close to the door. I’m not sure why it was placed so close to the wall when there was plenty of room to in the bathroom to move it away from the wall. We had a small fridge in the room that wasn’t working when we arrived. We called to have it fixed and maintenance was there quick to fix it even though we called at 10:30 pm. View: Our view was supposed to be of the “Garden” however we had a view of vehicles who parked in front of our door or the building across the street. We asked about an upgrade and were told we could pay an additional $100 a night for a bigger “Garden” view, we decided to stay with the room we had. Location: They will tell you Sea World is a 10 minute walk, this is NOT true. It was more like a 30+ minute walk. It’s a $20+ cab ride to anywhere (Old Town, Downtown, Balboa Park, etc.). They don’t offer any shuttle services so a 6 day trip got expensive quick. Pools: There were multiple pools. The only ones we visited were the main pool (to eat at the diner) and the adult’s only pool. The main pool was very loud and crowded. The adult only was nice when there were no teenyboppers running around. There was no hotel staff there to enforce the adult only rule. Restaurants: There are 3 restaurants on site. Since everything else is so far away you pretty much have to eat there. We visited all 3 of the restaurants over our 6 day stay. They are all over priced with slow service. The food was descent but not worth the price they charged. We paid $15 for a burger and $13 for a salad (with no meat) on a regular basis. Spa: I did visit the spa one day to have massage. It was probably the best part of the resort. It was a little pricey, but not outrageous. I paid $210 for a 90 min hot stone massage (price includes 20% tip). If the price had been all inclusive it would have been worth it, but otherwise I would not recommend staying here unless you were paying closer to $150 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling service,rip off bike hire,long queues in reception,pre fabtype”
Reviews.Author: Robtherecord
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with this hotel ,Paradise it was not. The rooms are housed in very old stlye pre fabricated buildings. The breakfast restaurant was not clean and the service was very poor. We always had to queue at reception. Went to rent a bike $15 for one hour , i could have bought a better bike on e bay for that price . The main restaurant food was good but it closed at 9pm every night. It seemed that the hotel was beeing left to run down. Five star cost for a two star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An outrageously priced Motel 6 with a bad service- a total rip-off”
Reviews.Author: vacationlover101
Reviews.Content: We arrived there on a Friday afternoon this July 2010, excited to be staying at a high end resort. We had paid more than $750 per night for a room on the bay (after getting a group discount). We had two people in front of us in the check in line. It took us more 45 minutes to finally get to the counter to a rude and arrogant clerk who also informed us that we would be charged an additional $25 per night per vehicle. We got our room keys and we were guided to our room by another clerk who opened the door and let us in. The room seemed okay, but not the high-end, $995 per night resort room on the bay we had been dreaming of. We left the room to have dinner and drinks at the bayside bar in the resort for a couple of hours. When we returned to our room that night the keys refused to open the door to our room. We took the dreaded LONG walk to the lobby in the dark to have the keys reprogrammed. Again with only two people in the line in front of us, we waited another 50 minutes to get to the counter. We were told that we were staying at the wrong room and we would have to move. They gave us a new set of keys and sent us out with yet another clerk to show us the correct room. Needless to say that we had to repack our stuff and move to our assigned room under the supervision of a suspicious clerk. Our new bay side room opened to small body of water and a beautiful noisy freeway bridge. From this point on we felt that this place was an absolute rip-off and not a high-end resort we had expected at this price. Two cheap paper cups for four people (no glass cups), loose screws on the door locks with multiple- trial- screw holes, a wrong size shower curtain that was too short and too wide (too many holes for the number of hooks) causing the bathroom floor to be flooded with every shower, a noisy bathroom fan that shook the bed posts in the next room but did not suck the bathroom air, a hungry ant colony in the kitchen that immediately covered the complimentary two-day old cookies and the leftover food from our dinner of just an hour earlier, a highly over-priced nacho chips plate with a dab of cheap frozen imitation guacamole and a few drops of SqueezeIt imitation cheese, $12.99 for an in-room movie, $4.50 for a 95 cent bottled water. We felt as though this place was making a genuine attempt at every step to cheapen our experience. We were glad to leave this glorified Motel 6. They should be embarrassed to call themselves a “resort”.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced camping spot.”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl12th
