Reviews.Content: I agree 100% with the other reviews. Rooms have mold, chipped paint, dirty drapes, rough sheets, uncomfortable beds, old shower fixtures and no water pressure. The property is old and the lagoons look like swampy water with bird poop. If you upgrade to bay view be prepared to breathe bonfire fumes night and day. I do not camp. So this is my version of camping. We bring camping gear and cook our food. We do this trip with other families and have a great time doing Stand Up Paddle Surfing (we bring our own gear) in the bay, running, and hanging out. We travel quite a bit and for the $350.00 we spent a night (not including parking) we could have a beautiful room at 5 star hotel. I have never stayed at Motel 6 but I am sure this would be about the same. If you are looking for over priced camping spot. This is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Barely passes for a resort”
Reviews.Author: InSA2010
Reviews.Content: OK - Let me preface my remarks by providing a comparison. I hope you find this review helpful before you book your trip. I have vacationed at a Sandals Resort in Ocho Rios, Jamaica, a resort in Cancun, Mexico, and the Hyatt Hill Country Resort in San Antonio, Texas. Paradise Point in San Diego does not come close to any one of these other resorts and the San Antonio resort I mention doesn't even have an ocean, lake, river or any type of body of water around except for their excellent man made lazy river that runs around the entire pool area. First of all - It is over priced. The grounds are not gated and while enjoying a nice quadracycle rental in the property we noticed what appeared to be a local police officer talking to a guest about what looked like a car break in. We also had someone run through our patio that hotel security staff was chasing. The pool area was not impressive at all - its a little larger than the average hotel pool but no slides or diving boards or anything really unique like you would find on other resorts. The room was old - averagely cleaned - we had purchased some food for breakfast one night to find ants crawling all over it the next morning. After complaining to the front desk - received a $100 credit at one of their restaurants - the food was bland and very average for the price - we tried to use the credit at the restaurant but we chose to eat out the rest of our trip. Also - cheap pergo flooring and knock off scandanavian furniture does not make it a 4 star room and the old noisy window units....really? We took a drive to La Jolla about 15 - 20 minutes away. We saw the real paradise in La Jolla. In La Jolla - you can really enjoy the beach - "not" the bay. The bay at Paradise Point is nice but you really don't want to swim in it - kayaking and fishing are fine but actually putting your body in there - at your own risk. We have concluded - our next trip to the San Diego area - will be in La Jolla. Anywhere relatively near the beach is fine - Wow - what a beach! You have it all in La Jolla including the aquarium and the zoo and Balboa Park are only 20 minutes away. In conclusion - Paradise Point should be called Motel 6 on Paradise Point. Happy Trails!

Reviews.Title: “Great family trip!”
Reviews.Author: neris12
Reviews.Content: We had booked at another hotel and checked out right away after we saw how bad the rooms were... We then called the company we booked at and they sent us to another hotel. Again this was more a motel than hotel, so we checked out right away. We asked the front desk Manager a good place to stay in the area for a family. He told us that Paradise Point Resort was a great place to visit. Since he was a local and we had walked out of 2 other hotels we had nothing to loose after a 8 hour drive. We called the Paradise Point from our car, they were very nice and helpful and made the reservation quickly. We arrived about 10 min later and was blown away from the surroundings. We felt as if we were driving into Kauai. We saw families riding bikes, playing mini golf, swimming etc.. we knew right away this was a great family place. The lobby was beautiful and the front desk service was very friendly. We told her about our experience at the other places and she told us she would place us in a great location on the property. Our room was more like a bungalow. It was very large for a family of 4 and we really loved that we were only a few feet from the beach. We called to the front desk to extend out stay to a full week from 4 days. They have 5 pools on site, so we rotated pools and the main pool has food and drinks. The service at the main pool was outstanding! The kids all at the pool got blow up animals to play with at the pool. They have a great little store on the grounds and they are close to Pacific Beach so you can also go out of the grounds to get food etc. They also have great room service. We ordered one night and got our food 30 min later. Then at night you go out to the beach and reserve a fire pit. It was a great experience to have your own private fire pit with your family making smores after a picnic on a private beach. This location is close to everything, very clean. We will be going back next year and making it an annual trip and plan to bring more people with us.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Paradise Dirty and Understaffed”
Reviews.Author: Trip in the Sun
Reviews.Content: For starters, the lobby bathroom was completely filthy. There was trash overflowing from the wastebasket, blood on the toilet sit and no toilet paper! The grounds are not very well maintained. There was trash on the ground in front of our room and lots of duck feathers and bird poop on the roads and sidewalks. The outside of the cabanas needing painting or cleaning, they seemed sooty or just plain dirty. Our room had a horrible musty smell in the bathroom and there was mold around the rim of the sink. The beds were comfortable although a little creaky. The refrigerator hummed loudly all night. There were no screens on the doors to let fresh air in so we had to use the air conditioner. Housekeeping did not show up until 4:30 even though we were out of the room all morning and into the afternoon. Parking was $25 dollars a night and $12 a day to use the gym! The hotel must be under staffed or going through management changes. I highly advise staying at this "resort" for the money that they are asking or if you are concerned about hygiene.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort! Great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: KNV793
Reviews.Content: I called ahead to let the management know that this was a special trip. The manager, Matt, was extremely helpful and courteous. When we arrived, we were told that we had been upgraded to a bungalow room. The room was amazing and the entire resort was beautiful! The food at the resort is pricey, but there are plenty of restaurants just a few minutes away by car.

Reviews.Title: “I was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mbhakta
Reviews.Content: As much money as I paid for the paradise effect I didn't get what I paid for... I was disappointed...the view was great from my front door but that was all that was great about my stay... it could have been better. the room could have been bigger b/c I was with my whole family anb I would certainly not come back again....

Reviews.Title: “Lovely grounds, great location, but could have been so much better.”
Reviews.Author: JohnandBarb020
Reviews.Content: Although we enjoyed our stay, we were disappointed by some aspects and wouldn't stay again. The room was large and well furnished, with patio doors and chairs outside. The only problem was that if you were in the little kitchen area, you could here every word that the people next door were saying and they were only talking normally. Same in the morning, if next door went in the bathroom, it sounded if they were in your room. The grounds were very well maintained and there was a selection of pools which were really good. No coffee making facilities in the room, so you had to go the the coffee station, but this was only open in the morning. If you wanted acoffee in the evening, you had to go to the grill restuarant, but cappucino was only available at the resturant at nearly 7 dollars!! Very poor. The grill resturant was good the first time we went, but food and service was awful on our second visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: leecypoo
Reviews.Content: I didn't book this hotel in the first place because of the reviews I read here. So we ended up at another hotel, which turned out to be so bad, they didn't argue, as released us with a refund from our non refundable reservations. I managed to get us a three night stay with two queen beds in the $200 range, same price as we had payed for the slum. As we were refugees running from our other hotel, we all agreed, we were now in heaven. The property was beautiful. We drove in the the lobby, the staff was very friendly, and we followed Tattoo in his golf cart to our room. Our little half a duplex with garden view was updated, clean, comfortable, quiet, even with a putting green right behind it. The grounds were beautiful. We spent most of our time running around San Diego as when we travel, we go to see other places, not other hotels. We did use the pools, gift shop, laundry, and have fun walking around the grounds. We agreed if our kids were smaller, they would have been able to occupy themselves for hours with the putting green( all the resort kids were playing mini golf on it!), riding the rental bikes, playing on the private beach, hanging out. The common area in the center has ponds, ducks, herons, and an observation tower to climb. You can see the fire works from Sea World nightly from many places on the grounds. We generally stay at hotels, not resorts, so maybe I am easy to please, but I've payed as much in San Diego in high season and gotten much less. The only negative was having to pay for internet connection, so we went without. We over heard a couple of women in the gift shop snottily discussing the clothes ($50-200 items). "They are soo ugly. O, that must be the clearance rack!) So, if you are a Regular Joe, like us, I think we got a fair deal for high season. If you are Thurston Howell the 3rd, maybe it won't live up to your expectations, but I don't see why.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: trayfamily
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd of 5 hotels in which we stayed on our 2-week vacation to California and Arizona, and it was by far the most disappointing, although it was the 2nd most expensive! Yes the location is great for seeing Sea World and the Zoo, and the room was spacious with comfortable beds. That's all I can say good about it. I felt nickelled and dimed to death the whole time. We did have to pay the $25/night parking fee. (We did not have to pay at the previous hotel, as we were allowed to find free street parking.) This was the only hotel on our trip that did not provide complimentary internet. Even the "ammenities" provided were nailed to the wall, literally. The shampoo, conditioner and lotion came from squirt bottles attached to the shower wall. When we arrived we had no soap or glasses of any kind. I called to ask for them and they did respond promptly. My children enjoyed the pools. We did not eat or shop here so I cannot speak for other things on the property. Were I to go back, I would not stay here again, especially if I were mainly going to see sights in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “It's not a 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: Soomba
Reviews.Content: A good family spot, but feels very dated, even post-remodel. The floor in our unit is filthy and we wonder when it was last cleaned. The bathroom was only partially remodeled and does not feature a "cascading shower." All that said, it is a nice spot for families, with the many pools and beach nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Priceline saved me money but I got what I paid for...too bad.”
Reviews.Author: Rocketsurfer
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell I tried to get a 4 star hotel from Priceline.com but ended up with this place. Paid $124 per night. Unsure I went to the web site and it appeared very nice and thought we got a great deal...until we got there. When we finally found it I thought it would be ok. There were lots of bungalows in groups and they appeared to be nice. The "lobby" was a separate building and it was clean and beautiful. Staff manning the desk was nice but seemed to talk down to you like it was an honor for you to be in the same room as them. $25 parking fee way too much. When we got to our bungalow we went inside and noticed the floors were not clean. Floor was made of a some kind of wood/tile and needed a was badly. There was a rug runner in the center of the room and it was dirty. There were spider webs occupied with their residents. Cob webs in the corners. Knobs missing from the AC unit. There was algae growing in the ring at the base of the sink. The two queen beds were newer and were comfortable to sleep in...Thank Goodness. There was a small refrigerator in a cabinet that had a door that was barely holding on to its hinge. The bathroom door was a sliding door that came out of the wall and was old and the paint was all scratched. When you turned on the light switch to the bathroom the sound was so loud and hummed like an Apache helicopter..no joke. The dust in the fan was disgusting and was very thick. We had dinner at the restaurant. Food was average at best and prices were through the roof. The pool was warm and the hot tub was warmer. We didn't go in either one because they needed to be cleaned and by 8pm there still were not clean. I cannot recommend this place to anyone. Quite a shame really because the potential was there. The grounds are taken care of but not the sleeping quarters. One good thing...you are just over a small bridge from Sea World. Overall, it was a glorified campground and even though we paid half price we felt ripped off and priceline lost a customer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- overall nice place”
Reviews.Author: Tiffkat2000
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a great vacation spot. I would stay there again Positives- -Gorgeous grounds. It makes you feel as if you at a resort rather than just a hotel - Very large rooms with kitchenette and living room (if you stay in a beach bungalow ) - you never need to leave the resort if you don't want to. Stores and restaurants on site. - new modern designs of rooms (stayed in room 544) - spa treatments were some of the best I've had (they add 20% gratuity and the treatments are pricey, but worth it) (try the hot stone massage!) Negatives- - the rooms do not have blackout shutters so when the sun comes , up so do you - the bay is not really private so boats can drive up it all night making for some noise (I am a light sleeper and was awakened several times where as my husband never heard a thing) - they charge you for EVERYTHING extra. Parking is $25 a day, mini golf costs, etc (even Internet) One last tip- we decided to walk to sea world from the resort as there is no shuttle. The front desk lady said it would be a 15 minute walk. It was more like a 35 min brisk walk so if you are with kids you may want to f skip this walk Still the place makes you feel as if you are on a tropical island rather than in San Diego and it is a great place. -service at the Baleen restaurant was less than amazing but the food was great!! -

Reviews.Title: “An island, for better or worse”
Reviews.Author: mehudson1
Reviews.Content: Super fun to be on a resort on an island. Also, super boring in an exciting city like San Diego because you're miles from the great restaurants, nightlife, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Surrounded by paradise”
Reviews.Author: birdsley14
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point is the place to go if you're looking for atmoshpere. It's located on an island in the middle of Mission Bay and has all the look and feel of a tropical island. You are surrounded with beautiful plant life and relaxing environments. There is no giant bulding breaking up the skyline on this island. The rooms are scattered across the grounds in single story buildings that typically only house a few rooms per building. Each room has its own parking spot right outside your front door (we read multiple complaints about high parking fees, but by staying for 5 days we only paid $12.50 per day.) There are multiple pools (including an adult only pool) and lagoons within a few steps of most rooms. Being on an island, there is also plenty of beach front. However, the beach was somewhat disappointing. A lot of the sand seemed to have washed away and overall the beach was just not in great shape. This didn't get us down because we knew going in that there wouldn't be a lot of in the water time anyway (the Pacific is cold!) The main pool will provide you with all you need if you're looking to lay out in the sun. The spa is adjacent to the main pool and there is also a poolside bar. The resort is only about a 10 minute drive from the airport and is within 15 minutes of the zoo and Gaslamp Quarter. Being located north of the city also puts you closer to L.A. (less than 2 hours if you're up for the drive) and close to La Jolla. While you're in town you obviously want to hit the zoo, but an unexpected bonus to our trip and one of the highlights was the U.S.S. Midway. You can do a self-guided audio tour of the entire aircraft carrier in about 2-3 hours and is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: FREEquentFlyer66
Reviews.Content: We booked our summer vacation in San Diego as a package deal that included Paradise Point for lodging. The photos on the website really made it look beautiful and the grounds lived up to the expectation. Driving onto the property you knew you were in for a treat with the wonderfully manicured lawns and plush trees. The room, on the other hand, was nowhere near as nice as we expected. We stayed in a beachside room with a lanai. It was nice to have a beach out our back door and we were lucky that it seemed to be a quiet part of Mission Bay. The room seemed to have been recently renovated, but didn't have enough drawer space for two adults and one 11-year-old boy. We did have a coffee maker in our room...in contrast to what some other reviewers experienced. The bathroom was quite large compared to the rest of the room. I noticed that the housekeeping wasn't the greatest as you could see built-up dirt behind the doors. The beds were very uncomfortable and the pillows were too soft for my liking....and they smelled bad. Parking at $25 per day was a shocker. Not sure why it needs to be that high. Also, some of the activities also seemed overpriced but the marina seemed quite fair with their charges. The minigolf isn't really as neat as it seems because the "greens" are more like fairway grass. The pools were nice and we enjoyed the Dive In Movie night. We ate at the beach grill a couple times and found the food to be very good. The property location makes it very convenient to visit Sea World, Old Town San Diego, Balboa Park, and La Jolla. Overall, we don't regret staying at Paradise Point, but I doubt I would go back there. Next time I'll go to the Hotel Del Coronado!

Reviews.Title: “TOO MUCH MONEY-TOO LITTLE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: VanNess4
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed at the San Diego Paradise Point every time we've visited San Diego. It used to be the San Diego Princess. It appears the new owners updated all of the rooms and then doubled the price to stay. We were also charged an additional $20 per night to park our car. All these new charges left me wondering what happened to the personalized service and beach hut feel this resort used to have. It looked like all the old employees we remembered were gone and replaced with 20 somethings that couldn't believe we had a problem paying an additional $20 to park when we were already paying more than $400 per night. Don't get me wrong, the new rooms are great and it's a great location (right across the street from Sea World.) The issue is they charge too much and lack the great customer service they used to be famous for. There's a great resort in LaJolla, The Lodge at Torrey Pines. If you want to be pampered for $400 per night, go there.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: mickeynewkirk
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked the Lanai Garden room at Paradise Point while visiting Cali for a wedding. ThenanI saw the reviews on Trip advisor and was upset to think the place we were staying at was "dirty and looked nothing like the pictures" When we arrived I was literally blown away by how beautiful the resort ACTUALLY was. The landscaping was beautiful and there was five pools instead of just one! The room looked exactly like how it did online. My only complaints were the $25 a-day parking charge and the cocky bartender. We rented a convertible from fox chase (excellent rates) and if that hadn't been enough we paid a hundred extra bucks for parking. But what can I say our stay other than that was literally complete paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated.”
Reviews.Author: frogfan63
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference and although initally driving in you think, wow this place looks nice, take a better look around. It's only the gardens that look nice. The bungalows look like little dumpy cubes. They really need to improve the external look if you want to match the landscaping & cost to stay here. This place is not a quiet romantic getaway type place. It is located within walking distance of Sea World, so you have a TON of family/kids, and if your prepared for that then you can go in knowing the noise level will be annoying. Having an adult only pool doesn't work, because you always have the losers that bring their kids here to get away from the other noisy kids elsewhere. No hotel staff around to let them know-adults only!! Many places like this are overrated. It is so frustrating to pay and arm and a leg to stay in a place like this, and then they turn around a charge you more for everything you want to do. $12.00 a day to use the workout room, parking fees, fees to use the tennis court. etc. etc. Are you serious? I don't call that a vacation when your raked over the coals everytime you want to do something "extra". Maybe for some this is "fun". For me I'd rather stay in a nice chain hotel that appreciates their guests. Spending more doesn't make it memorable, but if you don't mind opening up your wallet to be drained......this is the place for you.For me it was overrated, really don't have an interest in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay- Can't Wait to Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: mountainmama1
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was very hesitant, after reading such mixed reviews on this resort. But, I'd always wanted to stay here and we got a great rate (stay 2 nights and the 3rd was free), so we decided to give it a chance. We were very happy that we did! We arrived early and were able to get right into our room without any delay. The ice bucket was missing from our room, but they brought one, along with the extra hangars I requested, right away. Everyone was very friendly. The room was nicely decorated and the bed was comfortable. I did notice some mold coming out of a vent on the exterior of the room, but I don't think that's so uncommon when you are right next to the ocean. Parking was expensive, but you pretty much have to pay to park anywhere in San Diego, and here you get to park right outside your door. We knew there wasn't going to be a coffe pot- and I do agree that's something they should provide. The coffee cart is excellent, but people would be much happier with a coffe pot in the room...and many would still buy specialty coffee drinks and the delicious pastries from the cart. The food at the restaurant was very good, and the women in our family enjoyed the spa. We enjoyed the lagoon pool, but it got noisy and crowded late in the afternoon when everyone returned from their day's outings, so that's when we retreated to the peace and quiet of another pool right next to our room. The location was great- the only thing we really disliked was having to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value - tons of fun.”
Reviews.Author: RyanPatano
Reviews.Content: We had a bayside bungalow which was amazing. Located right on the beach in a quiet bay. The kids could play in the sand and swim in the ocean. The facilities are great - very family friendly. We rented a wave-runner one day and played in several of the resort's five pools. The staff was helpful and friendly. The food at the restaurants was very good. Located just minutes from Sea World and Mission Bay, this resort is great for families.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ralriver
Reviews.Content: The location was great. The grounds were beautiful, except the "natural" lagoon outside our door looked like it needed to be refurbished. There is a $25.00 a night fee to park that wasn't mentioned on their web site. To get morning coffee you must use the coffee cart and spend another $4.00 per cup. There is a charge for internet service etc. There was no major problem, but attention to detail was lacking - the drapes didn't fit the window, there was no ice bucket, the room wasn't made up until 4:15, the patio needed to be cleaned...basically, there were enough little things wrong that made it irritating. I don't think this hotel is looking for repeat business so I'll try another spot next time.

Reviews.Title: “hands down amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tonilynmarie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best I have ever stayed at. I went with my family, right on the bay! I went with many of my Aunts, Uncles, Cousins, and Siblings. We are all different ages and we all had a blast! I am 18 and live here in San Diego. This wasn't like anything I had been to before. Every aspect was great. When we asked for extra blankets they were right there with them, and were very informative; some employees could even tell us some history on San Diego! The shopping at the hotels gift shop was spectacular as well, it had many San Diego inspired aspects and a very nice theme. The s'mores packs they sell are very handy when sitting by the room side fire pits! The tower was fun to climb in the morning to get my blood pumping and see a pretty view of Mission Bay and even some of sea world! I have been to this hotel before it was renovated, and although nice before, the rooms are spectacular now! I enjoyed the clean bathroom which had complimentary shampoo, conditioner and soap that were very luxurious. The pool side movie was great to occupy my two young cousins while the rest of the family relaxed in the huge hot tub! As a San Diegan, this was the nicest hotel I've seen here by far. Perfect for all ages and occasions. I can't wait to stay at the beautiful Paradise Point Resort again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, relaxing, eventful for all”
Reviews.Author: evamarie11
Reviews.Content: We went to Paradise Point with family. Young children and teenagers. We went to the poolside showing of "Finding Nemo" at night and the Barefoot grill for live entertainment. We sat by the bayside during the day and kayaked. We had a bon fire, roasting marshmallows at night. The rooms were fantastic. The beds were very comfortable and updated. What a fabulous week end get away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, beautiful island, great San Diego location”
Reviews.Author: DaveInCa49
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at Paradise Point. It's located in the heart of San Diego on Paradise Island in MIssion Bay, close to nearly everything and yet set apart and very quiet. It also has a variety of equipment available for use on the bay (sailboats, paddle boats, etc.). Coming from the north, as we entered the Mission Bay area I noticed a sudden change from busy city surroundings to a quiet island setting. Part of this quietness, I think, is due to efforts by the city itself: we witnessed the bay patrol stop a speeding jet skier on the bay and asked him to slow down. This reduced both noise and possible hazard to vacationers who were using leg or wind-powered craft on the water. We ate primarily at the bar & grill, where the food was impressive (presentation as well as quality) for a simple family patio restaurant. It made me want to try the main dining restaurant, but we had no time during our 2-day stay. The rooms were very comfortable and decorated in an appropriate island motif. One of our friends said that the entire resort had all its rooms recently redecorated. The only comment I would have is that the hotel could do with a better coffee cart service, especially in the morning. While they had one, its quality was not on par with, e.g., the national chains, and the location in the bay makes it difficult to drive out for a venti half-caf in the surrounding area. We actually made a suggestion about this when checking out. All in all, it was a most enjoyable time. I wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: Livinandlovinlife
Reviews.Content: Booked this resort online. Read other reviews, but decided to give it a shot. Driving in to the resort, it was beautiful! Lobby was nice, front desk help friendly. That was where it ended! Drove to our room, through basically a maze of little side roads, a bayside bungalow, and not cheap! Exited the car, and noticed all the empty beer cans ,and beer cases, on the patio of the bungalow next to us, not a good sign.Also, there was litter on the ground next to the rocks, surrounding the bay. Opened door to room, el cheapo sheers on front windows, broken cheap blinds in bedroom! Room had a very funky smell, combination of must, mold, and pets! Decided to turn on the WINDOW air conditioning unit, to air it out a bit! Mold all over the window sill under the unit, and a horrible moldy smell being emitted from the unit! Also, there were several personal hygiene items, left in the bathroom, from the previous occupant! We immediately went to the lobby, and asked for our money to be refunded, and went elsewhere. They did not argue at all, I got the feeling that this happens ALOT! If you have any mold allergies, this is not the place to be staying. What a disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “The Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Breidt
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at your hotel and I had such a nice and relaxing time. The grounds are beautiful. I also really thought the remodeled rooms were so nice and tasteful, not to mention clean. The housekeeping staff were efficient and did a good job each day. In the lobby area, all the staff were gracious and helpful. They always said "hello" when passing by (all staff did throughout the grounds). Your manager, Pat R, was extremely helpful . . . he even escourted us to our room. We dined at the Barfoot Bar and the food was good, the ambience, amazing. I also ejoyed a spa service . . . a body wrap/scrub that was so indulgent, a can't wait to go back. I look forward to returning to your hotel this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: VacationOUTofVegas
Reviews.Content: It is a quite beautifal and intricate place to stay. Rooms are in little mini buildings and we only really stopped by the front desk on the way in and out. We got a great deal as I think it was off season. I think we could have easily paid twice the amount in regular season. Everything was clean...the bathtub still needed some work though. We did have some issues with the internet, which they did then fix. However it was pretty expensive, so we drove to a local Wi-Fi connection to send the stuff we needed. There are some very nice fire pits in the pool areas and there were a lot of family's there walking around. Very peaceful. Very close to Seaworld....you could probably walk, but I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “WOW.... Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: HummerDad
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at this hotel several times in the past and every visit just keeps getting better and better. Everyone is Super friendly, I mean way beyond the normal hospitality, but almost a Ritz Experience. When we checked in the landscaping was looking great, the front drive was busy from some groups that were checking in, but they still made us feel special, like we were the only ones there. The rooms was perfect, we went to the Barefoot Bar for Breakfast and our server took our kids around and taught them all about the fish in the pond from sharks to whatever fish are there. Pools were clean and well maintained. This is a super kid friendly resort, close to everything, Sea World, Beaches, SD Zoo You cannot go wrong by booking a room in this hotel for a night or a week

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point is a "must-stay" oasis, a great place for the whole family.”
Reviews.Author: eunderdahl
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in to the reluctant day of our departure, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the resort. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The new style of the rooms was very inviting, fresh and accommodating. The many pools, fun activities, shops and spa amenities on the property were all terrific. Finding a hotel that is fun for our children, relaxed yet refined for us as adults is no easy feat....and you have hit the mark. There are so many fun-filled activities to take advantage of on property, yet it was easy to find peaceful retreat areas too. We really enjoyed exploring the beautiful grounds of the resort - impressively maintained. Best asset is your incredibly friendly and professional staff - they did not miss a beat. Pool attendants went above and beyond, housekeepers were thorough and fast, concierge friendly-creative-informative, and room service staff thought of every detail. We have stayed at many highly rated hotels and resorts over the past 20 years - this is one we will continue to visit! I have told many family members and friends that this resort is a must see and a must stay - a hidden gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family stay and vacation”
Reviews.Author: family063
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this resort over the last few years and it keeps getting better and better. The new remodeled rooms are excellent and the staff does everything possible to make our stay enjoyable. The check in was quick and easy as was all the staff at the restaurants, poll and boat dock. The live fish of white sea bass and yellowtail at the Barefoot Bar and grill are always a treat and remind my son and I we need to get out on the water soon for fishing. The location is awsome in SD with great weather and right across the street from Sea World. We were also able to rent bikes, play tennis and rent a sale boat right from the resort. We cant wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family get away for all ages.”
Reviews.Author: ajcrishon
Reviews.Content: Having a family with three kids of very different ages, this location provided something for everyone while still allowing mom and dad some downtime. The set up of the rooms was perfect for visiting with our friends and their families. The rooms were perfect sized, clean and comfortable. We had an absolutely wonderful time and look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Worse customer service in the reservation department!!!”
Reviews.Author: freeman12
Reviews.Content: I was charged 4 times the amount of the actual stay on two different occasions. The reservation department didnt even offer to resolve any inconvience I suffurd instead they offered that i could cancel if id like, then at the time i had to call them back to dispute another charge the women that answered the phone actually yelled at me as if I did something wrong and hung up while i was still on the phone!. I have NEVER been treated as bad as this place has treated me. They are on a high horse and could care less about the actual customer, they only care about who is next in line and how much money they can rake in with all there extra charges. I cant even explain to you how let down i was. Please reconsider before staying here, unless you like to be treated like you are extremly un imporatant and you have a million dollars to pay for the reservation before you get there. what a joke this place is. I DO NOT RECOMMEND

Reviews.Title: “Like going to Hawaii without the flight”
Reviews.Author: S&S
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure where all the crticisms for the resort come from, but we were very satisfied overall with the experience. All the staff were so friendly and helpful and the grounds & location were great. The pool was fantastic for our 3 year old and we had a great time renting a little boat from the on site marina. There are a few cons, such as the paper thin walls (we listened to our neighbors every night) and the way they nickel & dime you for everything ($10 to 'rent' a putter, $15 for internet, $25 for parking, $15 to use the gym, etc....) So, when you reserve, be sure to take that all into consideration. And, I agree with everyone else that putting a coffee maker in the room would be nice for what you pay. Overall, we had a great family vacation and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Internet”
Reviews.Author: msprichsiliconvalley
Reviews.Content: Bayside room is nice and clean. Big resort pools small. $15 per day for slow Internet connection and $25 to park is a friggn joke. These people over charge for things that should cost 1/2 the price. Don't bother with this dump. Stay at the Del and you will be better off

Reviews.Title: “Run away”
Reviews.Author: erabellix
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a disaster from the beginning to the end. Rooms were dirty. Bathroom had two spiders on the floor, moldy shower, cracked bathroom sink, stained decorative pillows on the bed and ugly gray tiles on the floor with one stained and faded runner. Rooms were advertised as "renovated" but the bus boy admitted that only the carpets were removed and replaced with the gray tile. The bathrooms had not been updated and the furnature and lamps and art work looked years old. We looked at four different rooms, hoping to find one that was in better shape. All rooms had cracked bathroom sinks and stains everywhere. We asked for our money back and were given some trouble. The place seemed to be deserted. No wonder.

Reviews.Title: “Not Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Aleatha
Reviews.Content: I went out West to look at colleges with my daughters. My younger daughter saw this resort on Jon & Kate and was just dying to stay there. After a fair amount of research and speaking with Annette Ross, the reservations manager, I felt confident this would be a great place to stay with kids for 3 nights, one of whom has a walking disability and daily therapy. We arrived in the evening down a tropical path illuminated by tiki torches and were greeted by very friendly front desk staff and checked in promptly. Upon arrival to our "upgraded" suite we entered a room that was dirty (sink with food particles in the drain, bugs in the bathroom area, dirt all over the light switches, paper on the floor, cob webs in the corners... obviously not the clean I am used to even in the most basic hotel. I phoned the front desk and explained the condition of the suite and was moved to an "executive suite" within 30 minutes. Upon arrival to our new suite, we encountered some of the same problems in terms of cleanliness and no bedding for the pull out sofa sleeper. The pillows for the second bed were wet and once again debris on the floor, the bedroom door would not close without slamming and putting weight into it making it just as difficult to open, no soaps, a tub faucet that was falling out of the wall with a huge hole above it. I phoned housekeeping and asked for bedding and was informed that they were out of pillows, linens and blankets and had nothing to send us. I again phoned the front desk and then asked to speak with the manager on duty. I was told there was not a manager on duty and that she would send someone to another empty room to retrieve the missing bedding. Upon arrival the linens smelled of cigarette smoke. I gave up and 4 of us, slept in a king size bed - suffice it to say it wasn't a pleasant evening. The next morning I did meet with a manager (not the GM, he was on vacation), who listened, admitted the resort dropped the ball and did not charge us for the room night, and then offered to move us. Unfortunately, there weren't any rooms available, and the manager had the current room cleaned from top to bottom, reduced our rate if I wanted to stay. That said, the property while may have been renovated, it's not the caliber of resort my family is used to. The pools are small, the beach dirty... The restaurant was good. The rooms (2 that we were in) essentially had yellow paint slapped on the walls to cover up the old and a few new pieces of contemporary furniture. The rooms do not look like the pictures on the website, so I opted to move our family to a more suitable property. I would like to say that while the property fell very short of meeting our expectations, the manager did try to make things right. The problem is that it was the quality of rooms and housekeeping staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, too many extra charges”
Reviews.Author: Mtnlover2185
Reviews.Content: Pros: The resort has beautiful well maintained grounds. They have 3 pools (1 is adult only), one has a grill and bar. The rooms were nicely decorated, spacious and comfortable ( we had a garden view room). Outside of each unit are 2 patio chairs and small round table for relaxation. The staff could not have been better. Every person we encountered from front desk to grounds keepers were top notch. Very close to Sea World. Cons: Although each room has an assigned parking space, you are charged $25 per day to park. Internet was $15/day, Each day I was charged 6 taxes totalling $36/day. The on site grill was very overpriced for very plain average tasting food. Nearest off site restaurants about 2 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Past its sell by date - poor service and standards”
Reviews.Author: sunnytimthesecond
Reviews.Content: We had hoped for better. The rooms are in blocks of chalets which are packed tightly together with parking spots outside so it's more of a motel than a hotel. Room OK but small compared to other hotels in USA - clean but buildings are old with old (and so noisy aircon, fridge, bathroom ventilation). Noisy plant room outside (possibly the pump for the duck pond water feature). Housekeeping was terrible - they often didn't turn up till after 4.00pm. Got locked out of the room at one stage due to a faulty door lock - I think they are old too - took ages to sort out - couldn’t get to see a manager (all too busy apparently). The barefoot restaurant only has about 8 dishes on the menu which is the same for lunch and dinner - never changed all week we were there. The coffee bar is only open in the morning. The shop (Island Market) had helpful staff but was pricey. There are no other amenities nearby unless you drive. It's only saving grace was that it is just about within walking distance of Seaworld for children (about a mile) - there is no hotel shuttle to Seaworld though. If that’s where you want to go to then that’s the only good reason for staying here - there are many much better places to stay in the San Diego area for the money. Don't stay any longer than 1 or 2 days though and think of it as an overpriced motel with swimming pools scattered around the car parks and you are less likely to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort.... would absolutely recommend”
Reviews.Author: travelgal018
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on travel website. Beautiful resort, beautiful grounds... tropical plants and flowers everywhere. Beautiful lagoon on property. Everything was very well-maintained and cared for. The rooms were very nicely decorated, clean, comfortable, and updated looking. Convenient fridge/freezer in room. Attentive service. Appealing looking pools all over the place.... although the weather was a little too cold for me to swim. Easy check in and out. Option to upgrade my room for $15/night, which we did. Maybe my only complaint if you could even call it that was the breakfast at the restaurant was a little pricey for a basic meal, but to me it was worth it for the lovely relaxing view on the water. And yes you pay for parking, but who cares.... just know before you book and calculate it into the price of the stay. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here”
Reviews.Author: bcfc123
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this resort to anyone we loved it here. I too read a lot of negative reports before we went and considered cancelling and booking elsewhere. I am so glad we didn’t. The location couldn’t be better, close to sea world, restaurants and beaches. Easy drive to the Zoo, down town and La Jolla. The rooms were clean, spacious and modern. The staff were very friendly and helpful. On the first day we had a slight problem with the shower tap, I called reception and a maintenance man arrived to fix it within 5 mins. He was also happy to answer some of our questions regarding best beaches and restaurants to go to in the area. Our only gripe would be no coffee facilities in the room. We had to queue every morning at the coffee cart to buy some. The food at the Barefoot Grill was good, but not alot to choose from. Didn’t go to Baleen as it was a bit pricey. We booked through Virgin Atlantic so didn’t have to pay the parking fee. I’m glad because $25 a day is ridiculous! Altogether a brilliant week in San Diego!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: dejlim
Reviews.Content: I usually don't write reviews for hotels but had to sign up to write one for Paradise Point. Before going to the resort, I have read a lot of reviews and did read a lot of negative things about it so I was kind of hesitant with the place but still gave it a try since my little daughter loves the beach. Got there at 2 pm and immediately got a room. The room was really nice, cozy and spacious. Bed was really comfortable. Love the lagoon at the back of the room. It was very quiet and relaxing. Need to bring slippers, no carpet which makes sense since sand will be all over the floor. My daughter got to feed the ducks (they give you a free pack of duck food). It's walking distance to the beach and a lot of activities in the resort. Staff were friendly and the resort was really clean. There is a $25 parking fee per night which is a little pricey and the food in the resort were also a little pricey so I suggest you buy food outside and just bring it. They have a lot of fast food around Sports Arena Blvd. Overall, it was great! Will definitely go back...but maybe next time we'll get a room closer to the beach :)

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced and Lacked Service”
Reviews.Author: CottonwoodSierra
Reviews.Content: Check in was at 4pm did not get a room until after 5:15 pm and had to raise a fuss to get it then. Spoke to the manager he waived the parking fee for our trip. The next day or should I say nite 12:21 am a security person entered our room with a pass key without even knocking or announcing his arrival. Spoke to the manager again only to get a so sorry. A taco was 9.00. Rooms are clean but dont expect to see a maid before 3pm.

Reviews.Title: “Very kid-friendly, close to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: StrangeTripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed from April 3-8, 2010 (yes, we felt the earthquake!) and were thoroughly surprised. We were expecting your typical boiler-plate resort and were pleasantly surprised to find all this kid-friendly stuff----lagoons with ducks (kids could stop feeding them), multiple pools, sandy beaches, fire pits at the beaches, tiki torches, "campfires" at at least one of the pools (people roasting marshmallows every nite), tall observation tower (the kids loved climbing it), miniature golf, bike rentals........ The property almost has a campground feeling to it, which we most appreciated. Kinda cool, considering it's in the middle of a metro area! Location was great----5 minute drive to sea world, or if you'd like to save on the $12 parking fee, you can easily walk it in 20-30 minutes, which we did twice. Also within 15 minutes (traffic permitting) from downtown, airport , zoo etc.... And, within a 5-10 minute drive to Trader Joes and Von's supermarket. In addition, Home Desperate is close for firewood purchases.... Beaches on the ocean were very close, as was an old-time amusement park. Room was more than we expected---ours was fairly spacious with a king bed, and a pull-out couch, which was perfect for our 2 young boys. Kitchenette was just enough---decent sized under counter fridge, smallish microwave, granite countertops and a sink. We made most of our meals there, except for a few dinners out.... As another reviewer said, it would have been nice to have at least some minimal kitchen utensils. It seemed like the room was updated within the past coupla years. Another thing we appreciated was being able to park right outside our front door! OK, now the complaints----didn't like the $25/day parking fee. Might as well build that into your room price, unless you don't drive. While the room rate we got seemed fairly reasonable (about $129/nite+parking) for what we got and the location, the extras seemed a bit pricey---restaurants, duck food, s'mores kits, mini golf club rental fees and your other typical incidentals, not to mention the parking..... While the room was nice, the dark ceramic floor tile made the room a bit dark and gloomy, especially at nite. Also, my feet were always dirty after walking barefoot on this tile. Bathroom was a bit dated, plus the exhaust fan didn't work worth a crap (pun intended)..... Other than the sliding back door, it would have been nice to have a couple windows that opened. Overall, i would definitely recommend this resort to people with kids. For singles or couples w/o kids, it's your call----this place has a ton of kids. If you want peace and quiet, or romance or whatever, this may not be the place for you.......

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Experience, good price.”
Reviews.Author: aleigho
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline. I was pretty worried when I read the reviews, but I figured we weren't really going to be in the hotel much anyway. It ended up that we did spend more time in the hotel than we thought, so here is my experience. To start, we arrived at 12 noon. Check in time is 4pm, but I was hoping we could unload our things and go do a tour and come back. I was told there wasn't a room clean yet, but that she would call me when the room was available. I was also surprised to find out that parking is and extra $25 a night for a 'dedicated' parking space. They take your credit card when you check in for 'incidentals' okay- no big deal, but don't use a debit card, it freezes $300. I told the front desk clerk I didn't have a credit card with that amount on it :) and she said well I can just charge you $150 on your debit card. We left, and by 4:30 were ready to go back and relax after driving all night and doing a tour at the USS Midway. (If you have kids- take them! Very cool.) Noticing I hadn't received a call yet, I called the hotel only to be told that our room still wasn't ready. ? Check in time was 4:00 I thought? Sorry- still not ready. So I arrived there at the front desk at 4:45 and after waiting 10 minutes in line (again) and they "gave us a new room." The room was very nice. I was worried about the remodeling issue after reading the reviews here, but our room seemed to have already been remodeled. It had nice furnishings, a flat screen TV, new flooring, fresh paint and a nice sink area and closet space for luggage. The only part NOT remodeled was the tub, and toilet area. You could tell that was a leftover 70's project they did not get to. While clean, I don't understand why not just re-tile the tub and behind the toilet and finish the job? It was a little odd. We had a private entrance, and a semi-private patio area off the back of our room. We never heard any noise from either neighbor beside us, only from people outside walking by to the pool. I would request a 'cove room' or room on the outskirts of the property next time to avoid people walking by with noisy kids, but overall it wasn't too bad. We were happy to find out there are 5 pools at this resort, all with hot tubs. One pool is heated all the time, and the rest were solar heated for the season. The pool closest to us was very warm, and had two fire pits which they turn on at night. There was also croquet, and a very nice hot-tub. Towel service was great, they have a basket at the pool with clean towels. We would grab a few and take back to the room to supplement the 4 exact towels they left in the room. Pool hours are 9am-10pm. They have tiki torches all around the property and pool at night which was a nice touch. We went swimming at night several times after being out all day, and sat in the hot tub. Nice way to relax after walking all day. The beach was nice, nothing spectacular. It's actually an inlet, so don't think you are going to go surfing or anything. They did have a bunch of things to do at the resort (all at extra charges) but we didn't get a chance to do any of them, although the sailing looked fun. The concierge was very helpful and very nice. The landscaping was beautiful, and the location was perfect. It's literally 1 minute from Sea World and close to everything else. I was very impressed (as were my children) with the entrance. When you drive up into the property, the first impression is that of a 5 star resort. After looking at the menu for the restaurant, we decided to head down to Denny's each morning for breakfast, which was great. It's about 3 minutes away, just over the bridge. We planned ahead and had a list of dinner locations we wanted to eat at based on advice from local residents and reviews on line, so we skipped the overpriced gourmet tourist food. Overall, our stay was really great. I would stay here again, but next time I'd try to get out of that parking $25 sham, (Our 'dedicated' spot changed each night, and while across from our room, there never seemed to be an issue with finding a spot, and the place was booked.) and I'd request a room a little more private. One thing they do need to fix are the road signs. There is one major place on the property where there are two signs, one says NO RIGHT TURN and one says NO LEFT TURN, in the same spot!! The road is supposed to be one way, but I'm not sure if anyone ever just goes one way? For the price, ($98) a night, this was a great deal. One final thing- They do charge you $1.00 for a 'room tax' upon check out. What is that? Why $1.00? Wireless internet is an extra $10 a night, be warned. I didn't feel like taking the time to find out, but I thought it was kinda odd. You can check out from your TV, which is what we did, and back home we went.

Reviews.Title: “A great family resort in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: tvfishingguy
Reviews.Content: The Paradise Point Resort has been nicely updated and has a lot to offer families with kids. Between the bay-front beach , selection of pools and numerous on-property activities for the kids....mine could not get enough time feeding the ducks....it is a place you don't have to leave to have a great time. Nice rooms and 2 waterfront restaurant options are a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great zero entry/heated pool & loved being on the bay beach!”
Reviews.Author: foolishtoad1
Reviews.Content: If you're staying in the San Diego vicinity w/children, they will LOVE the heated, zero entry pool! It's one of 5 different pools. There is a nice sandy area beside the pool for little ones to dig. Pool side service of beverages and food make this relaxing. It feels like you're in a tropical location (minus the cold wind when you get out). Nice hot tub. Worth paying extra to stay in a room on the bayside. Our kids 2 and 6 LOVED being able to dig in the sand daily and find seashells. We even saw seals and otters in the bay. Could swim in it too, but it's was chilly when we were there. We all LOVED the shark lagoon over by the marina and Barefoot Beach restaurant ( i think that is the name). Great place to eat outside, but watch out for the birds! They stole my husband's salmon one night! Nice lava waterfall there. The kids were really entertained while waiting for their food b/c of being able to watch the leopard sharks and flounder fish, rays. Really neat! Baleen restaurant was really good too! Excellent food and service! It's a little fancy, but we went early to dinner and they were great w/the kids there too! The only downside about this hotel is that there are no coffeemakers in the rooms, but there is a coffee cart near the Gift shop. And the ventilation in our room was poor so our wet suits/towels never dried out unless we put them outside in the sun. Would be fun to go back in the summer so the kids could try the kids camp. Great proximity to Seaworld too! Less than a 5 min. drive! Nice mini gold course on the grounds too! We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience I ever had”
Reviews.Author: ajsas
Reviews.Content: 1. booked a bungalow and that was not available, we had to go in a room first and then move to the bungalow later, no excuses no sorry. 2. check in was @ 4 and we had to wait untill 6, room still not ready, no sorry no excuses... 3. when we were trying to explain/talk to them we we asked to leave because we were not silenced!!!!!! We paid 2500 dollar for 6 nights and were being treated as if we had to say thanks, we were asked to leave the hotel with our son (9) the whole service is the worst I ever had in a hotel, but thanks to them we stayed in a much better hotel THE HYATT.....better then the hotel in hel, paradise point

Reviews.Title: “Fun for the whole family!”
Reviews.Author: TeamPete04
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point is a wonderful getaway from the real world! Nestled in the midddle of the city, the whole family can relax and have fun. From playing on the beach, feeding the ducks, exploring the acres, riding bikes, playing miniature golf, swimming in the pool, watching the fish...there is always something to do! We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!!”
Reviews.Author: fungirl61
Reviews.Content: My husband, college age daughter and I were at the Paradise Point for our Spring break in March and we can't say enough about the accommodations and the staff and the whole experience. It really is geared to families with young children but we had a wonderful stay and all the little kids weren't annoying at all. Our room was beautiful, clean and we had a great view on the bay. The staff was Johnny on the spot with anything we needed. I highly recommend this to any age. It isn't the least expensive but well worth the cost!!

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat secluded - very much relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Citybrarian
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in room 454 - near Mission Bay. Overall the amenities were great. I love that the room came with an empty refridgerator, but nothing beyond that in terms of cutlery or dishes. Not built for independent living. The room was nice and quiet, beds comfortable, tv was modern and internet connection reliable ($10/day). The bathroom was my only complaint - bathtub not suitable for soaking, was very shallow and old-fashioned. I didn't use any of the spa services or pool so can't comment on those. Food seemed a bit expensive so I made the 40 minute trek to Trader Joe's and had enough supplies to get me through my breakfasts and lunches. Conference facilities were really nice and I was happy to see that my wifi connection extended there from the room. Planned on using the fitness facilities but it was an extra $13/day, so I ended up using the running trail around the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Resort is a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: travels_weekly
Reviews.Content: just completed our third vacation at this resort, what a wonderful time. Traveling with teenagers (14/17/19) can be difficult, but they love this place. locate 5 minutes from the airport, we were in our rooms by 1pm. three separate pools, flowers and green perfect grass everywhere is wonderful. we dined by the bay at their restaurant many times. the health club is an extra fee ($10) so they passed on that. every request we had was fulfilled by a smiling, pleasant employee. its not perfect (bathrooms could be cleaner) but it's a gem smack in the middle of san diego bay. we will return again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Camping Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: jkcain04
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the resort to a beautiful landscape, my husband and children and I were very excited. The first room we were assigned was dirty... dirty floors, dirt and hair in the beds and even bugs in the beds. Second room is where the thought of paradise started to feel more like camping. NO HEAT and very chilly nights bundled up like an eskimo. How kind the hotel offered us extra blankets??? Not to move us rooms or fix the heat as their repair man was not there. So in the freezing morning my thoughts flashed to a hot shower. OH and to my NOT so surprise, the shower didnt work either!!! They then moved us to another room ( so 3 out of 5 days was spent packing and unpacking) in which I required the manager inspect himself to be in working order. NO HEAT, NO SHOWER and DIRT N BUGS... Sounds like camping doesnt it? Not too mention the HIDDEN FEES: $25 daily parking fee and completely overpriced meals... For a couple omlets and some scrambled eggs... $60!!! Would never go back, such a shame for a beautiful place to be such a dissapointment.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here.. can't wait to go back again next year!”
Reviews.Author: kebj
Reviews.Content: This was our first family trip vacation... and we searched countless different hotels and resorts that would fit our expectations for a first famiily trip vacation and so glad that we went with Paradise Point. We had a magnificent time in San Diego as well as our stay at Paradise Point. We stayed in the Lanai Garden Guestroom, which was really nice and clean. House keeping and workers were great. Our rooms were cleaned, beds were made, as well as new towels provided to us everyday. The beds were really comfortable and we got really good sleep every night. We won't be searching for any other hotels or resorts next time we go to San Diego because we have found the perfect place to stay at already! Can't wait to visit again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Beautiful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: Bobkatevan
Reviews.Content: Okay, let's start out with the good... beautiful grounds include a lagoon, bridges, tropical plants, nice pools, clean and updated rooms. They had campfires on the beach in the evening with tiki torches lighting the area. Very nice. However, even with all this good, my biggest complaint is thin walls. I don't want to hear the party next door, and I did, on both sides. Luckily, we got a decent crowd on both sides and they went to bed at decent hours and they were not partiers. I would predict however, some people would encounter these issues. They can fix cosmetic or other easier fixable items, but adding more insulation to their newly decorated rooms will not happen easily. There is a $25 parking fee to park your car, right outside your room and the bar and grill is pricey ($14) for order of nachos. We ate appetizers, two beers and one iced tea and our bill was $80. However the view was gorgeous, so your paying for the ambiance. It's very close to sea world and right next to Mission Bay Park, so location is wonderful. Beds were comfy. Rooms newly decorated and very clean. I would recommend, but warn friends of the thin walls.

Reviews.Title: “Go to Paradise Point for your vacation. It is fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: Travel4scrap
Reviews.Content: On a recent "Girls Weekend", a group of 12 of us stayed at Paradise Point Resort and Spa in San Diego. It was a marvelous experience. We rented a conference room to have a place to craft. The conference room layout was excellent and well thought out. There was a bar with a sink, fridge, microwave and large flat screen TV, along with comfortable couches and chairs. We needed extra tables and power cords and they were brought to us promptly. The service people went above and beyond the call of duty to make sure we had everything we needed. The rooms have been recently remodeled and are wonderful. They are so relaxing and beautiful. The decor is cool and spa like. The new flat screen TV's are awesome, and the FREE internet connection is as good as being at home on your own high speed internet. (That is important to me.) Every single employee was courteous, made it a point to greet you, ask how you were, and asked if there was anything they could do for you. The location is fantastic, because it is just outside of all the hectic bustle of downtown, but close enough to get downtown in minutes. It is very close to Sea World. It is on an island, so it is surrounded by water and beaches. The property has a tropical feel, lush foliage, and low buildings. It feels like Hawaii. Although there is absolutely no reason to leave the property because it is so beautiful and there is a lot to do there, there are also tons of activities to do in the surrounding area. Shopping, Zoo, Balboa Park Museums, boating, bike riding, Sea World, La Jolla and the list goes on. The Resort itself and the staff made this such a memorable vacation, we have decided we must return here for our next "Girls Weekend". Not only was this great for a conference, but it is wonderful for a family vacation, or celebrating an anniversary. As you can see, I highly recommend any reason to drop all your cares and worries and go to Paradise Point.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful! Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: kkmcan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Hotels.com and chose the std no view room. After staying one night we decided to ask how much it would be to upgrade to a bay front room. We were quoted an extra $45 per night for the same room we had but on the bay. We loved it and thought it was a great deal! So nice to walk out your door onto the sand. There was a fire pit right in front of our room and after a quick trip to the grocery store to get smores making supplies and wood we enjoyed the evening on the beach in front of a fire. Our kids had the time of their lives swimming in the gorgeous pool, doing the mini putt golf course and building sand castles on the beach. The $25 parking fee stinks but oh well, all San Diego hotels charge exhorborant parking fees. We also brought our own small coffeepot and took our coffee out to walk on the beach in the mornings. No need to even leave this resort. We came to relax and take advantage of the resort offerings and activities. Newly renovated rooms are gorgeous! Super clean, freshly painted with wonderful tile floors and beautiful furniture. We can't wait to go back- we miss our ocean paradise already!

Reviews.Title: “OMG the hidden charges are totally STUPID!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shage
Reviews.Content: So, here we are at the Paradise Point resort and spa in sunny San Diego! Ok place...DON'T TRUST THE RATES you get from Travelocity or other sites because the room rate is the least of your worries. How is $4 for a cup of coffee? No coffee in rooms, sorry. How about $10 a day for WIFI...and only a single PC can be on at a time (sorry, we have two people...only on can be on...and the first time you register the first PC, the MAC address of the WIFI card sticks to the username so forget ever having the second online). How about $25/night to park your rental car!!!???!!!?? NO KIDDING! So, think again about the price of this place. Plus there are ants and spiders EVERYWHERE in these ground-level rooms... Also, when you check in, you will be given the worst possible room with the worst possible view, farthest from the lobby. If you don't cry and whine, you will be listening to the highway; not the surf. I have never written a bad hotel review before...and I have written many good ones. I travel a lot for pleasure....DON'T stay here unless you know about the countless hidden fees and ruse staff. Also, they have these crappy little refrigerators that hum louder than the frequent helicopters...except the fridges never fricking stop. You will not sleep well unless you unplug the damn thing.

Reviews.Title: “Dude, it is 7:30AM. Stop drilling on my door.”
Reviews.Author: Phinaddict
Reviews.Content: So we arrive early afternoon, room is not ready yet. No worries, the front desk gal will call me when it is ready. She suggested lunch. Off we go. 5 minutes later, just as we pull out of the hotel grounds, the phone rings, " Sir, your room is ready". Uh, Ok, why not tell us it was going to be 5 minutes in the first place. So after lunch, we check in and are happy with the room and grounds. They did a great job at creating a unique resort. So the next morning, at 7:30 Am, we are awakened by the sound of a maintenance guy drilling our door and hammering with a chisel to replace the lockset on the door. Im laying in bed thinking, this is not the Paradise Resort and spa I was planning on. Like any red blooded male, I open the door and tell the guy in no uncertain terms he had better cease and desist or I will have my girlfriend kick his a#%. He split promptly. The rest of the stay was uneventful. Clean room, quiet and not crowded... Low season. Three days later at checkout, the young lady at the front desk was not too personable, maybe she had something else on her mind.... A week later, we had a billing question. I called at 7 pm. it took me four tries to reach the front desk. Once I had someone on the line and explained the issue, the woman corrected the problem and credited us but, like our checkout experience, she was almost rude. Having to pay $25.00 for parking, per day, and 10.00 per day for internet connection seemed like being robbed. In short, great property, poor staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, unique venue and well done room upgrades”
Reviews.Author: SoCal333
Reviews.Content: We have stayed several times at Paradise Point for quick SoCal getaway and wanted to write a review due to the recent upgrades to the guest rooms. We were impressed with the new floors, furniture and room refresh. The room upgrades were overdue and probably the only downside of this unique resort. Paradise Point is hands down the most family friendly resort in San Diego due to all rooms/bungalows being on ground level and easy access to beach and pools. The tropical landscape provides a Hawaii like experience within 20 minutes of downtown San Diego/Airport. We had an amazing dinner (yet pricey) at Baleen just a few doors down from our room. Highly recommend for families or for anyone that is looking for a convenient location yet unique resort as a home base to see all the sights in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Relaxing, great all around resort.”
Reviews.Author: CJFCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival I was greeted by very the efficient, pleasent front desk personnal. Check in went very speedy and since it was already dark was escorted to my bungalow by the bell service. He offered to unload my car however I declined as I was anxious to meet up with my group and start my weekend. My room was more than I expected. Very large and spacious with all new decor and located very close to the area we were given for our ladies weekend. We had a great stay most sleeping very little however I took advantage of having a room all to myself and throughly enjoyed my weekend away from the hussle and bussle of daily life. I have already booked my next stay which will be with family and friends over the Easter holiday.

Reviews.Title: “RELAX IN SAN DIEGO”
Reviews.Author: MatildaP
Reviews.Content: When I think of San Diego I think of this hotel. It is a paradise of trees, flowers and beauty. I would never consider any other place

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: pieret1
Reviews.Content: I had a great time in San Diego. The hotel room was really beautiful. I heard the rooms were just renovated - They did a really great job. The grounds were really nice too. Everything was so clean and the staff always greeted you and were always so friendly if you had any questions.

Reviews.Title: “The resort was a delight. The staff was...”
Reviews.Author: Polistory
Reviews.Content: The resort was a delight. The staff was The staff was very helpful. We had a group of 14 crafters and the room we had as our workroom had everything we asked for - extra power supplies, tables, comfortable seating. The rooms have been redone & the environment was gorgeous. I could not have asked for a better place for our retreat. I am already planning the next one!!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Stay in San Diego yet!!”
Reviews.Author: karasmith731
Reviews.Content: I vacationed at the Paradise Point Hotel and Spa over Valentines Weekend and I can't say enough about my stay. I have been a guest at the Resort in the past and while my experience has ALWAYS been amazing, the new remodel was a VERY pleasant surprise! As always the service was amazing, every single request was reached with personalized service. We ate at the Baleen each night because every menu item is unique and delicious! We spent our days at the spa and having drinks at the very casual and well-priced Barefoot Bar and Grill and then we even rented a boat right from the bar through Action Sports Rentals. I cant wait to head back to San Diego and stay at the Paradise again.....there is always something new and pleasantly surprising!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl1211
Reviews.Content: The Paradise has been completely redone and it is AMAZING! My husband and I stayed here a few years ago and the hotel was incredible then but now, oh my goodness, it has been completely redone and looks phenomenal. The new furniture is so nice and all of the usual amenities and charm of the Paradise are still there...the staff is so friendly and helpful, the Spa is so relaxing, the food at Baleen is excellent, and of course, the location is the best. My husband and I feel like we're worlds away as soon as we step foot on property. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Average at best - but ok value for the money I guess?”
Reviews.Author: chichichicago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 days at this hotel over Presidents Day weekend. Take this review with a grain of salt - we typicallly stay at Ritz Carltons. We picked this hotel because we were visiting a relative who lives very close by - and it was recommended. It was inexpensive - we had some package that i think the room ended up being around 150ish a nite. The room was large - there was a big sofa as well as a king sized bed. Unfortunately the first night the heating/air unit leaked a huge puddle of water and there were ants around the bath tub. I called maintenance in the morning. We returned home late at night (1030 pm) and the heating unit had been fixed but housekeeping had never come to the room. Unmade bed and wet towels. Ugh. I called the front desk (I was furious) and they offered to send housekeeping over. I turned that offer down - we were exhausted and wanted to go to bed. I told the person i would like to speak to a manager. She said a manager would not be in until 3 PM the next day. I said "have the manager call me so I can express my irritation with him/her. If i dont hear from him/her I will post it on trip advisor so they can read it there". Obviously I never got a call. The ants remained our entire stay - but they were only in/and around the tub so we didnt bother reporting them again. The restaurant Baleen is nice - we had a good dinner and good servcie there on valentines day. The service at the bar (at Balleen) is BAD. We stopped by one night for a drink. No one else was sitting at the bar. We asked to see a wine list. The bar tender gave us a list and then proceeded to rearrange the liquor bottles and also fill waiters orders (from the tables). I am not kidding - 10 minutes go by and his back was to us the entire time. Finally i say "excuse me sir - i am sorry - do we need to sit at a table to order a glass of wine?" I said it very nicely and of course he didnt get the fact that i was being sarcastic. He said "oh - you can order here what can i get you?" Whatever. At the casual restaurant by the water - i went there alone for breakfast one morning. I waitied 10 minutes for a menu - 10 minutes for coffee. The omelet was very good. Had to ask 3 people to find the waiter to get the check. There was plenty of staff - i guess they were hanging out in the kitchen talking to each other. The place wasnt crowded - no excuse. The internet service at the business center is afortune. If i recall it was like 9 bucks for 15 minutes . Ridiculous. They charge 25 bucks a nite to park there. The workout room was pretty nice and not crowded. The have a multi -use pass that they dont tell you about - but it is much cheaper than the stated fee of 12 bucks a day.I think it was 35 bucks for 5 visits - and two people can share the pass. I hope this is helpful. I dont usually stay in hotels like this so maybe this is what you get for 150 per nite. It is NOT as nice as the sister property in Naples. Not even close.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaHotshoe
Reviews.Content: I had a group of 5 media guests with me. All said how much they all enjoyed the hotel and the grounds! I have used this hotel many times taking clients and they always talk about how much the enjoyed there stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: RAKSAM
Reviews.Content: Good location for the business I had to do. Great amenities, friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point provided an unexpected first quality Tahiti Like resort experience minutes from the city.”
Reviews.Author: CarriageKansasCity
Reviews.Content: I was personally surprised with the quality of the rooms (private villas), the food was exceptional, atmosphere casual, service fantastic and prices were right. Anyone traveling to San Diego for buisness or pleasure should stay here. Rick Miller

Reviews.Title: “Rotten Valentine's Experience - Worst Hotel Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: tikisuz
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Paradise Point before for a conference and decided to give it a shot for a romantic weekend stay. First, there was someone's room service tray strewn on the lawn in front of our room when we checked in at 2PM. After going out to dinner and coming back to the hotel around 9, the dirty dishes and napkins were still on the lawn. I went to the front desk and complained that this wasn't the quality I would expect from this place. They apologized and guess what, it was still there the next morning. Also, around 7:30AM on the morning after Valentine's Day, we woke up to the sound of a leaf blower outside our room. Seriously, what a romantic morning? Ugh. Another call to the front desk and the ambitious gardening was halted until after 8AM. We also ventured to the grill for dinner on Monday night and food was pretty sub-par on top of being expensive. The location is great and the resort is a great idea, but it's currently poorly executed. I'd compare this with a 2-star experience for a 4-star price.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined Valentines Day”
Reviews.Author: kylesvo
