Reviews.Content: They lost my reservation, we drove away, wife pissed, then found my reservation # online by driving around ,because they wouldn't let me use their internet, drove back, they made a mistake, got a room, shower leaked, profound mold smell, no customer service, no manger available for 30 minutes, only offered 50% off. We just left because the mold smell was so bad. Ceiling drywall falling off. HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE, and horrible customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Sad Vacation”
Reviews.Author: 2xlr890
Reviews.Content: Nicely remodeled but the tile floors need throw rugs because they are ice cold. Hard to believe that a hotel of this cost doesn't even give you a micro wave or coffee maker.Great location wonderful lay out. The heater/air conditioner made so much noise we had to have it off during cold weather when trying to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for all..”
Reviews.Author: gogirl40
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times and enjoy it. The last time we scored an amazing room rate (usually $200+ a night, was only $99) and I noticed a few changes... no coffee in the room, less amenities, overall not as high-end. Perhaps with the economy in the current state they are trying to appeal to larger crowd. The rooms are a bit outdated but comfortable. The restaurants are fun especially in the summer months when there is live music (I heard they cut the live music last summer because of the economy.) Love movie night by the pool. Love feeding the ducks. Enjoyed the Fine Dinning restaurant. Can get VERY crowded especially on Holiday weekends and beware of the jellyfish! The Bayside rooms are the best.

Reviews.Title: “The renovated rooms were nice, but the bathroom was a bit dirty.”
Reviews.Author: tropicalM
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at this resort for Thanksgiving last year. We had the garden-view room. The room was renovated nicely - nice hard wood floors and nice beds. Our "private" garden was amazing. However, some parts of the room still showed how old/run-down the room used to be. The walls and the bar/counter area were dated. The microwave and the fridge were a joke (but at least we got to use them for free). The bathroom was the least satisfactory. The bathroom had an open sink area with a closed shower/toilet area. The sink area wasn't too bad - it was bright - but the floor tiles felt dirty. The shower/toilet area was very problematic because it was VERY small. The water in our toilet kept running. The trade-off for a room like this is that you do get bugs inside. We saw some interesting insects and a few spiders...! All the renovations were done INSIDE the rooms - meaning the exterior of each room still looks like public washrooms you see in any parks. BUT - make sure you visit their ballroom area. Man, that was one of the NICEST ballrooms I've ever seen! It was very pretty and beautifully decorated. Only if the rooms were like that... Definitely over-priced. I'd say it's a 3-star resort that should only cost $90/night, including parking.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated!”
Reviews.Author: shala47
Reviews.Content: Setting is beautiful but the accomodation was average to run down down.The suite reeked of mold and mildue.When requests were made for disability accomodation we were completely ignored.The parking is a hidden 25.00 per day more, the internet no wireless was 10.00 per day.The site is set on 40.00 acres which is lovely but the gardeners have saws going non stop from early in the morning all day.And the jacuzzi whoch I desperately needed to use was broken. The setting is top notch and many of the waitress's and spa staff were very sweet and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “New rooms are incredible!”
Reviews.Author: threeplustwo
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed with our 3 kids. we stayed in a brand new room on the bay and it was out of this world/ i felt like we were in Hawaii at a fraction of the cost. The service was first class and we will return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: SaddleRock2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paradise Point many years ago and WOW has it changed! I remember it being a nice beach themed resort with some much needed TLC and I was thrilled with their newly renovated rooms. The room I had was designed with a kind of Balinese feel and it was gorgeous. Fantastic beds and large TV's. The lovely grounds are still beautifully kept. Walking around at night with the tiki torches lit up...it feels like Hawaii!. The Spa is fantastic (Ask for Lia for a facial and Annette for a hot stone massage). It is small, intimate and also has a Balinese feel. The restaurant is great (Baleen) and I can imagine what it wold be like in the warmer month to sit outside on the deck and watch the boats go by. All in all a great hotel and I was surprised how close it was to the airport. If you like big boxy hotels there are plenty of Hiltons and Hyatts around but Paradise Point is truly unique.

Reviews.Title: “great destination for families”
Reviews.Author: ZeppelinTSi
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time there. The rooms aren't the greatest, but we stayed on the Lagoon side and the view was AMAZING! Bring plenty of money to feed the ducks, they are lots of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Destination Resort On San Diego Bay”
Reviews.Author: TerryLagunaNiguel
Reviews.Content: This was our second family trip in six months to this wonderful resort and we have a third vacation scheduled in a couple of weeks. The breathtaking views, wonderful staff, delicious food and peaceful ambience make this resort one of our new favorite vacation spots. Our young children love it because they get to enjoy nature at its best. We can spend hours walking along the bay, picking up seashells, chasing birds, looking for water turtles and fish in the large lagoon, miniature golfing and best of all, sitting on the bay watching the sunset. Sea World is just around the corner and the San Diego Zoo and Balboa Park with all of its wonderful museums and entertainment are just a short car ride away. The resort is in the middle of a huge renovation but we never heard any noise from the remodeling. I have traveled all over the world and don't usually sleep well with all of the noise. On both of our visits I have slept very well. I have never stayed in such a quiet property. We peeked into one of the rooms that was being remodeled and it was gorgeous. The history of the property is quite fascinating so take a look at the website and see all that the property has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Very dark and tired MOTEL”
Reviews.Author: KarBear03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the PP/SD November 26&27, 2009. I received a $77.00 per night rate on priceline.com. I will say after receiving my hotel confirmation from priceline I came right here to Trip Advisor for the reviews and I was not happy with what I was reading. :( We arrived Thanksgiving a.m. and Front Desk clerk checking me in states that they had me down for 2 queens. I then requested 1 king and she told me she was going to give us a complimentary upgrade to the king with a view. We were excited!!!!!!!! The bellhop had us follow him over to a room in the 500 block. UPGRADE this was NOT. It was a very dark and tired room with ONE queen bed. I called the FD clerk from the phone in the room and she informed me that this was my complimentary upgrade.....confused by going from 2 queens to one king to a DARK DREARY ROOM with ONE QUEEN BED, I then requested to be DOWNGRAGED. She informed me that getting a king was impossible on the holiday weekend. I told her she JUST told me she was UPGRADING us to a king room with a view. She said she could not help me BUT that she could give us the room with 2 queens. I requested to SEE that room. I asked FD clerk about this room, does it have at least a view. FD clerk told me she does NOT know what the different rooms look like and I was to ask the bellhop. I turned to Keith, the bellhop, btw, who was an extremely nice young man, and told him FD clerk does not know the room and she said YOU would know the room with the 2 queens. He nodded and told me he did know this room (now in the 100 block) was newly renovated BUT no view at all, nothing, just the parking space for our car. We went and looked at the room and yes it was newly renovated. We decided to take this room AS we had plans and were meeting people and had to get going. I tipped Keith nicely as he was very helpful. Upon using the bathoom in our room, the door FELL OFF.....yes, indeed. I went outside to the parking lot and called to a hotel personel driving around on a golf cart and she called for an "engineer" to come fix the door which they did! There is nothing in the room. No coffee maker, no hair dryer, no water, no DO NOT DISTURB sign to hang on your door. There is a free fridge in the room, which we loved. The bed was VERY comfortable. The walls are PAPER THIN. We could hear both families on either side of us very clearly. Check out is at NOON, at 9:30am on the morning of our check out, housekeeping was knocking on our door very loudly wanting to know when we plan on checking out. They woke us up with all their noise. My husband told them we will be leaving at NOON. Parking is $25.00 per night. Check out is easily done on TV. Paradise Point is like a MOTEL as you drive up and park in front of your room. We did not enjoy our stay here at all. Thankfully, we only slept here. We went to OLD TOWN San Diego and that is fabulous. Many shops and wonderful homemade Mexican food. While there we ate at both Old Town Mexican Grille and Coyote Cafe. A+ for both. We also spent all day Friday at Torry Pines State Reserve and hiked throughout all their trails. A+. We drove to Rancho Santa Fe and Del Mar and did some sightseeing. All in all in was a wonderful weekend with friends and family. Paradise Point gets a C+ from me.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise, not!”
Reviews.Author: galshepherd
Reviews.Content: This place is far from a paradise... Amenities??? aside from the pools and hot tubs, everything else is mediocre and or highly priced. Parking $25 p/ day??? No coffee maker or bottled water in the rooms, come on!!! Mildew all over the room, shower tile old and tasteless, let's not talk about the tub! Nothing like what you see online, very disapointing. I guess the resort could look like a paradise until you enter their rooms. Extremely disappointed about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Vin004
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right across the street from Sea World and right on Mission Bay. The grounds are beautiful. The rooms themselves are big, but the furniture and interior felt a bit tired. Great pool. The daily parking charge seems a bit unfair since the grounds are huge and there is no other parking options.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for...except PARKING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cleanmom
Reviews.Content: My husband & I ended up at Paradise Point not because of our of choice...we used a "don't see the hotel name until you pay" site. And for that reason, I cannot complain, but will give my views after staying there. Check in was very nice....attractive lobby and staff very nice and welcoming. We arrived early (11am) and they were able to give us a room. Mind you, this is early November and it was a Sunday morning...not prime tourist season. But I did appreciate being able to drop our bags in our room as we had a full day planned and did not plan on being back to the hotel until later in the evening. And it is a good thing that we did. If we would have waited until it was dark, we may not have found our room. The lay out can be a bit confusing....the roads in the resot are very narrow and buildings are not marked very clearly. Our room happened to be on the "back-side" of a building...that made for confusion on how to get to it. The room was a "bungalow" type with a nice, small enclosed patio area at the entrance. They have two nice chairs to enjoy the outdoors. Being on the "back-side" of the building was good for this reason as it gave you more privacy from the parking area. The room, upon entrance, looked inviting...nice color scheme and pleasant layout...but it did have a rather musty smell as some people have stated before. It wasn't horrible enough to warrent changeing rooms....but was a little distracting. (that is the reason for only 3* for cleanliness) Because we were there during off-season, we did not use the grounds or pool areas. But they appeared to be well kept and attractive. The pool areas looked nice...one had a fire pit area that would be nice to have used if we had been there longer. I also liked the fact that they had an "adults only" pool....but we did not use it for this trip. Cleanliness (3*) because of slight musty smell) Location (4*) is really good...across the street from SeaWorld. So if you have children and this is your primary reason to visit San Diego, it is a good choice. It is close to beaches and has good access to freeways if going other places. I think it is very centrally located for a San Diego vacation. Rooms (3*) because they are nothing to get excited about (imho)....pretty standard room...two queen beds, desk, chair, TV, drawers for clothing, standard bath....tub/toilet separate from vanity, nice large closet. The negatives about the room...NO coffee pot!!! I thought that coffee pots were almost standard in all hotel rooms these days. They did have a "coffee cart" near the lobby that we walked to for coffee in the morning.....muffin and 2 coffee's were $11..The other negative was the fact that there is no "window" to allow fresh air. There is the "old" wall air conditioner/heater/vent units.....very NOISEY!!! The nobs were not on this particular one, so there was no way to adjust the heat level. The only way to allow fresh air was to leave the door open, or have the noisey fan running. The other negative was that there was no way to turn the porch light off. Because of the door/window set-up, this allowed quite a bit of light to shine into the room along the edge of the curtains....enough to be distracting all night. I am sure they have these lights stay on for safety reason, but I like dark room to sleep in. Service (4*) as the staff that we dealt with was very accommodating and we were able to get into our room early. Value (3*)....I did not mind the price that I got using the "no name " service...but I HATE being stuck with a $25 parking fee!!!! My biggest pet-peeve for hotels these days...and the thing I complain about all of the time....just charge more for the room, please...this is considered nickle & dimeing me, and having what I consider to be "hidden fees". (OK, so maybe I am old-school...but I still don't like it!!!) Would I "chose" to stay here? Maybe/ maybe not......but if you want to "pretend" that you are on a tropical island or Hawaii, without the airfare, this might fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: roq21
Reviews.Content: We really loved it here, so many pools and you can walk around inside the resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “One word: RIPOFF”
Reviews.Author: brasskitten
Reviews.Content: Here's a brief list of the things you must pay for in addition to the room charges: internet ($10/day/computer), parking ($25/day), poorly-equipped gym ($12/day/person), 3.50 per cup of coffee at kiosk (no maker in room). There is, however, a small bar fridge in the room. So you can manage a cold breakfast without having to pay through the nose at the "resort" restaurants. There are five pools, but none of them are over three feet deep. Ample lawn chairs near pool area. The rooms are dark, dank, and musty-smelling. Our toilet started leaking from the base when we turned on the shower. This is more like an old motel rather than a resort. Unless you are here for a conference, it's best to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: B_Family03
Reviews.Content: I hosted out-of-town guests at Paradise Point Resort this weekend. As a local resident, I highly recommend this hotel. The service staff members throughout the resort are excellent! My friends thought the room accommodations were lovely. The bathroom had been remodeled. The carpet and furnishings were clean and attractive. In the evening, the resort roads are lined with tiki-torches. The grounds of this resort are beautiful. The main pool is even better than the web site photos. We enjoyed roasting marshmallows over a bonfire situated next to the pool. The hotel staff lit the gas bonfire pits as a courtesy service. We also had the option to build a bonfire on the beach overlooking the bay. The parking fee of $25/day guaranteed that our car was within just a few steps of your room. Thumbs up to anyone who is considering making a reservation at this hotel. My special thanks to Janeice from San Diego Consierge for the discounted room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a Paradise per se”
Reviews.Author: rosweet
Reviews.Content: I booked paradise point through travelzoo special and got a basic room with two queen beds and upgraded was available for $50 dollar for better view instead of my parking space. I didn't upgrade the room due to the fact we were only staying there for one night. The resort is ideal for family who travel with car--the parking is right in front of your room for $25 per night. However, the room definitely need a face-lift. The furniture are old, and room has a funny smell to it. The Bathroom is small and shower water is running everywhere. We reserved the room for three people, but we only got two sets of towels. There is no mini-bar and in-room refrigerator looks dirty. We had to go to resort shop to get a bottle of water. Restaurant and resort shop are expensive, but isn't too bad comparing to any other resort. Besides that, the location is great for seaworld, and suppose to be very relaxing setting. Overall, I don't think the place is living up to its name and price.

Reviews.Title: “Oh, think twice, it's just another day ... in Paradise (Point)”
Reviews.Author: AZBluebird
Reviews.Content: Booked one bedroom bungalow ($500 for three nights) that turned out to be on lake/pond. Kids enjoyed feeding ducks - I didn't enjoy avoiding what came out the other end of the ducks. I appreciate the fact that the rooms are due for an upgrade, however, the standard was very poor. Bathroom needed demolishing - paint was poor standard, bath had seen better days, screws left in wall where handrail had been, saw a few bugs. As others have mentioned, the furniture paintwork has the distressed look - which doesn't help the overall distressed look of the room. Fridge in closet tried its best to work. The beds were very uncomfortable and squeaked at any opportunity (my wife is currently attempting to re-align her spine and pelvis due to the mattress). $25 a day for parking is a complete rip off, especially when someone parks in your space for the night. We reported it and were not charged for parking for that day. Looks like the place boosts its income on weddings and corporate functions as it was full on both evenings of the weekend. 'Resort' staff were friendly and did what they could to rectify issues. I think the housekeeping staff do a great job to keep the rooms as clean as they are under the circumstances. Very disappointing considering the glamorous website and location.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: gpayne3
Reviews.Content: we had a relaxing time at the resort.This time of year not very crowded.The room was a beachfront suite with a nice view of Mission Bay.The room was clean but could use some upgrading in the bath area.25.00 for parking seemed like a lot of money

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Lost”
Reviews.Author: BrunoBrody
Reviews.Content: If you go here hoping for a clean, serene, resort-like atmosphere you will be sorely disappointed. It felt like a campground. The pictures on their web-site are highly misleading. The room's are old and dirty. The furniture is cheap and worn. The room's air conditioning unit was loud and rattling. The bed was uncomfortable and the bedding was old and coarse. I didn't feel comfortable walking around barefoot in the room and there were insects in the bathroom. We paid extra for a bay-side room and the minute we walked out onto the terrace we knew that was a mistake too. We had no privacy. While sitting on our patio, we had people sitting 10 feet to the right and left of us without any separation. Kids were running by us and there were empty cups and bottles littering the area in front of our terrace. How they get away with advertising this place as a 'resort and spa' is beyond me. We were traveling without our children for the first time and this was NOT the quiet, secluded atmosphere we were told it was. We left after the first night and would warn anyone to stay far away. The accommodations were sub-Super 8 and the price was 4 times as much.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic stay with my husband”
Reviews.Author: Mirky
Reviews.Content: We splurged and spent extra to have a room on the water. It was so worth it! We woke every morning to a beautiful view and just steps away from the beach. It was great to take a cup of coffee and watch the crew teams practice and enjoy the peace. Then, in the evenings, sat in our chairs and watched the sun set. The casual restaurant on the water was our usual dinner spot. A nice walk from our room and good food. You probably want a car while staying there since you have to drive to go anywhere else but it is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise it is NOT!”
Reviews.Author: WellTravelled87
Reviews.Content: Not sure how anyone could give this resort high marks for the grounds, the rooms or the amenities. They would either have to be on the payroll or they are not well travelled. Given what we believed to be the amenities of the resort, our intention was to stay a week and travel around So California from there - knowing there would always be plenty to do right on the resort grounds. I saw the resort on TLC's Jon & Kate Plus 8 and given Kate's stated penchant for clean, we had high expectations. The place is filthy. The grounds are neglected. There are potholes in the crazy roads that take you around th resort. The rooms are dark, dingy, old, tattered. We had a ferrell cat sitting outside our door on arrival. It was just yucky. We were taken aback by the amonia/urine smell as we entered the lobby to check in. That was the first clue but we decided to proceed. The first room we were given was in front of the main pool with a sandy beach (why this is necessary given their private beach is beyond me. It just makes the pool a dirty, sandy experience). The bathroom had been updated but the floors were dirty with hair and sand, the rest of the room was painted a brash yellow and the furniture - which they call 'distressed' looked like it came from Walton's mountain. The tv was an old 36", there was no coffee pot in the room (you have to schlep to an outdoor vendor cart in the morning to get coffee), and the smell of mold was overwhelming. They graciously offered to move us. I have nothing to say about the staff we encountered. They clearly know that they are the only thing that would keep a guest at the facility. So, we felt as another family did that they try hard to be pleasant. The next room was larger but overall in worse shape. The yellow paint must have been a bargain because it is everywhere. We were afraid to walk on the carpets in bare feet so we put on socks. We put a towel on the floor of the tub so we did not have to touch the dingy, dirty bottom. The black on the socks was something I had never experienced anywhere. But it was the hair on the bathtowel and the bugs we found on the bath curtain that had us spend a day of our vacation in Paradise visiting other area hotels. There are great resorts nearby and they were a better value. We stayed in Torrey Pines and LOVED it. The hotel is going to undergo renovation but I would suggest that the housekeeping and grounds staff will not likely be renovated. So, if you get in early ... right after the renovation, your experience may be much different. (Though the pictures of the renovation showed that they were keeping the yellow paint which tells me they will not be truly rehabilitating the place but rather putting in new furniture.) I will bet that after one season of tourists, the place will already look worn. There is no way to mask mold, mildew and dirt.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded, Private, Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: UpANDatEm
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend here once, grounds are beautiful, private, and lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Another week in "paradise"”
Reviews.Author: welshvacationer
Reviews.Content: We returned to "Paradise Point" two years after our last wonderful visit (Sept); this time it was better than ever. The staff were very helpful especially the receptionist Priscilla who worked hard to get our three rooms close together in the orchid area. Everywhere was clean and well maintained. and made for a very relaxing vacation. The hotel is well placed for seeing the sights of San Diego,visiting the beach and for restaurants. We hope to return in a few years to see all thye renovations taking place over the next six months.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise for the kids .... Hades for the adults!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SunnyinCalifornia
Reviews.Content: First, I will start off by saying that our kids, ages 8,6,4 and 8 mos, had an absolute BLAST. Highlights of the trip were: waverunners, bonfires, great pool service, and a fun dinner at the local Fillipis's Pizza in PB. We rented a bayside bungalow for 3 nights. The rooms were old. Customer service was terrible .... basically, expect none. There was not enough shade at the pool or the Barefoot Bar. It's basically Paradise for the kids and Hades for the adults!!!! Piece of advice, set your expectations low and you will not be disappointed. We paid $279 for the bayside bungalows and I think it's a fair price. However, NEVER pay $579 for the bungalows .... it's just not worth it!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point - a great family getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Seinard
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. The furniture and rooms are a bit dated but the common areas and the grounds are the best we've seen. Pools are wonderful. Not terribly impressed by the Barefoot Bar & Grill but would try it again. January was awesome here but the warmer months would be incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation at Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: jazzinj
Reviews.Content: Really late posting of this review, sorry! I will post pictures too at a later date, I took a lot of pictures of the place just for TA. So here's the (long) review: I booked my family (2 adults and 2 children) into the Paradise Point Resort in March 2009 - I came across their website through my searches for beachfront properties in San Diego, and there was a 48 hour online sale ($207 a night for a bayside 1br bungalow suite). It seemed like a great deal, especially with a full bay view, and a great location, so I booked it right away. The website showed a beautiful resort and rooms. Then I started reading the reviews and got worried, but I was still getting a really good price for a bayview room. I called the resort to ask some questions and raise my concerns about what I had read in the reviews. I called the 1-800 number, the reservations desk forwarded me to the concierge (thinking I wanted to ask questions about activities at the resort). The concierge told me that he would get the manager to call me back and talk to me - the manager (Joe) called me within 10 minutes. I expressed my concerns about the reviews I read (cleanliness, bugs, condition of rooms), he told me that while the rooms are older, the rooms were clean. I asked about the parking costs and he reduced it from $22 a day to $12 a day. I asked a few more questions and felt comfortable with his responses. We stayed at Paradise Point Resort from March 12 to March 19. I've tried to put all the details that we experienced while staying in this resort in this review, so it's really long... We arrived in the evening, around 8:30pm. When we arrived, there was one person at the front desk, and the lobby was empty. He was courteous and friendly and checked us into our room. He also gave me a card (it was a birthday greeting card from the resort, I mentioned that it was my husband's birthday when I called to ask questions). The front desk clerk (Jarrod) mentioned that the manager (Joe) had put us in one of the nicer bayside bungalows. The bellman showed us to our bungalow (he drove a golf cart and we followed him in our rental car). He opened our door for us and helped us with our luggage. We had bayside bungalow #542 (3rd from the last one on the street). The first thing the we did was whip out our cameras and take pictures of everything so I could post it in this review :) The 1br bungalow was clean, bright and really nice. The bar/kitchen area had a mini-fridge, sink, microwave, and coffee maker with complimentary coffee. There was a side table and metal ice bucket too. All were clean and ready for use - just note that it was more of a bar area than a kitchen. There are no utensils, or cooking things, or dishes, nor do they advertise it as such - we knew what to expect, so we came prepared with disposable cutlery and dishes and paper towel. The dining/living room area was nice and open, dining for four, with a large patio window overlooking the cove, two chairs and one ottoman in the living room area, storage coffee table with some magazines on top, two side tables with lamps, and a double sofa bed. There was an older but functional tv in a cabinet with drawers in the living room, and a similar set up in the bedroom. The drawers were clean. There was a newer wall air conditioner/heater unit in the living room and in the bedroom. The bathroom was an interesting design - there were two sink areas with large countertops (one in the bedroom, one in the living room) sandwiching the toilet and bathtub which had doors on both sides so that it was accessible through the living room or through the bedroom, and there was a big closet next to each of the sink areas, with two luggage stands - we could have used more hangers, but we made do (I didn't call and ask for more). The bedroom was big, with a king sized bed (nice bedding), and small bench at the foot of the bed, night tables, digital clock radio, phone, and lamps. The sink areas and kitchen areas were well lit, the bedroom was only lit by the side table lamps, the dining room and living room had adequate lighting, and the toilet/bathtub area had dim lighting with noisy fans. Everything was clean, I did check the corners and base mouldings (from reading one of the reviews), and they could have been cleaned a little better, but they weren't filthy. The carpet was clean but older. The distressed furniture style and mismatched furniture style doesn't quite match - it doesn't match the nice granite kitchen and sink countertops, or the crown moulding and chair railing, or the bedroom linens. The toilet and bathtub are old but clean. The towels were white, we had enough for 4 - they weren't very soft and plush because they're the ribbed kind, but they looked newer. There was gel soap bars in the sink areas and an oatmeal soap bar for the bathtub, as well as shampoo, conditioner, and something else (either lotion or body wash). Outside the front door we had a great view of the bay, and we had two outdoor chairs and table. The buildings are older, but we felt pretty good walking into our unit and checking it out. While we were taking pictures, we received a phone call. It was a clerk from the resort, welcoming us and asking whether everything was to our satisfaction. We mentioned that one of the bedroom lamps needed a new lightbulb, and within 5 minutes a maintenance man came and replaced the bulb. The sofabed is not very padded and you can feel every spring in it - it sagged in the middle a little, too - when I had asked the manager about it when I called the month prior (I saw some reviews mention how uncomfortable the sofabed was), he did mention that they could bring something to pad it more for us if we wanted. I would have called to ask for that, but the kids didn't once complain about it, slept well throughout the entire trip, and the only complaining was more about who was hogging more of the bed. I don't know how they slept on it - I tried it out just to see, and there was no way I would have had a comfortable sleep on it - but it worked for them. Our king sized bed was really comfortable, I slept really well all week. Bugs - I did find a centipede crawling on the air conditioning unit in the bedroom on our first evening, but we didn't see any other bugs in the unit until after our 3rd day there. It isn't surprising, though - by that time we had walked on the beach and tracked in some sand, we were using the kitchen area and had fruit and food items there, and we bought firewood to use in the firepits in the evening and they were inside behind the front door - plus, when housekeeping comes to clean, they leave the door open because they leave their cart outside while they clean. All in all, in 7 days, we saw 1 centipede, 3 spiders, and around 30 ants - the first time we saw some ants on the ceiling in the kitchen area (after day 3) - I left a message for housekeeping about it and they cleaned the walls, ceiling, floors, etc (it was pretty evident that they did). the next couple of days there weren't that many ants, just a straggler here and there, but then my kids found a bunch of them crawling on the floor in the closet where we kept all our shoes - which is why I suspect that we tracked them in with our sandals and slippers from the beach. I left a message for housekeeping to please clean the closet areas, and they did. Usually I'm quite phobic about bugs, but these were tiny little ants and they didn't really bother me - the spiders were small house ones. The kids actually enjoyed finding the ants in the closet. Our unit was a short walk to the nearest firepit on the beach in the cove, so it was a bit of a chore to lug the heavy patio chairs to and from the firepits as well as the firewood and supplies, but it was better to be where we were because it was a quieter unit being closer to the end and not being directly in front of the firepits and beach. We bought our firewood from the nearest Von's (the Island Market was selling firewood at just over double the cost of Von's), but we bought the Smores kit from the Island Market for $22 because it included the long wood sticks to cook the marshmallows. We enjoyed an open fire for three of the nights that we were there - the kids had fun playing on the beach in the dark and making Smores. They even caught some tiny baby fish or shrimp (not sure if these were baby grunions) the size of the eye of a needle when they scooped up water from the shoreline. We didn't have a problem securing the closest firepit on all three occasions, even though the entire resort was booked (and the firepits technically are public use). Each unit only has 2 patio chairs, so I called housekeeping and asked them for two folding chairs - the fellow who came couldn't find any but brought me two conference type chairs to use - they were just fine, and we kept them for the entire trip to use out on the beach. Our unit was also directly in front of the tennis courts and bike rental place, so we just walked across and rented a quad bike for just over half an hour and biked around the resort - the kids really enjoyed that. We used the main pool once, in the evening - there's not much lighting, and to me the pool didn't seem very warm, I was freezing, but my kids didn't seem to have a problem and happily swam about for over an hour. We did find one of the filters had come off and notified one of the maintenance crew. I didn't use the hot tub because there were a bunch of young adults using it (being spring break), but it seemed really nice. We got to the main pool by calling the front desk and asking them to send a cart over to our unit - it arrived in just 2 minutes. The walk from our unit to the pool wasn't really far, but in our slippers and suits at night it was better to hitch a ride. We also got a ride back from the pool. When we were dropped off my door key card stopped working, luckily we were able to flag the cart driver to let us into our unit - the next day we got new key cards. I called to ask for robes, and they brought us two large fluffy robes to use (only one size, XL), they were really warm and comfortable but they were really old and showed their wear. We hung out on the beach in the cove for one day for a couple of hours. The kids had fun playing in the sand and exploring the rocks down the way, looking for little crabs. The sand did have a lot of broken sea shells, and my daughter found a piece of broken glass, but other than that everything else was fine - the kids were running around the beach barefoot and didn't seem to have any problems. It was really nice being so close to the beach and cove from our room, we had leisurely breakfasts looking out at the view every day. SeaWorld is just a two minute drive from the resort. We decided to walk the distance - it just seemed so silly to be so close and drive two minutes to pay another $10 in parking and then have to walk in from the parking lot. My kids are 10 and 6 - and with a bag full of lunch, snacks and water, and a bag with warmer clothes for the evening, we walked from the resort, across the little bridge on Ingraham Road that separated the resort from SeaWorld, and up to the front of SeaWorld - it took us 15 minutes door to door each way. The walk was actually really nice because we walked pass Ski Beach and park, took in the view, we got to look down at some boats and fishermen when we were walking across the bridge, as well as some birds, and before we knew it we were there. On the walk back, we chatted about all the things we saw at SeaWorld, and it really made the time pass quickly. There's a view tower near the lobby and pool, we went up there on our last day, you can't really see much through the bars at the top, but on each stair landing you can get a good view of the pond and the pool. The spa is next to the main pool, the treatment costs are really extravagant, we didn't try any. We did not try out their restaurants since we bought food to eat in, and also ate out of the resort. We didn't have time to try out the mini golf, either, but we saw a lot of people out enjoying it. We also saw people enjoying the tennis courts, too. We checked out early in the morning, there was one person at the front desk, the lobby was empty again, and she printed out my receipt and that was it - she didn't ask me how my stay was, but was friendly and courteous. All in all we had a fabulous stay, all the staff were friendly and helpful and met our needs every time, housekeeping cleaned our room well every day and met all our requests (extra towels, extra coffee). I can only comment on the 1br bayside bungalow that we got (room 542) - and although it does show its wear in places, some parts of the room were updated and the overall atmosphere was comfortable and relaxing, and it was very functional for us. I'm really happy that we experienced this resort and even happier that our experience was one of the good ones. One note - as much as we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and experience at Paradise Point Resort, I would say we got our money's worth (based on the price we paid) - I wouldn't have stayed there for full price, and after looking at the rest of the resort, I definitely wouldn't stay anywhere but in a bayside 1br bungalow - the whole point was to have the view and the beach, the other areas seemed gloomy and backed onto parking lots, roads, and other units. And I agree that the parking fee is unnecessary and should just be incorporated in the cost of the room, but I was satisfied with a discounted rate, better than nothing! I also think that they should just have a shuttle to SeaWorld, it's sooooo close!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise it is not!”
Reviews.Author: SL01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paradise Point Spa & Resort Aug 14-16, 2009. . We stayed in what they call their Bayside Bungalow, which opens up on to the Bay. This was one of the reasons we booked this room because we have two children and thought it would be great for them to be able to play on the sand in front of our room. How wrong we were! The Bay is dirty and is never cleaned, so all the crap from the bay gets washed up on shore and is just left there. There is no way the children could have played on the sand. It was nice to look at from the room but that's about it. The room itself needed lots of updating. We paid over $600 a night for the room and they couldn't even supply two beds. The pull out sofa bed in the living room was broken and it was the most uncomfortable night's sleep we've ever had (had to sleep on it with one of the children). The bath tub and bathroom itself were so outdated it wasn't even funny. We had a wet bar in the living room and the sink drain was rusty and disgusting. When these things were brought to the staff's attention, they didn't seem to care. The hotel was very busy over the weekend and there seemed to be a lot of people staying there but I for one will not be returning. I would much rather have paid an extra $200 a night and stayed at a real luxury hotel as opposed to this has been!Oh, and they charge you $25 per day to park outside your bungalow. The main parking lot is only a 5 minute walk, so I would definitely use that and forego the added expense

Reviews.Title: “If you like mold and dirty rooms, this is the place!”
Reviews.Author: shadowdad1994
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to this trip to SD, and were meeting family here. The front desk receptionist was friendly, but after that things went rapidly downhill. The room was musty and the carpet dirty. It smelled like a locker room! The thermostat on the wall is there for display, apparently, as it's not hooked up. There is an old style AC unit on the wall by the window, with about 5 settings. No desk, and internet access is a cable running out from behind the TV cabinet that doesn't reach the bed or any table. The socket by the bedstand was loose, and plugs would stay in if you didn't jiggle them. As far as the bathroom, the spider in the tub was a nice touch! (not). Peeling tub. The only good thing was that the grounds are ok, and the pool was fun, though a bit murky. Worst room I've stayed in since college, when we used to stay in rattraps because they were close to the beach. For what they ask for rooms, the resort is well below any sort of standard. Really a bad room, and a resort in decay.

Reviews.Title: “Left early...super depressing”
Reviews.Author: tripboss09
Reviews.Content: After waiting for a very long time to stay at this resort I was so disappointed. My room was so bad - very old - bathtub had been painted and was peeling. Carpet was old and stained. No coffee pot in the rooms - needed to get up in the morning and wait in line to pay mega bucks for a cup of coffee - Free newspaper delivered to your room...NOT!!!! Not enough hot water for 2 showers. Took a shower and floor was flooded - $25.00 per night to park your car - All of this to be told they were remodeling in 2010 - no kidding - wish I knew I was booking at a very dated hotel. After being gone all day walked into a room that had not been touched - I left. Major disappointment. $10.00 per day for the internet....Yikes!!!

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotels offer more than this "resort" hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandshells
Reviews.Content: I'll make this brief: no coffee maker, no lotion, old blue springy warped mattress in a 1970's pull-out couch was our "second bed". Room had a convalescent home smell. GROSS. The parking fee of $24.00 was a slap in the face. I'd seriously NOT go to this hotel unless you get a rock bottom deal on Hotwire or Priceline. The only good thing was the location- you could walk to Seaworld across the street. Grounds were green/tropical...but listen folks, when you stay at a hotel, you sleep INDOORS and your environment inside should be up to par, which this was not.

Reviews.Title: “Was very nice”
Reviews.Author: mikemclaug
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised after reading many negative reviews before my stay. The room, 215 was very clean, brightly painted, and opened directly (patio) onto the bay sand beach. I never heard any noise from my neighbors rooms which were occupied with families with kids; the walls were not thin as other reviews stated. Our bed (king) was comfortable with nice bedding materials. The couch (clean and fairly new) opened into a standard queen bed; not adult comfortable, but fine for kids and teens. The only negatives were- $25 per day for parking in your assigned space next to your room, and $10 per day internet access. They waived my internet fees after I showed them their resort brochure, which implys it to be an included resort feature.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: tamanna273458
Reviews.Content: the landscaping was great but the rooms were terrible and there very small and very,very outdated no in room coffie makers. they seriously need to spend some of the money there making off families vacationing and redo the rooms and there drinks are from10.00 to 12.50. a peice and both resturants were terrible and way over priced it was a beautiful place outside but would me and my family stay there again no...and to get into the fitness center it was 12.00 a day that should be thrown in not extra watch out for there hidden prices

Reviews.Title: “I was nervous about some of these reviews, but I LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: peanut895
Reviews.Content: We booked here because of a sale on Travelocity. We got a great preview of the grounds when the resort aired on Jon & Kate Plus 8 a few times. The grounds to the hotel are beautiful! I felt like I was in a rain forest. Many recent reviews are talking about poor room quality, but our rooms were great-- especially for women; the bathroom and closet area is huge! I went with my boyfriend and his family. Everything was clean everyday. The pools are nice, although at times, the main pool is just overun by kids, but there is an adult only pool, which is a great idea. We ate at Barefoot Bar & Grill, and the food is great! The prices are moderate for a resort. If you are looking for more food for your buck or a bigger menu, I do recommend walking over the bridge to the Blue Pearl Restaurant on Dana Landing. The one down point is location. Everything is a cab ride away - restaurant, beaches, etc. But I think San Diego as a city is really spread out in general. Because we were a party of 5, to many to fit in a regular taxi, we had to call for a shuttle every time we wanted to go anywhere. I recommend utilizing the resort's private beach. Our best day in Sand Diego was when we rented a kayak from the resort and paddled and laid on the beach all day! I would go back to Paradise Point in a heartbeat! Great staff, great rooms, great food.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: tracytravels
Reviews.Content: We used Priceline and were lucky enough to get Paradise Point for $60/night. The bungalows are in need of updating but overall, the room was quite comfortable and good size for a family of 4. The grounds are lovely with trails and ducks, birds etc. The gift shop has a nice array of shirts, shoes and souveniers. We didn't eat at the restaurants there or use the swimming pools. We did have a few drinks at the bar ($9.50 each). This hotel is close to everything! Very convenient. We rented a boat at the hotel for a 1/2 day which the kids absolutely loved. This is a very family friendly resort. One downfall- hot water is sparse! We didn't have hot water 2 of our 5 days there! Regardless, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Last time it was refurbished must have 100 years ago!”
Reviews.Author: LondonSleeper
Reviews.Content: When we first drove up to the hotel we thought that it looked fantastic. While my husband was checking in at reception I went to use the toilet in the lobby. The doors had dirty hand marks up them, this should have been a tell tale sign. then I entered the toilets to find a complete mess of overflowing bins full of tissuesby the sinks and inside the actual toilets. When we went to our room it was just as bad, there was thick dust on the headboards of the beds, the furniture had a distressed look which we think is just a good way of not having to buy new furniture. The sliding mosquito net across the patio doors was held on with tape which fell off when we tried to open it. It got worse, There was no kettle in our room so you had to go out to a stall to get tea/coffee. When asked for an orange juice and a tea the man said we have run out of both, we asked for a coffee and a hot chocolate the man said the machine is broke he cannot steam the milk so we left empty handed. Then we went for lunch in the hotel at the Barefoot bar and grill. We had to wait 40 mins to be seated!. My son asked for tea but was told that they had run out!, We asked for 2 glasses of white wine we were told that they had run out!, we asked for Sangria we were told that they do not have Sangria, Pimms maybe? "What is Pimms" they said. I ordered spaghetti for lunch just with a glass of water. When the spaghetti came I asked for a spoon. I waited and I waited, I asked again for a spoon eventually when everyone else had finished their meals I received a spoon but it was a teaspoon, "this is all we have" she said. Do the Americans not twiddle their spaghetti with a fork and a spoon? If you like to eat and stay in nice places, don't go to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Tron1
Reviews.Content: I selected the Paradise point after reviewing the hotel on-line, and deciding that this location was going to be hard to beat. Well, the location is wonderful. It goes down hill from there.... The grounds were beautiful, and the front desk staff was extremely welcoming. The disappointment came when we arrived in our room. It was so incredibly disgusting. The room has not been painted in ages, the bathroom paint was peeling in sections. The tub and sinks had more rust and mold stains than I have ever seen in my life. I believe the carpet at one time was a green color, but it is now so dirty that it was actually turning black/brown. Our families socks turned BLACK after one night! The mold smell was so strong. My daughters allergies went crazy immediately. We called to see if we could change rooms, but were told they were full that weekend. At the pool, we had to call twice for clean towels, and after speaking to others, they too were disappointed in the quality of the room. After two nights, we actually switched hotels and were VERY grateful for that decision. If you can be flexible with location, I would think twice about choosing this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel/resort was such an unexpected pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: duk-duk-dakota
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in 2 rooms during the week before 4th of July. We had our young grandchildren with us. There was so much to do at the grounds, there was no need to go anywhere else. The pools were perfect for the toddlers and the teenagers. The bungalow style rooms were so unexpected. What a great concept! It really felt like our past vacations to Hawaii. The grounds were lush with greenery. The sand/beach to Mission Bay were steps away from the room (it was even closer than walking to the front desk) . There is even a minature golf course on site. The staff was incredibly helpful (the front desk staff, the housekeepers and even the room service staff ). The waiters at Barefoot Bar/Restaurant were patient. The bartender made drinks for us that other bartenders at famous restaurants had not known how to make. It's so close to Seaworld, we probably could have walked.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: pickypersonCa
Reviews.Content: I also read some negative reviews and was quite apprehensive. I am rarely happy with hotels/rooms/service. But Paradise Point was all I had wanted. I wanted peaceful, quiet, pretty and clean/updated. Not a scene like the W or a high rise generic hotel. Booked via amex travel but their hotel site had the same good deal. Stay three nights save 30% on all nights. We had a garden studio lanai. Good choice. Private entrance, private patio overlooking lush greenery and ponds with ducks that come visit. Its like your own little bungalow with a mini kitchen with fridge and micro. Comfy bed with excellent high end linens. Couch and sitting area. Bay views not avail but didnt miss it at all-an entire wall was glass looking on this oasis. very pretty. The grounds are just like hawaii. It's a little like a resort from the 60's but updated enough to be current. Families abound, but we stayed at the adult pool and it was gorgeous and quiet. Didnt try the spa yet but toured it--high end. The marina is good too -we rented a motorboat at the hotel dock-competitive prices. Excellent experience. Do it! Food at marina side cafe Barefoot for breakfast was good as was the friendly service everywhere. Only negative was our bathroom. Just average. I will return. They are just 10 minutes or so from la jolla and that was awesome, too. If you like to sleep in, bring a sleep mask-the curtains dont go up to the top and alot of sunlight floods the room in the morning! They charge alot for parking but no resort fee. that said, they also charge for fitness center usage which is lame. If you complain they will often comp you for one or the other.

Reviews.Title: “"Never judge a book by it's cover" or should I say Hotel by the outside appearance”
Reviews.Author: lv2travel4fun
Reviews.Content: Our drive into Vacation street made us think we should booked for a 2nd night. Only when we entered our great Orchid Room did we realize, we wanted to leave so fast. But since this was done thru priceline and all was paid for and we had nowhere else to go, we had no choice but to stick it out. Where do I start. The first thing we always do when we get into a hotel room and walk around and inspect the place. Here is my list: * children found sand grits in the bed and chairs * DEAD BUGS in the carpet ( i understand this is a lanai room but dead bugs in the carpet is ridiculous) * the sink counter top and dirty from previous users toothpaste droppings * the sink was filthy with the previous users guck and whatever you want to call it (yuck) * Shower curtains were smelly With this much, we were about to leave but by the time my husband and I were done with inspecting we did not notice our children had unpacked and already changed into their bathing suits. Boy do I wish I had left that place. * No coffee pot * No place to hang a towel other than the one towel rod 2 feet above the toilet * Bathroom tiles popping out of the walls ( will attach pic ) * $22 bucks for Parking...be real. We only paid $10 for a hotel right in the middle of Hollywood where there is no parking at all. I can honestly say that the only thing pleasant about this room was it's good shower head. The water came out at a very good pressure. Hey alteast I took a good shower. Also the front desk staff was very courteous. The landscaping was beautiful Even if I was given this room for free...I wouldn't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation! Highly recommend if you have young kids!”
Reviews.Author: mcbBayArea_Ca
Reviews.Content: This place is GREAT if you have young kids - plenty to do right there with boating, swimming, exploring, feeding ducks and fish, and climbing the tower! As well as swimming in the pool. It is on the bay so the calm water and soft sand is also perfect for kids. The grounds alone are worth hours exploring on foot with kids - my kids loved the coves, water, fish and ducks! If you don't have kids don't come here - seriously! This place is great for families -- without kids, I would go somewhere else. The only potential issue is that this place is not the 4 Seasons and the rooms can be a bit run-down but the beds are comfortable, the service is good and who can beat a suite with kids?!

Reviews.Title: “A real oasis within minutes of downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: jolpe
Reviews.Content: I guess you could say I stayed here on accident. I used priceline and bid on the location sight unseen. I was just looking for a decent place to stay the night before my niece's wedding. I arrive at about 10:30, and the hotel staff was just fantastic. For some reason, they had upgraded me to a bungalow on the beach instead of my regular room. The next morning, as I was leaving, I got a good look at what I had missed out on - beautiful landscaping and amenities. I'm bringing the wife back for sure for a longer stay. Pricey if you pay retail, but so worth it if you can snag a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Pack your bags and go! It was great!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug1214
Reviews.Content: We almost canceled our stay at this Resort because of all the Negative Reviews we read, we didn't and we're very happy to say we're glad we didn't. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Upon our arrival which was late in the evening we were greeted by an employee who directed us to the Front Desk and advised us that he would take us to our room once we were done with check in, this place is TREMENDOUS so we really appreciated this. The girls at the Front Desk are exceptional. Prior to our arrival I had the pleasure of talking to Renee, I was very concerned about all the negative reviews I was reading and she was very honest and assured me that we would have a great time, and WE DID.... Thank you Renee you're the BEST!!!! We were then escorted to our room, full of all this negative anticipation from the reviews we read we pleasantly surprised. Our room had a King size bed, a sofa with a pull out bed, a desk, Granite Counter tops in the Bathroom with two sinks, a tub/shower with a new shower curtain (not like we read that they were old and smelly) with a cloth interior shower liner which I personally prefer so you don't get attacked by the plastic ones, an in room safe, and iron and ironing board, plenty of closet space, a small refrigerator, and no one on top of us since they are all single story units which is great... but NO COFFEE POT in the room... :-( We had a front patio and the other rooms on either side of us had rear patio's which was nice when you sat outside you had some privacy and so did your neighbors, we did NOT ever hear anyone else from the other rooms and we did have neighbors. We were in the Orchid section which had a nice view of Mission Bay, and we even had the opportunity to see a SKUNK, wow they are beautiful...but then we went in our room :o) We chose to use the smaller pool which was right around the corner from our room, it was nice and quiet with a beach entry, towels are available at the pool for your use, there is a hot tub as well as torches and fire pits for evening relaxing. This Resort is amazing the landscape is something else, the landscapers have some job to keep this place so immaculate, every day they are vacuuming the streets, blowing out the falling leaves, trimming the shrubbery, what a job and it shows, it's truly beautiful. We were very close to Sea World if you were a walker you could even walk it, but we drove it's just over the bridge, we didn't eat in any of the restaurants or got to the Spa, what was I thinking?, so we can't tell you much about them other than they look nice from the outside. We had 2 minor problems, someone took our parking space and since they are assigned we were concerned about parking, the Front Desk immediately offered us alternate parking, the other problem was one day we were not provided towels, let me tell you in less than 5 minutes someone was at our door with warm hot towels. The Staff is exceptionally helpful and attentive to your every need. The one thing that we did not care for was the $22.00 per night parking fee, personally I think that's a lot $10-12.00 would be acceptable to me but every hotel is doing it so you can't get away from it, just hope you don't have a parking spot near the sprinklers. Pack your bags, go and have a great time and by the way, someone posted a photo of a piece of furniture that looked like it was painted and the paint was peeling off, well the motif of the hotel is that distressed look so it's suppose to look like that. I was told the resort will be going through a complete overhaul in the Fall I can't wait to see it after that.... RELAX and you'll have a FABULOUS TIME..you won't be sorry and the person writing this is MS. PICKY that lives in Las Vegas and is use to Las Vegas Hotels. I will go back it taught me something, did you say RELAX!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice time, but wouldn't come back.”
Reviews.Author: Murphy_Jones
Reviews.Content: Went with 3 girlfriends - Sex & The City style. Opened the door to our Executive Suite, and it looked like most of the furniture that was supposed to be there had been stolen! We literally had a dance floor in the middle of our living space! (We pressed all the light switches hoping there would be a disco ball to no avail.) The room had a slightly musty smell, and we didn't get the bed arrangement that we had requested. We got a King bed and a let-out couch. The let-out couch was slanted and the mattress was about as thick as a slice of Texas Toast. The King bed was as firm as plywood. We requested a room switch, but the only other rooms, or so it was claimed, were much smaller so we kept our room. I will say that the bathroom was fantastic. All four of us could get ready as it was a very nice size. Four long showers and still lots of hot water and good water pressure. The staff was excellent - very very friendly. Food at the Barefoot Cafe was good - and like most have said - very pricey. I wanted to get a pedicure, but at $60 for a BASIC, I said "fuggetaboutit". To be frank, we're not a kid-friendly group, but the kids there were active and had lots of options, so it wasn't a problem at all. Stay here if you get a good deal - do NOT pay full price. (Restaurants: Gringos on Garnet for dinner and Kona by Crystal Pointe for breakfast!)

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Great scenery. Average rooms.”
Reviews.Author: thrillwill
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal through Hotwire for Paradise Point. The location was great since this was our first time visiting San Diego. We walked to Sea World and the resort was right in Mission Bay. I wish we were right on the ocean, but it was nice to have some water nearby nevertheless. The grounds were absolutely beautiful. Parts of it seemed like a rainforest. Took tons of pictures of flowers. The rooms were ok. A bit small and the room we had was muggy, but overall it was fairly clean and really no major complaints. We only had trouble with the toilet with a weak flush. The pools and hot tubs were nice. They had a number of pools throughout the resort. Restaurants were overpriced, so you're best off driving a mile or two up to Pacific Beach for a meal. The parking fee is annoying, but I'm told that most hotels in San Diego charge for parking. Overall: Nice location. Close to everything. Beautiful area. I would recommend it if you get a good deal. 3 to 3.5 stars is accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: Simopel
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our 4 day trip from San Diego. We stayed at the Paradise Point Resort & Spa. We booked 2 rooms for 4 adults and one 4 year old child. We had 2 Bungalow's right next to each other so we were able to open the doors inside and connect the rooms. That was very clever. The staff at check in was nice, Parking as stated in the reviews before is $22 per night. Pretty expensive, especially when there is plenty of parking everywhere. The rooms were also as described in the reviews before. There weren't to bad but a renovation or update would do better. This is a 3 star resort and nothing more. You get what you should expect for a 3 star resort. The rooms could have been cleaner. It wasnt so bad but there was a lot of dirt and spots which could have been easily removed by simply wiping it with a wet cloth. There is one bad thing - the shower or actually the water pressure from the shower. If your neighbor is taking a shower or flushing the toilet, there is no water left for you in the shower. It's simply only dropping. We had Dinner and Breakfast at the Barfoot Grill. The breakfast menu is a little poor. There is no buffet and no continental breakfast. If you are an european you may eat only once or twice there. The food though was excellent. We spent some time at the pool with the little boy and he enjoyed anyway. The property itself is beautiful landscaped and truly a paradise. I would recommend this property for a short weekend trip but not for relaxing or entertainment. Also if you look for something more comfortable where you feel like home or luxury - look for a different place. If you don't attach to much importance to luxury this is the place where you want to be...

Reviews.Title: “Almost Hawaii!”
Reviews.Author: AlyssaLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: For our first ever family vacation, we were debating about flying to Hawaii and having 2 days of a flying nightmare w/ a toddler, or driving down to San Diego...we opted for SD with a touch of Hawaiian perks. Researched every beach side hotel and came up with Paradise Point for location and price. Upon arrival, the property was very well maintained. Tropical folage everywhere and the spread out villas reminded me of typical Hawaiian condo setups. The bayside studio was very close to what we imagined and viewed online. Large room with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the beach. The sand was steps away. The extra money for this room type was well worth it. About $50 more with AAA discount. I wouldn't get the garden rooms. There were a few downsides...the mattress and pillows weren't the best quality and there was no WIFI. Furniture looked pretty well used, so I think they are about due for a renovation. We traveled with our 13mo son and it worked out great. Plenty of room for the playpen. He loved the sand and pool. They even had a firepit on the beach but we didn't use it. Next time! We ate breakfast and dinner at the Barefoot Grill on site. Food was ok, but very pricey. I would recommend going into Mission Beach or Pacific Beach for better food and prices. They are about a 5min drive from the resort. La Jolla was about 15-20min.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds but ...”
Reviews.Author: tsimmis
Reviews.Content: the rooms need to be updated and are not as nice as the pictures in the website. the place seemed to be understaffed. we arrived and their computer system was down so they could not check people in. someone pooped in the pool, so everyone got out of the pool but we did not see anyone drain or scrub it out. we got it thru priceline. if we paid full price, we would have been more upset.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of deferred maintenance!”
Reviews.Author: Relax92270
Reviews.Content: When my husband showed me the website of where we were staying I was thrilled! Unfortunately, this place hasn't been renovated since Elvis stayed there! The pictures on the web were not what we got! Other guests had the same experience regardless of the location on the property. The service at the desk was good and the restaurant, Baleen, was very good. For this location right next to Sea World, it was disappointing that they haven't updated it and still charge $300 for their regular rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but in need of an overall....”
Reviews.Author: love2vaca4ever
Reviews.Content: 2 girlfriends and I spent the weekend at Paradise Point Resort and Spa as a way to celebrate Mothers Day our way, since although married, none of us have any children yet. As we pulled into the resort, we were very excited as the grounds are GORGEOUS and remind me of Hawaii. It really felt like a vacation (we live an hour north). The check-in procedure was easy and everyone was very friendly. We were led to our suite and from the moment we opened the door, we were very disappointed: stained carpet from the front door all the way back to the sliding glass door, chipped furniture, a missing door on the armoire, a musty humid smell, peeling paint in the bathroom, rusty door joints. But who stays in their room? and so we decided not to say anything. A couple of hours later after walking the beautiful grounds, I decided to ask for a room switch. They gave us the choice between 2 rooms and we took the 2nd room, as it was the least shabby and the carpet was mostly clean. It actually had a nice feel. When I asked the front desk gal for the switch, she did say the property is due for an overhaul in September. That made me excited!! I'd come back after a major renovation!!! We ended up going to Baleen, the onsite restaurant, for dessert later that night...very good. And ordered room service the next morning...not so good. No flavor to the omelettes, eggs, potatoes, toast. The 35-40 minute window took an hour. Busy because of Mothers Day I'm sure. Bottomline: The resort is in a perfect location and is gorgeous. If they really do the room renovation in September, I'll be back. For sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Scenery, Dissapointing Room Service”
Reviews.Author: yd700519
Reviews.Content: It was my first mother’s day and I was excited to spend a weekend at this gorgeous resort with family and friends. After viewing the resort's website, my expectations were high, as we booked an ocean view suite and our brother and sister in law with their beautiful little girl booked a room near the lake. Driving into resort it almost felt like we were in Hawaii. The greenery, the lakes, the fire torches gave perfect touches to this small 'paradise' so close to home. Upon checking in we were given our key to a little bungalow on the beach, Room 541, and a certificate for complimentary desert at Baleen, a restaurant on premises. The room was towards the end of the resort and had an amazing view of the ocean. There were two lounge/beach chairs in front of the door and ducks roaming around. My son definitely enjoyed looking at them. The room itself was average. It had a bedroom with a King size bed that was comfortable and sheets were very clean. There were connecting bathrooms with two sink areas sharing a shower in the middle. The shower showed signs of wear and tear; however, the water pressure was excellent. Clean towels were also provided. The living room area had a pull out couch, two arm chairs, a futon, a small round table with 4 chairs and a small kitchenette with a sink and a microwave. Overall condition was average, but clean. When we first walked in there was a smell of moisture, however, once we opened the door and let some fresh air in and sprayed Fabreze, the smell was no longer noticeable. Our first night there we decided to have dinner at Baleen, a restaurant on premises serving above average priced food. The staff at Baleen were very accommodating, especially with our two babies - high chairs were provided. The food was a little disappointing. I had ordered a salmon dish, but it had a weird BBQ sauce and another flavor I couldn't put my finger on. The server gladly exchanged my dish to Seared Ahi Tuna - it was finger lickin' good. Other people in our party ordered Rib eye steaks, Chilean Sea bass and Lobster Tails - they were satisfied with the portions and taste. We ordered our desert to go and enjoyed it back in our suite. It was chilly that weekend, but the fresh air was very crisp and refreshing. The next morning everyone in our party decided to order breakfast in and enjoy it with the view of the ocean. This was perhaps the worst and the most disappointing service me or anyone in our party has ever received. All of us pretty much ordered egg dishes (how hard is it to make eggs?). It took us 4 phone calls and an hour and 15 minutes to track down and receive our breakfast. When the breakfast finally did arrive it was cold and missing butter for our toast and a large pot of coffee (they did deliver the creamer). We called the room service and spoke with Patricia number of times regarding the condition of our breakfast and the missing items. SHE offered a refund and we accepted. The missing items never arrived and we decided to let them know at which point she stated in a not-so-pleasant-customer-oriented tone that 'were were the ones who requested a refund and shouldn’t be getting the rest of the items". This was absolutely not true and simply an unacceptable way to deal with customers. Although we did receive our money back, it wasn't what we were looking for. We wanted a nice, relaxing weekend with good service but it was cut short after our breakfast incident. We checked out right away with disappointment. I MAY recommend this to a friend, but definitely not the room service. I have placed a phone call to the Service Manager, but have not received a call back. OTHER PLACES TO CHECK OUT WHILE IN THE AREA: Mission Beach - very hip and happening. Nice restaurants, a rollercoaster and lots of other activities.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: springsBoston
Reviews.Content: I was a little scared to book this hotel thru my travel agent after reading some of the reviews on this site. Now that I'm home, I have to say it was well worth it. The reviews are right...rooms are small (but bathrooms were big), TVs were small, furniture was less "shabby chic" and more just plain shabby. But who spends time in a hotel room in San Diego? Th grounds were beautiful, LOVED the adult only pool, perfect location and easy for driving about. Wish the management would smarten up and provide free wifi (if Super 88 Motel can do it, why not PP?), skip the parking fee (we did get a discount), and for heaven's sake, don't charge for the average gym. But management should give kudos to their helpful staff and groundskeepers.

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a resort! While the grounds are nice, everything else is in bad shape. I would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: austingolf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May 2000, when I think a recent remodel had just been completed and the bungalow room was very nice. The restaurant was still under construction at that time and not open. Unfortunately, I did not check trip advisor for this booking in May 2009. Well 9 years has taken a toll! The resort is in bad shape, every where you look. The room, this time bayside lanai, was very dated. Furniture ready to be changed out. Nicks on walls, outside door/windows/paint/door matts all in very bad shape. Room smelled moldy and musty. Refigerator in room, very loud and leaking water onto the wood furniture (part of the smell), needed to unplug at night just to sleep. The pool furniture at the adult pool, broken. The pool area was kept clean, and the pool bathrooms looked to be udpated with new tile. The ponds are nice to look at, but also in need of repair, the main pond by the big pool, has what appears to be a bridge that has broken apart and not repaired, and that end of the pond was in very bad shape. Because I was so bothered by the shape of property after arriving, I refused to pay for any services on property, including food, so enjoyed all meals off property. If you are attending a large gathering event, such as family reunion or wedding, I think the place would be nice to gather, and you don't have to worry about damaging the rooms, since they are already in bad shape, the property could be alot of fun for a gathering, but for a couple, looking for a resort, this is NOT the place! If you stay here, you better get a good rate! Othewise the place is not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Destination Resort”
Reviews.Author: danver8
Reviews.Content: Our linens and room were kept immaculate. The resort is beautiful with the grounds being constantly maintained. Because of the concrete one floor rooms there weren't any other guests to annoy us with noise. They also had 5 well maintained pools and one for adults only! We played minigolf there too. It is conveniently located next to see world and on a huge island with running tracks along the beach. The staff was incredibly attentive as well. The only set back in the room is a clean but ugly rug. I highly recommend this resort/spa/hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Know what your expectations are prior to booking”
Reviews.Author: gatordoc96
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful vacation and this was exactly the place we needed knowing what to expect after reading all the mixed reviews. If you want a 5 star hotel, this is not the place for you. It is older and this is evident by the furniture and the carpet in the rooms but our room was very clean and the grounds were spectacular! The room reminded me of beach front condos we have rented and have also enjoyed. We stayed in a bayside studio and it was clean and comfortable. It was very quiet! I think that is also dependent on your neighbors no matter where you stay. We loved being able to step out of our room with our daughter to go play in the sand and watch the beautiful sunsets! It also had the convenience of a small kitchen that had a small fridge, a microwave and a full sized coffee pot. We bought our own drinks and snacks. The employees were all very cordial and accommodating. The restaurants had great food. The barefoot grill had a wonderful atmosphere with a great view on the bay. Kids enjoyed feeding the fish and the frequent visits from the seagulls. We knew it would be pricey to eat on the grounds. The hotel IS overpriced overall. The $22 parking fee was no surprise thanks to the other reviewers and when we were checking out other hotels in San Diego, most of them had a $20 parking fee. We were taken by the hotel tax! In summary, this a great place to get away from it all and be with your family. I suggest staying in a studio or bungalow, if feasible, to get a better room judging from the other reviews. Staying on the water is expensive no matter where you stay in San Diego and there is certainly no real value here. Being on the water was a priority for us and this place met our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location, NOT A 4 Star Resort”
Reviews.Author: mattpine
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point is a nice hotel. It's best asset is it's location. It's on the Bay which gives you direct private access to the beach and water. It's miles away from downtown San Diego so it provides a relaxing country atmosphere, however downtown is only a 5 minute drive. Now for the bad part. The cost of the room is just that, the cost of ONLY the room. EVERYTHING else you do at the resort will cost you money. If you have a rental car, it will cost you to park it at the resort. If you want to use the fitness equipment, it will cost you. If you want to play a round of mini golf with the kids, it will cost you extra. About the only thing they don't charge you for is use of the pool. So, it is a nice resort because of it's location and service. The rooms are small and just okay. The cost of the many incidentals will greatly increase the cost of your stay. But the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Combination of wanna-be luxury and camping, but great if you're prepared”
Reviews.Author: ValueSeekerRW
Reviews.Content: We went to Paradise Point on the recommendation of a couple other families with young children who have been there before.
