We wanted a water-facing room with easy access to a nice beach--and was able to get a good 30% off deal one of the Bayside bungalows because we stayed 3 nights. I read through a lot of the reviews, and I can see why this resort gets such a mixed reaction. First of all, the place is HUGE and you know that they have to fill a lot of rooms in order to cover the operating costs. I'm sure that's why there are a lot of priceline opportunities---but beware as there is a vast difference in the set up of accommodations for each price point. If you're not specifically paying for a standalone bungalow (lagoon or bayside), then you're likely in something of a motel like structure with cramped patios right beside each other. Even the bunaglow are pretty close together, and your neighbors can really impact the quality of your stay. The front grassy area and firepits are all shared. This would actually be nice if you had a couple families traveling together. The view from the bayside bungalows as represented on the website are artfully misleading. It is not nearly the hidden away paradise you think---across the bay is a lot of traffic along a busy road. Having said that, the cove waters are very calm and great for young children to splash around in (although the signs warning you of potential high bacteria count does give you pause). From the cove you can see the Sea World fireworks at night which is a nice bonus. The bunaglow itself was well appointed. It was great having a separate living area so that while preschooler napped or went to bed, you could read/watch TV/talk/relax on the patio. There were two separate bathroom sink areas on either side of the main bathtub/toilet room. Housekeeping was difficult to schedule if you didn't want your room cleaned on their usual scheduled rounds--as in it didn't happen one day. Again, the size of the place probably really hurts their ability to provide flexible service. One of the best tips I can give is to bring your own snack food and bottles of water. Our bungalow had a little kitchenette with fridge, and it is way more convenient and cost-efficient to bring goodies yourself. Our stay contained both weekdays and a Saturday. The pools are really lovely but do get extremely crowded on the weekend. Even the ancillary pools that were practically empty during the week were jam packed on Saturday. Thank you tripadvisor reviews as we knew to stake out our pool deck chairs early on in the morning! The spa is not quite at the level it should be. I had booked a month in advance one of their signature treatments (Javanese Royal Treatment). The treatment itself was great. However, they had no lockers available when I got there (I guess the fitness center shares lockers with the spa...but geez, I had pre-booked a couple hundred dollars worth of services and they can't set aside one?), they had failed to tell me when I booked that my therapist would be a man (doesn't bother me, but I think some women might not be comfortable), and the toiletries were pretty sub-par. The on-site Barefoot Bar & Grill is OK. Prices are a bit high, but the setting is really nice by the water. Food service by the main pool is nice, but they don't serve breakfast. The resort itself is lots of fun. Ducks and fish to feed (best thing we brought was our own loaf of bread--although you can buy duck and fish food at the gift store), covered cycle carts to rent, miniature golf, nice pools. We had planned to not leave the grounds during our entire stay and we were never bored. So in summary: if you are willing to pay more to stay in one of the bungalows, are prepared by bringing your own drinks and snacks, and don't expect too much in the way of luxury, this can actually be a really nice family getaway. Stay away from weekends if you can. I would NOT consider this a good place for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds, rooms need updating!!”
Reviews.Author: sassyv
Reviews.Content: The grounds are very nice, beautiful landscaping. However the rooms are in big need of a re-model. The beds are to hard, and furniture is old. The main pool is heated....nice for little ones. However there's a RIDICULOUS $22.00 NIGHTLY PARKING FEE aside from your room reservation. Would only come back if they remodel rooms...grounds are nice and its a location close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for kids, getting a little long in the tooth”
Reviews.Author: globalnikki
Reviews.Content: My family of four (with two kids under 10) stayed one night as a treat for the kids at the tail end of a wedding trip. As a result, we didn't get to use everything the place had to offer, but next time we're in San Diego, we'll probably stay here again with the intent of doing more at the resort. Our room was nice but musty and the air conditioner wasn't great - it seemed like there was some kind of humidity problem in the room and I don't really want to think about what kind of mold might have caused that smell. I didn't see any, at least. The pool is great - well heated, with a really shallow, almost beach-like side that is perfect for under-4, can't-swim kids, while still offering a lot of space for big kids to swim and splash. The location is fantastic - only minutes from great SD beaches, minutes from Sea World, minutes from the airport (which is noticeable when the planes fly over during the day). But it's an interior part of the bay, so the beaches at the resort itself are a bit stagnant - no waves, and it was slimy when we were there. The concierge recommended the perfect seafood restaurant with a kid-friendly menu. Next time we go, we'll try the miniature golf and the croquet, and maybe check out the bike rentals. We didn't do the s'mores special (the firepits are on the resort's beaches), but even though it's pricey, it was tempting anyway. We ate breakfast at Barefoot, out on the deck, and it was typical hotel breakfast fare at typically expensive hotel breakfast prices. They're pretty good about controlling the birds out there, and hotel staff were feeding the fish in the pond by the restaurant, and let our kids help - which was probably the highlight of their stay. Oh yeah, and they charged us $22 to park there, which I thought was a bit rough considering that the rooms are scattered all over the place, not in one big building. Overall, they try hard and I can't think of a place I've stayed outside of Disney that is more kid-friendly than here.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and undervalue - beautiful spot, but that is it!!”
Reviews.Author: Annjudith
Reviews.Content: Never have I had to pay $22/day to park in front of my motel room! Filthy carpet, abysmal concierge information, cool 'hot' tub, overpriced food, drinks, rooms. Really awful...

Reviews.Title: “Disaster!!!”
Reviews.Author: woogs
Reviews.Content: loved the land the resort is on, hated everything else. first of all, when we arrived to the resort, we were informed that they double booked our room, which we had made reservations for over a month in advance. they did give us a 50 dollar credit and sent us to the hilton on mission bay. then when the next day we went back to paradise point to find out that the only room we were able to get only had one bed instead of two meaning i had to spend the rest of my vacation sleeping on the couch, which was not very comfortable at all. the rooms were run down and old, the dresser had big black scuff marks all over it. there were also ants crawling around everywhere, including the bed. then the next day i came to find out that they took out a 450 dollar incidental deposit charge which they specifically told me would not be taken out unless we messed up the room. that 450 was all the rest of the money that all 3 of us had for the rest of the vacation which we still had the rest of that day and a whole extra day. they did agree to credit our room with 100 dollars which was nice, but not the 450 that we had to go shopping with, go to 6 flags and the wild animal park. huge bummer. then when we checked out the manager rather rudely accused us of smoking in the room, which we did not do, and told me there was going to be a deep cleansing fee asessed to the room. i was sick of dealing with him and did not want to end up with any other "incidental" charges so i agreed and left.. this resort single handedly ruined our vacation, and this is the first vacation i have ever been on.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location, rooms could use some major renovation.”
Reviews.Author: eastporter1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Paradise Point for 5 days. Loved the location, as it was close to the beaches, SeaWorld, and the highway. The property was paradise, pools were clean and warm, restaurants were fantastic. Didn't love the $22 parking price. Didn't make sense to me, as we had a private driveway. The rooms however, could use a major renovation. Front door casing was rotted and it needed a new welcome mat. The bathroom needed desperate repair, as the tub felt like it was going to fall through the floor. The patio was nice, but needed a little sprucing up. The hotel staff and service were excellent. Would stay again, only if they updated their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View, Ordinary Rooms”
Reviews.Author: waeld47
Reviews.Content: The view and atmosphere was nice. The amenities are standard, but be prepared to pay for parking and internet ($22 and $10 per night, respectively). Central location. Sea World is only a few minutes away. The rooms are nothing to write home about. Just what you would expect, a normal television with cable and a smaller than average bathroom. The staff was very friendly and the concierge was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Shows its age”
Reviews.Author: schreib5
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Paradise Point property a number of years ago on a regular basis and got a tremendous rate through Priceline (Negotiator). The grounds were always, and still are, beautiful. The rooms unfortunately are a different story. We had a basic room just off the bay-the carpets were stained; the furniture looked like it did when we stayed here a long time ago and older and with more cracks and paint chips. All in all somewhat of a disappontment. They have also added a $22 parking fee and a $12 fee just to use the gym.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort, Standard Rooms could do with an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: kimod74
Reviews.Content: I was a bit weary after reading some of the reviews on this resort. After all, I pricelined it and you get what you get and can't get a refund. I believe the average price of this resort lies somewhere between $160-200 per night for a standard room. We got a standard room. However, the priceline price was for $70 a night, add in the $22 a night the resort charges and we got our room for $92 per night (not including taxes, fees, yada yada yada). I thought that was a fair price all things considered. I consider myself a fairly well seasoned travel for my young ripe old age of 34. I have stayed in a lot of resorts & hotels. Here is my breakdown of this place: The room: We received a standard room, with 2 queen beds, 2 sitting chairs & 1 table (awkardly long & placed strangely in the room). There was a small refrigerator in the room, a coffee maker, hairdryer, iron & ironing board. The refrigerator & television were housed in the armoire, along with the coffeemaker. You receive soap for your face, soap for your body, shampoo, conditioner & body wash. The towels are a bit rough. They are not soft towels, I did not like them. The refrigerator did not have a door on the little freezer compartment that is in the refrigerator & the side bar inside was broken off so we could not stick anything in the side of the door. I noticed those weird "wood bugs" crawling around on the inside of the armoire...ok....eek. The shabby chic thing is not working for the room decor. It looks trashy & yucky. Rooms are in need of a paint job & new furniture. The walls were dirty. I always look at the walls, the baseboard & the corners of the floor in the bathroom areas of hotels to determine if they properly clean and this one failed. Yuck. The maids really need to do a better and more precise job of cleaning. The bathtub was oddly retiled over or something. It definately needed an upgrade as well. Upon walking through the door of our room the "tack board" (nails and all) were exposed where some of the carpet was torn up right along the edging of the carpet against the door. Our young daughter stepped on this more than once when she would walk up to look out the window. Rooms need: new furniture & the hotel needs to dispose of their ugly shabby chic design, it's just not working here! Can we get some nice bathrobes in the room for guests to use? This place is supposed to be a 3 1/2 star resort, come on...act like one. The beds were comfortable but I just felt like the room needed to be cleaned or something... As a side note I broke out in hives while staying here. I have no idea what type of detergent is used in the bedding, etc. I tried at the front desk and they could not reach the housekeeping manager so they gave me her phone #. But when I call I only get voicemail. Other incidentals: Charging for parking? come on! $22 for a parking space. Do you know that customers do not like to be nickeled and dimed to death? Just incorporate the parking charge into the price of your daily rate, how hard can it be? Front desk staff: very nice but both times I visited (to check in and check out) there was only one person working and there was at least a 10-15 minute wait to be helped. Seemed like the one person working up there was overwhelmed both times and had no back up? Pools: We visited the main pool on one occasion. Very nice. Has a little beach/sand area and a shallow area for the little ones to play in. Was not overcrowded at all when we were there. The main pool is the only pool out of the 5 pools on the resort that is heated. The other pool areas looked nice, some have big gas flame heater things that they turn on at night. Grounds are lovely. Nice landscaping, you can go for a stroll along the pond or through the resort. It's nice to have a place to roam. I loved, and so did my daughter, all of the ducks in the duck ponds. There are tons of places, gazebos, sitting areas, to sit and lounge and be by yourself. The lobby itself is nicely appointed and HUGE...lots of places to sit, fireplaces, etc. Some people stated in other reviews that if you get a room too far back in the resort it can be a long walk to get from point A to point B. Not neccesarily. I didn't find it difficult to get from one end to another. But then again I love walking. The resort is within walking distance to the beach. The beach was nice & clean. The only issue I found were there was lots of shards of seashells that if stepped on could feel like little pieces of glass but I never cut my foot. There are about 10 firepits on the beach for guests to use, however you have to buy your wood elsewhere or buy it from the marketplace on the resort. We did not eat at either of the restaurants. I did buy items from the resort market place. A little overpriced but not terrible. I bought a San Diego coffee mug for $8, mango sugar lipglos for $4, newspapers, huge bottles of water are $4. Some of their clothing & other tourist items are way expensive, you can probably get those things elsewhere for less if you care to . There is a little coffee cart right outside of the market place where you can get muffins, bananas, lattes, etc. I had a cappuccino frozen latte $7.50 ( a little spendy) but hey, what the heck...indulge a little right? All in all this is a very nice property. I am assuming that the more deluxe rooms/suites are decorated much nicer and are much cleaner than the "standard" rooms. At least I would hope so for the price some people pay to stay here! Not me, I priceline if I can. I was also a little surprised at the lack of character of some of the buildings, some had these goddy looking structures over the doors (see my photo). I still liked the resort, I just wish they'd do some more upgrading. It could be a really REALLY gorgeous place.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: mylilanthony2121
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Paradise Point 5 times last year, and everytime was amazing...we always get the bayside bungalow, and being that close to the water is awesome and its just gorgeous!!! the staff has taken care of us everytime we called for something.....the first time we stayed there our toilet was broken and we called the front desk and they comped our 250 dinner we had from barefoot bar and grill.....everyone is very friendly and room service was always sent to us in a timely manner....i love this place and every 4 months when we go to san diego, i always book there....never had a bad experience there....only problem is if you have t-mobile, you dont get great service....but thats not the hotels fault...plus who wants to answer their cell phone when you're sitting on the beach drinking a margarita, enjoying the scenery? amazing place and i will recommend this place to anyone wanting a great place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, nice grounds, good service, empty kitchenette”
Reviews.Author: Bears70
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, with two young children. I had a 1 bedroom suite garden room. Kids slept in pull out couch. Rooms are clean, not perfect, as there is a bit of age and wear and tear. The problem is that the level of accommodation does not match the price. The kitchenette's in the room have a small refrigerator and microwave and absolutely nothing else. Not a single plate, spoon, or paper towel. Thank goodness room service prices are reasonable but with a rather limited menu. No place for 4 people to sit down and eat food. I was an off-season guest which meant poolside service, grill and bar were all closed. Main pool is heated, smaller pools near rooms, have heated hot tubs which my family enjoyed. Nice seaside dining option, but the area immediately outside the resort is an industrial concrete jungle with limited dining options. $10 a day for internet. My family enjoyed our stay but in the end felt the price did not match the level accommodations. We used it as a launching pad for Legoland and San Diego Zoo for kids.

Reviews.Title: “The entrance is great and it went downhill from there”
Reviews.Author: drehan
Reviews.Content: Beautiful entrance to the resort and great location. We had a garden lanai room. We had ants in our room and an outside light that was out. Service was quick to fix the outside light so we could see to use our key... but the light switch didn't work and it illuminated our room all night long. The lighting in the room was not adequate to use the business table set up (we were just trying to play cards). The big surprise is the additional fees parking additional $22.00 per day, gym another $12per person per day and wi-fi $10 per day. Most hotels offer this for free. I wouldn't stay there again, Pacific beach area has same prices and lots more beach to watch, great restaurants and activities. It is nice if you want peace and quiet only...and some ants.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point Resort is exactly that....Paradise.”
Reviews.Author: verve93
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the wonderful Paradise Point Resort Jan 31st for a quick romantic overnite trip. We were lucky to get 50% off the room rates online so we booked a Garden Lanai Room and we were extremely happy with the room! From the minute we arrived we felt VERY welcome by all the staff, from the Front Desk to the guy that drove us to our room. The room was very clean with a king bed and a big shower with a tub and the sink was seperate from the bathroom which was nice. The bed was perfect and the pillows were just right. There was also a couch that looked like it was a sofa sleeper as well. We were right next to the Adult Lagoon pool -which was heated as well as a "just right" in temperature jacuzzi. We chose to stay onsite and eat at Baleen. We called to concierge and they picked us up from our room and dropped us off at the resturant. We ate outside and were kept nice and warm with the heaters. I highly recommend the Filet Mignon - cooked perfect with a pepper crust and the portion was large. My GF had the Ahi Tuna and she could barely finish her plate. The prices are up there but the food was delicious, the portions were good, and the drinks were strong. We would recommend the Paradise Point Resort to anyone looking to get away and feel welcomed and leave relaxed!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Spot, Rooms are Hit-or-Miss”
Reviews.Author: amydd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the resort for nearly a week- the first few days at a business conference, then my family joined me for a long weekend. The conference center was terrific - newly remodeled, modern & tastefully decorated, meeting rooms with walls of windows overlooking the bay. Fantastic! The room I was booked into originally was a garden room and was definitely sub-standard. It was dark, had mis-matched furniture and even a non-matching cover for the toilet tank (a smaller, differently-shaped cover had been placed over the tank - tacky!). The sink counter was not fully cleaned, it was dusty/dirty everywhere but just around the sink. Two times my cardkey de-magnetized (which is a big pain when you are a 5-7 minute walk from the front desk) and one morning I had no hot water! Luckily I was able to be moved for the weekend and ended up with a really nice room, a mini-suite, just behind the pool/pond area. That room was so much better - airy, bright, a little kitchenette, large space with a king-sized bed and queen pullout couch (but even my 10yo daughter complained about how uncomfortable the mattress was). We were very happy with that room. The resort is nice - since it was off season only the largest of their 5 pools was heated (but all the hot tubs were), which was fine for us. We used the compliementary ping pong and the pro-shop let us use the tennis courts for free (usually $20/hour which seems spendy). We ate at the Barefoot Grill and it was fine - usual resort prices. They have all kinds of boat rentals which seemed fun - we just ran out of time as we had gorgeous weather and spent a day at Mission & Pacific Beaches. Bell staff were all very friendly and helpful. I was fortunate to have the conference rate package so was not charged for the $10 internet or $12 fitness center charges (which are ridiculous). Overall, it was a pleasant stay but I probably wouldn't go back - too many other places to try!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Gardens”
Reviews.Author: mm73
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay with two kids (11 &12). Nice check in & lobby area. Bellman took us to our room with luggage via golf cart. Gardens are lovely, beach leaves much to be desired. Not cleaned up, broken glass in places so be careful where you walk. Love the idea of bayfront rooms with personal firepits. We had a garden lanai with two beds, room was pretty small but OK since we didn't plan to be there much. If you stay at this hotel, rent a car or plan to take a cab. Went to the beach each day, apx. $10 one way. This was still less expensive than a car rental plus the $22/day parking fee at the resort. All the staff was very friendly & helpful at all times. Overall, was a nice resort but didn't knock our socks off by any means.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Renovation and New Policies”
Reviews.Author: Strongbru
Reviews.Content: Compared to other resorts and even other "normal" hotels I've stayed in, Paradise Point falls short on both service and amenities. The first room I was taken to had the carpet pulled up and the beds stacked on top of one another. Thankfully, I got a new room instantly, but even then it fell short of my expectations. There was no real desk, except a hutch to pull out and sit uncomfortably under the TV. The furniture looked quite used (even if they're trying to replicatate an antique look) and the walls were dirty and scratched. The sliding glass door didn't fully close or lock, though it did have a safety bar in it. On the plus side, the beds were big and comfortable and had nice sheets. The $10 a day for internet is really uncalled for in the 21st century of wireless networks; what's worse, you have to plug in an ethernet cable; you don't even have a wifi choice. Room service also charges a $4 "delivery fee." What I've loved about other resorts I've stayed at was the fact that these types of amenities are simply part of the package; here it felt like getting nickled and dimed everywhere I turned. There's also no shuttle services to anywhere and since it's in the middle of an island, it makes it pretty boring or expensive if you don't have a car. As for the service, the bellhops and tram drivers were excellent, but the front desk is on the slow side. Anytime I called the front desk I was put on hold for a long period of time. Once no one even re-picked up the phone. Overall, I just expected much more for the money.

Reviews.Title: “I was the best vacation we've had in a long time.”
Reviews.Author: gthornton
Reviews.Content: Not only was the weather perfect, but so was the resort. We stayed 3 nights and had a wonderful time. It's great for a romantic getaway or for family.

Reviews.Title: “nice but not fabulous”
Reviews.Author: AZgirl40
Reviews.Content: My stay at the hotel was OK, but not the luxury resort experience I expected from the website. This ended up being OK for me because I was there for an intense conference, and not paying for a "vacation resort experience". None the less, here are my comments: My check-in process was fine, although when I asked to have my reservation stating I was there with a conference, I was told that because I booked through a third party they could not put that in, but that I would get "everything that all conference attendees get". Not the case. They tried to charge me 10.00/day for internet use, and when I stated I was supposed to get free internet due to being a conference attendee, I was told this was not the case because I had booked through a third party (Orbitz). I had to go to the conference staff, and they did eventually get me free internet. I had their basic "garden" room. My room was OK--I had some trouble sleeping due to the bright light outside my door (covered by a somewhat thin curtain). And noise carried very easily from adjacent rooms, so much so that I could hear other people's conversations. Bring earplugs. The resort itself is pretty with several pools, and you can take a nice walk along the beach around the resort. At night I found the lighting to be poor in certain areas of the resort, which could be an issue for elderly. The food we had for lunches at the conference was delicious. I ate most of my meals after conference hours at the Barefoot Bar and Grill, which had pretty decent food, although somewhat pricey and not a lot of healthy options. I was able to use the fitness center for free (but like other people have said ,their usual charge is 12.00). The fitness center is actually halfway decent, with 4 treadmills, 2 ellipticals, and 2 stairmasters, along with freeweights and some weight machines. I really wonder how much they stick to their policy of charging 12.00 to use the fitness room because most days I just walked right in and no one asked me anything. I did treat myself to an Indian Scalp massage and hand and foot massage at the Spa, which I had heard was good. I was somewhat disappointed--my massage was mediocre at best, and $150 for a total one hour mediocre treatment seemed to add salt to the wound. My massage therapist's name was Jesus, so I would try to book someone else if you go to the spa. The concierge in the hotel lobby was extremely helpful and friendly. I think there is a place at the resort to rent kayaks and go in the bay, which looked like fun, but there is a separate fee for that, too.

Reviews.Title: “Okay not great”
Reviews.Author: cbrstj
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of days at this fairly nice resort. The property was well kept. The ponds were green, but I don't know it that was on purpose or not. Rooms were nice. They had A/C that worked well. Enjoyed the Adult pool. Hated that the ice machines are in the pool areas which are locked up when they close. Had to call room service to get ice. The staff was courteous and professional. Food at the restaurants was a little pricey. We went to the IHOP in Pacific Beach instead.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby room, shabbier service”
Reviews.Author: Travis74
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a nice private resort style get away on the coast in SanDiego, and we got a nightmare. First of all a $22 per night parking Fee?They couldnt just raise their rates to include the parking fee? Well no they couldnt for a few reasons. First of all the room we stayed in was shabby, carpet was dirty, the layout was odd, we had to shut the tv hutch just to get to the bathroom. The first night I take a shower, after five minutes im up to my ankles in backed up water, "gross" so I cut my shower short. Later I flush the toilet and the toilet overflows slightly and we use our dry towels to sop up the water, we call the front desk and they send someone out to snake the line, but dont send any new towels for us. I have to go to the adjacent pool and snag towels from there so we have clean towels. The next day the toilet didnt overflow but just about did and we didnt dare take showers. We told the front desk and they said they will have facilitys look at it, we came back later that day and still not fixed, still backed up. We decided to checkout and find another place. When we checked out we explained how poor the service was, and they just said "we hope you have a better stay next time", I said "never ever again". This is the second worst Hotel experience ive ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point, just so, so”
Reviews.Author: runner108
Reviews.Content: Don't expect to use your cell phone or have wi-fi access. Very sketchy cell phone service on the property, I have AT&T wireless and did not have access in my room. I had to wonder around outside of my room to find a signal. Also, no wi-fi access except in the lobby of the hotel. Didn't like the $12 charge just to walk on the treadmill in the spa. Indicated that I did not want to use any of the other spa services, but still $12.00 charge every day to use gym equipment....added onto the $15.00 per day charge to park your car. This was surprising as parking was available everywhere on the premises. Resturant staff was friendly and service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Experience”
Reviews.Author: Vailite
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice week in California. The hotel staff was on top of everything. Well worth the money. Great rooms and location.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: fampratravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the first weekend of October to attend conference. Prior to the trip, we were promised "luxurious resort at tropical setting" The driveway leads into resort seem luxurious and impressive. However, this is the only luxury part of this so called resort. Our gardenview "suite" has terrible odor like no one had stayed in this room for long period of time. The furnishings inside the suite was outdated to the point that it felt like it was picked out from Goodwill Store. The carpet was old and dirty as evidenced by my 2year old son's feet. The aircondition was very noisy and yet it produce no comfort at all. We were so fed up that we turned off the A/C and open the back patio door because the room was suffocating with terrible stench. The conference center restroom was sadly the only modern facility in the whole resort. The swimming pool water was cold and bottom were filled with dirt and debris. The pond is perfect breeding ground for mosquito that probably carry west nile virus. No housekeeping bother to clean the room until we had to call them twice. The maid was probably mad that she took all of our towels without replacing it and she didn't even bother to leave and soap or any toiletries behind. Those essential toiletries and towels were brought after FOUR calls to housekeeping. Overall, this "resort" is anything that it called itself as. If you like to pay $250 for a room that is so antiquated that is even worse than any motel in teh USA and $22 daily parking to boast, you have found this place is perfect paradise point.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place..”
Reviews.Author: Audi_Chris
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before ,so coming back was to be a welcomed trip, as this was the first 2 days of our honeymoon, before we headed off to Hawaii (Big Island). The place is nice on the eye and quite tranquil. A selection of pools - one of which is adult only, so no noisy kids! The rooms are well decorated and of a generous size. The ones which have a beachfront are obviously nicer and you get a view too. The main restaurant looked really nice and up-market - though we never ate there. The smaller cafe/lunch bar - which also served evening meals, was much more basic but nice too. This place had a wonderful view and was on a large pond full of tropical fish. I really liked Paradise Point and the reception area is something else! I would have no hesitation in returning to this place, however, my only gripe is the expense of the car parking! It was at least $10 per day - check with website. A 5 day visit here would be ideal!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: KatieScarlettO
Reviews.Content: I went to Paradise Point for a family wedding. This place is absolutely not worth the money and I'm not even sure they should be calling themselves a Resort. My first complaint is that it is laid out in the most convoluted, confusing way it could possibly be. You never know where you are or how to get from Point A to Point B. My second complaint is that my room was awful. It was dinged up, stained, and dingy, the a/c was old and migraine inducingly loud and noisy. The ironing board wouldn't stay up and the iron didn't work. The toiletries were cheap and kind of gross. The daily parking was $22! per day (the rental car rate was only $20!), the use of the gym was $12 per day, the food was excessively expensive, the internet was $10. per day, and the market had nothing but junk food. My room, at $250. per night, had a view of the maintenance parking lot and all the golf carts. You would think that as part of a large wedding group that they might try to give us each decent rooms. My third complaint is that 3 miles away is the ocean front Best Western where an ocean front room ws $60 per night cheaper, the parking is free, the gym is free, the internet connection is free, and the breakfast is free. Next time I know where I'm going! To give credit where credit is due the wedding was lovely and the Resort did a very good job in creating a beautiful setting for the bride and groom. But the guests didn't get much to be happy about.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room!”
Reviews.Author: OregonWheels
Reviews.Content: We read reviews and were concerned, but took a chance. We were in room 150 so can only report on that. It was amazing! The rooms were very clean, very spacious, and very quiet. The bathroom was larger than normal. Each room has both a front and back patio. The one negative is the pond does have a odor to it. However, the trails are beautiful and the pool was wonderful! We walked around several paths early each morning and just enjoyed the ducks and fountains. Another problem is there is no microwave in the room and none you can access to warm up baby bottles even. The room service and poolside drinks were far too expensive. They could reduce the cost and still make a lot of money! the pool is beautiful but was a little too cold for my toddler. Overall I recommend this hotel to anyone! Booking through Entertainment book.com saved us a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Pricey Resort”
Reviews.Author: irishmom2005
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this resort after a weekend stay with my family. Driving onto the property the lush landscaping was beautiful, reminded me of Maui. Staff at check-in were friendly and helpful. Proprerty looks nice and probably was wonderful when it was originally built but is in need of an update, at least the parts of the resort we experienced. We booked a Garden suite, which was very outdated, nothing luxurious about the rooms. Very basic, in fact, the carpet in our room was very dirty as evidenced by my 3 year old's feet! Air conditioner was loud, king size bed was uncomfortable. $22 parking fee per day is outrageous. Barefoot bar was pricey for the type and quality of food served. It's a 3 star resort charging 5 star prices. Good location if visiting Seaworld, but not a luxury retreat by any means, and room prices are too high for quality of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Echoben
Reviews.Content: Stayed midweek (3days, 2nights) the week before Labor Day weekend and had a great time. We are a family of 5 with 3 boys (7,5,2). We booked a Garden Suite the day before we left as the rates drop significantly to clear inventory. They were also running a special with increasing discounts the longer you stayed. When we arrived we were upgraded to a larger and newer Executive Suite. Read the somewhat conflicting reviews about it but am glad to say we had a wonderful time. We never left the property. And while some parts did look a bit dated the staff was fantastic, very friendly and attentive. I think being midweek had something to do with this as the resort wasn't really that crowded. The main pool has a beach with real sand that the boys loved. And the grounds are beautiful. It really does feel a lot like being in Hawaii. There are plenty of activities and they're all quite reasonable (bike, boat and kayak rentals), and there's a very convenient market on premises for child essentials like milk. Bring your own firewood though, they charge a lot for firewood. The spa is first rate. The beach is great for younger children since it's on a lagoon and there are no waves. It's more like a lake. The Barefoot restaurant is a bit pricey for the kind of food it serves, but it beats driving off property. The fish and sharks in the surrounding pond are a definite plus, especially if you buy the food to feed them from the market. Seaworld is literally right around the corner, but a bit far for walking. The zoo is only about 10 minutes away by car. The only thing I wish they had was a proper Starbucks or equivalent. Looking forward to coming back next year.

Reviews.Title: “A true Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Delga
Reviews.Content: On 8/17/08 we came back from a stay at The Paradise Point Resort and Spa. It is an island which is a true paradise. The lush vegetation, the views of the water, the beautiful swimming pool (there is also a children's one), the fantastic spa where everybody greets you with a smile, with the most knowledgeable staff, everything makes you feel pampered. The service is impeccable. The concierge always ready to help, togive directions to restaurants, other hotels (to pick up somebody) or anything one needs. There is a great golf cart service , you can call them up on the phone and in 5 minutes they will be at your door to take you anywhere in the island (which is not small) The beds are excellent. The rooms are not spectacular, but comfortable and well provided and they are not in a big building , but just one story, divided in small "villages", which makes it cozier. Everything was wonderful .We had the most enjoyable stay(specially because our son was getting married there and it is a picture perfect place for a wedding.) We would recomend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Travelon44
Reviews.Content: We just recently spent 4-day at Paradise Point. It's a tough place to reveiw as I feel it may fit some and not others. Also, feel they need to put more effort in customer service and paying attention to guest. Overall at the price we paid it wasn't worth it to us. Day one room was ready around 2:30, paid $ 600.00+. When we got to the room we had 2-towels? With four of use that doesn't work. I called for some more and no one showed up, I finally walked to find a maid who gave me as many as I wanted. Our room had a kitchnette. Basically a fridge and microwave. Thier wasn't one thing supplied. No napkins, forks, spoons, cups, no ice buck Nothing. At this price per night I think it's riduculous. Rooms were good size, however most of the walls and furniture were nicked up, scratched and capet was rough. The pull out bed was awful. THE SPA IS AWESOME! We picked this resort because it was close to Seaworld, we didn't realize it's so private. You can't walk to anything and the bike paths etc. are all accross the water. It's a great place if you're looking for a quiet place to sit and read, but to me it's not suited for an active family vacation. My wife and I enjoyed walking the ground in the morning, my kids 15 & 12 were bored. Pools and Grounds are beautiful. If I did this trip again I was stay near the beach were we could walk to bike trails, resturants etc. We moved north of San Diego later in the week and stayed at an awesome resort that was $200.00 a night cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Your Expectations Low and You'll Be Happy”
Reviews.Author: Kabillionaire
Reviews.Content: Keep your expectations low and you'll be pleasantly surprised. Overall, it's a nice place and very convenient to Sea World, but the place is just crying out for some renovations. The hotel and grounds are beautiful, but the rooms feel old and dilapidated. We originally had a Lanai Garden room with a King bed and a sofa bed. It felt very run down, old, small and although the room was clean, it just felt a little dirty. Definitely needs some updating. My kids (ages 10 & 7) complained (rightfully so) that the sofa bed mattress was really thin and uncomfortable. It was pretty worn out. I contacted the front desk and they were very helpful. We were moved the next day to a different Lanai room with two Queen beds which was much larger too, but not any better as far as the run down feeling. Nonetheless, we were a lot happier in the new room. Staff was extremely helpful, really went out of their way for us and were very friendly. A few other observations: -We ate at their Barefoot Bar & Grill for dinner and again for lunch. Service was really slow at night and a little better at lunch time. Food was a bit overpriced and the quality was sub-par, particularly for the price. The nearby restaurants in Mission Beach are much better and a lot more reasonable. -We rented a paddle boat and a motorboat from the marina and they were fantastic. Really helpful and the prices were reasonable. -We went to the "Pro Shop" to play tennis and found the courts to be pretty run down; the tennis rackets available to be borrowed were a joke. Old, beaten up, too small and in horrible shape. I think they were paddle tennis rackets. Also, the ping pong table was gone, so we couldn't do that either. -The main pool has a beach which is cool and it was pretty easy to get a drink. We were there in August - high season - and the pool was pretty clean and not very crowded. We got 4 chairs for the family pretty easily, which says a lot about the place. Two thumbs up for having lots of chairs at the pool. The other outlying pools were also relatively uncrowded and were great for kids because they are pretty shallow. -Proximity to Sea World was great. If you don't count waiting in line to pay the $12 to park at Sea World, you're no more than 5 minutes from the front gate. Unless you stay in a Beachside room, just try to plan on being away from your room as much as possible, so you're not bothered by the tiny size. Otherwise, you should be satisfied with your stay.

Reviews.Title: “some bits we loved, other bits let them down”
Reviews.Author: Ilovemypets
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort as the hotel we had picked originally was having their pool refurbished during July and our kids like to swim every day. Paradise point was in our travel agents brochure, and in a good location for Sea World, so we picked it fairly quickly as a replacement. Some things we liked, but overall they let themselves down. The landscaping is great - beautiful plants and flowers, lovely beach areas, the pools were well maintained and very attractive, the lagoon areas had lots of birds, paths were maintaned well. Our bathroom was great and looked refurbished. The bedding was spotless, but the rest of the furniture was shabby and chipped and the walls were scuffed. There were stains on the carpet, but they had been hoovered and it was generally clean. Our room didn't smell, but the kids room did smell musty. We suffered what other reviewers have mentioned - our rooms were not ready when we arrived at 5pm! The second room was not ready until 6.30pm, an hour and a half after check in - though in their defense they immediately and without us asking gave us $100 on the room to go and have a drink whilst we waited, but it is frustrating when you've had a long journey. As others have said the parking fee is a bit cheeky and not needed when a room is so expensive. The restaurant food ( Barefoot grill place) was fine, but again, they let themselves down. The outdoor furniture hadn't been treated, so the legs of the chairs and tables were rotting and the seats needed sanding and re-varnishing. The second day, all of the waiting staff had dirty uniforms at breakfast - there's no need for this and the manager should be looking out for this sort of thing. The people who manage the grounds should take over the general management, who need a shake up. The concierge was lovely and exceedingly helpful, as was the lady in the shop.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Get Away Hotel. : )”
Reviews.Author: meanttolive
Reviews.Content: My family have stayed here since before I was even born. I almost have grown up at this hotel, as we go at least once every year. Every year I grow more and more in love with it, and when the occasion arises, it has always been my dream wedding destination. Yes, it is pricey, but I believe it is well worth every dollar. I have read the reviews here and have no idea where they are coming from. The pool at paradise point is one of my favorites. I have stayed here almost 20 years, and have never seen a "weird greenish tint" to it. In fact, the pool has just been remodeled over the past few years, and is absolutely breath taking. The main reason why I love Paradise Point is the landscaping. It's breath taking. Since this hotel is older, all the plants are full grown and absolutely magnificent. My favorite thing to do is to just walk around the hotel and explore and take in the scenery. (esp at night when all the torch lights are light...) If you are a fan of being able to explore and walk around your hotels, you'll like it here. And that beautiful San Diego weather just adds to the charm! The hotels may be starting to show there wear, but I would never compare them to a "motel." anytime we have had a problem with the room (ie, one time our drain in the shower didn't work) someone came out that day to fix it. And, seeing as this hotel is on the beach, you can expect the usual wear from simply being near water. My only complaint is that since new owners, the place has started to cater to a different, less family oriented crowd. I def miss the old barefoot grill with the sand pit! ;) and the old breakfast buffet where the check ins currently are. But those reasons aren't strong enough to keep me away! Anyone who cannot see the beauty in this place needs to open their eyes. To me, this hotel is not like the usual cookie cutter "corporate" hotels. It has character. And I think you will find the more you stay, the more you'll want to go back. Paradise Point is my favorite place to get away, stay for a week, and never even leave the hotel. Please don't judge this hotel by the negative reviews on here, and experience it on your own. I hope you see the beauty in it that my family here at home have for over 20 years now.

Reviews.Title: “Great for July 4th Fireworks”
Reviews.Author: WhirlwindTravel
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at the resort on July 3rd. The fireworks show was spectacular. The resort itself is okay. Certainly nothing like the fancier resorts in Mexico, Carribean, or Hawaii. But for Southern California, it's not bad. The property is large, meandering roads, ponds, etc. 18 whole miniature golf was fun. The beach is right there; there're fire pits you can you to make a bonfire. The rooms are small and motel-like. The are 2 restaurants in the resort; a formal and an outdoor bar. Pretty mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Loews is much better”
Reviews.Author: ddjs
Reviews.Content: Rooms - old and are not cleaned well; bugs in room; there was no door to the bathroom sink Bathroom - had stench of mildew Amenities - a lot; had mini golf, 5 pools, basketball court, tennis court, bicycle rental; everything cost money, even to use the courts! Receptionists - showed no initiative of service; stood in line and wasn't addressed at all; they sure need to be taught what service is! For the price of around $300-$400 per room per night, it is better to go to Loews. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: YLMom
Reviews.Content: After reading so many negative reviews of this place I just thought I would give my opinion. We just finished a two night stay at Paradise Point. It was my husband, our 14 yo daughter and me. First of all, we stayed in a Junior suite. This is a little pricier than a standard room but it is a larger room with a sitting area, a tiny kitchette area and a very nice bathroom arrangement. When I originally booked in early March the Jr Suite were pretty expensive so I decided to settle for the standard room. However I kept checking prices and the suites came down in price so I changed my reservation to the Junior Suite. The main reason I love Paradise Point is because our room backed up on to a lovely shaded green belt. We had a small patio with chairs. There was a pond near us and every morning I would drink my coffee, read the paper and sit on the patio while ducks would meander by. I just found it peaceful, tranquil, lovely and exactly what I look for in a vacation rest. I will agree that the rooms aren't 5-star quality. But this is a very old place and what the rooms are, is clean and comfortable. They are freshly painted and the decor is 'shabby chic' or maybe they are just shabby (?) but I really had no complaints. The room was clean, the bathroom was very nice with double sinks and granite countertops. The bed was comfortable and I slept wonderfully. My only real complaint was there were no instructions with the coffee maker. The first day I didn' use nearly enough water. The second day I figured it makes about 6-8 cups. I probably could have called to find out. We played the 18 hole putting green, ate at the Barefoot Grill and my husband and daughter rented a jet-ski and jet-skied around Mission Bay. We all relaxed a lot and in a very beautiful setting. I am a person who reads hotel reviews religiously, am very picky about where I stay and really thought twice about Paradise Point based on some of the reviews. But I think it comes down to what you really want. I've had San Diego vacations where we've stayed Downtown in a high-rise with all the moden conveniences and walked the Gaslamp up and back and took in a baseball game. Tons of fun. And I had this vacation where I sat on a patio, fed the ducks, did the daily crossword, enjoyed an absolutely beautiful parklike setting and just relaxed. Both were great vacations and both cost about the same. San Diego isn't cheap for any quality hotel but for what Paradise Point is, it is unique and we will definitely go back. We had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, beautiful weather”
Reviews.Author: beachblanketbingo
Reviews.Content: Well this was our return trip, we stayed at this hotel last year and enjoyed it so much we couldn't think of staying anywhere else. The cost is more expensive then an inland hotel, but it was the best place for us because of the young children that were traveling with us. We stayed in the bungalow again and were first put into a room that had little sand and mostly rock with a dangerous incline. My daughter is 4 yrs old and the other child with us was 6 yrs. so when i contacted the front desk and explained my situation they gladly switched my rooms. I was afraid they wouldn't be able to because we stayed during the 4th of July weekend and it was full, but they accomodated me and i wish i could remember that girl's name because she was very helpful upon check in and when i changed out the room! I probably won't do a 4th of July weekend again because there were too many people on the beaches during that weekend and Sea World was crazier than it usually is. It took us over an hour to enter Sea World because we went on the 4th! With the exception of one family who wouldn't allow us to share the firepit on the beach, we had excellent neighbors. Our kids played with each other and we all sat on the beach and talked and relaxed! This is the perfect hotel because the bungalows sit right on the bay so there is plenty of sand and water for the kids to play in. This is not the hotel if you're looking for an exceptional room. It's dated but comfortable. The sofa bed is definitely not comfortable at all, but even my sofa bed at home that is only a year old and rarely used is not comfortable. So we bring an air bed that sets up in a matter of minutes. Because of the young children we haven't tried dining out at their restaurant which i hear is pretty pricey but i have ordered room service and it's decent as far as room service goes. We love having the mini fridge and microwave in the room. We bought fruit for the kids to munch on and sandwich fixings and then had popcorn as we watched TV, which wasn't much! With the location and the weather you can't help but be outside! We took our own beach chairs since the ones on the patio are heavy and hard to move from the patio to the beach but our chairs fold are easy to transport. You have to come prepared to relax and the firepits aren't in front of every room...it's more like one to every four rooms, which we didn't have a problem until the one family said we couldn't share with them (my kids wanted to roast marshmallows) because another family was coming to visit them. I brought my 4 yr old inside crying but this was no fault of the resort. We could see the firepit from our window and their "friends" never showed up! But other than them, last year and this year we had no problems making friends! I like it better that way! But no one is bothering you unless you make contact...everyone is friendly, the housekeeping, room service and front desk personnel were all helpful and courteous and after 2 yrs there is no doubt that i would stay here again and recommend it to others! I just wish it was more cost effective to stay longer and come more frequently! I enjoy it that much!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Mission Bay Resort”
Reviews.Author: rjc260
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a recent conference for three nights. Given the wide ranging reviews we weren't sure what to expect but we were pleasantly surprised. The room was very spacious and the furnishings were more modern than we were anticipating. The bathroom had two sinks and a separate shower/toilet room. The only room complaint was an adjoining door that would make a loud thud every time the next door occupants opened/closed their door. We had a small patio in back that overlooked a stream - was a pleasant site to have lunch. The overall property was very beautiful, with meandering gardens, lagoons and gardens. There are at least four pool/hot tub areas to lounge around in during the day. The beach overlooking Mission Bay is nothing special - I swam some laps there one afternoon but there is a fair amount of seaweed and muck. There are a couple of restaurants on site. We had food prepared for our conference but it was typically of average quality. The views of the harbor from the conference/dining rooms were very scenic however. Also beware that there is a $15 fee to use the not that extensive workout room. We found service at the resort to be not exceptional but good enough. One issue was check-in/out. There can be large buildups of vehicles at the reception area and long lines inside the building (automated check-out was not working during our stay). The location is great for quick access to beaches, Sea World, downtown, etc. However there is no public transportation so a vehicle is needed unless you are willing to rack up expensive taxi fares.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Banker-Rick
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Paradise Point was much more pleasant than we had prepared ourselves for. The grounds (as commented by everyone) were beautiful, and the room more than served the needs of a family of four. After having a very favorable bid accepted on Priceline, we became concerned after reading the negative reviews of the property. Thankfully, these concerns were unwarranted. The room was clean and functionally furnished. The staff was courteous and responsive. The mini-fridge allowed us to purchase groceries and do breakfast in the room - saving time and money during our stay. We did not sample either of the on site restuarants, opting instead for nearby, off-site establishments. Being just a few steps from the waterfront was an added bonus. The location was great - convenient to Mission/Pacific Beach, the Zoo, downtown, and LaJolla. As mentioned in another review, GPS was very helpful to first time San Diego visitors. Overall, a very enjoyable stay at Paradise Point.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Location. . . decent MOTEL”
Reviews.Author: orridge
Reviews.Content: As a San Diego native and resident, I have seen a lot of hotels in San Diego and finally got to spend some time in Paradise Point. I have always been impressed with the lush landscaping and during Christmas when the lights and christmas tree are up, it is delightful. However, the rooms are very dated. This means you get an older squeaky wooden bed, old furniture, a small TV and old bathroom fixtures (and the place smells). My wife and I both agreed that the room was reminiscent of those motels one stays in when traveling across the country. The landscaping is nice, always has been. But thats about it. Since our room was paid for as we were attending a company retreat, we had no problem returning to our condo at nights. If you love motels, this is an expensive one you just might like.

Reviews.Title: “Palm Trees, Pine Trees, Coast and Skunks”
Reviews.Author: christiki295
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point may be the best lace next to Hawaii, but there is still considerable room for improvement. The nice aspects are tiki torches by the lobby and the restaurants, lush landscaping (particularly on Hibiscus lane), lagoon view rooms, and convenient access to the coast. Bikes can be rented for $10 hr/$50 day, there is croquet and miniature golf. There are 2 pools with waterfalls and another pool under construction. The marina rents power boats and sail boats. However, there is no beach, but a bay with views of apartments and freeways. There are no chairs provided to guests at the coast, who are left with option of taking the patio chairs from someone's bayfront room - without getting caught. There also is an abundance of pine trees - and a shortage of palm trees - by the shore which reduces the tropical vibe. The decor of the rooms are decorated based on a New England Hampton theme as opposed to a tropical theme. The red plaid couches, the colonial headboard and lamps and the (sparse) artwork on the walls all should be removed in favor of a tropical theme, like the rattan mirror and chairs in the rooms. However, I love the spacious bungalows! The bathrooms are marble palaces and the bath products are of spa quality. On Hibiscus Road, there are ducks in the lagoon in the day and skunks in abundance at night. Baleen is a 4-star restaurant, with a $40 price-fix menu to match, except the menu was limited to steak, seabass or quail. I recommend the teak tables of the more casual marina-front Barefoot Bar & Grill. (By the way, the sand dance floor has been removed).

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point Resort is Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: MargeMerced
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at the Paradise Point Resort and would have loved to have stayed longer. We were in San Diego to attend commencement at UCSD. The location was great - close to Sea World, La Jolla and Old Town. I had read the negative reviews and was concerned about room quality & cleanliness. Our room was very good - clean & in good repair. The grounds are absolutely beautiful - several pools, waterfalls, beach access. It felt like Hawaii. The Barefoot Grill Restaurant (on the property) served a wonderful breakfast with a view of the bay. We had a few minor requests for extra towels and to have the outside light turned on that were dealt with promptly. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. We would definitely look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Venue -- Very Surprised”
Reviews.Author: lvein
Reviews.Content: I am not one who generally writes reviews as I have not traveled much recently and prior I almost always used AMEX Fine Hotel and Resorts, which are generally bullet proof for quality. Now I have a wonderful toddler and she was the priority. I looked at various options that would be easy to travel to from Beverly Hills. I thought Sea World would be fun and looked at around 15 hotels in the SD area including Gas Lamp district. When I came across Paradise Point I was excited that they had the duck ponds, as my daughter loves ducks. HOWEVER, I started to read the less than favorable reviews and became very concerned. I called the hotel and asked a bunch of questions. The agent on the phone was exceedingly helpful and I drilled her with questions. She satisfied my interest and I took the leap of faith. Great Decision! Amalie loved seeing the ducks. My schmoozing of the agent resulted in a very nice room upgrade at no cost. I expressed a bit of angst at the $22 car park charge, not that I can’t afford it but one principle, and they did something nice for me with that. There were other unexpected perks at no charge…and clearly no guarantee you will get the same, but I could not have been happier as my daughter loved the place. Also, they have chairs comfortably placed throughout the grounds to sit and relax, nice gardens, very nice staff and a miniature golf course we did not get a chance to use. The beach was nice for all of us as were the pools. The Spa looked impressive but no time for that with the toddler being the focus. Bottom line, I am one pain in the butt when it comes to hotel stay and I certainly will be back! Lawrence Vein

Reviews.Title: “baaad”
Reviews.Author: tazzax
Reviews.Content: I thought it sounded good and 5star review nailed it but: 1. Rooms tatty - less than 3star standard. 2. Service arrogant 3. location (if you don't have a beach side room) poor - little better than a motel! 4. Not a lot around it to do...which is ok if you don't like doing anything! 5. Supermarket (only one small one which sold nothing!) expensive. 6. Pools packed at weekends... On a good point has loads of potential and nice gardens - but not any better than 3star! honest!

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: m-barbie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister during a conference in early June. Having read earlier reviews, I was very nervous about the property, and our room in particular. We were very pleasantly surprised. Our bayside room was in excellent condition, and the view was stunning. Service at the front desk was friendly and efficient, and our conference facilities (and the food provided through the conference) were as good as others I've been to. I know that experiences can vary greatly from one guest to another on any given day, but I was very happy with my stay at Paradise Point and would go again. As to food costs, they were high, but that's pretty typical for a resort. I advise renting a car at the airport. It's cheaper than taking a cab around San Diego when you want to explore the area, even including the parking fee charged by the hotel. (Our parking spot was next to our bungalow door).

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel Needs Lots of Attention”
Reviews.Author: cactus13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was built in the 60's and it shows. The rooms are tiny with tiny bathrooms. For a family of 4 you get 3 bath towels. The rooms get cleaned every day late afternoon not mornings. The parking(far from room) fee is $22 a day and .075 for the paper daily that is automatically charged to the bill. The menu movies are $12.99. The Bar and Grill food is not to my liking-worst ribs and steak ever. The mojitos are good but are $12. Food is very expensive here. The steak was $25. The inroom desserts are yummy though-huge chocochip cookies and bread pudding. They call their chocolate cake a lava cake but it was just frosted chocolate cake. The AC units are going out so we heard a loud buzzing sound when we tried to sleep. My husband's back was sore from the stiff bed. The pillows need to be replaced because they are crumbled inside. Lots of skunks running around. There is no shuttle service so taxis cram the front parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: crystalcapen
Reviews.Content: Check-in was great, staff was friendly. First night was wonderful. Pools close at 10pm Erica, at Front Desk opened the pool by our room for an extra hour, we were very impressed! I then tried to access the internet in my room, after three username and password failures received from the front desk, I gave up for the night. The room next to our hotel room is a HouseKeeping supply room, all night a long squeaky sound would sound off and on. There is no parking option other than the one assigned by your room, but since there is no option the hotel adds $22 a night for parking. (What is the other option????????) The area is very confusing with a even more confusing map. Few signs are posted to even give a person a clue. First night I found out the outside porch light did not work, called the front desk and was assured someone could fix it the next morning. (Thanks for the added security for the first night.) Then I also realized this is the first Hotel I have ever stayed in that does not offer a deadbolt or inside lock, not to mention my door did not even shut securely and since we were at the back of the Resort (in nowhere land) it made me feel very unsafe. The next day I applied the “Service Please” sign on the door to receive Housekeeping for the day. (The Housekeepers get there supplies and everything two feet from my room), returning at 5PM my room had not been touched. Day two of trying to get online, called for a computer expert. I was sent a Man who came with a cord for the dataport. Plugged it in, and said is it working, because it must be your computer because when I plugged the cord in I didn’t hear that special “CLICK”, I said but the port is lighted up so it must be connecting!! His response was for me to call the front desk, maybe they could help. (Was this ther main IT Man?????) The pool closest to our room was the Meadow pool, night two, it was completely dark, my daughter was swimming, and I could not even see her in the dark to see if she was ok. One of the maintenance men drove by in a cart so I stopped him and asked why is the pool so dark, and if it had no lights why was it open until 10PM. ----No joke ----for the next hour I sat watching four employees walk around the pool with flashlights clueless. I laughed to myself thinking this is like the joke “four men and a lightbulb”. After an hour of the four men searching for this “magical light switch that nobody knows about” one man claimed finally of having no clue, and would try to fix the problem in the morning. - - - My curiosity is with four men on staff, why in the world would none of them have a clue???? Was this side of the hotel just opened after 50 years or something???? Has anyone ever swam after dark here at this pool ever? It’s open till 10PM! Finally after 2 hours of tapping into the IP address from the hotel I finally got online, but password and username didn’t work, so called front desk for the 5th time. 3 light bulbs went out in our room during a three night stay. I am somewhat clueless of how to feel about my stay here, I think I will try somewhere else next time, wouldn’t you?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise After Airport Snafu”
Reviews.Author: HikerGirl41
Reviews.Content: We ended up at Paradise Point when a security breach closed Terminal 2 at Lindbergh Airport. We called a reservation service from a courtesy phone at the airport and were referred to Paradise Point for $149 per night. I was a little nervous because I'd never heard of the place and the rate seemed cheap on the weekend of the Rock N Roll Marathon when many properties were sold out. The property itself is beautiful...tropical landscaping, lagoons, a pretty main pool, a neat observation tower, lots of outdoor seating areas. It felt like Hawaii. Our room was satisfactory. Nothing special but nothing to complain about especially at $149 per night. We had plenty of hot water. I'd agree with others however that the A/C sounded like a 747 about to take off. We stayed in a little bungalow on the bay and we were just steps from the beach. Fire pits on the beach were a nice touch. This was a great place to be with kids. The beach access was super. There were fish and ducks to feed. Walking paths were nice. There was a movie at the pool in the evening. We used an outside pizza delivery service right to our door. Disadvantages: Like so many other reviews, our room was not ready at 3:00 pm when we arrived. They said they'd call but didn't. We didn't get into our room until 4:30. There was no room service menu in our room. Our portable crib requested at check-in didn't come until almost 7:00. The restaurants were expensive and not really geared to someone with kids. Golf carts to get you around were a nice touch but seemed to disappear after dark...and this is a place where you can really get turned around. No ammenities are really provided. I've stayed at Best Westerns that will give you a toothbrush if you've forgotten one. This place will nickel and dime you to death. As I mentioned, we were there because of airport snafus. We had no luggage. 6 diapers, a pack of wipes, two toothbrushes and a mini toothpaste set me back about $24. All that said, this seems like a great place to come with a family if you are prepared. We met many families from Orange County who come as a getaway with the kids. They bring snacks, waters and toys for the kids. They enjoy the pool, movies, beach and walking paths. It's a gorgeous place with room to explore. Despite some of the negatives, I believe we'd come again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Far From Paradise”
Reviews.Author: 3LilBears
Reviews.Content: We planned an overnight stay in San Diego and we picked this hotel since it was close to a lot of attractions (Sea World, San Diego Zoo, Fashion Valley Mall). The hotel's rates were also lower than usual since it was the week after Memorial Day. Our visit started quite nicely...the valet attendants and the front desk personnel were helpful. The lobby was nicely decorated so we couldn't wait to see our rooms. We booked a Lanai Garden bungalow. The room was spacious for a family of 3 but seriously needed updating. I was worried to bathe my infant daughter since the bathtub was rusty. It was also draining very slow. The air conditioning unit looks like it was from the 70's and the remote control was very dusty. When we checked out, I informed the front desk personnel about the bathtub and the patio light that left us in the dark at night. She was nice enough to credit us the parking fee of $22 for giving her the feedback. If you want comfort in a hotel stay, this is not the resort for you. It is convenient to a lot of the popular San Diego attractions but there are plenty of resorts around the Mission Bay area to choose from. We were glad to leave after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Lost - rather disappointing”
Reviews.Author: DisneyDave23
Reviews.Content: This was our 7th and last destination in our 2007 summer holiday which took in San Francisco (Holiday Inn, Fisherman's Wharf), Yosemite (Yosemite View Lodge), Carmel (Carmel Mission Inn), Santa Maria (Holiday Inn), Beverly Hills (Beverly Hilton), Anaheim (Sheraton Anaheim) and San Diego (Paradise Point). This review is for the Paradise Point Resort and Spa. “Oh, you’re gonna love San Diego” they all told us as we travelled down from San Francisco. Well I’m not sure that we saw the true San Diego (given that we had a 3 night stay and both Sea World and San Diego Zoo to fit in as part of our Southern California Attraction Pass), but overall we were very disappointed. The journey down from Anaheim was hell on wheels. A 4+ hour crawl like nothing we’d seen on the holiday prior to that. We got to the resort late afternoon and at first all appeared fine. The grounds are large and well maintained. I likened it to an upmarket Centre Parcs (for all the Brits reading this) – a series of bungalows with a shared front door which then leads left or right to your room. You park outside your bungalow in a number bay. The rooms were pretty weird. An eclectic mix of aged furniture of all different styles and colours, a drab kitchenette and an odd sliding door directly opposite the beds to the bathroom. There was a patio door to a small patio overlooking a large pond (no, not a pool; a green weedy pond – somewhat of a risk for young kids). Lighting was poor and hot fully functioning and the air con was a beast of a thing in the corner of the room that nearly had the place taking off when it was turned on. Our closest pool was quite small and very shallow: more suited to small kids. There were a couple larger pools on site but not exactly close at hand. The reception building was simply a place to check in and out but the staff were extremely polite and efficient. Eating wasn’t easy. The location, opening hours and offering were not very appealing hence we did our own thing off-site. All in all, the brochure picture looked stunning and this was the second most expensive nightly stay after the Beverly Hilton. What with the journey down to San D and then a nervously early set off to LAX to allow plenty time, we really think we would have preferred 6 more nights in Anaheim (for the same price as our 3 at Paradise Point). If you want to spend loads of cash paying for extra sports activities on site then OK but to be honest, having had such a great holiday, Paradise Point was a big let down – definitely not paradise for us. As for Sea World, well, after Disney I’m afraid it cannot compare. I’ve done Sea World in both Florida and San Diego and I won’t be going back. San Diego Zoo was also disappointing. Some good areas but also quite a lot of very bedraggled enclosures that were really not what I was expecting. The bus tour is useful to get your bearings but overall, the zoo is quite hard to get round and very hilly in places. Food offerings and gift shops at both attractions are poor. Disney 100 San Diego 0

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: anmee2
Reviews.Content: I don't ever write reviews but my experience with this hotel was so incredibly frustrating, that I am going to take a moment and let you all know. From the beginning, the hospitality and courteousness of the hotel was lacking. When we were checking in the front desk clerk, who happened to be the manager, was very rude and a poor reflection of their service. Our rooms were not ready, even though it was past check in time, so we had to wait....and wait.........and wait. We didn't get our room until after 5:30pm! They lied about calling us to tell us our rooms were ready and they had tried to make it seem like it was our fault. Secondly, there was curly hair in the supposedly cleaned bed....GROSS!!! They only had 2 towels in the bathroom, so when we called for new towels they didn't deliver them until 2.5 hours later. The pictures of the hotel do not depict the actual image of the place. It is old, unkept, and their lagoon/pond is full of mildew and debris. Lastly, they charge you $22 a night for parking, which you are forced to do since there are no other places that you can park due to the location of the place. Again I personally will never stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: evelynyoshimi
Reviews.Content: As evidenced by the less than flattering title of my review, Paradise Point is a pretty mediocre hotel with less than great service. We chose Paradise because a friend was having a wedding here. After driving from LA and arriving at about quarter after four, we were told that our room wasn't ready yet and they had no clear idea of when it would be ready--- this happened notwithstanding that the hotel knew we were there for a five thirty wedding on their premises!!! After forty-five minutes were unapologetically given access to our room and therefore ended up being the absolute last guests to show up at the wedding. Overall, the rooms were ok-- but in the morning we discovered both that the hotel had forgotten to put shampoo in our room and that after about fifteen minutes the hot water in the bathroom runs out. Definitely not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty resort, Nice to get away”
Reviews.Author: SBinLA
Reviews.Content: I was pretty nervous staying here after reading all of the reviews. My boyfriend and I booked this place because we wanted to spend a weekend away from LA and it seemed like everything was booked. It was very last minute and we were making reservations the week of. We wanted to stay in a nice hotel that wasn't like a huge chain and felt special. I actually loved the resort. I loved the location because it's easy to drive to other places, but it still feels like a private resort. It didn't even feel like we were in a city. The entrance when you drive in is pretty as well as the lobby. At check in we asked to get an ocean front room, but they were all booked. We went to our room after check in and the room was nice. Small TV, but we weren't planning on really spending much time watching TV. We didn't really have a view except grass where you can walk around, but it was still a nice room. The room looks exactly like it does on the website. My main complaint is that the room had a strange smell and the beds were big, yet a little firm for my taste. Also, we ordered in room service and the food was okay. Not something I'd order again. I go the Ahi Tuna and it wasn't at all what i was expecting. My boyfriend got pizza and that was really good though. The pool's really pretty and heated which I liked. I'm basically giving this place 5 stars basically because the room is spacious and nice. The resort as a whole felt like Hawaii and we felt everyone was there for leisure as opposed to a place like a big hotel where it's a mix of business people and tourists. We wanted something special and a place that felt like a romantic getaway and we got that for the most part. We weren't expecting anything extravagant because we only paid 140 for the night.
