We weren't going for a honeymoon or for a big family vacation (i wouldn't recommend this resort for that), but for a quick getaway to relax...this place is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Vlovesyoga
Reviews.Content: I just spent the last few days at Paradise point with my 2 boys. I absolutely loved it! It was my second stay there but my last stay was in 1999. My first visit was just as wonderful. The room was very comfortable and the service was exceptional. I would recommend it with or without children. They have a very large lagoon with beautiful birds every where. Also, the main pool was very beautiful and clean. If your thinking about visiting don't hesitate. I have traveled a lot and the price is very well worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “4th stay in 8 years”
Reviews.Author: conservative1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at Paradise Resort at least 4 times in the past 8 years. The first was in 1998. We loved it back then because even though it was a bit pricey it was what we were looking for. We stayed in a suite on the bay side and we had no complaints about the room, the room service, the management, or the restaurant service. The best meals we had were in the 5 star restaurant that was, unfortunately, a few years later converted into a banquet hall (What a bunch of idiots!) On our second stay the prices were higher (both food and room) and our only complaint was that the music from the live band at the restaurant was too loud in the evening (I think it was the Barefoot). Our third stay and the prices were higher again. The room service staff were pleasant and for the most part timely. The pool side restaurant had removed the spicy Buffalo wings from the menu (What a bunch of idiots!) and my wife had several minor complaints (can't remember what they were.) Her complaints were not being addressed, so, she asked to speak to the manager (don't remember the ladies name) and would you believe it, the manager refused to come out to the front desk to speak to my wife! Unbelievable! Our 4th stay in May '07 we had a larger suite with a double bathroom. I didn't like the location because it was next to the storm drain. Which is just an ugle eyesore, and what parent wants their kids playing next to an unsanitary storm drain? Incidently, the storm drain beach is the family beach where all the larger families stay because that's where the bigger rooms are. I have several complaints from our last stay. Maid service has definitely gone down hill; on one instance we asked for some sugar packs and ketchup and we got tissue and cotton balls--slight translation problem here? But my biggest complaint is smokers! Try and relax in a beach chair with a magazine and a great view while some idiot is upwind puffing away on a cancer stick! In the Baleen restaurant there were cigar smokers on the outside patio. So, we figured, "well let's just eat inside." What a bad decision! All the smoke was blowing inside the restaurant!! It's too bad the management could care less about this place, because it used to be a real gem and worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TripHHH
Reviews.Content: We won this resort through Priceline for a fantastic price. I was a bit worried upon reading the reviews, but was pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The resort is gorgeous. Our room was spotless and nicely decorated. The furniture is antique, distressed style that is made to look worn and old. It is a style, not a reflection of the room being outdated or old. Beds were very comfortable. Nice spa toiletries provided in the room, as well as cotton balls and q-tips. The food at the dockside restaurant was wonderful. I didn't think it was too pricey, probably moderate...although the drinks (even soft drinks) were very overpriced. $3.50 for a soft drink with dinner. The meal itself was very, very good. It was nice eating outside at night even, as they have outdoor heaters that worked wonderfully. We enjoyed the big birds that wandered around looking for food. Not sure what type of sea bird they were (not seagulls) but they weren't aggressive and we found them rather charming. Really enjoyed the main pool. Beautiful with a waterfall, sand area and beach-style pool entry. I would recommend this resort to others. Walking on the beach at sunset for nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise if......”
Reviews.Author: manandtwoprincesses
Reviews.Content: Just got back from great stay in San Diego I booked within the week cancellation policy so was not able to cancel when read trip advisor visitor's poor reviews. Friends assured me that they had a great time, but they had not visited the property in a few years. Why do hotels have a week cancellation policy? Fortunately, my wife, myself and our 2 year old were only staying one night. We booked a garden room and it was excatly as trip advisor describes...dark, mildew smell, outdated furniture, no screens on door or windows.....nice bathroom with bathtub for 2yo though. When taking a stroll with the 2 yo saw great rooms facing the bay. This is the secret. We upgarded to a bayside suite and watching the boats on the water and the sunlight entering the room made all the difference. Did request a screen which was never brought to us. We will definately be returning to san diego, and will stay here only if bayside room available or possibly if they do major renovation to garden rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hairy tubes”
Reviews.Author: pstgearman
Reviews.Content: After reservation booked our rooms for the wrong month even though we said we be there Easter night. I checked into the room and their were long black hair all over the floor. I looked at the bathtub and saw several black curly hairs on the bathtub walls. I walked up to the front desk and asked the manager to come look at my room. He came to see the hairs and his first question was did you use the facilities? I pointed out that we just checked in and my wife and child are blond and a redhead and since I have military short brown hair this could not be possible. He sent a maid with a spray bottle and a towel to wipe up the hairs. She didn't get them all so me wife and I ended up cleaning the tube. No discount no apology.

Reviews.Title: “Dumpy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mdmcmanus1
Reviews.Content: Dumpy rooms. The grounds were beautiful but the rooms left a lot to be desired. In it's time I'm sure it was a nice place. The rooms smelled like mildew and were basic. For some reason the hotel put a $5,000 hold on my credit card and it has not been resolved a week later. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: twkrssk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. For the price of the place, we would have expected big rooms, but the room we stayed in was small and stuffy. At least the bed was comfy. I felt it was way overpriced for what we got, the Holiday Inn would have been a great comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star!”
Reviews.Author: claire1616
Reviews.Content: This hotel shows as a 4 star on Priceline. I might give it 3 stars but definitely not 4. The rooms are sparsely decorated and in need of updating. The food was surprisingly bad in the casual restaurant - I tried lunch, dinner and room service and was very disappointed with each meal. My friend remarked that it was one star food at 4 star prices.The property itself is quite pretty and is pleasant to walk around but not "luxurious". Front desk staff were courteous and the concierge was very helpful. There is an adult pool which came as a welcome respite since this is a very family oriented resort - especially during march break. My only consolation was that I booked this hotel at a very good price. Could only recommend it if you get a good deal and keep your expectations low.

Reviews.Title: “What is okay? Not with my hard earned money!”
Reviews.Author: les805
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paradise Point Resort the weekend of March 8,9, 2008. We are a couple whose two children's families also stayed. While one couple professed satisfaction with the resort (they stayed in a beachfront suite) we other two famiies felt it worn and much in need of attention. The good: Rooms were clean and ready upon our arrival. Beds were of very good quality and comfortable. The bad: Arrival: We were greeted at the spartan front reception with little or no sense of care after 'valets' ignored guests while they walked into lobby. At no time were we told prior to our arrival that there was a $21 'parking' fee for our car. When we asked if we could park elsewhere the fee was halved for 2 nights. In our room the blinds did not operate properly on one window and could not be opened. The front door outdoor light was out and we had to ask 3 times for it to be replaced. The resort is surrounded and encased by driveways and asphalt. The foliage is overgrown and borders on dangerous in areas where palm trees are in desperate need of branch trimming overhead. Pool drinks were over $10 for specialties on their menu. The area around the pool was dirty and unswept, irritating when guests were naturally barefooted. The dining room was noisy but most disgusting were the seagulls or other seabirds who were lurking ready to swoop down to your tables, even at night. One was under the table right next to our set of tables. Upon checkout two of our son's bills were placed on our bill, causing a delay while they verified our concern. Our overall view is that.....where is management? Tired is an apt phrase for this resort. Would we return........NO

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE MONEY...... SKIP THIS ONE -Better accomodations at 1/4 of the cost”
Reviews.Author: kkgd
Reviews.Content: ROOMS not at all what the pictures show. Broken Toilet that would not flush and leaked constantly. CHARGED extra money for 4 in room and then the sofa sleeper was broken. After bringing it to the attention of the front desk they attempted to add an extra person charge that was already paid for at booking. Service slow and poor at the restaurants. The landscaping and location were the only highlights. WE FELT LIKE COMPLETE SUCKERS when despite bringing our concerns to the attention of management, they did nothing to rectify. We have left 4 messages for the general manager and still no REPLY. This place is arrogant, you will find MUCH Better options at MUCH LOWER prices...... SAVE YOUR MONEY........ SKIP THIS PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Not at all worth the price”
Reviews.Author: goingplaces63
Reviews.Content: We've just come home from our third stay at San Diego Paradise Point and won't be returning there in the future when we head back to San Diego. We booked at Paradise Point again because of our past great holidays there, however, now the hotel is way over priced for what you get. Over the last couple of years they've let the rooms run down. We were supposedly upgraded to a better room when we got there, however the pull-out bed our son slept on was so uncomfortable that we left it as a couch for him to sleep on the last three nights. Our garden view was of a a big tree with the highway directly behind it. This for just about 500.00 a night?? plus parking fees, plus admin tax...the size of the room was small, the amenities they provided were of dollar store quality and one night, we were given one towel to use for all three of us. We had to wait over an hour for bedding for our son the first night and one of the blankets they brought had holes in it. We travel a lot and have stayed places that were half the cost that had much more to offer. The food in the lounge was over priced, especially for the quality. Want to play on the tennis court? Don't expect to be able to rent a racket that isn't crooked. We must say thanks to the great staff at the court who must have known that it was silly to charge us 10.00 for a half an hour to play with lousy rackets-thanks to him for giving us one positive experience and allowing us to play for free. We were very saddened by our experience there as we'd returned because of our great memories. We'll be staying elsewhere next time and would recommend the same as the rest of our trip to San Diego was fantastic. It would have been great to come home to a nicer place at night, but ah well, at least we didn't spend much time there. The grounds are pretty, but for what you get in the rooms, you might want to just stay at a motel 6

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet expectations by a long shot”
Reviews.Author: entmanager
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to make a "romantic getaway", so I booked this hotel. The internet site that I used to book this trip labels the property as a "four-star" resort. We are not picky travelers - we're very easy to please, but this was nothing like described. The first room we checked into had "leftovers" in the toilet, and a great deal of hair on the floor of the bathroom. The tub was dirty, and the non-skid surface of the tub was peeling up. The room smelled strongly of mildew, and the bed was very old and cheap for a supposedly "upscale" resort. To top it all off, the curtains would not fully close over the floor-to-ceiling windows, allowing a foot-and-a-half wide unobstructed view of us in our bed to anyone who cared to walk by. Since the room was filthy, we asked for a different room. Management complied by putting us in a room that was smaller, also smelled strongly of mildew, did not have adequate lighting to fully light the room, and the curtains still left a foot-wide gap through the windows. So, we went back to the front desk again. This time, the management gave us a suite that was, in their words, "one of the best units on the property". Being a one-bedroom suite, it was certainly acceptably roomy. But that's the best thing I can say for it. Even though it was a "luxury suite", the furnishings were still terribly cheap and uncomfortable. Exact same bed as in the two other rooms. Smelled just as strongly of mildew as the two previous rooms. Still unacceptably dirty (there was a a dirty plunger and several wadded-up pages of a newspaper on the stoop in front of our unit), but we just didn't have enough energy to complain anymore. The carpet was a worn, threadbare, indoor-outdoor carpet that was fraying along all the edges and along the seam in the center of the room. To top it all off, there is an additional $22/night charge for parking - which is not even covered, it simply gives you an uncovered (and undersized) parking space on the asphalt in front of the unit. In short, this hotel simply does not meet expectations. The grounds of the resort are OK, but the room quality is two-star at best. I'm not exaggerating - the rooms are along the lines of what I would expect to find if I stayed in a discount hotel along the side of a deserted highway somewhere. Which would be fine, had I paid a two-star discount hotel rate. Which I didn't. The "discounted rate" that I paid for this trip was more than what a legitimate three-star hotel costs at the full price. In fact, In the past I've paid less to stay at legitimate four-star hotels hotels in the San Diego area. Be warned - this property is old, run-down and until they give it a complete renovation there will be many other hotels in the area that can give you a better experience for the money. Room service was extremely rude and surly in the morning on the last day of our stay (in spite of the fact that we had tipped them extremely well the entire time, and did not complain to them even once about their slow service). On a positive note, however, the front desk staff was very professional and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, but it could be better”
Reviews.Author: happychap79
Reviews.Content: I have to admit to being disappointed at the quality of this resort. It has the potential to be wonderful, but its in desperate need of refurbishment and renovation. For example, the main pool area - facilites are limited and the whole area had a 'tired' feel to it. My family thouroughly enjoyed our stay, and the staff were wonderful, however, Iwouldnt recommend this place as good value for money

Reviews.Title: “great but could be better”
Reviews.Author: travelsalotAlbanyNy
Reviews.Content: ok so I dont know what MOST of the fuss is about..great resort the grounds were beautiful even in the rain-rooms very large with queen size beds-plenty of towels etc....I have two complaints the first is the $22/day for parking that everyone complains about! get rid of it raise all rooms $5 and call it a day also if you are going to get $75-100 for breakfast you might want to work on the service-ok most days- last day was a nightmare $4.50 for a small glass of oj, couldnt get a refill on coffee for nothing. You could get snacks and cereal, milk in the gift shop which we did most days. Also its away from the city and the transportation is fair at best you really do need a car. Overall the staff was very helpful, the place was clean what more did you need.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort - over 44 acres”
Reviews.Author: bhershey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, and the grounds are beautiful. I attended a conference with my husband. I wish I had known, in advance, that the resort is very spread out over 44 acres. If you want to go for breakfast, or a drink, you must walk - pretty far - depending on where your room is located. The shower heads are wonderful. The rooms could be updated. The pools are well maintained. The fitness center is small. We did not use the spa, as the prices seemed high in comparison to the rest of the resort. We would stay here again. You definitely need to rent a car, if you stay here to visit the other San Diego sights.

Reviews.Title: “refreshed and relaxed”
Reviews.Author: Newtravels2
Reviews.Content: First, we found this resort through a package with Frontier Airlines and were so glad we did. 3 night stay...and didn't want to leave! The location is perfect, close to everything. The concierge is helpful, rooms are beautiful and food/ service is excellent. One of the best showerheads in all our travels so far...and the bed, linens, etc...amazingly comfortable. Nice sized sitting area and two adirondak chairs on our front porch. Our first night in we were so late that we ended up ordering room service...just a pizza...but wow, what a pizza! Breakfast the next morning, on the waterfront, was also excellent. Their premier restaurant, Baleen, looked gorgeous...also on the water with a beautiful deck. Wish we had more time! The grounds are beautiful and, as the property is 44 acres, there are plenty of areas to walk and explore. Even though the resort was heavily booked, it never felt crowded. Wonderful espresso cart...best mocha ever, right next to the resort market..but only open until 11AM, I believe. Nice bird sanctuary area to relax with your morning coffee...or walk to the beach and enjoy it there. 4 separate pool areas throughout the property. 1 is for 18 and older only, another perfect for children, etc. We did not try the spa, will definitely use it next time. Also beautiful. Only recommendation I would make is to verify the type of room you want. When making our reservation we thought we were getting a room identical to what we saw on line after speaking with reservations, not the case however, we were not dissatisfied..we just didn't have an opportunity to enjoy sitting outside of our room as the front porch area didn't receive any sun. A bit chilly in February without it!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: stef_ray
Reviews.Content: Went here for vacation with my mom, and we had a blast. It was beautiful, there was so much to see and do! Felt just like I was in Hawaii! The room was nice, a little outdated, but still a good place for sleeping. The staff was very helpful, getting us a rental car and advising us on what malls to hit! And the food was amazing! They were very helpful in accomodating my gluten-free diet, and everything tasted so good! Definitely want to go back someday!!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: ncdeb73
Reviews.Content: Went to Paradise Point for a business trip. The grounds are beautiful. Extremely spread out. Our room-nice king bed, with couch and two extra chairs, plus a desk and chair. Also had a wood armoire with TV and mini fridge. I liked the bedspread on the bed. It made me think more of home or a bed and breakfast rather than a generic hotel bedspread. Our fridge did not work. It lacked a temperature knob and wasn't even plugged in. There was coffee left for us, but no coffee pot. I'm sure we could have asked about the fridge and coffee pot, but it really didn't matter to us. You could definitely tell that the place was old. The last night we were there, the armoire door came off one of the hinges. It was a heavy door and I didn't want it falling off the other hinge in the middle of the night. We called the front desk and someone came to take the door off completely. It wasn't something that was a quick fix because the wood of the armoire was worn and old. Again, it wasn't something that concerned us cause we were leaving the next day. We did not have a car, but from what I understand, it costs $17-$25 to park your car. ( I don't know the exact number). The bar/grill at the hotel is WAY overpriced. We didn't want to eat there, but we were starving and didn't have a choice. The gym is located in their spa. The gym cost $10 or $15 but we had a reduced rate. Small gym, but they had what I needed. All of the machines are brand new. Each bike, treadmill and ellitical had it's own tv and they gave you water, headphones and a towel. The changing room was very nice as well. The grounds are very extensive and spread out. If you call the front desk, they will send a golf cart to take you to other places in the resort. You really need a car at this resort as there is no other place closeby to walk to. I don't feel as though the prices they charge for this place are worth it. They were charging $185. Considering that you have to pay to park, are limited on the food choices and that it is old, I think you could do better in the SD area. If you could get in this place for under $150, I think it would be ok. The proximity to Sea World is outstanding and that is one positive point. There are lots of restaurants within close driving distance. One other positive point is that the meeting and banquet facilities at this place are outstanding. The rooms and the restrooms are beautiful. Also, the staff was always very friendly. So, I give the 3 circles because we had some good and some bad with our trip. Stay here if you can find a good rate-otherwise, find somewhere else where they don't charge you for every single thing.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not worth 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: smsteffy
Reviews.Content: I don't really understand why this hotel has 4 stars, but I'll say that the rooms are decent. I've been there twice - the first time, the room was incredibly humid and border line clean. The second time was a little better. The A/C units are old, noisy and inefficient, and the beds not that comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Escape the City, without going too far away”
Reviews.Author: FormerUALEXOinVT
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay in room 133. The pool and jacuzzi were right out our door. The resort is very private and secluded. The place had a tropical feel to it because of lush plantings. The place was so charming we really didn't want to leave the resort for dinner but didn't quite want to dine in the high end Baleen restaurant which looked lovely. We asked the desk for a pizza recommendation which was provided promptly. The pizza establishment did a lot of business with hotel guests and delivered right to the room-great service and fun for a change. We stayed here at a very reasonable priceline "name your price" of $90 for a Saturday night stay.

Reviews.Title: “more Problems in paradise”
Reviews.Author: travelin___man40
Reviews.Content: Stayed here and thought at first it was going to be a good deal! No soap in the room for the first 2 nights! Rooms were not very clean and to top it all off my wife and baby got food poisoning from the bar and grill restaurant and we nearly lost our baby! Ive spent the last 4 nights in the hospital with my child. I Had to do cpr on him to resuccitate him...doctors said that it was problem someone who handled the food the salad which she had and the strawberries that somehow contaminated it! Will pass next time, beware! Todd

Reviews.Title: “Could be Paradise”
Reviews.Author: GORUk
Reviews.Content: Each time we have stayed here has been through Virgin Holidays (you don't pay the outrageous $20 per day car parking!) and we have always enjoyed the stay. The surroundings are lush and relaxing and the staff are friendly. There are, though, certain frustrations: You do have to check that the room type booked is the one you are given, usually it takes 3 tries to get the right room. Expect hefty prices in the restaurants (there are plenty of wonderful places to eat outside the hotel!) and even the coffee cart is expensive. Always check the signs on the beach as the water may well not be safe for paddling. On the last visit we shared our Lanai garden Room with a family of ants (complained about but not rectified). Having said all that, you are on an island so expect your fare share of wildlife. The pools and landscaping are great and the shop is well worth a visit even if only to buy duck food for the kids. This is a great place to stay to get away from the bustle of this wonderful city. Finally, what is it with hotel telephone charges? The local Virgin rep is in Las Vegas.... be seated when you discover the phone charges if you need to speak with them! I like the place and will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Trouble in Paradise (Sort of)”
Reviews.Author: WorldTrvlrGuy
Reviews.Content: I booked same day for a next lower than bay view on Expedia for $111 ! I grew in San Diego and have seen this property change owners more times than...well, you finish it. A lot. I had never been there. I always stay in the Hayatt or the W in the Gaslamp Quarter as I usually am there for conventions these days. About the hotel, the grounds are as georgous as they are difficult to navigate. What is it with the $20 parking fee? The girl at the front desk must have seen the [--] on my face and she went overboard with "you will parking right next to your room" speil. Expedia should mention that PARKING WILL BE 25% OF THE ROOM COST. As for the room. It had obviously recently been refurbished. It was roomy and had a beachy charm. Even at $111+$25 it was well worth it. BTW the hotel could not have 10% occupied. I was the only person in the Barefoot resaurant and the other reviewers are right. Save you money. Way, Way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but...”
Reviews.Author: mauijunkie
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that generally I am not picky about where I stay. We stayed at this "resort" since we were participating in the Mission Bay Triathlon located across the street. The photos on the property website looked great plus it was walking distance to our race. At first glance the property is nice. Then you notice how overgrown everything is. Check in was 3pm. We arrived early gave our information and went to lunch at the Barefoot Bar. This was overpriced, the food marginal and the service slow. We went back to the front desk a little after 3 only to find out our room wasn't ready. We went to meet friends and drop off our gear returning about 4:30 with still no room. We were finally given a key about 5pm but only after my husband kept going to the desk. The room itself was decorated nice but the whole thing was dingy. There was mildew on the base of the armoire and in the bathroom. The patio would have been a nice place to sit if there wasn't a huge spider web with accompanying large spider covering the whole thing. I called for someone to take care of it and 2 days later it was still there. This place could be spectacular if there was more care taken in the property. I wiould only stay there again if the property is remodeled.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location with adequate room for short stay”
Reviews.Author: willowy74
Reviews.Content: won hotel through priceline for $100 a night. fabulous location for sea world. beautiful stunning 'island'. Resort grounds are lovely, although not clearly signposted. Gift shop adequate as is the barefoot bar and grill, although service lousy. Reception and porter staff are great, Ring 0 for a courtesy buggy to collect you from your room, The cove/beach is pretty too. Lovely resort for couples or families. Very quiet and i wouldnt wanna stay there on my own. i agree with a previous review - it is like butlins on a paradise resort. shalet bungalows and little lanes. nice and relaxing... i would recommend it for a week or less

Reviews.Title: “Solid, Good for Our Family and Needs”
Reviews.Author: rubytuesday
Reviews.Content: When my travel agent suggested Paradise Point, I was definitely nervous, what with so many mixed reviews here. But I took a shot, and I am glad. Our family, including several small children, really enjoyed PP. We rolled in at 3:15 on a Saturday and no one was around guest-wise. Based on previous reviews, I was worried about not being able to check in. No problem at all actually, I walked right to the counter, quick CC swipe and got the key. The bell staff came right over and gave me a ride on their golf cart while my family followed behind in the van. Parked at the unit, a suite on a little cove, and the bellman took everything in. Suite was perfect for us, a living room with pullout sofa, nice little kitchenette with refridge/micro/sink and then a separate bedroom. No cracks, smells, etc. They had forgotten our cribs, so a quick call and three minutes later another cart pulls up and a man sets them up for us. The rest of the stay was very. Our kids loved the little cove as they could goof off in the sand and chase birds. The firepit was a huge, especially when we made smores. Staff we encountered were nice, efficient. We did not make much use of the pools or grounds due to weather and off-site activities, but the place really is pretty, reminiscent of resorts in Hawaii with all the flowers and foliage. So I feel relief and good fortune for our stay. About the only thing I can say is that I wish it was a little closer or walking distance to offsite shops/restaurants, we took our car out almost every day. Never more than 15 minutes, but might try the Marina or Coronado some time.

Reviews.Title: “What an exceptional Resort”
Reviews.Author: Marissa51
Reviews.Content: The name of this hotel truly describes it. The staff are exceptionally helpful, every part of the resort is immaculate and the pools are all amazing. Would highly recommend this resort for anyone wanting to have a really relaxing holiday but there is lots to do in San Diego if you want. Can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: jdmrv2420
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Paradise Point for 5 nights in October on our honeymoon. We let the front desk know it was our honeymoon and they upgraded our room to a gorgeous suite overlooking the bay. The staff was courteous and helpful at every turn and helped create the perfect honeymoon for us. We cannot wait to return and are already planning our one year anniversary trip. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: hawkeyelady
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Paradise Point Resort and I have to say I was disappointed. The meeting and conference rooms are very nice and well serviced, but the sleeping rooms leave much to be desired. I found the rooms to be dingy and not very clean. The beds are very uncomfortable and some of the bungalows do not have much room in them. The view was very nice and we had a room right on the water, which was wonderful. We found the service to be good and the concierge was extremely helpful. The drinks at the Barefoot Bar and Grill are a little pricey compared to what we're used to . Expect to pay $7-10 for a bottle of beer...mixed drinks were much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: louisvillemom
Reviews.Content: This resort is WONDERFUL! Four of us booked a trip through Expedia and were a little nervous reading the reviews. I cannot understand any of the negative reviews on here. The only thing we decided is that there are some people that will complain no matter what, they will find something to pick on. Also, there are always people trying for a free room! The grounds are beautiful and the rooms spacious and clean. Everyone that worked here always had a friendly smile and great attitude about helping with anything. The food and drinks were very good, although a little expensive. We went to a nearby store and stocked our refrigerater witch helped alot. The concierge was great with information for the nearby attractions. We all agreed we can't wait to go back and bring more friends along with us - our last couple trips were Cancun and Cruises - we decided this was just as nice without leaving the country.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of paradise in san diego”
Reviews.Author: WelshTraveler
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for eight nights at the end of a busy three week holiday travelling around California with friends. We were a bit apprehensive having read reviews before we went which couldn't have been further from the truth. Although we arrived on their busiest weekend due to the power boat racing in the next bay we found the resort was quiet, beautifully maintained, and a real haven to relax in. The room and ensuite were well proportioned and kept very clean and tidy by a housekeeping staff who dealt with any problems very quickly. The pool we used was very clean with a constant supply of clean towels. Breakfast in the Barefoot grill was reasonably priced, the waiters very attentive and the views over the bay very picturesque. The concierge was most helpful with any queries we had about local attractions and the shop sold a variety of items from foodstuffs, clothes, and souvenirs. The only disappointing part we found was at the Baleen restaurant where the drinks were quite pricey and the service not as good as it should have been. We would certainly return here and would recommend this little bit of paradise to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Paradise”
Reviews.Author: SuperGirl20
Reviews.Content: I was so shocked to read the bad reviews of Paradise Point. We had a terrifc time here. Stayed here in the middle of September and we are already talking about going back. Rooms were fab - bigger than our apartment. The grounds are beauitful if a little dark at night. Room service was excellent we got breakfast one morning and went for a swim after - when we came back it had all been cleared away - we didn't even have to leave it outside the door. I would highly recommend Paradise Point to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay At This Property !!!”
Reviews.Author: APSCAGuy
Reviews.Content: I decided to bring my parents (seniors) to San Diego after a 45 year absence plus to celebrate their 54th anniversary. Instead of booking through the website - I called the hotel directly to reserve two rooms (Bayside Studio & Garden Lanai). From the conversation with the booking agent, it appeared she was knowledgable about the property in detail. And when price was discussed, she bargained the rates with me (to my benefit). Entering the property, you find it lush and large. There was no valet or bellperson at the lobby entrance after waiting 15 minutes. I asked for an early 2pm check-in when the reservation was made. We arrived at 4:10pm and the rooms were not ready. (They were finally ready at 4:45pm.) BTW: Check-In time is published as 4pm. When we got into the rooms, the Garden Lanai room had filthy sheets, hardly any towels, a broken shower head and smelled of mildew. The Bayside Studio had a damaged amoire, a tattered bedspread and a sliding glass door that would no lock properly. The whole property is in BAD shape - it needs a comprehensive makeover - especially given its price point. The only attribute is its location. I am a world traveler plus work in the hospitality arena. This is one property I will never stay at again and ensure everyone I know traveling to San Diego to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, terrible "resort"”
Reviews.Author: millsisforlovers
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point is far from paradise. Upon arrival, we were taken to our room at what seemed like the farthest end of the hotel, adjacent to a main road (rooms 550-560). As we walked in the door, the rubber door lining came off the doorjamb, thus making it impossible to fully seal the door. Once inside, the room itself was freezing! It was about 63 degrees inside the room, and it was in the 70s outside. We turned the AC off and soon realized why it had been turned down so low. The room reeked of mildew. We noticed that the refrigerator was leaking and making a strange high-pitched squealing noise, so we shut it off and cleaned up the pool of water underneath it. As we were taking the top bedspread/quilt off the bed, we saw two large cigarette burn holes on it (in a non-smoking hotel). We immediately called housekeeping to get it replaced. The woman on the phone sounded exasperated, as if this kind of thing happens all the time. The staff didn't come to replace the quilt for at least an hour. Later that night, we ordered room service for dinner. The staff member who delivered the meal told us to leave the tray outside when we finished and he would be back to pick it up later. The next morning as we left for breakfast, we almost tripped over the tray and dirty dishes that were still sitting outside the door. Everything had been picked over by all sorts of animals, judging by the tracks made on the dishes, and there was trash scattered everywhere. We called room service to come pick it up. It had still not been cleared when we got back an hour later. Last, but certainly not least, there was a huge black stain in the closet. At first, we thought it was spilled coffee, until my mom placed her dirty clothes on the floor of the closet. About an hour later, her jeans were soaked. It turns out the stain in the closet was actually mildew (that explains the awful smell) from the standing water all over the floor. We complained and they offered to give us a new room and clean my mom's wet clothes free of charge. The front desk staff were very reluctant to comp us a night, even when we explained that the mildew smell had given us both sinus headaches. They kept telling us how "embarrassed" they were, a line that sounded incredibly rehearsed. We were not offered a free night until we spoke with the manager. Bottom line: if you expect quality when spending over $200 a night, do not stay in this so-called "resort."

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel for couples!”
Reviews.Author: Izzy-Poole
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for our honeymoon after staying at the amazing Hotel in The Mandalay Bay Las Vegas. We were unbelievably disappointed when we arrived & were shown to one of the 'unrenovated' rooms with old marked furniture & a stained carpet. We booked through Virgin holidays & were led to believe that this hotel was a tropical paradise - not the case at all especially if you go there without children! The food was mediocre & surely not even acceptable if you have three screaming children running riot around the outside areas. We switched rooms 3 times & finally got a bayside room which was a significant improvement but I would still not recommend this hotel under any circumstances & would suggest that you book somewhere else should you wish to have a romantic holiday!

Reviews.Title: “The most relaxing experience....”
Reviews.Author: gina5kelly
Reviews.Content: This was a gift to me from some friends and I must say it was the best trip I ever did take. It was a place for me to get away and just relax. It was very comfortable and well deserved.....I'm planning on taking my kids next time.

Reviews.Title: “Sullies the star rating system”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn711
Reviews.Content: This experience has succeeded in scaring me off Priceline for a long time. Dank smells, Many screaming children,everywhere.,HUGE charges to use Business, fitness centers and nearly everything else and my priceline "Bargain" was only 10% off Published Rates. Oh, how i wish that they had only a pale little star instead of the overrated 4!

Reviews.Title: “MIxed Feelings !”
Reviews.Author: eghamcb
Reviews.Content: As this resort is considered to be a five star, I went expecting the best ! With the dollar at a high against the pound, booking direct made this affordable. But once there - $20 daily for parking, $15 daily gym, Water sports hire $40-80 1/2 hr, Crazy golf $11. All resturants very expensive, in fact everything was extra and at a cost!. 5 Pools - yes but very few seats around the 4 smaller ones and the Main pool was for children to play and you felt like you were sitting in a cinema in rows at least 3 deep! No shade! On the plus side, lovely gardens and settings and ballrooms , although these are only used for outside functions not guests. There is very little to keep you there in the evening. Rooms OK, lots of towels and extras. BUT, a very small old fridge situated high next to the TV comes on constantly all through the night! They do have a lovely beach, but do not provide any chairs or encourage you to use it. The staff are all very freindly and helpful but if only they read these reviews!

Reviews.Title: “the most horrible hotel I stayed classified as "4 star" in my life”
Reviews.Author: yellowpeace
Reviews.Content: I am a resort landscape designer, and frequently traveling and staying in several hotels. this hotel has good protential to be the world class 5 stars hotel if they put some $$ to clean it up. It is the most horrible, scary, and unbearable stays I have ever had in my life. Thank their staff and priceline helped to refund the second day. I can't even stay one more minute after wake up at 5am. Stink, ugly and dirty. spider everywhere.....unreliable...photos on their website are big LIES!!! At the end, to give some credits of refund, I strongly suggest their managing company Nobel House to pay some money update interior. It wastes the beauty of outdoor environment. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: L.A.Curlygirl
Reviews.Content: We took the kids ages 2 and 7 for 3 nights. We booked a bayside suite which was right on the beach with a lovely view. the hotel has fun activities for families~ mini golf, bikes, ping pong, pools. Room service is pretty sad though. The food was mediocre. The grounds coulld be kept up a little better. We checked in at 4pm and rooms were not ready when we got there. There were many families with wild kids (mine included) running loose in the lobby while we waited for rooms to be released. If check in is at 4, the rooms should be ready. We don't plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good in some ways, but not for us.”
Reviews.Author: philbot46
Reviews.Content: All right. In all fairness to other negative reveiws - I liked the grounds. I thought they were expansive, tropical and fantastic for kids. The golf, the pools, the location - great! It felt safe and family friendly. Our problem is this - We decided to splurge and stay in one of those VERY overpriced suites. We walked in and the room was huge and looked great (I had No issues with the cleanliness/shabbiness). However - our room was only separated from another room by a Partition that did not touch the floor! About 24 feet worth! I could have played footsies with the neighbors next door (across the entire expanse of the room) and peek into their room. The partition has barely any threshold attached and was 2 inches or so off ot the ground! The noise - you can imagine. There was no wall separating us from the other tenants! You could hear everything. We were very disappointed - (management was unhelpful for the most part because they were busy and because we booked through expedia )- and felt like we were paying a fortune to stay at summer camp instead of a suite. This issue might not bother everyone - but I never would have booked here if I had read a review like this (some privacy is a factor for me) and so I am posting this in an effort to assist people just like us.

Reviews.Title: “Expect 3 star at most”
Reviews.Author: Scotswaehae
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 - 2 adults and 2 kids (14 and 10) who stayed for 2 nights. The rooms are a good size and the fridges are useful and the location for Sea World is good. However that is all the positives that I can think of. This hotel is basic - the furniture in the rooms look really tatty. The pools looked dirty and did not look safe enough to be in. We had 2 interconnecting rooms with views of our car parked in front. As we like to be beside the sea, we were disappointed by the lagoon and views as it was not what we thought Mission Bay would be like. The kids liked the beach. You need to remember a torch to walk to the restaurant. We ate at the hotel once -near the lagoon - not great. We managed to avoid spending time at the hotel by visting Sea World one day and going to Coronado Island the next day . This hotel does not merit the 4 star rating given by our travel agent and I would not return here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl46
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort from August 3rd-5th, which we had won through a contest. The grounds are absolutely beautiful and very tropical. It is quite a bit to get around within the resort but nothing horrible. We did enjoy walking and there is a great climate there. The staff was pleasant. We had a lagoon bungalow which was very nice and clean and very nicely furnished. Some of them did need some work on the outside. One problem that we did have is that half of the window was not covered by a blind or heavy curtain, only a very sheer curtain, which let in very bright sunlight early in the morning and made it very hard to sleep in if you wanted to. At night you had to be careful where you stood at the bathroom sink area because you could see right in. We wound up putting our comforter over the sheer curtain that was there to help get some privacy and block out the sunlight. The "lagoon view" that we had was filled with pond scum, which could easily be remedied with a pool skimmer. The ponds above the one that ran into ours were very clean, we were at the bottom. The pool area is beautiful but if you are trying to spend a weekend without the kids, the larger pool area, which has the bar area, was filled with children. If you want to have a drink, the adult pool does not have a bar area at all. We did have to contact the front desk 3 times to request a bellman because he didn't show up when we were leaving. When we finally decided that we would walk our luggage to the lobby building, he came as we were walking out our door. The Barefoot Bar and Grill has an excellent breakfast but I didn't care for their dinner. Very pre-packaged and not worth the money. Do prepare to spend $$ if you are staying there. Drinks and boat/jet-ski rentals are very expensive. I would highly recommend renting a car to get around but from what I have heard they charge $20.00 a day to park there. We rented from Enterprise, which works with the concierge. You do get a discount if you tell them you are staying there. Nice gift shop but very pricey. I've stayed in some nice hotels and resorts and overall for a free weekend it was good. I'm not sure that I would spend the money that they want to stay there though.

Reviews.Title: “rats, mold, murky pond and i paid what???”
Reviews.Author: lkg1123
Reviews.Content: This is our 5th year going to Paradise Point and each year it has gotten steadily worse and I have paid steadily more! Wake up - I'm not going back. Between the rude service, the late check in, the unkempt grounds, the duck/bird poop, the trash in the fish lagoon, the urine smelling hostess stand at the Barefoot Bar (which by way you can't go barefoot to), the rat licking up a spilled smoothie near the main pool, the dirty pools, the flaky concierge, etc.etc.etc. I know this sounds made up but I am actually leaving stuff out. We had such a bad stay last year I complained and got three free nights this year. We went back and confirmed what we had though, the hotel has completely gone downhill. This is such a heartbreaker becasue we love the property but it needs a huge upgrade to charge the prices they are charging ($895 for bungalow!!). Oh did I mention that the AC didn't work consistently, the toilet was plugged, the sink in the kitchennett smelled like it hadn't been cleaned since who knows when. Yikes!

Reviews.Title: “Murky Ponds to Dead Duck”
Reviews.Author: EventsColorado
Reviews.Content: I found this property on the internet. I fell in love with the bungalow style island paradise resort. After waiting in a long line to check in and then waiting a long time for a bellman to take us to our room we find we overlook a very green, slimy and murky stagnant pond. The grounds are large and in another pond was a partial dead duck floating about. I reported it to the front desk and days went by and there was that duck. Our room furniture was tattered. Paying over $300 per day and then they add in parking fees! Is that not something that should be disclosed at booking? Long waits at the restaurant. The pool by our room was NOT heated and was murky also. I could go on an on. Bottom line - San Diego has many beautiful properties I only wish we had booked at one of them. Stay clear of "paradise."

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort but in need of updating.”
Reviews.Author: CarolineUK
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 7 night stay at this resort and whilst we enjoyed our time in San Diego felt the resort is in need of a facelift! Undoubtedly the grounds are lovely and well cared for but the main swimming pool was very disappointing.It looked grubby as sand gets dragged into it and the pool side bar food was awful. However we used one of the smaller pools near our bungalow and this was much nicer and quieter. We were told this was a 4 star resort but the bungalows are very basic and tatty and in need of some serious updating, but they were clean and the bathroom was o.k. The car parking charge is crazy but when we complained that someone kept parking their car in our designated space we got a 20 dollar refund. Also to to Charge 10 dollars for the miniature golf is ridiculous! Surely this should be included free of charge, as there is precious little other entertainment on the site particularly in the evenings. Concierge was excellent and helped us a lot. Finally, the huge lagoon in the centre of the resort is wasted, it should be made into a swimming pool worthy of a 4 Star?? resort. Really enjoyed San Diego though, lovely area and would recommend the IHOP breakfast just a mile away. .

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable accomodations, if you get a deal”
Reviews.Author: 3littlebears
Reviews.Content: Booked via Priceline and ended up here. I would concur with other posts, which indicated that this place is ok, if you get a deal...well below rack rate. The rooms were pleasant, but I would have been seriously disappointed had I booked at full price and expected a luxury resort/spa experience. Our room/bungalow had been updated, but still felt dated. Carpets were stained and overall room did not feel particularly clean. I would only stay here again, if I got a serious deal. $20 parking fee is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time, where did you go?!”
Reviews.Author: iwanttogoonholiday
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in 2004 and really enjoyed it so when booking our holiday for this year we thought we'd come back (we also spent a week up in Anaheim). After reading some of the reviews on here we were a bit worried that we had made a mistake, but we've stayed at places which have received mixed reviews before and always enjoyed ourselves. I am so glad that we went back as we had a great time. Reading some of the negative reviews I wonder whether we stayed at the same place! We are a family of four (mum, dad and 2 'kids' in our 20's) and so we had 2 rooms. We were pleased to discover that our rooms were within the same bungalow so we shared the same front door which opened into a small passageway and then our rooms were on either side. We had lovely views of one of the lagoons and we were right next door to the waterfall pool. The rooms were plenty big enough, with a king sized bed and a sofa in mum and dad's room and two queen sized beds and a smaller sofa in our room. We had mini fridges in both of our rooms which we always kept well stocked with food and drink - a trip or 2 to the nearby Vons saved loads on buying breakfast and lunch everyday. Our room also had a small sink area (aside from the bathroom) and a microwave - which was handy for popcorn on the beach in the evening! We liked the way the sink was separate from the main bathroom, allowing 2 people to get ready at once, rather than one taking up the whole bathroom! Speaking of the bathroom, we LOVE the complimentary toiletries provided, they smell great!! A few negative points were that the plumbing was quite noisy - we could hear when the other room was using the shower, and if both rooms had the shower running at the same time you lost water pressure. A couple of times we found that the maids had forgotten to replenish one of the toiletry items, if we wanted to we could have phoned to have them replaced, but we didn't bother. Yes, the carpets had probably seen better days, but given the type of resort you spend a lot of time barefoot or in flipflops and you don't take your shoes off before you come in the room so what do you expect? It certainly wasn't so bad that you didn't want to stand on it, they just weren't as clean as our carpets at home! I'm not going to complain about the cost of parking (mainly because it was included in our package from Virgin holidays!) but anyway, we are used to paying at hotels. Yes, it's an annoying added expense, but at least you get a dedicated space right by your room. What is really annoying is when people park in your space! As we had 2 rooms, we technically had 2 parking spaces next to each other, but one night we came back and found someone had parked their huge SUV not only in one of our spaces, but blocking both of our spaces! Please park where you're supposed to! We found the concierge to be very helpful, and even let us use his phone to call home when we mentioned that whilst using one of the phones in the lobby, the person the other end couldn't hear, and was there another phone to use. The grounds are beautiful and we always saw people tending to the plants around the resort. We didn't find the pool dirty like some have said - yes, there was the odd leaf etc, floating around, but surely that's to be expected with the amount of surrounding foliage? All in all, we had a great time and were sad to leave. We'd definitely like to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMH1416
Reviews.Content: We lucked out and "San Diego Concierge" (in the San Diego yellow pages) found us a room here for $139 a night. It was a great hotel and the pools were really nice, but I felt things were way overpriced here. The restaurants were out of our budget and the market charged $6 for a 6 pack of Diet Coke. We drove down the road and there is a KFC and a Wendy's and a grocery store where we bought breakfast items. For what we paid, I feel this was a reasonable price. But when I heard the normal rate was $400 a night, I was in shock. Do not pay that much to stay here!!! We had a lot of fun here, but I just recommend to anyone staying here to not agree to pay the high rate. The staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Do you know there's a skunk here?”
Reviews.Author: vincekelly
Reviews.Content: There's a $250 fine if you smoke inside the rooms. We'll say that's fair enough so I was sittin outside my room smokin a cigarette and when I turn to my left, what do I see? A damn skunk! I don't know if I saw the same one twice or two different ones but it scared the sh*t out of me. The next morning, I saw a opossum that looked straight at me and then kept goin on his way. There's considerable walking at this hotel so upon checkout, I called for a bellhop to come get me and my luggage...he took (and I was lookin at my watch) 45 mins. to get to my room, even though I was calling (almost harassing) the front desk to send him. Save your money, $300 will get you a much better place.

Reviews.Title: “not ready for prime time”
Reviews.Author: Mikey42
Reviews.Content: Insufficient housekeeping staff to have overpriced rooms ready for the 4pm check in. As a front desk employee put it "check in just "starts" at 4 pm (long line)..that doesn't mean the rooms are ready. There were several crowded pool facilities, but since we had no room card key, we had to just wait around until almost five o'clock. A food credit was offered to make up for the inconvenience, but it was "accidentally" charged to our room instead of credited (check the bill carefully!) Ice bucket was missing from room, but it didn't matter, because ice machines were too hard to find and soda machines empty. Room had "adjoining" door in bad repair & peeling paint and grody grout did not effect a real "resort" atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, service very hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: waltons39
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 5 nights and had a lovely garden room, quite near the ocean and pools, in orchid area.. we had a great stay and would recommend the hotel, but the service was frustrating at times, in that it could be excellent but it could also be realoly awful. This applied to the barefoot grill and the room and pool service. The Balleen restaurant and the concierge were excellent. DO complain, ask for a manager, they listen and respond. Its the only way to get an improvement, by the time you write on here, its too late. The watersports facility is good but its not really a bathing beach, more a relax and look at the ocean type of beach. The reviews on here about the layout and orienteering are harsh, it is well signposted and well lt, you dont really need to get in to your 4x4 truck to go to the coffee cart, there are paths!!

Reviews.Title: “nice staff, dirty rooms.”
Reviews.Author: neeens
Reviews.Content: The landscape is beautiful but since the bungalows look the same, it's hard to navigate during evening hours.You may get lost so don't hesitate to ask the great workers driving around all day and night for directions or even a ride. The staff/conceirge are nice but terribly slow!!! At one point, I was ready to jump behind the desk and check myself out. The rooms were poorly cleaned; the bathrooms were really dirty, carpet felt dirty, and the sheets did not feel clean or soft. This was true for all 3 rooms my friends and I rented out. To be perfectly honest, the only great amenity offered was the friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Should be called Paradox Resort”
Reviews.Author: SkaryKitty
Reviews.Content: All I can say is avoid this hotel unless you booked through Priceline and you are stuck with it as we were. Only good thing I can say about this place is the price we paid which was about the same as a motel nearby. The rooms are small for a "resort". We saw ceiling light fixtures falling off, light switches not working, paint peeling, etc. The front door into the room was blocked by a chair which obviously didn't belong in its place - I moved it to another place which made more sense (me being an interior designer). Is the pool salt water or is it just dirty (if you know what I mean)? One last thing, the hotel reception told us that we could walk to Sea World which is about a mile away. We decided to drive and realize that the walk is along a busy highway with a very narrow sidewalk. This is totally unsafe especially if you have kids or at night returning from the park. Do yourself a favor and stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Family Only”
Reviews.Author: Gigz
Reviews.Content: A simple message to any young couples who are recomended this hotel as place to stay by a tour company. Dont go. This is a strictly family orientated hotel more like a Butlins to any UK/Irish readers. The only bar in the place is the barefoot grill which closes at 22:30 and is still full of children until this time. The hotel is located close to sea world but not to the city for shopping going out etc. Tip Garnet is 10/15 mins in a taxi away and has some lively bars. The grounds and the pool were beautiful and the adults only pool gives you a reprieve from the screaming children. All in all, nice for a family holiday look elsewhere for anything else

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed and still owed a refund 2 months later”
Reviews.Author: Jayne-NYC
Reviews.Content: We saw Paradise Point in a brochure and researched it on the web. All the glossy images do not live up to the reality. This is a 1960's looking complex with basic concrete bugalows for rooms. Essentially it's a tropical Centre Parks. Our room was adjoined to another and we could hear everything through the door due to the large gaps around it. Rooms were big but very dated and in need of repair. You also have to pay for everything, including parking and the gym. I have stayed numerous hotels and none, absolutely none, charge to use the gym! The beach was awful and manmade. You can see what look likes oil lines on the sand from the pollution in the water. There is also construction of a swimming pool taking place, nice and noisy during our stay and they couldn't move us. We rented a car to get away from the noise, which the hotel suggested and said they would refund us for. 2 months later, and countless phonecalls, we have not received the refund. This is extremely poor service and unacceptable. As a final note, do not visit San Diego in May (May Grey) or June (June gloom). Its cold and miserable. Something all the locals know but none of the visitors!

Reviews.Title: “Wishing For Sea Breezes”
Reviews.Author: 1Kendall
Reviews.Content: Plus: A great location and very close to Sea World A large property with a delightful swimming pool Great fish and chips Minus: The windows don't open, so none of the marvelous fresh ocean air is available The property is large and you park your own car, but they charged $20 for that luxury. An additional fee for internet access

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: loveinsandiego
Reviews.Content: My eight year old son and I stayed at the Paradise Point at the beginning of June. What can we say other than it was beautiful. The views from the bay were breathtaking. The way the bungalows were set up I felt that it was very private and only a few steps away from the bay. Pools were very nice considering that it never really gets hot over there they were heated so that you could still enjoy a swim when you weren't on the go. The grounds were well kept with the feel of peacefulness and relaxation after a long day at a theme parks. The rooms were kept very clean, the staff was very helpful and polite. In fact we are planning our trip for next year. Excellent place to stay for families, located very close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Well under par”
Reviews.Author: vacationer71
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point dramatically oversells and overprices itself. Our bungalow had many things outdated, missing or out of order and management had a casual attitude towards remedying those deficiencies. The restaurants are mediocre in cuisine and service. The roads are laid out in a thoroughly serpentine and perplexing fashion -- and with essentially no street lights, you are certain to get lost when coming home at night. On the plus side, the spa service was nice, the views and beach access are nice if you are in a beachside bungalow and much of the property is beautiful. The beach is not exactly a bathing beach, though, and non-Californians need to be aware that there is no such thing as a private beach in California -- non-guests can and do have access to the beach right up to six feet from your doorstep. With renovations, some added housekeeping and engineering staff, and a new team in at the restaurants, this could be a champion place which earns its rates.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: ThePoolGirl
Reviews.Content: I thought the grounds and pools were lovely. The casual restaurant had dull food but had a very pretty view. We stayed in a "garden studio suite" which actually from the couch offered a view of Mission Bay. The decor was pleasant. The size of the room was very nice. I booked early to get a good rate, but right before I stayed there the room rates were dropped on many travel search engines. The deal was not offered to me because Paradise Point takes a deposit on the room well in advance of your arrival and no refunds 7 days before arrival. But, Dear Annette, don't dump rates on Expedia and Travelocity and not offer those same rates to savvy frequent travellors. We feel screwed over even when you offer an upgrade because its not a real upgrade. We are only getting what we paid for and nothing more. You dumped the regular room rates and offered me the "discounted" rate for a better room but I'd have rather had the room I booked at the dumped rate with the two beds instead of the king + sleeper sofa. I cannot recommend a hotel that baits and switches. And travellors, please do not book early or in advance for this hotel as they offer such wonderful discounts for last minute travel.

Reviews.Title: “avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: wcl_2000
Reviews.Content: I came here for a conference. average decor in the room. silverware was dirty almost every time. didn't seem like they care about the cleaniness at all. The glasses had black stuff stuck on it. and half of the glasses smell like bad breath. so I am very unsatisfied with how they clean. toilet was leaking. after flushing the water drips out. yuck. and worst of all, I could never reach front desk. the phone just rang and rang. so they are always understaffed. if it weren't for the conference, i would never come.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. for Families, A Bit Musty for Price”
Reviews.Author: WestCoast11
Reviews.Content: We wanted a luxerious, one week vacation for my husband and I, my son 4, and our exchange student 16 for the end of February 2007. Weather was cold but sunny. Booked largest bungalow on beach, had two separate areas, one bedroom with separate vanity and closet, and Student slept on comfortable pull out and his own vanity and closet space. Toilet and bath was shared between the two rooms. Space is larger than it looks on the website. Kitchen unit had nothing. We bought plastic bowls, dish soap and sponge, cereal, milk, snacks, and ate breakfast in the room each morning. Maid and front desk staff were excellent. However, the bungalows were old, toilets back up occasionally (water only not sewage) causing water damage to be dried out and leaving musty smell. Decore nice, modern, and comfortable but the unit just smelled and felt a bit old, musty and damp (my husband didn't think it was noticable). I guess I prefer newer construction. But what can you expect from an updated resort right on the water? Water view, beach front, and gardens were spectacular. Great central location. Casual dining on site and for room service o.k. Student thought hamburger awesome. TV channels very limited, no plug in for playstation 2. Pools seem nice. The heated one was too cold but we spent some time in the whirlpool with everyone else. Good resort for families with older kids (7-16 probably ideal), adults on their own or sharing with other couples. Less expensive room options around the site as good as the beach option. Rent a minivan. Driving is easy to all attractions. Ask the resort for a reduced parking rate for longer stays. They are very helpful and keen to ensure you enjoy your stay. Meal Tips: authentic, inexpensive mexican food at Valentinos in Mission Bay; and, fresh Italian take out back to your room at Cafe Bella, Garnet Ave Mission Bay. See all Sea World shows and consider two day pass with backstage tour. Well worth it. Loved Legoland. Both Sea World and Legoland have huge, excellent play areas for young kids. You could spend several hours at these locations with toddlers and preschoolers so bring something to read. Carlsbad shopping outlet is great and close to Legoland. The mall has a Diner that has the best milkshakes! Las Americas is even better shopping south of San Diego (quick drive). Coronado bridge and beach great. Zoo fun (avoid the petting zoo, disappointing compared to local farms). We did not go to the wild animal park. Old Town is very quiet and nice. Great mexican food everywhere. Our four year old could not follow the walking tour (too boring) but my husband and our student thought it was great. The shops have interesting art and pottery, and unique imports. We will return to San Diego when the weather is warmer. Lots still to see and do in the years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for kids! Great place to relax!”
Reviews.Author: OCMommyof2
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paradise Point many, many times and my family and I enjoy it every time. The rooms are definately not luxurious, but they are beachy and comfortable. We have only stayed in the bungalows on the bay front, so we do not know what it is like anywhere else. The unit that we get has very large windows facing the bay with beautiful views. There is a sliding glass door that leads to the bay. Outside the slider you have your patio with chairs and small table, then grass, then the sand on the beach, then the bay. Inside we have a kitchenette with a small fridge, sink, microwave, storage and counter space. I can not tell you how wonderful it is sitting on those patio chairs watching my 2 year old and 5 year old playing in the sand together with sail boats and rowing teams passing by in the bay. I find that view so calming and relaxing... that is why I love it there so much. The inside of the room has a king bed for my husband and I and a sleeper sofa for the kids. The property grounds make you feel as if you are in Hawaii... very lush. My husband and I enjoy their fine dining restaurant , Baleen, because we can bring our kids there without worrying about it. They have many other activities there like a minature putting green, swimming pool, boat rentals, etc. I can not believe this place is rated so low. I love it there. Yes, the furniture in the rooms are a little banged up, but I'll take that any day to get that relaxing bayfront view. The property is also situated on its own private island, so you are away from all the riff raff of Mission and Pacific Beach. There are no homeless or seedy people drinking alcohol & hanging around a public restroom next door like there is at Tripadvisors #1 rated Pacific Terrace Hotel. The rooms are not luxurious like the Pacific Terrace, but to me, nothing beats opening that sliding glass door to the bay, putting my feet in the sand and enjoying the sunsets and the beautiful relaxing views. It is very calming and that is what you need with two young kids. We always go off season so we feel like we own the beach as it is very quiet and not a whole lot of people around. At night, we build a fire in one of the fire pits that are situated on the beach in front of the units and roast marshmallows for Smores. The kids love it. My husband and I love it. Smores and wine go well together. Go figure. If you do not want to be around riff raff, then stay here, but if you want luxury, then stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful gardens, musty, moldy room”
Reviews.Author: DonnaSunValley
Reviews.Content: We booked a garden lanai room at Paradise Point off their website. It was supposed to be $250 "total" per the website. The first thing the woman at reception noted to me was an additional $20 fee for parking. Apparently "total" does not mean all charges. When we opened the door to the entry way of our room we were blasted with the musty odor of mold. I'm allergic to mold. Thus, I didn't really enjoy being in our room at all. My nose ran the entire time. I got up at 6:00 a.m. and went outside to read to get away from the mold. The $8 million upgrade apparently didn't make it to our room as one of the chairs looked as though someone's cat had sharpened their claws on it . Other pieces were really banged up. The thin, poorly insulated walls brought us a little closer to the family with small children and a baby next door than we might have wished. How many times can small children open and close a hotel room door while their neighbors are trying to take a little afternoon nap? We lost count but we were awake and trying. The woman at check in put us in a room on a lagoon. She told me that she loves those rooms. The lagoon was an algae filled mud hole surrounded by bare dirt. The algae was huge and biologically fascinating but less than aesthetically pleasing. I would happily go back to Paradise Point, walk around the truly beautiful grounds, other than the lagoons area, maybe have a tropical drink in the bar, and then drive away to a fresh, clean room somewhere else in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “It almost is paradise.”
Reviews.Author: ukscots
Reviews.Content: The basics: Paradise Point is a hotel where the rooms are in small single level buildings througout its 40-acres. The grounds are nice, with ducks and other water fowl in the numerous ponds. Onsite are restaurants, five pools, tennis, croquet, minigolf, bike and water vehicle rentals. Appearance: The grounds look nice, though the room I was in could use some minor work (small cracks in the walls and signs of mildew on front door curtain). Comfort: I was unable to get a good nights sleep, primarily due to the very hard bed. Other than that, I had no complaints. Food: The restaurants are expensive, but the food is good. Room service is available. If you venture one mile north or south, there are many eateries to choose from. Ammenities: The main pool is nice and heated! I cannot comment on the the others (waterfall pool, adult pool, child pool and one that was under construction). The rental fees for the water vehicles (pedal water trikes, wave runners, power boats) are on the high side --- wave runners were $95/hr and a small power boat was $80/hr. Other comments: The room I was in had quite a few small black moths in it, which were OK, they minded their own business. The TV received very few channels clearly. On "movie night" at the pool, the hotel was showing whatever was playing on ABC Family. During our stay, there was a child menacing a duck that was swimming in the main pool (ducks are often in the pool) to the point that the duck was extending its wings in fear. The pool staff saw nothing wrong with this, though the front desk seemed a little upset.

Reviews.Title: “I had a good experience at this resort.”
Reviews.Author: doggydogface
Reviews.Content: On a recomendation from a friend,I made a last minute reservation for two rooms here during easter vacation. I was a little nervous since I had read some negative reviews on this website. I called up the hotel's reservation line and got a rate of $169.00 each for two non-bayview rooms (the bay view rooms were sold out). Our rooms were clean and comfortable. One was bigger,and had a walk in closet. My mother took the smaller room and my wife and daughter and I took the bigger one. The bed was reasonably comfortable, but the pull out bed that my daughter slept on was not due to a very thin matress. I would recomend getting a room with two queens if you needed to sleep more than two people. The big room had a little private porch that I enjoyed sitting in in the afternoon. Our rooms were in the Orchid village part of the resort and the girl at the front desk said that it was quiet area away from the main pool, and it was. We enjoyed our rooms and I can only sumise that there must be some good rooms and some bad rooms at this resort The Baleen restaurant was expensive, but the food was excellent. Room service food was good, but pricy. At many of the self contained resorts in Southern Ca (Hotel del Coronando and Ritz Carlton Laguna Niguel come to mind) you are going to spend a fortune if you buy all your meals there. We brought food and wine with us (there are refridgerators in the rooms. Also,bring your own putters to play the resort putting course. They charge $9.00 a putter. I did not find trash on the beach as was mentioned in the previous review and enjoyed walking on the beach (which by the way is on a bay; no waves). I found this resort to be a peaceful place to retreat to after spending a day exploring San Diego and I would return here.

Reviews.Title: “E.G., Worst Hotel Experience of my Life!”
Reviews.Author: Glamour_Girl247
Reviews.Content: When we first drove up to the hotel the grounds were beautiful. But then when we walked to the front desk the staff was very rude and gave us hardly any help at all. After we checked in we drove to our room. With no help from the staff we drug our luggage in. My first impression was the old dirty carpet and mud outside the door. The bathrooms were not much better than a gas station. The kitchen had moths on the light bulb. We got there late so the first thing we did was go to bed. In my daughters bed there was no pillow so i called the maid service and 2 hours later we got the pillow. So much for sleeping because our neighbors kept us up all night partying. We called the front desk and they didn't answer. The next day we hoped it would be a better day. Me and my kids decided to go the pool. Well, the pool was crowded and you could hardly get around. The first time I noticed a child pee in the pool I grabbed my kids and we left the pool. I have to say the only good thing I have to say about Paradise point is the food at the restaurant Baleen. We checked out three days early and headed to the Westgate Hotel, San Diego, where we had a very wonderful experience. Stay Away!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Find someplace else”
Reviews.Author: Dallyn
Reviews.Content: We booked our room in November. Our confirmation stated that we had a one bedroom overlook. When we got to our room, we found that we “overlooked” a hedge and the 6 lane road it partially obscured. I called the front desk and was informed that “overlook” just meant you could see some of the grounds. The frame of the sofa bed in our room was broken, making the bed nonfunctional. As I lay on the floor with one of my kids trying to sleep, the excessive road noise made me envision that I was in some cheap roadside motel rather than a Noble House Resort. It took two trips to the front desk, a phone call and two trips by maintenance personnel to remedy the situation. We were initially promised a new room so we packed our belongings. Then we were told a replacement sofa had been found. Finally we were told they would just have someone repair it. The first repair attempt failed, prompting a second, successful attempt later in the day. On April 1 we visited the Lagoon Beach. The amount of trash on the beach was unacceptable. My children made the best of it by making a game as to who could pick up the most trash. Unfortunately, the fire pits on the beach had not had the ashes removed recently.
