I feel like it was a complete waste of over $2000. This wasn't the first time that we had stayed at a Noble House property, but it will certainly be the last.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed our stay and our kids loved it even more. The place accommodated our every need, down to making PB & J sandwiches for our niece who eats hardly anything else. The pools were great. The beaches were great. Kids loved finding shells. The conceirge would do everything they could to help you with what you need. They helped us overnight fed ex a package of meat to family back home. The only thing I didn't like was there was no where to wash your feet after being at the beach and coming back to your room (we had a room on the beach). We had to wash feet in the tub, leaving sand and such all over the tub. The carpet would leave your newly washed feet dirty after only an hour of being on it due to all the tracked in dirt/sand that a vaccuume can't get. No wonder the carpets are dark brown - it hides any dirt. Overall though, it was a great place with great service!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort...bring walking shoes”
Reviews.Author: candgfun
Reviews.Content: Spent the last weekend in April at Paradise Point Resort for a business conference. Grounds are absolutely breathtaking and soooooooooooo relaxing. This resort has something for everyone (beautiful nature/landscaping, swimming pools, spa, putting greens, beach, wonderful food, courteous staff, and great conference facilities). They even had relaxing "spa age" music in the ladies restroom at the main swimming pool (nice touch). My ONLY "gripe" was the length of time it took for bell staff to pick me up in their golf cart and drive to the conference facilities, as it was not a comfortable walking distance from my bungalow in dress heels. Even so, I'd really like to go back to Paradise Point some day as a leisure guest to really avail myself of their awesome facilities!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: cw_123
Reviews.Content: This resort was midway through our honeymoon in July 2003, after we had been to Orlando, Los Angeles and Las Vegas, and believe me it was a welcome relaxing change. The staff were wonderful and gave us a lovely hand written congratualtions card and a bottle of wine. Our bungalow was beautiful and everything was in perfect working order. We didn't use the pool as we were newlyweds we tried to keep away from the crowds - but we did have a lovely eveing meal at one of the restaurants. We hired a speed boat and had a wonderful day racing around the bay - which was great fun My only bad comment is that the view from our bungalow over the bay also included the concrete highway, but we couldn't hear it so it wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth!”
Reviews.Author: ggarlic
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day stay at Paradise Point and truly loved it! The grounds are absolutely gorgeous. Everyone is very friendly and the service was all you could ask for. Would highly recommend it and can hardly wait to go back....so relaxing!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Nasty Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thought this hotel was overpriced, but we had driven by it in the past, and the grounds looked amazing, so we decided to splurge on this vacation. Arrived at midnight. It was Christmas night, and one would have expected all the lights to be on - but they were not. The hotel could not find our reservation at first....took over an hour for them to locate it. Not fun with three small children waiting in the car after a long flight. Finally got through the maze to find our room. I have one word for our room - n-a-s-t-y. First of all - the smell. . . mouldy and mildew. Almost unbearable, but it was now approaching 1:30 a.m. and we were exhausted so decided we could put up with it. Bathroom pocket door - stuck halfway open - would not open all the way nor close Broken tv remote Phone was not working - cord was halfway ripped out of the phone which could explain it Had air conditioning central unit outside our door which banged extremely loud all night long. Had to ask them for a pack n play since they didn't note it on our reservation. Brought it promptly, but no bedding. Called them (on my cell, because remember, the phone was not working) for bedding for the baby. They brought 2 pillow cases?!? Bed sheets were mildewy and damp. Shivered all night from damp sheets and woke up smelling moldy. Tub was dirty, had hair in it, and tile was cracked and moldy. Furniture old, worn, and broken. No mention of $20 per night parking charge until checkout. What's up with charging for parking? Woke up to complain to the desk staff who argued with me that it was a luxury resort, but would not come down to the room to see what I was complainning about. Would not give me a refund on the remainder of my 10 day reservation as I had booked through Expedia. (Expedia did refund me though). Did not take time to do anything around the beautiful grounds as we couldn't check out of this place soon enough. Can't enjoy what ammenties the resort has to offer if you can't stand to be in the room, much less try and sleep there. Nasty, smelly, awful, horrendous, terrible room with obnoxious and clueless staff. Finally got an apology letter from the management with an offer of a free nights stay, but wouldn't stay here again even with the free coupon. We went to the Marriott on Hotel Circle and were super impressed with the suite, the cleaning staff, the free breakfast and dinner buffet, the cleanliness, new ambiance, helpfulness of staff, kids bunk room. This is where we will be going back to. Never this "Paradise" (and I laugh at that term) Point.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a family to sleep and enjoy the pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip online and THEN read the reviews of the place on TripAdvisor. We too were a little worried about what we had booked. We took our trip during the last week of March and found the hotel and grounds to be a really nice place. This was a family vacation to San Diego so the most important thing for us was the pool and a clean and quiet room. We visited the attractions through the day and wanted a nice place to sleep and something for the kids to do (play in the pool) in the evenings. Our room was 710, which is somewhat secluded compared to the other rooms. It was very quiet, the large heated pool was great fun for the kids. (Beware the smaller pools on the grounds are NOT heated and they were very cold. Use the larger heated one.) Our room was clean and in good repair. We did have an ant problem but we reported it and they sprayed which solved the problem. Overall a very nice stay. We did eat breakfast on the grounds a couple times. It's a little expensive but not too high priced - the food was good. We stayed a week and really enjoyed it. I would highly recommend it to anyone that finds a good price for this place online. Oh an they didn't charge me the extra $18 a day for parking. They said that because I was staying for a long visit they'd drop the fee. Pretty nice of them. There are plenty of places to eat nearby just ask at the front desk and they'll give you directions. We found everything we needed (fast food, sit down places to eat, laundrymat, etc) within a 5 minute drive. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “It was Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed for 2 nights during Easter Break. We had a king sized bed with a sleeper sofa. The room isn't that big but it's good enough for our family. The best part was our location. Room 222 was awesome! It's not a beach front bungalow but the beach is literally 20 steps away, plus we get a view from our room. While my husband and I tidy up our mess, the kids just layed some towels on the grass and watched the boats pass by. It was beautiful! The main pool was the best for us. The high during our stay was 65 degrees but the pool temp was at 82. It was hard to pull the kids out of the water! The casual dining restaurant was relaxing and food was good. A little pricey but the $5.50 kids' meal was the best deal. Bottled water will cost you around $2.50 so make sure you pack some with you and just put them in your little refs in the room. The gift shop is expensive but has a lot of goods to tinker with. A $1.50 duck food will put a lot of smiles in your children once they start throwing them in the lagoon. Try not to have a room starting in the 500s. I noticed from my walks that those rooms get a lot of road noise since it's closer to Ingraham, the main road. Rooms needs a little refurbishing but it's a place I definitely look forward to going to. The serene atmosphere, friendly staff and beautiful gardens will definitely relax you.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from several days in San Diego, half of which was spent at Paradise Point. While it was pricey, and they do charge you for everything ($20 for parking is just an example,and the cost of the mini-golf at $9 per person is just silly), the resort is breathtaking. Rooms are large, beautifully decorated and spotless. It's extremely convenient to be able to park adjacent to your room. Our teenage sons just loved the facilities including multiple pools, tennis courts and basketball. I'd rather spend fewer days at a memorable place like Paradise Point than a week elsewhere. When you check out, be sure to doublecheck your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights on March 30 and 31. After reading all the negative stuff on this site I was a little apprehensive , but our travel agent assured us she had good things. She was right. The grounds are beautiful, the service we received was excellent. Had a problem with out HVAC unit and it was taken care of in 15 minutes. The rooms are a little old, but they were clean and spacious. The bed seemed to be brand new and was incredibly comfortable. Don't be turned off to all the negativity --the place was wonderful---not the Four Season but you are not paying for the Four Seasons

Reviews.Title: “Good family resort - needs a remodel”
Reviews.Author: cougarmountainfamily
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Paradise Point with our two kids. The good points below make it a great family destination. Wish they would fix the Bad and the Ugly though . . . We agree with the prior post that guests should not expect a fancy spa type of resort. THE GOOD: The pool, the location (near Sea World, Mission Beach, airport and more), in-room refrigerator, bay front rooms, small putt putt course. We had a one BR suite on the beach on the bay. Our daughter loved playing in the sand right outside the room and swimming in the pool. Fast access to area attractions was a real plus. We enjoyed the pool side bar & grill, and the large suite. Also a good family friendly restaurant on the grounds, and a very nice gift shop. Room prices were good for the area. THE BAD: Like seemingly all hotels in the Mission Bay area, it seriously needs to be renovated and updated. The rooms have decent decor, with some newer furniture, but the overall feel is pretty worn. The exterior and landscaping is very worn and not well maintained. The maid service is slow and not so good. Bunch of guys driving around in carts doing nothing. They have an espresso bar, but its hours of operations are erratic, and the grinder had some disgusting looking beans around the top. The coffee was not very good. THE UGLY: Our room (and others) flooded during the rain, with brown water seeping up through the floor and pouring down through the light fixture in the bathroom. Judging by the water damage on the baseboards and walls, this was not a new problem. At least they didn't argue when we asked for a partial refund. The room of course ended up smelling pretty musty, but that's typical of the Mission Bay area from our experience during a prior stay at another hotel and other reviews we read before traveling to Paradise Point.

Reviews.Title: “High maintenace hotel”
Reviews.Author: grayling
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 326 from 3/22-3/28 for a conference on construction. Since we are in construction we thought we should give a review on the phyisical complaints about the hotel. 1. This hotel is a very high maintanence facility. With so many small buildings, each requiring it's own water heater, roof system, and plumbing, it's really tough to manage. It's not built like one huge building with one system to control everything. I'm sure each building also has it's own electrical panel too. The hotel does a pretty good job keeping up considering the challenges. 2. The scale is enormous. It's almost like it's own amusement park with all the paths and vegetation and wildlife. Everyday staff is outside hosing down the bird droppings and trimming the vegetation. The birds are everywhere. They really make a mess. But the exterior is quite clean considering the birds. 3. I don't know how the hotel can charge as little as they can considering the huge staff required to keep the place up. The staff required are 10 times the amount required for a single building high rise type structure. 4. The age of the buildings put them right at the point of being torn down. I can see Paradise Point disappearing and a condo development reappearing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Accomodations, The kids loved it!”
Reviews.Author: aznycmama
Reviews.Content: We were so apprehensive about staying at this resort after reading all the reviews but decided to give it a try because we wanted to stay very close to SeaWorld and the beach (and Fodders rated it one of the best family resorts) . Well, I have not one bad thing to say about this place and we would definitely stay there again. We had a beautfiful bayside bungalow suite with the beach just outside our back patio (complete with lounge chairs and a working chimenia). The room was beatiful and very clean (especially the bathroom) and quiet too! Our room was exactly as pictured on their website and it was perfect accomodations for our family of four. The grounds are well kept and gorgeous and our kids especially loved climbing the lookout tower. Service was terrific and prompt- room service was delivered within 20 minutes (used them for our breakfast and dinners) and were always accomodating to our special requests. We stayed one week and the staff was always friendly and helpful. I highly suggest going with one of their hotel packages - we did the Seaworld package which included accomodations (we upgraded) Seaworld tickets, free parking, and a $39 food credit daily. The best part is, it is less than a mile from SeaWorld and we had a great beach right at our door step. Definitely a great place for families. We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't let the reviews stop you....I surprised my husband with a trip to San Diego and was VERY nervous after reading the reviews here. We've stayed at resorts all over the US and found this to be a very beautiful visit. The rooms could use a little face lift, but the grounds more than make up for it. The heated pools were beautful, the staff was VERY friendly and the location was 10-15 minutes from everything. Only a 5-minute drive to beautiful La Jolla. I thought the bed was ultra comfortable with plenty of clean, fresh linens. The concierge was so great in helping us pick the best restaurants in the area, shared menues with us and offered to make reservations. The only major complaint I had was the $18/night parking fee.....not sure why they charge extra. We came home from being out all day to find someone else was parked in our spot. The resort took care of it immediately. We were just outside the adult pool...great location....ask for room 134. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, peaceful family resort.”
Reviews.Author: leflef
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Diego on February 19th for four nights. Our family and the friends we travelled with all loved it. The resort was absolutely beautiful. We loved staying right on the beach, which we mostly had to ourselves this time of year. The kids enjoyed a day in the heated pool. The food at the Barefoot Cafe was good for breakfast and lunch. Room service was timely. Location was good for Sea World, Zoo, 30 min to Lego Land. Would love to return. Only drawback was thin walls...heard our neighbors shower and chatting at 5 am first two days. Then we went to Santa Monica at the Fairmont Miramar and heard street noise, so I guess it's hard to avoid the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, food - for a fortune”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: $189 a night (conference rate) and the rooms leak and have cobwebs. Friend's room filled with water, carpet was soaked like a sponge - they did not move her to another room, just put fans on the carpet. It smelled terrible. My room had no desk chair (despite two calls) and room was twice not made up despite calls to housekeeping. And it wasn't my "do not disturb" sign -none of us had those in our rooms! Rooms often not made up until 3pm or later. Rain knocked out the server, so no $10 a day internet. $20 a day to park your car outside. Restaurant service spectacularly bad. Dessert the waiter told me was rasberry was actually blueberry; waiter argued with me that there was "raspberry IN it" (it was creme brulee. Hard to hide fruit in there...what with all the blueberries and all). Casual restaurant was even worse. Food bland, ordinary - twice, hot dishes were served cold. Sent an e-mail to the manager and answered the "satisfaction" survey with my name and contact info, but no response.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the reviews scare you away...”
Reviews.Author: ssbn
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a wonderful stay at this hotel – don’t let the negative reviews scare you away. If you want 5 star service this may not be the perfect resort for you – but if you want a private room on the water - don’t hesitate to book a room here. Our family of 5 stayed here for 8 nights and had a wonderful time. What we enjoyed the most: 1. Waking up each morning on the water – greeted by ducks and swans at our door. 2. Walks along the beach – collecting shells with the kids. 3. Fires on the beach at night – toasting marshmallows. 4 Swimming in the heated pool (87 degrees). 5. Climbing the tower at sunset. I do have to warn you – the resort is expensive. The rooms are expensive, the food is expensive, the gift shop is expensive – and the parking fee is expensive. If you are not willing to pay a premium – do not stay here without a car. We would eat breakfast in our room, lunch at the many attractions in San Diego, and dinner out, or bring back pizza to our room. We did have problems, similar to the other reviews, and I agree the service was not the best, but it did not negatively affect our vacation. All the resort employees were polite and helpful, and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. There just were not enough of them to service everyone at the same time. If you want a bargain – don’t stay here. If you want to be pampered – don’t stay here. If you want a room in a tall hotel near the Seaport – don’t stay here. If you want a private room, on the water, where you can walk out of your door and be on the beach – consider staying here – we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere between terrible and okay but some problems.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok- first. We like to go to different kinds of hotels and don't mind spending the money to do it. I also have never felt like posting something like this before. But a lot of little things added up to: yuck and a rip off. We just got back from staying two nights at Paradise Point. At check in time we were greeted by a friendly staff person. When asked if we had stayed here before, we said no, but had stayed at another Noble House property. He then said the he would waive the $20.00 per night (that we did NOT know about in advance) parking fee for being return customers. The parking spot was right in front of our room. It wasn't like they had to rent a spot in a nearby garage. The bell person was friendly and asked if our daughter would like to ride in the golf cart to get to our room. Being three, she thought that was a good idea. He was helpful. Upon opening our room there was a very musty smell. The room was obviously in an old building. They had redecorated - newer paint over badly prepared chipped walls. The furniture was new. But there were two small cafe chairs paired with a small round and short end table for a "dining area"- odd. The bathroom was a strange mix of old and new. New granite or marble countertops. Old bathtub and tile. AND DIRTY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Dirty toilet surfaces. Mold growing on the walls. An incredibly moldy shower curtain. Hair everywhere. Thick dust on the lampshades. Thin and dingy towels. Mold growing on the closet walls too. We ordered room service that night. It was fine (not remarkable either way). They did not pick up the dishes that were left out all night until after housekeeping came the next day. Breakfast our first morning was pleasant enough. We ate outside and our server was fine. Dinner in the casual restaurant that night was not great. The service in the mostly empty place was terrible. I am a 20% plus tipper and I even said to my husband that we won't be tipping much. Breakfast the day after was ok but with terrible service. We were due to check out and said to post the bill right away. When we went to check out it still was not posted and after three calls from the front desk the embarrased front desk person decided not to charge us. The grounds of the resort are very pretty. But bad service, expensive for what it was and a dirty room added up to NO WAY WOULD WE EVER GO BACK! I did not want to spend any extra time in that room after a long (and lovely) day at the zoo. Now... for a different story... after we went to Disneyland for a few days of impeccable service and a very clean and comfortable room at the Disneyland Hotel we came back to San Diego and stayed at the THE DANA ON MISSION BAY. Part of the hotel is brand new, part of it is old. They have redone all of the old rooms. We stayed in the old part. They were CLEAN, COMFORTABLE, OFFERED A FREE SHUTTLE TO SEA WORLD, GOOD STAFF AND A GREAT PLACE TO EAT WITH OR WITHOUT KIDS. The water main even broke on our way out. We stopped to get a bite to eat in the restaurant and Anna the manager was very on her toes, making it all work out without running water. So, if you need a place to stay close to Sea World this is one. So... Happy Trails. And in the end... what I want is a CLEAN ROOM and GOOD SERVICE. Paradise Point does not have it. Noble House should ditch this property or hire new management.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Xplorer80
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife in October of 2005. We were very happy with the resort. The rooms were nice, and so is the outdoor restauraunt and bar. Too bad they did not have smoking rooms. I think the entire property does not have smoking rooms. It is right on Mission Bay which is great for family fun. Sea World, La Jolla, and Downtown are a short drive away. I would definitely recommend this hotel for tourists, families, and lovers.

Reviews.Title: “Great for relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed in Paradise point last July on our honeymoon. We found it a great place for relaxation, especially the adult pool where there was absoulute serenity. The room was lovely although on one occasion we arrived back from breakfast and the room wasn't finished. We were anxious after reading reviews before we arrived but after a hectic week in Las Vegas it was a perfect retreat. The resort shop was a great idea with everything needed for our 7 night stay. Although the driveway was a bit fusty smelling i think this is understandable with the nightly watering of the luxurious grounds and no breeze to carry away the humid air. Overall the staff were friendly, the service fine and the scenery breathtaking!!!

Reviews.Title: “my stay was great”
Reviews.Author: estocoffee
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative reviews about the Paradise I was somewhat anxious about my prebooked stay (I know -your supposed to read the reviews BEFORE you book) . Suffice it to say I need not have worried. My room was clean, the staff extremely pleasant and the pools were well utilized by us during our stay. I will, however, agree with the notion that a place that you need a car to get to, should not have an $18/night surcharge for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Beckyf
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a trip to California last August. We had stayed at the Grand Californian in Anaheim for 3 nights, then traveled to San Diego to stay at the Paradise Point for 3 nights. The Grand Californian might be the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in; gorgeous place, fantastic service, etc. Disney's best. While Paradise Point was not the worst place I have ever stayed, it was close to the worst. The joke is - our bill for each hotel was almost to the penny the same! To those on this board who say the "heated" pool at Paradise Point was too cold to swim in Dec or January, note that this pool was too cold to swim in August! The bike rental place closed right in our faces; very rude service there. Food was very expensive. Boat rental was extremely expensive. The bathroom door in the room is louvered (sp?)!! The kitchen table and food area are pressed up against a door you can hear through so clearly you may as well not have a door at all. Totally disgusting. The hotel is sort of isolated and we had little to do. On the evening my husband and son went to a Padres baseball game, my daughter and I were bored out of our minds. We couldn't go anywhere without the rental car, the pool was too cold, there were no bikes to rent in the evening, no evening entertainment at all. The room was dirty. I had to call housekeeping to solicit a room cleanup every day. They never came automatically like every other place in America. If I had to say something good about the hotel, the grounds are pretty. The view from the tower is very nice. That's pretty much it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm a fairly seasoned traveler, althought I'd never stayed in San Diego. Well upon first entering the resort I remember getting an almost surreal feeling. And by "surreal" I don't mean "gosh what a placid, quiescent place to relax for several days", but rather "you have got be kidding me this looks like a run-down Miami Vice movie set complete with groves of plastic palm trees" surreal. On top of that, upon checking in I was informed that my room wasn't ready. Not only that, but I'd have to wait *three hours*. And did the manager have any sort of explanation, maybe even an apology? You know I'd tell you but I couldn't, since he never showed up after my waiting there for thirty minutes. When my room was finally ready, I was escorted to my bungalow on the back of a beat-up stretched golf cart (I'm not kidding). The room certainly wasn't worth $180/night, more like $50. And as another reviewer already mentioned, the nicest part of it was the bathroom. I did dine at the outdoor restaurant one night, and the food was sub-par as was the service. I'd heartily recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Massive disappointment”
Reviews.Author: walkley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked into this resort with our two children aged 9&10 for a 10 night stay. Having waited in the lobby for almost an hour, we were eventually told that our rooms were ready. When we entered the hallway of the interconnecting rooms, it was patently obvious that the rooms were not ready, the floors had not been vacuumed, the trash bins had not been emptied, and the bathroom had not been cleaned following the departure of the previous occupants.The rooms were in need of refurbishment, and had a very musty smell. We contacted reception immediately, and requested another set of rooms. We were told that this would not be possible, due to full occupancy. I insisted that a housekeeper attend promptly to make the rooms habitable.She vacuumed the floors, and was about to leave, when I pointed out the other areas that needed cleaning, including ( "I kid you not") at least a quarter inch of accumulated dust on each bed headboard. She used a hotel hand towel to quickly wipe the areas pointed out to her, then promptly left. At no point did I see her use any cleaning or disinfectant materials. When we opened the fridge door, we were appalled that it was infested with ants, as were most areas in both rooms. When my eldest son got in the bath later that evening, I was disgusted to see "PUBIC HAIRS" from the previous occupants floating in his bath water. My youngest son had previously developed a stomache bug, and during the middle of our first night at the resort, had a bout of excessive vomiting all over the bathroom floor. I cleaned the area as best I could, and went straight to reception the next morning, a) To complain about standards,& b) to seek reassurance that the bathroom would be totally cleaned and disinfected. Having been given the appropriate assurances we went out for a few hours, only to return to the overwhelming smell of stale vomit. Whilst the beds had been made, housekeeping had done nothing else to the room. I could go on and on about this resort, but suffice it to say that we checked out on our third day, and booked into the Raddisson La Jolla which was absolutely fantastic. I had read the reviews on this site prior to booking our stay at paradise Point, and came to the conclusion that It couldn't possibly be that bad. IT IS!!!! Do yourself and your family a favour - BOOK ANOTHER HOTEL!!! If You require any further information, then please send me an E-Mail

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point Resort is charming and quaint...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of four just returned from a week at Paradise Point Resort in San Diego (12/26-1/1/06). The grounds are beautifully landscaped...a lush and tropical feel embraces you the minute you drive into the resort. They had Christmas lights up and twinkling all over the resort and my 5-yr-old loved them. The staff was very helpful. We arrived 4:30 p.m. on Monday and needed to find a grocery store to buy formula and diapers for my 9 month old. The bellhop gave us a copy of directions to most major attractions in the area. We used these directions every day! They are wonderful and much more reliable than my interpretations of a map! We received an ample supply of towels every day. Good considering that the air on Mission Bay is always damp. Nothing will dry completely. Surprisingly, we never received new glasses. Mugs, yes, but glasses, no. The bungalows are charming, but they do need some additional remodelling. However, the staff was attentive to our concerns; our bathtub was slow-draining and by day 2 that had been fixed. The walls are thin. We had a lovely location, with our Adirondack chairs facing the lights of the Pacific Beach area and the bay. While the pools are heated, they are not really warm enough to swim in. My 5-yr-old swam twice, but only for brief amounts of time; this was a huge disappointment for us as we were assured they would be warm enough. I cannot comment on either restaurant, as we didn't eat there. I had read enough comments about seagulls to know that would completely gross me out. And let's face it, with two young kids who wants to waste that kind of money?? Overall, an enjoyable stay. Probably would stay there again if our kids were older.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: GregSt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our two young daughters went here just a week ago, based on the generally favorable reviews on this site and the recommendation of a friend in San Diego. While the place was well located (on Mission Bay, near Sea World) it was not worth the $300+ we paid per night to be in a "Bayside Bungalow." The bungalows (their most expensive room type) are generally nice (not great), but the "bay view" is not worth the money. You're not on the ocean; the water is still and the beach is not very attractive. We liked the main pool very much, the grounds were very nicely landscaped and the restaurants were good (Baleen is overpriced with no entree less than about $25+). Also disappointing were a number of things including the fact that they were charging $10 per day for use of the gym/spa -- at $300 per night, that should be included. That added tot he feeling of being "nicked and dimed" (so did a poor $4 latte). Also, the observation tower was covered in bird excrement, which reflected poorly on the hotel generally. There's also a slight "theme park" feel here as opposed to that of a truly elegant resort (which they represent themselves to be). Upon reflection, the Hotel Del Coronado (on the ocean) would have been a much better experience for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a getaway”
Reviews.Author: MilesToGo
Reviews.Content: The Paradise Point Resort has everything; you don't need to leave if you don't want too. The resort is structured around a bay and has duplex bungalows. Our bungalow had a small entrace area, a huge room, fridge, mirowave and eating area, large bath area, couch and a small patio. We were a short walk from the bay, the spa and the pool. Our room was very clean and well organized. We enjoyed our stay very much and this would be a great location if you're planning on visiting Sea World which is right down the street. We booked trhough Hotwire at a rate of $119 per night and it was a steal at that price.

Reviews.Title: “hold onto your wallet”
Reviews.Author: sunnygal1900
Reviews.Content: If you have money to burn stay here. Parking is 18.00 a night on top of your 182.00 per night. They do not tell you this until you get there. Too, late then, it was a package. Then, simple fare was quite expensive as well. Any healthy choices will cost you dearly. Lovely view, great Christmas decorations. The worst part, having to leave unexpectantly 2 days early. We had trip insurance and Expedia tried to get our 2 days back or at least a portion. The manager would not give a dime back he said. We were very disappointed as we had no choice and had to leave early. It is up to the discretion of the hotel and they chose to give nothing back. From now on Days Inn it is They do it all...

Reviews.Title: “Back to Gilligan's Island”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip for only one night and it was definitely not my best choice here. The hotel is located near Sea World in the middle of nowhere, so you better have a car or be prepared to pay very high taxi fees. Though the lobby and rooms were nice and kind of tropical warmth, this is imperatively a summer resort, and unless you plan to go there for a week or so and use all the hotel facilities, simply choose something else. It did reminded me of Gilligan's Island, but getting to my room was a mess and parking the car in the "right" spot was another mess. Getting from the hotel to downtown takes about 15-30 minutes depending on Traffic, but make sure I insist you have a car, beware of the $18 fee per day, I arranged it because I ran out of hot running water in the middle of my bath. I visited tha spa which is nice, but nothing out of this world. Just an average summer resort.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: bensnan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for 2 nights and were very impressed, it is set in a beautiful tropical island with lovely Bali type pogodas with chairs to sit and look out over the lovely lakes. We checked in very quickly and the receptionist was very friendly and helpful. Our bungalow type rooms were spotlessly clean but a bit like the chalet style that you get in a holiday camp but once inside our bathroom was lovely and the room was very well furnished, the beds were huge and the linen was clean, we had a lovely lanai with two chairs and a table overlooking the lake,it was very tropical and very relaxing.The Bayside restaurant was very good but we asked for cappuchinos after our meal and was told to go next door to the Baleen restaurant which was very expensive. We were charged $22 for four coffees.The pool areas were lovely and very clean. A beautiful place with lots of lush tropical plants but the rooms were not as luxurious as the island. Would stay there again and we loved San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised- gorgeous resort”
Reviews.Author: honeymoonusa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon. We paid an extra $50 a night to upgrade to a bayside view room- 233. To be honest, I was a little nervous about staying here because of the reviews on here, but we had a great time- don't be put off. We found staff to be helpful and friendly. The grounds are really amazing- gorgeous gardens and pools, with blazing torches at night- it was a shame that we had lousy weather as we would have enjoyed it much more with a bit of sun. Having said this, the pools are heated, and we loved the adult pool with the hot tub at night- it is pretty much deserted and very romantic with changing light colours in the pool/tub at night, with clean towels provided at the pool. If the weather had been hotter we'd have loved to have stayed on the loungers there. The bayside view was really lovely too. We ate at the Barefoot Bar and Grill every night and for breakfast one day- we found the prices to be reasonable and the food nice- eg $6.95 for 3 massive pancakes and syrup. Service was very good too. If you feel like eating out one night and don't have a car, take the no. 9 bus into Old Town, where there are lots of nice Mexican restaurants. The bus stop is at the end of the entrance to the hotel. the Baleen was too expensive for us. Sea World is a short walk away. We wanted to visit Coronado, so took the Old trolley Bus tour which can be booked and picked up from the hotel for $30, which was good value. We also went shopping at Horton Plaza and at Fashion valley. You can get on the no 9 and change at the Old Town transit center for Fashion Valley mall, all for $1.75 fare. Alternatively there is a free shuttle that goes from the hotel twice a day except Sunday. We loved the shopping and got some bargains in the Macys sale. On the downside, we were pleased with the room, but found the carpet to be a bit dirty if we went barefoot- probably because of the bayside location. It did smell a bit musty on arrival, but we didn't notice it after that and it didn't affect my asthma at all - think it's its sea location which causes this- we went to mauritius and had the same problem with mustiness but worse. We didn't have ants- and were generally pleased with the size and facilities in the room- not as bad as painted on here. Gift shop was very pricey for essentials, which was a shame ($7.99 for a sandwich). These aspects stop us giving it a 5- if the prices for rooms were a little lower and the rooms refurbished we would have given the resort 5. Similarly, we found the Spa to be very expensive ($120 for a 50 minute facial), so did not use this, when i would have loved to have gone if it had been a bit cheaper. Overall though, we thought the resort was great and would stay here again if visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful grounds, nice location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and upgraded to a standard suite #301. The room was large and clean with a nice patio that faced the adult pool and a nice pond. The kitchen was a joke, with just enough room to walk in but we ended up not needing it anyways. Disappointed we upgraded. The room did smell musty and the everything had a damp feeling to it, but we noticed that if we set the a/c unit to just blow air and close the outside vent, the smell went away. That is the price you pay for being on/by the water. The bed was very comfy and besides the damp feeling, no complaints. Cute room. The grounds were beautiful and extremely well kept. We loved taking evening strolls to burn off our dinner. We only ate breakfast at the Barefoot Bar & Grill and besides being a little pricey, enjoyed our meals and service. The coffee was awful so we went to the Coffee Cart next to the gift shop every morning for a coffee. The gift shop is nice, but again pricey for what is offered. At night, the grounds are beautifully lit with a romantic feel. All the staff we encountered were very friendly. Adult pool was nice and relaxing. The lounge chairs were padded with a thick cushion so we easily fell asleep. Over all, we enjoyed our experience at Paradise Point.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, give it a ten”
Reviews.Author: SPARKY0210
Reviews.Content: Don't be swayed by some of the bad reviews, I thought it was true paradise. We had room 119, garden room, the room was clean, perfect, had 2 queen beds, large room, great maid. I love ducks, we fed them every day on our patio. This room is close to the lobby, pools and restaurants. The grounds were immaculate and the lawns are all golf course quality. I didn't see any trash anywhere on the resort. You may want to book the least expensive room, then once there ask for an upgrade to a bayside one bedroom suite, we were offered one for $50 more, but decided to stay in our room. The concerieges - there were always 2 on duty were very friendly and helpful. Pick up brochures at the airport, I didn't see any on display at the hotel. A steak at baleens will run you $33, french toast or a hamburg at the barefoot restaurant is $12.50. The food was all excellent. If you want to walk to another restaurant, take a right out of the resort, walk over the bridge, take a right to the restaurant next to the Dana hotel. There is a bus stop at the end of paradise resort. great area for riding bikes on mission bay, can ride to pacific beach in 15 minutes. There's waterfalls and fountains all over the resort. This is the best resort I have every stayed at, I felt like I was in the caribbean. I also saw a soap opera star at the barefoot restaurant. Rented a power boat for $80/hour, can also rent waverunners $95/hour, pedal boats $20/hour, sailboats and others. I love this place. If you don't like your room just ask for another. Reviewers should give thier room number.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort”
Reviews.Author: Cubbies
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left this place was excellent in every category. We arrived on a Friday afternoon check-in was quick and we were hoping to catch a ballgame after a quick conversation with the concierge, he had got us 2 tickets for the game as quick as a flash. The room was lovely and had agreat outlook to a stream with ducks that you woke up to on a morning which was nice. The pillows in the room were the best I have ever slept on in a hotel. The landscaping of the resort was beautiful and there were always staff gardening tidying up reparing putting greens and generally keepinhg the place tidy. The heated pool was lovely and fairly quiet as well. The barefoot grill was a good setting with bar type food that was nice. And at night the mood changed again with beautiful lighting that accentuated the resort and gave it an entirely differnt look again. The only negative I would have if you could call it that was that it was a little far from downtown and if you were catching a cab in each night it could soon add up.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away - not a 4-star as advertised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a nice weekend and booked through Hotwire. Hotwire listed the hotel as a 4-Star property and was NOT. We have stayed at many 4-star Hotwire hotels and been pleased, but this was not the case here. Rooms are very dated, dark - with a strange dim spotlight that highlights the bed. The rooms were large and provate, but the parking area is very dark and not well marked. The secuirty guard banged in my door at midnight to move my car because it was parked in the wrong spot - even though they were 4 empty spaces next to mine and the reason it was not in marked spot was because the numbers were worn off. The pool looked nice, but there was power boat races going on around the property and we were informed that we should leave by 8 AM and come back after 4 PM if we wanted any solitude and not have to face traffic congestion. Beachfront here means a sandy beach overlooking a bay/lake that overlooks mobile homes and camping areas. I give this place a 1-star and advise you to book elsewhere - not value oriented either. Parking was $18/night for a non-urban hotel - crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic time here - a few probs but not major.”
Reviews.Author: sarah333
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon and our trip down the west coast of America. When we checked in we were upgraded to a bayside view room which was fantastic of them. They seemed really organised at check in and had someone on a golf cart who was lovely ready to show us where our room was - which was really helpful. The room was massive and had such a lovely view, we really liked the complex there were windy roads with gorgeous flowers and vegitatin and ponds with ducks and they also had massive fish and sharks swimming in a river at the back of the restaurant. It was a beautiful setting. There was also a lovely gift shop with all sorts of bits and pieces and food and drink. The pool areas were great and it's nice to have an afult only pool to get away from screaming kids - although when we went there was no staff there to serve drinks so we ended up going to the main pool anyway. We ate at the Baleen restaurant which was expensive as you'd expect but the food was absolutely delicious. The only down sides were the barefoot bar and grill where we had breakfast - the food was gross, we had poached eggs that were liquid. The plates weren't cleared very fast and there were pigeons and seagulls walking over the empty tables trying to pinch food - it was horrible! There were staff members just stood about chatting whilst this was going on which i thought was wrong. We also thought we'd give the place a try for an evening meal but again it wasn't up to much. Also the beach wasn't that nice and had quite a lot of rubbish on it - the hiring of sports equipment was also REALLY expensive so we didn't bother. Car parking charges are ridiculous too. But all in all we had a great time and if we came back to San Diego we'd probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but going downhill!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I just got back from this resort. The location is incredible, the main pool is very nice. Nice tropical feel. We've stayed here before and I have to say, the rooms were much cleaner in the past. For the price we paid, this place should be immaculate, but no way! Our curtains in our room were torn. The sink in the bathroom wouldn't turn off completely. We ordered room service and the plates were dirty. There were ants in our room. They didn't clean our room everyday. We were pretty disappointed. It's like they initially wanted this resort to be upscale, but got lazy over the years. It's a shame, because we've loved this place in the past, but we won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “needs some help”
Reviews.Author: yollH
Reviews.Content: Nice, relaxing room overlooking Mission Bay. Wonderful pillows! Patio to have lounge chair, but didn't. Called desk twice and still never received chairs, finally took some from another patio. Service at bayside cafe slow and not what you would expect from resort, also very overpriced but good food. Wonderful gift shop. Staff at their pier rude, we walked away and rented at another hotel instead.

Reviews.Title: “It's so bad we had to leave the next day!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The beach was dirty with debris. Run down facility with cabinet door that won't close fully. Sofa-bed was tilted with legs higher than head--> not only gave me a head rush, but also gave me a glimpse of what women go through during pelvic exams. The toilet kept running. Infested with ants and spiders. The carpet was so dirty I wouldn't let my toddlers walk on it without shoes. It's a shame. The resort has great potential being in the middle of Mission Bay with great views. $18 dollar parking fee a day is just ridiculous! We stayed at their Bayside Bungalow at $425 a night plus tax! We had planned to stay for 3 nights. We just couldn't stand being there for more than 24 hours. We left the next day and found another resort and had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Not the same”
Reviews.Author: MarkRosenthal
Reviews.Content: I have been a fan of this hotel since it was Vacation Village many years ago. Princess took over followed by Noble Hotels. When Noble first took over they really improved both the service, rooms, and the beautiful grounds. But since then everything has slowly but noticably dropped each time we have stayed there. This trip the grounds were noticably dirty and the community trash bin outside our room was overflowing with garbage for two days before being emptied. Room serivce was ordered twice and one time the food was so bad we had to complain and they happily took it off of the bill. Unfortunately the dirty dishes stayed outside our room for almost a day, and this happened twice. The same day we had a full day of going to the zoo followed by the the Padre game. After a very long, hot, and tiring day we returned to find our room hadn't been serviced and of course that meant we had no clean towels. The grounds are still nice but Paradise Point is one of the most expensive hotels in the area and you just expect better. The one thing I have noticed lately is that their seems to be less and less employess patroling the grounds doing maintenance and it shows. For the price you pay you just expect better.

Reviews.Title: “Safety not an issue!”
Reviews.Author: Woodstockpilgrim
Reviews.Content: The resort itself was ok but my daughter said the light in the bath was flickering. I tried screwing the bulb tighter and it came off in my hand. When I looked up inside the globe the light socket was burnt and charcoaled. The bulb had foil wrapped around it to stay in the burnt socket. I immediately went to the front desk and complained that this repair was unsafe and I didn't appreciate my family's safety being treated so lightly. The manager said he agreed and it would be repaired immediately. We went to dinner and thought the fixture was replaced. The next day we saw that the bulb was replaced with a new bulb with new tin foil. I believe this is a big fire issue and it makes me wonder what other safety issues are that can't be seen. If this had been the Days Inn for $60 a night I might not be surprised but the price of the resort would suggest quality and good maintenance without worrying over safety issues. We will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “not paradise but very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: helenathome
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for four nights this month and loved it, although the resort is a long way away from san diego's attractions (apart from seaworld which is 5 mins by car). we had driven all the way down from san fran and wanted a break from driving, so we ate at the hotel every night, which was ok at first but then got to be a problem as the place was very busy. However, our 11 year old son fell in love with the herons that made a nuisance of themselves at meal times and loved the main pool (which was not particularly clean). He didn't venture any further, but there were 4 other pools dotted around, including an adult-only one. our room was very clean and spacious and not at all noisy, plus it backed onto a wonderful lagoon with ducks and wildlife. the whole place has been done out like a tropical resort, lit by flaming torches (although a bit dark in places) and is very beautiful. I had read loads of bad reviews before travelling and was very concerned, but all our worries were unfounded and we would return if ever in san diego again

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a 4* resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was a little worried about staying at Paradise Point. Many reviews had stated that the rooms smelled musty and weren't clean however we found that our room was clean and smelled fresh which I must admit I was relieved about. We had a 'Parlour Suite' which had a king size bed, a sofa queen, a small dining table and chairs, refrigerator, sink area, a vanity area with a wash basin and separate bathroom/toilet. The room looked as if it had been recently painted and gave the feel of a beach house. The resort just needs some TLC - the lagoons were rather dirty, full of bird feathers and debris and the main swimming pool, although well used, never really looked clean and did not entice you to go in for a dip. There were a lot of birds about and obviously where you have wild birds you also have bird poo and plenty of it - everywhere!! The birds were very off putting around the 'Barefoot Bar and Grill' as they used to land on the tables and finish any food scraps before the servers had time to clear the tables. It was unhygienic and unpleasant as they came swooping in and landed on the next table. The food at the 'Barefoot' was Ok but on the expensive side for what you got. The breakfasts were a real let-down after having been to the Mirage in Las Vegas. The 'Baleen' was more upmarket and although expensive the meals we did have in there were excellent. Tennis. bikes, croquet, putting, boats, jet skis etc were all available but were very cost prohibitive. My son is 14 and did not want to go on the beach but had he been younger I would not have wanted him to play on the beach as both the sand and the water looked dirty. Not the pristine white sands that the brochure describes. We stayed at Paradise Point for 8 nights and although we had no major problems we thought that the resort was overpriced and we weren't sorry to move on.

Reviews.Title: “When Good Hotels Go Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The bathroom is the first tipoff to a bad hotel experience. And this bathroom had "Awful" written all over it. Let's just say that the maintenance crew had not been especially diligent. We tried to get to sleep, but a bad band was playing loudly at the bar. The front desk said the noise would stop at 10, but it lasted until 11. Sleep deprivation is part of the Paradise Point experience, as the turbo leaf blowers started at 6:30 AM. Then we took our little boy to the "heated" pool. As President Clinton might have said, it all depends on what the definition of the word "heated" is. We pulled him out when his lips turned blue. Then we had breakfast, though by the time the servers brought us the runny eggs, the time was closer to lunch. It reminds me of an old joke. In a raffle, first prize would be a week at Paradise Point. Second prize would be two weeks. It's a shame, since the place looks as if it used to be nice. But it isn't nice anymore.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at paradise point was perfect. The staff was excellent and they where always available to answer questions. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. The view from the room was spectacular. I would never stay anywere else.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the cost, a little run down, bad service”
Reviews.Author: dolanpm
Reviews.Content: First the good things: The king size bed was very comfortable, the grounds could have been quite pretty, and the shower had great water pressure. The bad things: "Service" was horrible, and I am not a person who is interested in overly-attentive service, but like it to be decent. It wasn't. The first day we ate at the casual restaurant. We waited about 15 minutes to order (finally went and got a waitress) and literally 30 minutes for a plate of nachos and 2 kids dinners of chicken fingers, and 2 glasses of wine.The restaurant was not crowded and we saw lots of wait-staff come and go from the kitchen. We did not try the other restaurant, so I don't know how that would have been. In general staff were not very nice or helpful. We went there again the second night, basically because we had tired and some jet-lagged kids with us (rather than go find a better restaurant off the resort as others have correctly suggested). The waiter paid more attention to our tables, but that didn't seem to stop him from forgetting stuff and for the whole thing to just took way too long. The room was ok, but just ok. There was a used band-aid stuck to the bed post (how did cleaners miss that??) Our alarm clock was left set by previous guests for 6 am. I wouldn't expect staff to check for that, but it could be a nice thing to think of. I guess we will next time. Our friend's room (with a little kitchenette and living-room area in addition to the bedroom) was downright dirty and run down. She is from NY so when she first described it I thought she meant it was like shabby-chic and maybe she just wasn't used to that Ca. style (which I like) but no, when I saw it I realized it was just shabby. The grounds were pretty, with flowers, ducks, etc. The rooms overlooking the little cove were cute, and the kids enjoyed digging and playing by the quiet water. But again, not terribly clean. Our room had 2 little chairs overlooking a grassy area outside that was pretty, but the trash everywhere seemed to be overflowing, and the whole place just has this run down, rather than resort-like feeling. The parts of it were nice had little to do with the resort which is ridiculously overpriced for what it is. It was nice because we were in San Diego, which is beautiful, and because we were seeing our friends and playing with our kids. Our little trip was not ruined by staying there, because it would take a lot to make San Diego unpleasant, but it did bug us all that we had paid for and expected (nice website) something that this place did not deliver. The bottom line is this place should be either cheaper or nicer. If it was the cost of a normal hotel room (not a resort, which it isn't) that would be fine, it could be a decent family place that is a little worn out but fun. If it was much nicer and shinier and the service was decent and the rooms and grounds more uniformly kept then they could charge what they do and that would be ok. As it is, I would say find a nice hotel room and go enjoy the beaches, restaurants, and attractions of San Diego. I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Due For Renovation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from what was going to be a 4 night stay, after 2 nights. I spent more time in the lobby dealing with room problems than on my vacation. It's too bad. Five years ago I had a nice experience, but the hotel has become very run-down. My room was changed 4 times, each with problems. Each room had a musty odor, worn and dirty carpets, and cob-webs. The first one had only one bed even though I requested 2 (not going to work with 3 kids.) The next room had no windows and felt like a dungeon. One room had a water leak, which looks like it had been a problem for quite a while. Our last room had a bathroom light fixture explode, sending shattered pieces of light bulb everywhere, and had missing window coverings on the front door (which is a see-thru glass door that faces the street.) The grounds are nice, but right now some of the lagoons look more like swamps. The main pool is nice, with the other 4 being nothing to speak of. The prices are high, especially for the present condition, and everything is an extra expense -- self-parking, gym, bikes, mini-golf, etc. This hotel is in desperate need of some major TLC!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, But Not For the $$$”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in San Diego and would highly recommend this as a family vacation destination. We stayed at the Paradise Point Resort upon the recommendation from a friend, although were somewhat cautious about staying there after reading other peoples' reviews. The Resort grounds are absolutely gorgeous!!! There was lush greenery, flowers and ponds throughout...not to mention the convienience of having a beach within walking distance. Our kids, ages 4 & 7 were enchanted by the water, the beach and the daily visits from ducks, who came to our patio daily for a friendly visit (this was a real winning point for the kids). We found our room accomodations to be "adequate", with a "beach house" feel. There was nothing fancy about the room we were assigned to: a small room with 2 double beds, a small table, a television hutch with drawers and a small dorm-sized refrigerator (which we found helpful to stock with drinks and lucheon meats), as the Resort's restaurants were over priced and the food was only "adequate". There was a sizable walk-in closet a nice sized vanity area, with the bath & toilet in a separate room. The cleanliness of the room was questionable...although we had no difficulities with any ants or other bugs. I didn't feel the accommodations were worthy of the heafty price we paid per night. Also note that this agency has the nerve to charge for parking on top of what you're already paying!!! ($18 per night). The pool areas are nice, but not very clean. If you plan to spend lots of time in and around the actual Resort, this is a beautiful place to stay, but if, like us, you plan on visiting all the attractions in San Diego, you may consider someplace more reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $$$”
Reviews.Author: mauigrays88
Reviews.Content: The price that the Noble Resorts charge for a stay at this (resort?) is outrageous. Although the executive suite that we (2 adults & 2 children) stayed in was large and spacious the surrounding resort, employees and atmosphere did not warrant the inflated summer rate that we were charged. When you stay at a Resort you expect higher quality with knowledgeable employees and premier service. None of this was true all through the resort from the front desk, checking in to the Barefoot Bar & Grill. A blatant example would be after waiting 40 minutes for a simple meal to arrive to your table a manager gives you the excuse that the computer is at fault. Other tables were served and families left before our dinner arrived! We would not visit this motel again.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: dafont
Reviews.Content: I was very concerned about staying at this resort because of some of the reviews I have read but we were pleasantly surprised. As soon as we arrived the line to check in was out the door. However, we were in our room by the 4 pm check in time so that was nice.The grounds of the property are well kept and very pretty. Ducks wander the property and came up near our room in the morning which my 2 yr old son loved. The room was smaller than I had expected but since our room was on the water it made it okay for the time we were actually in the room. The main complaint I have is that they need to have a bay maintanence crew. My son was digging in the "sand/dirt" and found a corn cob pick with a very sharp point. The sand/dirt should be kept up since there are firepits along the bay and that tends to add to the problem.Overall, this is a perfect place to stay with kids since there are a lot of things to do and the pool is very nice and warm. Things in the hotel are overpriced. For example, 2 plain coffees were $7 at the coffee cart. Luckily, we had our car and the hotel is very close to restaurants and coffee houses so we left for food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort--not so beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: MeinPhx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our two girls, ages 5 and 7, to San Diego from July 10th-15th. I had originally read some good reviews on this hotel--it was not until a few days before departure that I started reading some bad ones. If I had it to do over again I probably would have picked a different resort. Check in was fine- we arrived about 1:30 and our room was ready. Very nice man gave our girls and my husband a ride in his shuttle to our room and I followed in the van. I was immediately disappointed with the location of the room. It was right next to the convention center . This made our view from our room some type of wood fence that was used to hide some of their equiptment. Since I had not specified where I wanted my room, I did not complain. I was also disappointed about the size of the room. There were two queen sized beds and a small desk with two chairs. The TV was set into an armoure that also held a very small refridgerator. If my husband and I had been traveling alone the amount of space would have been fine. The bathroom sink was very nice, but again very small. The shower/bath was also tiny.There was a strong must smell in the room. I decided not to fret as we were planning on spending the majority of the time at the pool and Sea World. We ordered room service that night. Took about 30 min to get our food. I would give it a 2 on a scale of 1 to 5. Not cheep by the way! In the morning we woke up to find we had visitors in the bathroom. Ants! I was not pleased about this. I do not go camping because I like the outdoors to stay outdoors!! We called housekeeping and advised them we would be gone for the day and would appreciate the ants be gone when we came back. Sea World was wonderful. Only stayed a few hours. Did breakfast with Shamu--I highly reccomend this for the kids!! They loved it!! Decided to go back to the hotel and swim. We would finish Sea World the next day. We really enjoyed the main pool. There were many families, but that was fine with us...we had ours with us!! The service at the pool was great. We always had a drink in our hand and the food was OK. Not a very big selection and the prices were high, but it was nice to be able to eat at the pool. The girls had their hair braided poolside. They thought that was neat. I would give the pool area a 4 on my 1-5 scale. The ants did make a return a couple of times and eventually I did not smell the musty smell. Must have gotten used to it. When we checked out we complained again about the ants and the fact that one day we came back and had no parking space--there was something going on at the convention center. They ended up crediting two days of parking which was $18/day. There were many on site activites- boat rental, bike rental, ect. We did not visit the beach at the resort, we drove to Mission Beach. Don't get me wrong. We had a wonderful time on our vacation. The room issues did not ruin the week, however I would not reccomend this resort or stay here again. It was definitely not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Just Got Back from Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: WeLove2Travel23
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed 3 nights at the Paradise Hotel for a short vacation to San Diego. Our room was clean and nice and the grounds are decently maintained overall. The service was attentive, especially at the pool, where we ate lunch one day. We also ate one meal at the Barefoot Bar and Grill and the service was friendly and the food decent. The only bad thing is there are tons of large birds everywhere at the Barefoot Bar and Grill and one was eating eggs off of a table near us, which I thought was really gross. The family sitting there must have found it acceptable because they just sat there and allowed it. The restaurant should post signs discouraging that because the birds are a bit of a nuisance. I felt safe walking around the resort, even at night, because of all the families and other people around. The main pool is very large and warm and the pool area is kept clean. Some areas of the grounds could use a little TLC, such as a bit of trash in the lagoons and the water is a little funky in some places. Some of the outdoor furniture by the lagoons could also use a cleaning as well (the pool furniture is kept very nice). We stay at a lot of hotels and I felt that Paradise Point did an overall good job of meeting our needs. I am picky and would be quick to point out anything gross or dirty in our room. The curtains in our room need to be replaced because they were torn and worn on top. Other than that, the beds are very clean and comfortable and the rooms are quiet. I guess people's impression of this resort depends a lot on where the room is located and there is a lot of variation. Our room did not smell musty at all, nor was the carpet dirty, as I have read in other reviews. Why some rooms are cleaner than others seems strange to me as well (different housekeeping staff?). This is a nice, family-orientated place to relax. There are lots of kids everywhere, so we felt very comfortable (I was not the only pregnant lady by the pool). I wanted a place to stay with the kids while my husband worked in San Diego and not have to drive anywhere during the day. Our room was right on the bay and we had a lovely view. We walked on the beach at night and enjoyed all the bonfires and other people around. One last thing-the prices for snacks are very high in the gift shop and restaurants are pricey (the resort does seems to nickle and dime you). Since the rooms have refridgerators, we went to a grocery store and stocked up on juice boxes, bottled water, yogarts, fruit, etc. and ate breakfast on our little patio. For dinner, we left the resort and ate at some of the wonderful places San Diego has to offer, such as in Old Town, and for a lot less than Paradise Point. Great way to save money.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Flaws and Red Flags within the first two hours!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: GOOD POINTS: Lots of lush mature vegetation, I love flowers so lots of hibiscus and tropicals for my outdoor pleasure. Nice to be able to park the car right near our casita room. We are from the desert so the cool and green was NICE. On the pond I amused myself with feeding the ducks, and the fish for the snowy egret that stayed at my side all wkend. Food was okay--fruits and veg. were fresh-- San Diego is fairly compact so location didn't matter that much.. Nice conference room on the water with windows. Hate those dark-hole rooms in hotels. Easy to get around off-property, near La Jolla and other beaches. One staff member that stood out to me, she was helpful and a jewel. NOT VERY GOOD: First thing in the room, had no screen on the sliding door--so I called maintainance and they had to come and put one on. We live with A/C all summer so I wanted FRESH AIR all weekend. I spoke Spanish to the gentlemen, and tipped him, after all--it's management that screwing up not him. Water main broke and we were out of water within the first two hrs. Then they shut if off 9pm-5am to repair it. Left us a note with bottled water...as it should be! Two locks on the door, only one worked, the deadbolt above did not. Seemed like I could never get printed info from the Concierge--he was not there, and they didn't leave out any brochures --as if they were stingy or something, I wanted some maps and info on what to do, go, see. None to be found put out in racks. We asked for extra hangers for our room, and we got these WIRE ONES that looked like what you get at the cleaners with the cardboard bar on the bottom. Gee I mean, I can live with those but hey, what we were paying for a ROOM?? COME ON... SPELLED OUT CHEAP to me the first hour! OVERALL IMPRESSIONS: Would not pay to go back. The price doesn't compare to what you get. I like comfy rooms and clean, not worn. I need to feel, safe, clean and okay with the energy of room. The worn also makes it not feel very clean. Details mean alot! The details were overlooked.... Beds okay, nothing special--could be more firm. Our room felt like it was a bit dated and worn. And we were there for a conference, so our group bought a big block of rooms. You'd think they'd want our business back. I think some of the reviews I have read come from people with kids and some can live with a certain messyness and chaoticness -- I come from a family of 10 kids so I am not a snob. Families with kids can dirty up the rooms, or don't care about dingy carpets, etc.....so they overlooked the room points. We didn't go to SeaWorld so that was irrelevant to us, the location. I worked for the airlines, travelled extensively and have been to many nice resorts and even motel 6's...we've lived in Europe and all over the U.S, and can enjoy nice Motel 6's to the very posh. Paradise Point survives because of people who buy into mediocrity, and pay that kind of money for inferior services and goods, so it promotes it. The property is old and needs heavy revamping, which is why the pipes keep breaking, etc. No money is being put into the hotel for upgrading--shame, it's a nice property, just poorly managed. You can just look at it to tell. The rooms and details of the property look deteriorated. One day it might shut down from run down. Also, when I check into a resort or hotel, their main business is to supply a comfortable place to sleep and be during our stay, and the first impression I get is when I walk into that room. I mean, I told my husband, hey--here I am having to be on the phone calling for MAINTAINANCE, etc. and these are the things I do at HOME! When I arrive on vacation, I shouldn't have to be taking care of ordinary room maintainance things because that is what I am paying a resort to provide! So that didn't set a very nice TONE for our 5 day stay. My niece lives in San Diego and she kept telling me that we were staying at a VERY NICE RESORT. We brought her back to our room and she walked in and said--"oh..this doesn't look like what I'd expect, for what you paid." So BINGO! We had a nice time, but really, this has been one of the most expensive places we have stayed this past year --I am talking about the room price--nice resorts always will have expensive eateries....so that is a given....close enough to other places to eat within a short drive....the little restaurant on the water was okay but we didn't eat at the nite-dining one. I am surprised for such a large resort there were only 2 restaurants on the property. There was some nice staff that helped to make our stay pleasant, those are the few that go out of their way to please and put in 110%, but not all were like that. I am so surprised, our 1st trip to San Diego and for that area, seems like other resorts and hotels would be UP from this place. A family in the casita next to us, showed me on the map some other resorts they stayed in, and recommended! The family was from Carlsbad. Next time we will choose one of those recommended places.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: luv2run64
Reviews.Content: We too were not to sure what we were in for after reading some of the reviews. We arrived at the hotel 4 hours before the required check-in and were provided with our room immediately which felt like we had gained an extra day. Our bungalow was clean (no musty smells)and large, had a mini kitchen area with a sink, fridge and micro. Our screened door opened up to a grassy area with beautiful gardens and two comfy Adirondack chairs. The plant life here is well maintained and we felt like the resort was on its own island. We only found three pools. If you want peace, stay at the waterfall pool. The large pool is definitely a kiddie area. The beach was clean and sandy, not dirt. The only downfall is the hotel charges you for parking, $18 per day, and extra activities such as use of the tennis and basketball courts ($10/half hour). And the food is very expensive here. There are many eateries up the street on Ingraham and Grand or Garnet Street.

Reviews.Title: “Overall had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: s0479
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant about staying here after reading some of the reviews but was pleasantly surprised. We arrived before checkin time and had to wait about 40 minutes for a room but the clerk let my daughter pick where we wanted to stay on the grounds. We ended up right next to the governors suite, so one room away from the bay. The room was a bit small, with 2 queens beds and the bathroom was tiny! But the room was clean and had no musty smell. The staff, restaurants, pools and spa were great. Great location to Sea World. I don't often stay at 4 stars and this wasn't quite as luxurious as I thought it would be but I got a good price and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomm, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After visiting San Francisco and Las Vegas for the previous 6nts we were looking for some wind down time on arrival at San Diego. We had to wait 2 hours to checkin , sitting with our luggage around the pool waiting for a room to become available (this after queueing at checkin 3 times to chase it).The checkin staff were unwelcoming, lacked knowledge about the location of the hotel and frequently were unable to change travellers cheques into cash (even with a limit of just $100 a day). Lanai garden rooms are lovely, beds really cosy, good bathrooms and lots of living space and gardens beautifully manicured although our patio did not get much sun. Restaurants are well situated, good food, friendly staff but get booked up quickly so reserve ahead. Good walks around mission bay and access to beach (fine sand)from the hotel.Slightly awkward to get around without a car but no 9 bus runs every 30mins to old town for approx $1.75 and then connects with the trolley into downtown city centre at various stops which is useful. San Diego zoo is brilliant although $32 a head to get in including buses/skyfari etc but worth it! Visit new baseball stadium and see the San Diego Padres- its a great experience and the stadium is well placed for transport and does tours if no matches on, such is its attraction. Coronado island by ferry is a "must do" and the beach at the Coronado hotel is free so take your towel and sunscreen and chill out! Everyone in San Diego was great except the frontdesk staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families!”
Reviews.Author: VEGASRUSS
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights 5 days at Paradise Point and really enjoyed our stay. This resort is great for families with lots of resort activities. Our Daughter loved movie night at the pool. The Barefoot Bar and Grill on property has a great menu and service. Our room was in a perfect location to the beach and main pool/spa......we did talk to several people that were not satisfied with the location of thier room. The resort is minutes from Sea World which was our favorite attraction, breakfast with Shamu is a must do!!!! The only downfall of our stay was the $18 a day parking fee. Overall, the property was clean with great service.

Reviews.Title: “A Fun Place for Families”
Reviews.Author: 4boys4me
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort in July 2004 - 2 adults and 4 kids. While expensive, it was a lot of fun for our kids and they would do it again.
