I would probably stay there again, but if you are looking for a good swimming and boogie boarding beach, this isn't the one. The fun things about staying here are: the resort atmosphere; your own "private" beach; campfires at night on the beach just steps from your cabana; lots of good rentals at the rental shop; friendly help and smiles from the resort staff; terrific location for sightseeing and Sea World, Legoland, and San Diego attractions. It's a fun place for the kids to just sit and play in the sand and in the water and for Mom and Dad to watch them without worrying too much. The accommodations are a bit smaller than I would have liked and we felt really cramped after about 3 days there. Also, the restaurant was a bit pricey. All in all, not a bad place to stay for a week in the sun!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not great”
Reviews.Author: kgreenaz
Reviews.Content: PRO: -we paid for a garden lanai room and asked for one near the beach. We were just across the street from the beach which was great for my 2 & 3 year old boys. -Main pool was nice and warm. -Location to SeaWorld makes it all worth it. Able to come back for naps and go back afterwards. -Barefoot Bar had yummy food for adults & kids. Room service was good, too. CON: -$18 to park my own car was not disclosed when reserving room online. -Between taxes & park fee, add $40 a day (at least) to your room rental rate. -Had no maid service the entire time: we left at 9:30am for SeaWorld each day and returned at 2:30 for naps. Maid service ends at 4pm. We had to order clean towels but never had the room cleaned the four days we stayed. -Except for the main pool, the others pools are dumpy. -The mini-golf course was being re-seeded and not worth $9 to play on sand. -Loved the toiletries that are from the spa but the room was small and old. I brought lots of scented candles that did not help. I would look at another hotel first to see if there is anything comparable. If not, I would definitely stay at the PPH again. Employees were friendly. We had a water main break on our last night so had no water from 9pm - 5m but were given bottles of Evian. Liked the close proximity to the public beaches across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I went over the Memorial weekend. It was our first time going to the hotel and I was a little worried. Especially after reading the other reviews. The place was wonderful. The grounds were beautiful. Very lush. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Tony gave me and the kids a great ride over to the room. The location of our room was perfect. Right by the main pool and close enough to walk a few steps to the beach. We basically stayed the whole trip by the pool. Playing a movie by the pool Saturday night was a great touch. Yes, there were a lot of kids by the main pool. But what do you expect. It is a holiday weekend. The only negitive thing I could say is about the $18 fee for parking. I would expect that for valet, not for parking our own car. In any case, if wont stop us from going back.

Reviews.Title: “Not All It Claims To Be”
Reviews.Author: kayjay13
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here in May 2005. We had reservations for two nights, but checked out after only one. Some info: -- The staff is friendly and helpful enough, the lobby is nice, and the pool area is beautiful. -- The carpet in our overpriced room was *filthy* (black socks in an hour). -- As many others have said, the rooms are musty. Bring air freshener. -- The grounds are interesting and fun for the kids, with lagoons (which are not for water play, as they're nasty), many many birds (ducks, etc.), a cool fish/shark/ray pond. They have chairs on little docks in the lagoon areas, to make you want to sit and relax. But once you get near them, you see that they're essentially fowl furniture -- complete with poop all around. Ewe! The worst part -- the clincher -- was the "white-sand beach" we were expecting our room to open out to (per the brochure). It's dirt! Dirty DIRT. Not "sand" by any stretch of the imagination. The highlight was the pool area. That's the only place there's any actual sand for the kids to play in. The pool area makes it worth staying here again, just in a regular garden room -- not a pricey bay-view bungalow. My advice: pick the cheapest room, enjoy Sea World, the zoo and Balboa Park for most of your time, and allow for plenty of pool time. As little room time as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific visit at Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay at the Paradise Point Hotel. The room was nice, (not perfect), but nice. The grounds were beautiful. We went over spring break and the tempature rarely went above the low 70s, so we were greatful that the Paradise Point offered 2 heated pools. The pool tempature was VERY warm and my family enjoyed playing in the water for hours. The staff was friendly and responsive. After reading several negative reviews prior to my trip, I was very concerned, but I was pleasantly surprised to find the Paradise Point to be the perfect accommodation for our family. If you are looking for top of the line luxury, look somewhere else. But, if you are looking for a very pleasant, relaxing and enjoyable hotel, this is a great place. My kids loved it and they already want to return.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing ”
Reviews.Author: Santu
Reviews.Content: Little duplex bungalows located within a 44 acre resort. Old with mature landscaping. Interiors have been updated. We stayed in a one bedroom bayside parlour suite. Very nice, bedroom small, but had dual sinks with toilet and tub inbetween. Small bayside patio with not so comfortable chairs. Very quiet atmosphere. But the best is the spa. If you are looking for a great massage, facial, etc. in San Diego. This is it. Had a stone massage by Matt, pedicure by Trisha, and facial by Bree. Loved everyone. Not cheap and they automatically add the 20% gratuity to your bill. Ate at the Balleen Restaurant. Wonderful "Lobster Martini" for an appetizer and I had the filet one night for dinner and crabcakes the next night. Came with avacado dip which I don't like, so they made a special tomoto sauce. Very accommodating and a relaxed atmosphere. Resort casual dress. Had room service twice. Since the place is so big, food was slightly cool by the time we received it. It was just okay. Only problem, is they don't come back and get the trays, leave it up to the cleaning people. Biggest drawback, no ceiling fans and no robes in rooms. Quite unusually not to have robes especially at a spa resort. Overall, I would probably go back here only for the spa experience. Pool was crowded with families and small children. Too close I guess to Sea World. Beautiful grounds, friendly staff, we did not have an ant problem, but left our door open one morning and in walked three ducks. Quite comical. Got them out with a few Ritz crackers...... Airport in San Diego is terrible, have been there many times, but now is extremely crowded. Had to wait in line 20 minutes to use the restroom. Treated like cattle throughout the airport. Makes us not want to go back for a short weekend. It deinately needs major overhaul. Too bad because it is so convenient to Las Vegas for us. Beware that security lines are long for check in and there are not enought seats in gate area. Not a pleasant end to a relaxing weekend.

Reviews.Title: “The little things add up....”
Reviews.Author: Tagger87
Reviews.Content: I found this property to be disappointing. There were too many little things that taken together raise big red flags. I was in an upgraded bayview room. I walked in to a strong cleaning scent that wasn't extremely pleasant. I opened the patio door to let the room air out while I unpacked. Minutes later, two ducks were wandering into the room. There was no screen on the door (even though there was a track for one), so you couldn't leave the door open without the ducks wandering into the room. There were cigarette butts all over the lawn outside the room. The butts remained, even after the landscapers spent the next morning grooming the grounds outside my room. The security lock on the main door to the room appeared to have been reattached before, like the door may have been kicked-in in the past. The ice machine and pop machine were located a good 5+ minute walk from the room and the grounds are very dark at night. The spa was terrible -- small, cheap and overpriced (they constantly are upselling you -- talking you into additional services and/or products. I had a facial and the therapist insisted that I needed a brow waxing and made me feel like I'd be an ugly fool not to let her do it. Then she wanted to sell me very expensive products for my face...). Back to the spa -- no waiting area, no whirlpools, very small saunas and steamrooms and only two showers in the locker room. And they only gave you one small bath towel. There were no piles of towels anywhere in the locker room -- just one small towel in your assigned locker. The "business center" was a joke. I wanted to FedEx some materials back to my office, so I went to the "business center" to find an unstaffed room with computers, printers, fax machines and credit card readers for your payment. No packing materials, etc. I went to the front desk and was told to go to the conciege. The conciege couldn't give me a box and waybill, but would take my items, have me fill out a long form and have "the shipping department" send them for me (for a fee). No thanks. I carried my items back on the plane. I think the place just needs a little more TLC and needs to be managed by a company that will bring higher standards. The meeting and banquet space did appear to be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is not called Paradise for nothing! We stayed with family in the cabanas for 3 nights. We rented all three rooms and it was great to leave it open during the day but then have the privacy at night. It was absolutely incredible to go and let the kids swim in the bath water temperature pool that was absolutely immaculately maintained, then come back to the room to relax and the kids could go look for sea shells on the beach. We had bon fires at night-(I recommend bringing wood or buying some if you are traveling from a far distance like I was). We roasted hot dogs and made s'mores. It was AWESOME. The rooms were as immaculate as the grounds, I don't know how they do it with the sand from the beach just outside your door but they did a great job. Sea World is just down the street and we were able to sit out at our bon fire and watch the fireworks from the park on the weekend nights. The small kitchen area was great as well, the microwave was great for heating my nephews bottles and the fridge allowed us to keep hot dogs on hand for the bon fires. There are tons of activities that are offered as well and my only regret was not making the time to use the jet skis and kayaks-they had kayakers leaving from the beach in the morning just outside our door- (How cool is that?). They also offer an unbelivable spa and my mother recieved the whole treatment-she absolutely loved it! Overall I would highly recommend this resort. We only stayed the short 3 nights and then went on to Anaheim but didn't want to leave and plan to return for a full week next year!

Reviews.Title: “paradise on the beach”
Reviews.Author: UkCarlos10
Reviews.Content: I also was worried after reading previous reviews but decided to carry on expecting the worst. Got there and they didn't have any record of our booking (I felt at this point I was right to be worried). Luckily they were not booked up and because of the confusion gave us a room right on the beach. With kids of 7 and 10 this was fantastic. After a hard day out enjoying ourselves ,beach for kids, relaxing chair for mum (not on the beach), very nice gym for dad,PERFECT. The room was spotless. The staff were great. What more could you want.l

Reviews.Title: “Not quite paradise...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's funny to me as a Californian how people from England think this hotel is HEAVEN because there is a pool and a jacuzzi. That's pretty standard in every hotel here. But, if you're looking for one of those warm weather resorts with a huge pool near the ocean - this is definitely NOT it. I live in Los Angeles and we drove down for a few days with our 6 year-old daughter. This place is a great location if you're headed to Sea World. (It's next door.) And it was loaded with folks from England who we enjoyed meeting. But, it had some kinks that bugged me. When we arrived (a bit before the 4 PM check-in) the computer was down and they couldn't check us in. We had to wait an hour to check-in. The main pool is not very big and the jacuzzi is small and up the steps from the pool. There are three other pools on the property - but the others are much smaller and only one other one is heated. (It was chilly when we were there.) There is only one jacuzzi. This might seem picky - but, this is a huge complex with dozens of rooms. If the weather had been warmer and more people were in the pool and jacuzzi - you wouldn't have been able to move. As it was - I kept bumping into people when I was swimming. Our room was a lanai room - no view of anything except the parking lot in front of our room. Okay, that's what we paid for, but forget about the barbecue pit and view of the water unless you want to pay $300 a night. (Not really worth it.) Our room was conveniently located next to the main lobby and pool though. And it gave us easy access to our car. There seemed to be a lot of hidden costs where you felt nickel and dimed: $18 for parking, $10 to use the gym. The food at the restaurant was not very good and overpriced and the service was poor. And if you want to order one of those tropical drinks while you sit by the pool - it's $9.00. Oh and leave the golf clubs at home - that silly putting course they have is for kids and they charge extra to use it! Our first morning we were woken up by the gardeners at 6:15 AM mowing the lawn right outside our room. We complained and got $50 off the room. But, I would have prefered the sleep. That afternoon we returned from Sea World to find my earrings were missing from the room. We complained again and got more money off - but, again I would have preferred the return of my opal earrings. The rooms are nicely decorated in "country" style. But, the maid short-sheeted our beds every night and by morning I was sleeping on a bare mattress. When you go to San Diego you have three choices of areas to stay in: the Gaslamp area downtown which is terrific - you can walk everywhere. But, maybe not the best place for families with young children. There's Old Town which is a must see, another walking area and some nice hotels are there, (Best Western Hacienda is wonderful) but you might get some freeway traffic noise. Then there is the Mission Bay area near Sea World. Paradise Point is really on a point that juts out into Mission Bay. You have to know though that this is a marina and boating area - and you are not allowed to swim at the beach across from the hotel. The other problem with Paradise Point is that you have to drive to get to anything. You can't walk to restaurants or stores or pick up the trolley to Mexico like in the Gaslamp or Old Town area. Still I think if you have kids you might like the space at Paradise Point where the kids can run around. San Diego is a compact city though (unlike LA!) and Old Town and downtown San Diego are only a few minutes drive away. If you stay at Paradise Point, I'd suggest getting your drinks and some snacks at the grocery store. Thankfully there's a small (empty) fridge in the room and if you just drive down the road from the hotel you'll find a Von's and Ralphs. There are some things to reccomend this hotel: the staff at the front desk was courteous, the hotel was clean and well maintained and there was an effort to accomodate the guests. There's some nice touches on the property like the fountains that turn into torches at night. I'm sure the spa is nice - although I didn't have a treatment. But, I have to tell you the $10 for the gym was worth it because it also alllows you to use the eucalyptus steam room in the spa - now that was HEAVEN!

Reviews.Title: “How can you not love this property?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back 4/12/2005. After booking I read the reviews which seem to be quite varied, so we simply prepared for the worst of the reviews to be partly true. I cannot recall a more delightful stay!!! We booked a garden lanai but wished we had a room on the bay, once we got there. For $25 more per night we were moved to a room on the bay for our remaining two nights. Not only that, but we were at Sea World, so all we had to do was round up our suitcases and leave them together in the room. The bellman came by when the new room was ready and moved our bags. I was afraid we'd have to check out at noon and back in at 4, but no, they moved us directly over at 3:30. I don't understand the parking complaints, your space is reserved and right at your front door. So $18.00 is a little steep, but the overall cost is not. People that don't bring a car probably appreciate this expense not being "included". Food was great at the restaurants, every single staff member was cheery and polite. Every big "tower" hotel we drove past we all agreed "I'm glad we're not staying there!" My boys 11 and 13 will absolutely NOT sleep in the same bed and in any other hotel I've been in when there are 2 queen beds they do not allow a rollaway. These guys did. Not only that, but in our particular room the closet was soooo big that the rollaway fit in the closet and we still had plenty of room for everthing else, including accessing the door that went from the closet to the back end of the bathroom! What fun. On our last day our plane didn't leave until 10:00pm so after check out we were permitted to use the grounds the entire day. I will go only there whenever I return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had 3 joining rooms. 2 of them were bugalows. The view was awesome. We got to see seaworld fireworks everynite while doing a bonfire with the kids. Which is located in front of your bugalow when you open your door. The Adults and kids loved it. We made new friends at the bonfire and it was so relaxing at day and night. The rooms were awesome, especially the beds, they were heaven. We loved the pool and jacuzzi it was "HEAVEN". After a long day at seaworld, sand diego zoo try the jacuzzi it is heaven. put your feet on the jet stream it is "WONDERFUL". My mom went to the spa and love every minute of it. We like the fact that in the day we can open the doors and it can become one big house and at night close the doors and have privacy. The staff was awesome, my husband and I tipped the bellmen 20 dollars and I have never tipped someone that much. Very professional and friendly with the kids. My 7 and 14 year old son loved him. I recommend if you stay there to make sure you leave your shoes and sandals outside of the rooms. Due to all the sand, because the bay is right there. I dont know how they keep the rooms up but our room was very well kept and beautiful. We stayed there for 4 nights and headed to anaheim to disney and universal. We all wished we stayed there for our whole entire vacation. great food, great service, great place to vacation. This resort has made our vacation a memorable one. We are still talking about it. I highly recommend this resort. We already have planned to stay here next year and planned to stay there our entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “wish we were still there”
Reviews.Author: oersue
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights at Paradise Point in the garden rooms, check in went smoothly and there were no problems with the room. The beds were very comfortable and rooms well equipt, our room was a stone's through away from one of the pools, ( this was heated ) as many towels as you required were availabe for your use at the poolside and deposited for laundering when finished with, plenty of sun beds at all times of day. We ate in both of the resteraunts and found the food very good, only one small moan the cost of coffee in the Bellene was very high. San Diego is an amazing place to visit with many different areas, The Old Town is well worth a look, so is the Gas Lamp Quater, dont' forget Wyour visit to Sea World which is a short way from your accomadation. For the shoppers out there Fashion Valley is amazing. I hope to visit San Diego again and would not hesitate to book Paradise Point for my visit,

Reviews.Title: “tropical paradise in san diego”
Reviews.Author: draycot2
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews we were a little worried about our visit , however we found the hotel name very apt, you really are in paradise. The resort is a tropical oasis with very good standard accomodation and excellant staff. We certainly did not have any problem with service or ants in the room. The only slight downside was the maid service, although very thorough the room was often not serviced until 5.00pm. The bayside grill is excellant and in a lovely setting. We did also have an excellant meal at the Balleen restaurant, but this was quite expensive, especially for children and the added service charge, the coffee at $8 dollars was expensive. The resort is situated ideally for the old town and the Gaslamp Quarter and only a mile from Seaworld. If you are looking for a relaxing tropical resort then Paradise piont is a must

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought the place was great! Accomodations are totally cute, and I am a hotel snob. You get an individual cabana so your walls aren't on top of anyone elses. You get your own back patio with a little meadow in back, there you can see everyones back door, but still very private. Has its own fridge and microwave, close by ice machines. The decor is little country house. Not too over modern. Bed is comfy. You can go get drunk on one side of the complex and the little golf cart will bring you back to your little cabana and be nice. Room service, spectacular, however pricey. Do plan on tipping, as there are lots of people to serve you

Reviews.Title: “Fair, at best.”
Reviews.Author: UncleBoomsky
Reviews.Content: Very pricey--so then again is most of San Diego. We were greeted by a long line of angry people waiting to check in. Rooms simply were not ready and available as scheduled. While waiting we were offered the option of going to get food at one of the restaurants. I have a peanut allergy and even though I asked, yes they served me peanuts. They were most unhelpful in managing that having security ask me questions to protect them from lawsuit but pretty much left me on my own to find medical care. Even when I didn't eat peanuts, food was fair. Parking a disaster. We were promised a full size crib but they only had pack and plays. On the whole, it seemed like a place that wanted to do it right but was run by a bunch of amateurs. At least the Dan Brown's book that I brought along was a good read.

Reviews.Title: “will never go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week's stay at the Paradise Point Resort. My husband and I took our 9 and 12 year old daughters for spring break. The minute we walked into the lobby of the hotel to check in, the lobby had a terribly musty smell which was very noticeable and the people in line in front and in back of me were all talking about the same thing. When we got to our room, we were again disappointed in the room. The size of the room was o.k., but the section of the room where the vanity was, the toilet, shower and walk in closet were all covered with ants.Ants on the floor, on the ceiling, in tub, on the clothes that you were trying to shake out to wear that day. Ants were with us the entire week. I have never felt so dirty in an resort as I did here. The accomodations were very dated, and not much to speak of and the room curtains were terribly stained and dirty as well. We found the food in the resort to be disappointing and very expensive. The staff we found to not be of tremendous help including the concierge. We were charged $18.00 a night to park our car which was across the street from the room. They had miniature golf, which was not very elaborate and the charge for that was $9.00per person (including children). I would certainly never stay here again nor would I stay at any other Noble House property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: JoGo13
Reviews.Content: We visited the Paradise Point Hotel in March, 2005. I can only say that we had a wonderful experience. The rooms, although not very fancy...were more than adequate, were clean and had very comfortable beds, not usually found away from home. The service was exceptional with all the hotel employees being friendly, helpful and always polite. The restaurants were excellent, the grounds absolutely beautiful...with lush tropical plants and folliage. The spa was lovely and added to a most relaxing and enjoyable vacation. With something for people of all ages, I would recommend Paradise Point to anyone. Before leaving for this vacation, I read many reviews with some being quite negative...I will tell you that not one of the terrible things I read were experienced by us. To be honest, everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. I cannot wait to return for another absolutely perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!! Beautiful paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: MJfortworth
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a week. March 11-18. It was a wonderful place. The beachfront bungalow was amazing. A great view out the door and windows and very private. The service at the hotel was very good and the room was clean and the bed turned down when we came back every day. The entire island is beautifully landscaped and around every corner there are beautiful flowers and lush gardens with palm trees. The fancy restaurant, Baleen, is absolutely perfect for a nice dinner. Outside patio seating is ideal and the food is first class. The informal Barefoot Bar and Grill is great for a casual meal. It is right in front of the Bay and it is a fun atmosphere that makes you feel like you are on a tropical island. The Marina is right across the walkway and there are plenty of sailboats, jet skis, and powerboats for rental, with reasonable prices. Overall, I was very impressed by the hotel and regardless of other reviews, everyone should try it out. I do recommend the rooms directly in front of the bay and beach.. Other rooms are nice but not as impressive. The proximity to the aiport, Sea World, and downtown is great. Perfect location and easy driving from everywhere. This is THE place to stay in San Diego. You will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Go to the Sheraton instead!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ShareTravelInfo
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference here for almost a week. Was told to wait for a golf cart attendant to guide me to my room. Waited 20 minutes and ended up finding it on my own. Opened the door to my "bungalow" and the smell of bleach almost knocked me over. The walls and furniture had mold on them. Furnishings looked like something a shelter would have. Checked out and went to the Sheraton downtown. Many complaints from others who did stay there for the conference - they charge extra for everything. $10 for a half hour to rent a bike and $18 for a full hour. $18 a day to park in the space reserved for the bungalow. $10 to use the gym. Stayed there years ago when it was run by Princess resorts and it was gorgeous. It's a disgrace now.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a refresher”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The website makes this place look like paradise, but it was average. The room smelled musty and moldy, perhaps because it was close to the water. I opened the mini fridge to find someone's old guacamole and sour cream. I called the front desk and they asked if I would like it removed. What kind of question is that? The towels were smelly, also. The staff was friendly but would drive by in their golfcarts while I was carrying luggage in the rain and not offer to help. Be careful walking around at night. It's very dark and easy to get lost. The grounds were very pretty and the spa was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We took a family trip in July 2004 and fell in love with the Paradise Point Resort that we didn't want to leave! We had none of the problems that are in some of the other reviews. We had just the opposite. Our rooms were very clean & nice and offered plenty of room for a family of 4. The staff was nice, courteous & helpful. The food was good. Our 2 children had a blast at the pool & playing on the beach and feeding the ducks. It is very family oriented.The grounds are covered in all types of blooming colorful hibiscus and plants, it's very beautiful. The environment is tropical & serene. We have already booked our trip for this summer and are staying longer because we had such a wonderful experience, it is now an annual family trip. It is definatley worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I expected...”
Reviews.Author: GilhamStreet
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews of this hotel I was expecting to find the words "Helter Skelter" scrawled in blood on the wall of our room when I opened the door. I was happy (and quite relieved) to find them painted a rather cheery shade of yellow. The room itself was clean & tidy. It did have a slight mildewy smell, but one you really only notice when you first walk in, and certainly not enough to poison us in our sleep. The grounds were well maintained, with some bird poo here and there, but unless the grounds crew followed the ducks around with a roll of paper and some bleach, I don't think it could be avoided. The main pool area was a nice place for a swim or to have a cocktail and relax. My boyfriend and I stayed over a weekend, and I'd say the majority of guests seemed to be families with small children and groups of girls on Bachlorette weekends, fine for us, but I don't know how romantic it would be for honeymooners. Overall, the worst part of the trip was having to deal with the traffic on the way down from Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: groovynet
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I read all the bad reviews on this site, so frankly, I was skeptical about staying there, however, the convention was booked and our room was paid for, so we decided to take our chances :) I must say that I was very pleased with our room and the grounds and our stay there! Okay, they do charge $18 a night to PARK (UNREAL!!!), so be aware! The room was clean, and the resort was lovely. We had a $400/night room so I would expect it to be over the top. Loved the patio, with lounge chairs, and all the beautiful flowers and green green green everywhere. We didn't dine in the restaurants on site (everything was catered for convention), the beach was clean and very pretty. I can say that I was really pleasantly surprised and happy with our stay there and I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be misled by the website”
Reviews.Author: Camando
Reviews.Content: I proposed to my fiancé here last spring and I was fortunate to find some private moments to do so amongst the plethora of children running around. The staff were very helpful, especially the concierge and bell staff. Upon selecting a nice private location providing us with some beachfront and seclusion we decided on Paradise Point. The website images lured us with visions of privacy and exclusivity. It was to much dismay that upon arrival we were "nickel and dimed" for every service and "perk" offered at the resort. To our surprise to park on the concrete pad in front of our room actually costs an additional fee. They ballyhooed amount of swimming pools were chocker blocked full of kids, which led us to the adult pools which were deathly cold or under construction. The room we had was quite nice (as it should be) for we paid considerably more to be on the beach. I could not imagine staying in any of the rooms not on the beach because of all the traffic and noise. The restaurants were great with some fantastic vistas, especially in the evenings. However, the dining room was a bit costly for what we expected. Essentially the resort is more kid friendly than couple friendly, which we should have known based on it's proximity to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It. don't know where the bad reviews are coming from.”
Reviews.Author: JK&JS
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed there for Valentine's Day with my girlfriend. I live in the area but threw together a quick surprise for my girlfriend. I was a little cautious after reading mixed reviews. Although, I've come to realize that these reviews can often be tainted because people didn't get the weather they wanted or had other bad experiences beyond the control of a hotel. I've stayed at several luxury resorts for work such as the Ritz-Carlton (Naples, Boston, Atlanta, San Juan), Westin Diplomat, The Jefferson (Richmond), Loews Coronado, and several other. Paradise Point is not at that level but I paid at least $200 less per night. I thought the grounds were gorgious and I found the staff extremely nice and friendly. I thought the rooms were comfortable and nice. I really enjoyed the privacy and layout of the resort. All the rooms are "bungalow' style. They upgraded us to a bay view after I told them about the occasion and because there was availability. The room was a bit musty at first but the mositure we've had in area is probably the cause of that. After we opened the patio door and let the breeze come through the room, it was very nice. We ate lunch at the grill. I didn't find it as expensive as everyone else in these reviews. It's not fast-food prices and the food was good. All and all we both thought the property was nice and well worth the cost. It offers a lot more than a cookie-cutter downtown hotel. The best advise I could give is to take these reviews with a grain of salt. I would definitely recommend this resort if you're looking for affordable accomodations in a great location. It offers you a resort feel and more on-site activities than a chain hotel downtown.

Reviews.Title: “All the bad postings are true”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I did not listen to the bad reviews of this property, their website makes it seem like a 5-star resort. but, DO NOT STAY HERE. We just returned from a 1 night trip that I had won a $200 gift certificate for from work. The room was small, I asked for 1 king bed, got 2 queens instead, the bathrooms were DISCUSTING, the toilet had so much mold under the tank lid it was caked on about 1/2 an inch wide, which you could only see if you were sitting in the bath tub or bend down in the shower. The door to the closet was broken which made it unaccessable. The furnature was warped which made the drawers unable to open without a huge tug that I thought was going to bring down the 25" TV. The wicker chair in the corner was FILLED with dust and the lamp shade was torn at ever edge. There were ants in the bathroom & on the counters, which given the wet "tropical" surroundings I guess it could be expected. The bed mattress was the only thing that was actually nice about the room. The window that looked out on to the "lagoon" collected so much moisture we couldnt even see out of it. and that "lagoon" turned out to be a small shallow duck pond that looked more like water collected in a rain storm. The heater was so bad, 1 it didnt work that well, 2, it was so loud we couldnt sleep when it was halfway working. there is a small frig on the shelf next to the tv that kicked on every 15-20 minutes with a high-pitched whining noise. We decided to rent a movie off the tv but just after choosing to buy the $11.99 flick my fiance accidently hit the channel button instead of the volumn and we were not able to get back to the movie selection. We had to call the front desk and verify we werent charged for a movie we didnt even get to watch, they said we were not charged but that the movie was no longer available because only so many rooms can rent a particular movie at once. It didnt help matters that I sat on hold trying to talk to the front desk for over 5 minutes. Upon checkout I was just waiting for that "How was your stay question" so I could tell them I'll never stay there again, but they never asked. Perhaps they got tired of hearing people say they hated the place. I HONESTLY FELT DIRTY AFTER STAYING AT THIS PLACE AND HAD TO SHOWER THE SECOND I GOT HOME.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in june of 2004 but only for 2 nights as we had booked prior to our hols. When we arrived it was like another world as we had driven from la and after our 2 nights were up we wished we had booked another 1 here and less in la!! Nothing was too much trouble for anyone, the food was great, the room was really nice, the loo backed up when we first used it but the guy came out within 5 mins and sorted the job out, had a lovely time here, we are going to go back this year and stay for longer , it was the highlight of our stay in the states ( and we had done vegas and la in the same trip ) . I do not understand the bad reviews i have read but all i can say is i can't reccomend this place enough.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review, since I don't want to waste anymore brain cells on this hotel/resort. I had heard they are notorious for calling people the week before a visit and telling them they didn't have a room for them anymore, due to a "convention extending its stay" (i.e. thay overbooked and needed to cancel people now. But I booked here anyway (I must secretly love pain!). And yes, they called us 5 days before the trip WITH THIS SAME STORY!!! They instead told us they had a room for us at the one-star hotel down the street. Obviosuly, we passed and scrammbled to rearrange our flights and hotel to go somewhere else in Southern California that week. They were not the least bit sorry or apologetic about this. So BUYER BEWARE!!!! This place has a reputation for cancelling people's stays the week before, offering a horrendous alternative - and generally treating people terribly. Stay somewhere else and save yourself the ulser (By the way, it's not that nice either - we checked it out when down there and were frankly glad we got booted once we saw how run down and below par it really was!)

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Starting with the lobby....looks like is hasn't been decorated since the mid seventies. We were driven to our bungalow in a golf cart. It was raining (pouring)and our cart did not have the plastic covering that the other carts had, so by the time we reached the room, we were soaking wet. Upon opening our door to our room, all I could smell, was a disgusting moldy, musty smell. The heater barely worked, and the drapes were falling off the window and they had a big rip in them! The walls of the room looked like someone had ripped off the wallpaper and then painted over it before fixing all the holes and divots. We had friends in other rooms and they also complained of a terrible musty smell along with other room issues....old worn sheets, loud clanging heater. They should have paid me to stay here, not the other way around. They should spend some of that $$ they are overcharging people and use it to give this property a MAJOR FACELIFT. I couldn't wait to check out....I will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Big price for pretty surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Mardy1
Reviews.Content: I too was feeling nervous about my reservations here. We stayed the week between Christmas and New Years. I requested adjoining rooms so my husband and I could have some privacy. That is not what we got but we arrived late and decided to take care of it the next morning. Note to self, ask to SEE the room(s) your reserving before checking in. We toured some awful rooms. The comments about musty smells, ants and no privacy were right on. We even found a pile of beer cans off of the back patio of one unit in the Hibiscus section! I think the rooms in the Orchid section tend to be nicer, specially if you're going for a bay view. In the end, we took our orginal room with a patio out back and put my boys in another room (same configuration but w/ 2 Q's) 2 doors down. Both were clean and private and could be accessed from either the front door or patio (the room between us had a front patio only). We only ate at the Barefoot Grill and liked the food. Room service was was prormpt and friendly and the concierge was helpful. Skip the golf, nothing fancy here. We got a deal on the rooms since we were there off-season but still I would not pay that kind of money again just for beautiful grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: tigardguy
Reviews.Content: Pretty much every less than favorable review is correct. We experenced everything bad that every reviewer seemed to experence and though it all - we still had a good time! We stayed for a week during Thanksgiving 2004. It started off at check in - we were told that the water was not working and they were not sure when it would be turned on. We were told not to use the bathroom or use any water at all. If you had to wash your hands please use bottled water and you will not be charge. My wife was less than pleased, luckily, our flight was not that long so no one had to take shower. I remembered that we were on on island and these things do happen. After my wife had the maintence people provide a bucket of water so we could use the toilet - we had to discuss if we were going to really stay here for a week. At 11:00pm - 7 hours after check in - the water came back on. The room itself was Ok, nothing really special and it really didn't match the polynesian island theme. Three people taking showers, you will run out of hot water. We had a garden - lagoon view and by the weeks end, we had bugs inside (we were being careful about that too) the room. Somethings just seemed strange to us but that could be just where we are from - Oregon & Japan. At the begining of the week, there must have been about ten people in the whole hotel - the staff out numbered us two to one. It was off season and it was fun to have the run of the place even though I felt a little uneasy about eating in a restuarant and we're the only people there. Though out this, they would charge for everything; parking and miniture golf ($16 & $9 per person) fitness center...everything! If they could find a way to squeeze a dime out of you, they will try (duck and fish food were @1.25 each)! Maid service was Ok, once during the week they miss us and we had to call. Room service was quick and they had no problem in sending us extra plates and silverware. By Thanksgiving, the place started to fill up. Total, must of been about half full but it felt very pack. I cannot imagine this place completly full -parking, swiming even the rooms with their very thin walls would be horrible. The problems with check out were there - a mystery charge of $8.00 for water appeared. But we checked our bill using the in room system through the televison and called to clear it up before leaving. The funny thing about this whole ordeal was that I contacted the hotel via e-mail before we arrived and express my concerns about staying here. I pointed out many of things that I have read in the other reviews in this section and was reassured that none of this would come to pass. Even with all this, the grounds were just great. We brought our own scooters and was really alot of fun going through the maze of trails and roads. We tried swiming once at he main pool but the water wasn't really heated so we didn't stay to long. The location of the hotel is fantastic, nothing except for maybe the Wild Animale Park, is thirty minutes away. And once you get the "lay of the land" getting around is really easy. Over Thanksgiving weekend, they lit the Christmas lights and they were absolutely beautiful. So even with all the little things, it still was pleasant experence. I read on the door or somewhere that the maxium price for the room is $350 per night. I feel that the room was really worth about $125.00 plus $16 for parking and $5.00 for tax. If any questions about anything San Diego, Oregon or Japan please feel free to contact me!

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed Paradise Point”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Paradise point for the Thanksgiving holidays. I was very nervous as the reviews on this website were scarey !! But, we were Pleasantly Surprised !! Got a great deal on the room through a brochure sent home from my son's school. I think it is getawaytoday. Super company with whom to work. Anyway, we ABSOLUTELY LOVED the property. The number one benefit is its location - right on a point in mission bay. It takes away the hustle and bustle of being in a large city. Our Family felt safe and secure as well being nicely tucked away from the party scene of some of the other properties in the area. The pool was excellent and very clean. We ate at Barefoot Bar & grill for breakfast.....that's a little pricey, they charge a lot for juice ($3.95 i think)......But it was beautiful and worth it. Pretty standard for resorts. We also took advantage of room service quite a bit and found it a better option as we brought our own juice and other drinks and put them in the refrigerator there in the room. That worked out REALLY WELL. Another great feature was kids meals on the room service menu priced at $4.50. That Rocked. The rooms were quite nice but you have to keep in mind that this is an older property.........it's not brand new and does show some wear and tear....however, the features that were upgraded were the ones important to us. Marble in the bathroom, granite counter tops, nice shower head, new bedding and shower curtains, upgraded lighting, new carpet, etc. It's definitely a big property, so pick your location wisely.....certainly should ask for a room that DOES NOT overlook the parking lot. Also should have your kids bring skate boards and scooters as there are many trails throughout the property and it was a fun way to get around. IT's a perfect family destination.....we'll absolutely be back ! We looked at several other hotels while in the area and couldn't find one that we'd preference. I definitly recommend Paradise Point to Families. It was super.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the paradise point”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read the Trip Advisor reviews prior to staying at the hotel and apprehensively decided to commit based on location, the more positive reviews I had read here, and the website. I was actually VERY pleasantly surprised upon arriving at the hotel and was still pleased after 5 days of staying at the resort with my staff and family (taking up 3 different rooms). Yes, the prices at the restaurant seemed a little high for family style eating and the spa was pricey as well, and some of the features in the room were slightly worn, but there were so many positive things about the hotel that outweighed any negative marks I've seen written about to date. First of all, the setting is just beautiful. The grounds are extremely unique with the lush landscaping, ponds, wildlife, and so forth. Moreover, the main pool/jacuzzi area is equally beautiful and great fun to swim in for kids and adults alike. While the bedroom we stayed in was a little dusty perhaps at first and had a torn screen door, it is hard to find such spacious rooms with such comfortable beds and linens anywhere. Moreover, any issues we asked housekeeping to attend to were promptly addressed. I also really liked how the rooms all had patios that went out to lovely gardens and ponds. It made for some very relaxing morning coffee sessions with my husband! Finally, I found the staff most helpful. At times, the facility seemed a little understaffed, but we also visited at an off-peak time, so this wasn't a big problem. Once Thanksgiving week rolled around, I saw many more staff on site, so I'm sure it is a function of numbers of people checked into the hotel. All in all, I highly recommend the resort and feel it should be highly rated for its uniqueness and character in particular. Any issues encountered while on site will be quickly addressed by the friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but disappointed by the bungalows”
Reviews.Author: spmclw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thought that the location and the landscaping of the resort were beautiful. We stayed in early November 2004. Everything in and around the resort seemed to be very well maintained. Our kids loved the main pool. Unfortunately, I have to agree with some of the other reviews regarding the guestrooms. The bungalow we stayed in had a run down look to it. One of the table lamps barely functioned. The sheets on the sofa bed were worn. One of the doors to the bathroom would not close because it was coming off its hinges. And, the walls had multiple scuff marks. The staff quickly fixed most of these issues. The wood was painted with a faux "distressed" motif. Unfortunately, most of the doors and cabinets were really distressed. On the plus side the bathroom area was very clean. It was a beautiful location, but not a very good value for the money. I was especially annoyed by the $16 a night vehicle fee they charged.

Reviews.Title: “most wonderful”
Reviews.Author: FIONA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on 3 seperate occasions. I have just read some of the reviews and dont understand the negative ones. I have always found this place to be beautiful, calm and very relaxing. The whole place is just like paradise. The rooms are very nice inside. This October when we stayed there was alot of children but that was only because there was a beauty pagent for young girls taking place. We hardly saw any children on our previous visits. I will keep coming here year after year as I love San Diego & the Paradise Point

Reviews.Title: “A taste of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: meathwoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 04 for 2 nights. We were very surprised when we arrived at the size of the place. Our room was very spacious with large living area and very clean. The only problem was the air conditioning, it was not pumping too much cool air, but we got that problem rectified and someone came to fix it while we were out to dinner. We ate at the restaurant onsite, there was a big crowd there due to it being a saturday night so we had to wait over an hour for food, but there was a band and entertainment outdoors which made up for it. We stayed mostly at the smaller pool (quieter than the larger one) and it was closer to our room. Check out was quick however they added someone elses restaurant bill to our room so make sure to check it. They rectified the problem and found out where the charge was to go and placed it on the correct bill problem solved. Would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel in its Class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from Paradise Point and upon reading the previous review I feel compelled to respond Being there on the same date as the previous reviewer I am staggered to read what I did Like others I too was concerned by the less than favourable reviews this hotel had but decided to go with it after being assured by United Vacations of the hotels quality. Having just left the Venetian in Vegas (Brilliant by the way) we headed South for San Diego and Paradise Point. Arriving in darkness did not help our check in as we ended up in a large conference hall foyer which was deserted which we thought was reception, at that point I did have great concerns about where we were staying, but once u grasp the size of this place our mistake was an easy one to make. Once we found reception checking in was simple and quick and CERTAINLY NOT Delapidated!!! we were guided to our room by a man in a golf cart who also took the kids along for a ride. The room was large, Very clean (including the carpet) it looked out on to a stream the patio did have debris on it but after the storms thay had full acceptable, it was cleaned in a couple of days. The Oueen sized bed was the best we had ever slept in really excellent my only critisisim was the bath way too small with a little rusting round the overflow but nothing major. The pools were also very good the groundstaff were having a very difficult time with the weather and the leaves but did a remarkable job my whole family really enjoyed their time at the pool no birds or bird poo NOTHING and as for being overrun with kids this is complete nonsense this was a very quite week, my children were struggling to find other kids to play with for the whole duration, one day we had the whole main pool to the four of us I would recommend this hotel, this is not The Coronado!! its Paradise Point a diffterent style and Class of hotel but never the lees very good in its own right. I have pictures available if anyone wants to see for themselves and I assure u No Poo, No Delapidated Reception, No Hoards of Children, no Dirty looking Pool just a really nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “A real let down!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on our honeymoon with Kuoni, we had already spent some time in San Fransisco and Las Vegas and really were having the holiday of a lifetime........that was until we arrived at Paradise Point. I had read some reviews so was a bit concerned but Kuoni had assured me it was a fantastic place. The first thing to hit us was the horrible damp smell everywhere, reception was really run down and dilapidated, and had a smell of air freshener trying to cover up the damp smell. After checking in (took a while), we were taken to our room which was was so dark due to all the overgrown trees and bushes, and the patio outside was really mouldy and damp. The room smelt really damp, the carpet was filthy making our feet black, and the bathroom stank of cooking pasta? We kept hoping things would get better, but when we ventured outside we found the beach to be dirty and smelly, everything was covered in bird poo and everywhere was overrun with kids!! The pool was also green and looked very uninviting. What made matters worse the shop sold bird food to encourage more poo to the resort - I would have thought it would be unhygenic with all of the open pools! I was so upset I would rather have flown home than stay at Paradise Point. Luckily Kuoni managed to move us the next morning to the Del Coronado (fantastic), and we had a great rest of honeymoon. I really wouldn't recommend this resort (& spa - what a joke!) at all we thought it was terrible!

Reviews.Title: “A quick trip”
Reviews.Author: BandNLady
Reviews.Content: We took our kids to PP for a quick weekend during Fall Break. I scheduled this trip with the best internet travel agent I have encounted, jpmauer@verizon.net. She booked this property and promised that we would not be disappointed. I called the day before our arrival to verify our reservation. The operator was extremely nice. I requested a room by the heated pool, and we let me know he would do everything possible to make that happen. We checked in late, and our room was absolutely perfect. Great location!! 20 feet from the pool!! We had a fruit basket and spring water in our room when we arrived. That was a very nice touch. The grounds were beautiful. We were by the lilly pond where my children enjoyed playing with the ducks. Hey Aflac! Although we were gone most of the days, we did get a chance to hang out by the pool, and eat at the restaurant in the marina (barefoot, I think). Our waiter was very attentive and really nice. But the food was a bit pricey for what you get. If you go to Seaworld, the zoo, or the animal park wear comfy shoes, lots of walking!! Overall it was a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point the good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: RKBB
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Paradise Point on October 4th, 5th and checked out on the 6th. (Family of 5 Dad, Mom, Kids 15, 11 and 6) Upon arriving the grounds look great - you feel like you are arriving at a resort in Hawaii. The Lobby is very attractive. We had booked a Lanai Garden Room, but upon arrival my husband decided to upgrade to a bayside suite. The checkin attendant was quick and friendly. The Bellman that drove us to our room by golf cart was very friendly. Upon arriving my husband told me that the room was not as nice as he expected, but not terrible. The kids slept out in the living room on the pull out couch. We had a king size bed in a separate bedroom. A single bathroom is shared by all. The toiled is in with the shower so one person at a time had the whole bathroom. The room definitely showed it's age. The Bay outside was ok, but there were signs about the water not being safe after a rain (runoff). We did not feel that the bay water was swimmable and was cold. The room had a kitchenette, but no utensils, etc... That night we were cold (being from Phoenix) and turned on the heater. Our room filled with smoke and the fire alarm went off. No one called or noticed from the front desk. We fanned the room out till the alarm stopped. It was late and we did not want to change rooms so we went to bed with the smell of smoke in the room. The next morning we called the front desk. They did not seem to care about it - said they would send a repairman while we were at Seaworld. No apology, etc... We decided to see how the repair went. Seaworld was great. Our daughter got splashed by Shamu so when we got back to the room she layed her wet sweatshirt out on our deck chair. The sweatshirt was from Paris and had sentimental value for her. Well in the morning it was gone. She was crying and called the front desk to see if anyone had turned it in. They did not seem interested - did not act like they cared - and did not have it. I know it should not have been left outside, but they could have been like - oh no! We will definitelykeep our eyes open and watch for it (ie at least feign fake concern). The heater did work the second night so we did not pursue that issue. The last morning we called to see if we could get a late check out (a Weds in the middle of October) and they said no. There hotel book says to ask about late check out, but I guess they were busy?! We did check out then go to the pool for awhile. The pool is very nice. In summary the good points are the beautiful grounds, great pool - nice and heated, the barefoot cafe - where the staff was actually very nice! The bad points are substandard accomodations for the price, mostly uncaring staff. I would only stay here at a discounted rate - definitely not for full price!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Paradise Point for three nights last week. Check in was a little slow, but overall the staff was very helpful. Our room had a cottage feel to it and was situated right on the bay. The room was clean, had a comfortable bed, and a large bathroom. Given that a lot of children have started their school year, we found the place quiet and peaceful. The breakfasts at Barefoot Bar and Grille were reasonable and tasty. Our dinner at Baleen's was delicious but pricey. We were disappointed that there was a daily fee to use the fitness room as well as a daily parking fee. My spa experience was wonderful and worth the splurge. My biggest complaint would be the cost of everything at the resort, but it seemed to me as if San Diego as a whole is rather expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose this location based on the amenities that were listed for our children. No where in any write up on this property, was it listed that every single thing you want to do is at an extra EXPENSIVE charge. $20/hour for tennis, $20/hour for use of the basketball court and $8/per person for mini golf. For four of us to enjoy minigolf, it would have cost us an additional $40. The room rates are fairly high for this property. I believe that tennis, mini-golf, and use of the basketball court could have been included in the room rate. It is at the Del and at the Marriott properties. We felt cheated and decided to spend our time off-property! Meals were outrageous. For two of us at lunch, with no drinks and no childrens meals, the bill was $56 (chicken ceaser salad, iced tea, hot dog ($11).....just too much to enjoy our stay. Never again...

Reviews.Title: “Only good if you have children”
Reviews.Author: Vegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Mid July for 2 nights We got a cottage with a king bed. The cottage was very pricey, but nice inside. But there is not much privacy on your patio. All the cottages face the bay and the beach area is crawling with kids and people walking by the water. The main pool is nice , again packed with kids. There are satellite pools( 1 is adults only), but they are all outdated and they provide no towel service in these locations. The grounds are lush and very nice. The bay is ok, but not really that scenic when you compare it with the ocean that is right around the corner. The restraurants are very expensive and not worth it. Even for a few drinks. Service was very slow. This place is pricey on all levels, rentals, etc..and not a good place for adults. If you want a place that caters to kids, stay here. Otherwise I would recommend someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: NJSunPrincess
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Saturday night, August 21st via LAX, big mistake! The traffic was horrific. I called ahead to the hotel to tell them of our planned arrival time because I was afraid they might give our previously arranged bayfront room away. The receptionist assured me our room was waiting for us and indeed it was. Arriving at 7pm we were immediately escorted to our beautiful and spacious enough room for our family of four. Huge walk-in closet and big bathroom. The room looked exactly like the picture on the internet. A bowl of fruit with fancy water was a nice greeting. The bed was very comfortable and I had the best sleep of my life because it was very, very quiet. Anyone who is a light sleeper like me knows the value of a good nights sleep!! To me, waking up to the peaceful view of the bay is heaven on earth. We had our morning coffee in the Adirondack chairs and watched the birds swim and the fish jump. From there we went to the Barefoot Bar and Grill and had pleasant service and delicious breakfasts every morning of our stay. Our children, ages 9 and 11, had the buffet and my husband and I ordered from the menu. If your children are big eaters, go for the buffet. The granola encrusted french toast was a favorite. The grounds are amazing! You feel like you are in the Carribean with the lush landscaping and tropical trees and flowers. The main pool was teaming with children who act like children! The pool is heated and clean enough. It is partly surrounded by a sandy beach so the water gets murky. Lots of clean towels and waitresses serving drinks by the pool. Yes, the drinks are expensive. Nothing that you wouldn't expect at a resort. My husband and I shopped at Ralph's in Pacific Beach and bought wine and snacks which we enjoyed while watching the sun set over the bay again from our chairs. The kids loved swimming in the calm bay and looking for marine life which is in abundance. The only other pool we went to was the children's pool which oddly enough was quiet with few children. This is a perfect family vacation even without the distractions of all the other San Diego attractions. Because it is so family-friendly, I am not so sure it is ideal for the couples seeking absolute solitude. I loved our room, the view, the peace and quiet, the landscaping. I would mention, if you are mainly visiting San Diego for the tourist attractions, it might be better to stay in a cheaper hotel since you won't have much time to appreciate the tranquility of the bay and surroundings. We also had our children go to the kid's club for an afternoon. They were well cared for and had a great time. Even though it was extremely expensive, it was worth it for a little alone time with hubby!! I recommend this resort to families who like to sightsee but also like to relax.

Reviews.Title: “In addition...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I forgot to include in my review that the room vanity light bulb was out, but was fixed with a simple call to housekeeping. In addition, the refrigerator, which I relied on heavily for baby formula, smelled like fish and the knob was broken so I couldn't adjust the temp. They came and put a knob on, but I had to go to the market and purchase cleaner to clean out the refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but you do pay for it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a honeymoon package in August 2004. First impressions were great, we were able to check-in at 12.30pm (normal check-in time is 4pm) and our room was very pleasant with a huge bed and separate dining table living room area. There are a number of swimming pools in the complex, catering for couples and families alike and the grounds are absolutely beautiful, both ar daytime and night. Sea Wold is about a 25 minute walk away, however if you do not have a car you will struggle to get to other places in San Diego. I would recommend car hire. The own big downside to this resort is the price of food and drink - the value for money is poor and I would recommend eating offsite in the evening. San Diego is a beautiful city, the old town is great for a night out as is The Gaslamp District, two very contrasting places. Del Coronado is picture postcard stuff as is La Jolla. One word of warning - avoid Tijuana in Mexico unless you after bargains on leather and silver. The place is just full of shops selling rubbish and shopowners hassling you to buy their merchandise. Not an enjoyable experience rounded off by the 90 minute wait at Immigration to get back into the USA. But San Diego is beautiful and our weather was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a romantic getaway. Paradise Point was recommended by several people and I too read all the reviews of it being the romantic second honeymoon place to go. What we got was disneyland. There were 15 kids to every adult. There were kids and families everywhere. We could not even go into the pool because it was always packed. We got lucky and had the room next door throwing a 12 hour bachelor party our first night. We could not move because the place was sold out. Can you feel the romance. The next 3 nights we had a family with a newborn.... The sound of cries in the night lulled us to sleep. The furniture was uncomfortable and the bed was so squeaky and noisy. Paradise, I think not. I think this place would be wonderful for families with kids. No doubt about it. But for a couple looking to get away from it all....this was not the place. The prices of the food, spa, and every other amenity were outrageous. We cabbed it everywhere and sometimes it took the staff 30 minutes to get a cab to us. The conceirge was the worst. He was unaccomodating and looked like he wanted to be anywhere but there. It took over 25 minutes for anyone to answer at the front desk. I was extremely disappointed and would never return or waste my money on this place.

Reviews.Title: “Hum, Nice for families and groups”
Reviews.Author: pinksuit
Reviews.Content: Delighful setting with a wonderful layout concept. Nice for families, especially with young children. Was rather shocked with the $16.00 per day for parking fees, especially since the property is on a secluded location, in addition to not being informed at the time of making reservations. Housekeeping services was somewhat awkward. One day we were left without wash towels and one day it seems as though used bath towels were folded and rehanged. Our particular room, was in need of serious carpet cleaning or carpet replacing. We informed the staff of the mildew smelling odor and was promised that it would be taken care of by housekeeping, but it wasn't. We were also disappointed with the usage of the hot-tub. There is only one on the property approx. 44 acres. The main pool area was always overcrowed. The resort staff was pleasant. This property has wonderful potential in gaining a greater rating if thoughts of investing some bucks in the reception areas, replacing carpets, adding microwaves in all rooms, acquiring quiet refrigerators, updating furnishings, adding additional hot tubs and overhauling the menus in the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “This is my new favorite resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I too was aprehensive about staying at this resort after reading the negative reviews but am glad that I kept my reservation with Paradise Point after all. It was Paradise. Everyone was very polite and very helpful. We stayed 2 nights. We were checked in by 2pm on Saturday afternoon, the 7th of Aug, 2004. (4pm is the posted checkin time). We checked our luggage and were laying by the pool (which did not have any of the dirt mentioned by other reviewers) when the front desk called and said that both our connecting rooms were ready. The bellman helping with our luggage told us about the firepits surrounding the beach and that is where we roasted marshmallows on the first night, under the San Diego lights. The maid came to clean the room as we were leaving for Sea World the next morning around 10 am. The grounds are gorgeous and my kids fed ducks food from the gift shop right off our lanai. The prices at the restaurant, Baleen, are a bit high, but is a classy looking restaurant. We called a pizza place and had sandwiches delivered right to our room, no problem. I would have given this resort 5 stars but when we checked in Martin Quick, a staff member, did not call the bellman as he promised to have our bags checked and held while we waited by the pool for our room to be ready. I waited 10 minutes before asking another employee to please check on the bellman. However, like I said, the bellman and everyone else after was very helpful and curteous. I was offered a ride by a staffmember in one of the many golfcarts down to the firepit when I was seen walking with a bundle of firewood. We are already making our plans to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A bit run down”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this resort for a convention. The group rate was about US$195 for a room! It is an impressive looking resort but once you start using the facilities, you start to notice that it's a bit run down. One room had a toilet that wouldn't flush and after calling house keeping several times, still noone showed up. It's a large resort and sometimes it seemed like it was short of staff especially with a convention going on.

Reviews.Title: “It's Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made our reservations before I read the reviews on this site. I was ready to cancel, but decided to give it a try. I am so glad that we did. We loved this place. Our room was terrific and within steps to the beach. We had a really nice patio and there were constantly ducks napping nearby. We are nature lovers, so we really enjoyed this. The main pool was really crowded, but the other pools were almost always empty. We loved the Barefoot Bar and Grille. The service and food were both fantastic and you can't beat the views of the bay. They had a live band on Monday night and they were quite good. Yes, we had a few ants in the room and on the patio. With all of the tropical foliage and water, it is to be expected. If you are looking for a sterile environment, this is not the place. This place is warm and inviting. Yes, it is a bit pricey, but to us, it was worth every dime.

Reviews.Title: “A Poor Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This resort was a big disappointment. We made a last-minute decision to take a three-day getaway (late July, 2004) with the kids. We should have kept looking. The furnishings are tired, and despite the wonderful pictures, the entire resort looks a few years past it's prime. Housekeeping is poor, and the carpeting in our unit was filthy. Just walking across the room in your bare feet left your soles black. The main pool area was not very clean, and poorly staffed. The restaurants were very poor. The food was almost inedible, and the only thing worse was the service. VERY poor and inattentive. If you do decide to go, be sure to check your bill carefully. When we arrived, the lobby was full of people checking out and disputing their bills. When we departed, the three people in line in front of us were all disputing their bills, and yes, our bill was wrong as well. The staff needs some serious customer service training. Their common attitude is clear that they could care less if you are there. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced paradise”
Reviews.Author: MTruvillo
Reviews.Content: Myself and a peer stayed at Paradise Point with our families while in San Diego on a business trip July 24 - 28th. We were referred here by our travel agent because it had a kids program that my kids (7 & 9) could stay at while I was in meetings. While the property was very pretty, it was not worth the $300 a night! The rooms were ok but nothing to write home about. The refridgerator knob was broken and it froze our drinks. A light bulb was missing over the bathroom vanity (which is very small) and I killed two spiders in the bathroom. The beds however were comfortable. My co-worker had no chairs on their patio. When they called about it they expected they would bring out nice chairs like the other patios had - they brought $5 plastic chairs. They were disappointed for the money they spent and value they recieved. Plus a $16 a night parking fee is rediculous. I was surprised that they charge for every amenity - tennis, fitness, etc. even the USA Today delivered to your room which most upscale hotels do not. The kids club was not geared for business travelers as the hours were 9:30 to 4:00 at a whopping price of $160 for 6 1/2 hours. There is no actual room for the kids like there is in other resorts they basically take the kids around the resort doing activites like playing tennis, walking on the beach, riding a bike, etc. My kids did have fun but the price and the times were not comparable to the other hotels with kids programs. The food was very overpriced and not very good. We ate at the pool and at the Barefoot restaurant - we would have gone out but there is not much around the resort close. I got a half hour massage at the spa and and found out that it is only for 25 minutes and they automatically charge a 20% gratuity! The treatments are all overpriced too - $72 for a 25 minute massage. On the 28th we moved to the Catamaran Hotel for the rest of our trip. The Catamaran has - which had similar type of grounds like Paradise but was $100 a day cheaper. We booked it through Southwest Airlines Vacation Package. We were pleasantly suprised that kids under 12 eat free at the Atoll restaurant, tickets for complimentary appetizers at the restaurant, complimentary cruise on Mission Bay for the family on the Bahia Bell, and tickets for 2 free hours in the arcade per child. Our room was spacious and had a kitchen with a full size refridgerator, dishes and cookware. Which was great to save money on eating out every meal. Plus the hotel had a schedule of activites most of which were free including surfing lessons, movie on the beach with coke & popcorn, kyak lessons, etc. They also didn't charge like the Paradise Point for all of the amenities like the fitness center, tennis, etc. They did charge for parking but it was $9.00 a night and it was covered in a garage. I would recommend that you save your money and stay at the Catamaran or elsewhere in San Diego instead of Paradise Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: hey19
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I were meeting in San Diego and I wanted a nice place to stay. My travel agent suggested the Paradise Point Resort. It was the most money I had ever spent on a hotel room. When I got there the room wasn't made up and it was 7:30 at night! And the only room they had was with one bed! But when I finally got to the room it was stunning. The decor was bright and cheery. And there was a sofa bed, but the the bed was huge and high and had big, fluffy down pillows, we just picked a spot. The patio had lounge chairs and it was so grown with tropical plants you would have thought you were alone until the sound of an occasional golf cart went by. Paradise-yes. Pricey-yes. I go to San Diego alot, and it was by far the nicest room-but for the price-and the parking-I think I'll stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Point Resort is great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Paradise Point Resort and Spa is a great place for families. The bungalows are clean and well kept up. Our family loved walking around the resort. We could collect shells at the ocean and then go swimming in the main pool. It is also close to all the freeways. The barefoot bar and grill is also pricey, but the food is good. The only negative was the $16 for parking a day. That was alittle much. But overall we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: nick3333
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week over the 4th July 2003 and were deeply disappointed. On arrival we were shown directions to our room, only to find it had not been cleaned. Our second room was located next to a smelly pond and was for disabled persons. We stuck to our third room, but the decor was still tired and the whole room needed to be refurbished. Then to our amazement when we tried to get into bed the sheets were dirty. They did come and change them quickly, but we received no apology from the management. We also went to eat in their restaurant baleen and were greeted with oysters that were off and uncooked seabass! The setting of the hotel could be very nice, but I would never stay here again and for the price we would have preferred the Coronado or the Loews, which were comparable.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the 5th July for 4 nights.We checked in and were allocated a garden view room which consisted of approximately 6ft by 6ft, with no garden furniture. When we went into the room we found that we had been given a Queen size bed, when we had actually paid for a King.
